title: Best location!!
text:
A very nice hotel with an unbeatable location. 

The hotel is right at Washington Sq. Park and very quiet. Small rooms (some without a view) but clean and well functioning. OK service too, especially from the door man. We did not try the restaurant or other facilities. Choose this hotel if location and pricing are key; not if you are into luxury or spa adventures. The wonders of Greenwich Village and South Manhattan await you!

title: Not bad considering the prices in NYC
text:
Convenient to go to NYU rather clean but aging. A nice little gym. The room is decent but the bedding was very old and bad.

The staff is adorable and that's the strong point with the location near the metro.

title: Loved the hotel and location
text: What a great hotel in the most perfect location. We walked to everything! There are so many great restaurants and fun bars and neighborhoods surrounding it. The hotel staff was great - they were so helpful to get us around the city. We can’t wait to come back!

title: Great stay - cool place
text: I really loved this place especially its great location.  Staff friendly, esp the doorman.  I had a single room and felt it was fairly spacious (by NY standards) and the sheets/pillows great.  I hope people that book here appreciate its cool history and also understand this is an old building and old buildings have pros/cons.  In this case - the very small and slow elevator but that wasn't an issue for me.  I will def stay again.

title: A Gem in the Village
text:
Pleasant,friendly, attentive and helpful staff
Excellent location 
Clean hotel, quaint and personal. 
Nice rooms 
Great breakfast on the weekends
A Gem 
Will stay there when we are in NYC moving forward!

Greenwich Village central 
Walkable to lower Manhattan and elsewhere.

title: Little Historic Gem
text: The location is first rate.  The room is basic but comfortable. The shower/water pressure was wonderful.  The restaurant was convenient and reasonably priced for breakfast. The history of the hotel is fascinating. I would recommend this hotel and will come back next time I don't feel like going back to New Jersey after a night out in NYC.

title: SMALLER, VERY CLEAN, QUIET, NEWLY RENOVATED HOTEL
text: Excellent hotel, safe neighborhood, not part of a chain, run by people who care.  The rooms are recently renovated. Great location is off Washington Square Park. It is very near several subway stations and great for moving around NYC. The rooms are quiet. When you phone a real, live person answers. You do not have to press 1 or 2, then be told to wait by a machine. The doorman helps with luggage.  Prices very reasonable.

title: Great location & a comfortable room at a reasonable price!
text: From the moment I was greeted by the friendly staff, my stay was exceptional. The room was cozy, quiet and clean, the bed was super comfortable and the bathroom had great storage. The location was ideal for everything I wanted to do in the Village and felt very safe.  It was easy to access from JFK airport via the subway. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and would recommend to anyone visiting NYC.

title: Ronnie Jenkins
text: Ronnie Jenkins was the best. I am from NY but now love in MN and had never been to the WSH. Our first time there we met Ronnie and he was such gentleman/saint.  We have been back many times since. True level of class and hospitality. We will definitely miss him on our next trip back.

title: Village spot
text:
Great location if you are Village people. Close to everything from McSorley's  to Gene's Restaurant, Village Vanguard and Blue Note and the park is across Macdougal St.
subways nearby 
Highly recommend  if you prefer older hotels with some history. Dylan, Baez, Rolling Stones stayed there
My regular spot in December

title: The little hotel that could if it wanted to
text: This hotel could be so much more. It's cute, quaint, and in a  great location. Our executive king room was big but unfortunately we were right by the elevator so constant noise. Room 302. The front desk was unfriendly,  not helpful,  and nobody went out of their way to make us feel welcome.  Even the baggage holders have to be called 3 times before responding.   I've stayed at so many New York hotels that were larger but  have felt more welcomed. In my experience,  workers only do as much as the leadership Inspires. This hotel needs some inspiration

title: We cannot wait to stay here again!
text: We discovered this quaint boutique hotel during a walking tour of Greenwich Village on a previous trip to Manhattan. The doorman brought us inside and showed us the charming lobby and restaurants, of this family-owned property, which has been lovingly maintained and boasts a welcoming and friendly staff, many of whom have been employed here for over 20 years. The hotel is not only beautiful, it has well appointed, comfortable and exceptionally clean rooms, at very competitive prices. The location is perfect, in the heart of the west village, adjacent to the park and the hub of the 4th street subway. We will are looking forward to our next stay at this NYC gem.

title: Treasure in the West Village!
text:
Have stayed at this hotel on two occasions. Great ambiance and very comfortable. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Housekeeping is excellent and front desk staff are very helpful.

Can’t wait to return!

title: Staff, location, and cleanliness make this hotel well worth it.
text: While an older, non-remodeled hotel, I enjoyed my six days there immensely. First, the staff at the hotel are phenomenal - from the front desk to the bell stand. Everyone goes above and beyond to be helpful and accommodating. Second, the hotel is clean. Third, the location is perfect for shopping in SoHo, eating at great restaurants in Greenwich Village, and taking the subway uptown (West 4th St metro station is 50 yards away). If there is one drawback, it’s that the double beds are very small - two normal-sized humans will probably have difficultly sleeping in one bed. Luckily, our daughter is tiny and fit ok with my wife. Overall, very pleased.

title: Good Simple accom near subway
text:
This hotel is exactly as they describe rustic.

The rooms are usual NYC size and are very clean. Shower is great water pressure.

Small wardrobe with safe . Couldn't see hairdryer in the room but sure reception would have . Iron and board in room.

Staff on reception very friendly and check in and out was pacey.

Subway on corner of street to get into Times Square etc and world trade was half hour stroll.

Area is quieter than being in main manhattan area and the area is ten mins walk from the LGBT scene and the infamous landmark of Stonewall Inn

Def stay here again 

I didn't need but they do store luggage 

Didn't eat at hotel but great little dinner on corner opp subway

title: Amazing!
text: From the first time we stayed at the WSH in 2017, it won our hearts! There is no where else I will ever stay while visiting NYC. To have the park, space market, the subway and the most beautiful neighborhood right outside your front door is priceless, while enjoying the coolest vintage charm and the last privately owned and operated hotel in the city - priceless!

title: Fantastic stay!
text: The shower in Room 815 was perfection!  There was some renovation going on but it did not hinder us in any way. It was a nice quiet street which was what I expected from Greenwich Village. Pleasant place to come back to after exploring all day.

title: QUIRKY, AUTHENTIC
text: It was nice to wake up and know immediately we were in New York – I mean as opposed to some generic hotel-chain room. The rooms are not beautiful, but the whole place exudes history – and it's fun to know that (like the Chelsea Hotel) lots of famous people (musicians etc.) stayed here. Perfectly located in charming Greenwich Village and handy for Wall Street, Chelsea etc., but quite a schlepp for mid-town etc - at least if you favour walking (as we do). In its favour, it is pretty cheap by NYC standards, and we were lucky to get a stay-6-pay-for-5-nights deal. Helpful, informative staff. Also, on our last night we were lucky to witness the lighting of the Christmas tree in lovely Washington Square park – just a 2-minute walk away. Read my separate review of their restaurant (North Square).

title: Great Hotel in a great location
text:
Wonderful service, spacious room in a great location for getting around New York in fabulous position if you want to use the subway.  
Room was spacious if a little tired.
Restaurant and bar were great and good value. Breakfast was good. 
Cannot recommend highly enough.

title: Washington Square Hotel, terrific place!
text: The Washington Square Hotel was a terrific experience. Service is super friendly, and the room was cozy and clean. It's located on a quiet street, right near the park and subway. Lovely place to spend a weekend in the city!

title: Quaint and quiet hotel in the middle of the city!
text: This quiet, historic hotel was the perfect retreat at the end of a busy day in NYC!  The front desk staff were professional and polite, the doorman had the best personality, and the restaurant served the most delicious meals!  This hotel was in a great location, across the street from a beautiful park and less than a block away from a subway station.  I would love to stay here again!

title: Great accommodations
text:
The staff is warm and friend and very helpful. I've stay in many different
rooms and they are always clean and well stocked. The C O Bigelow products
are wonderful. It's always fun to see which black and white movie star picture will
be hanging over the bed.

title: good night sleep in a great location
text:
This is my second time staying at this hotel and it is my new goto hotel in NYC.  Lovely older hotel located off the NW corner of Washington Square Park.  The neighborhood is wonderful and surprisingly quiet at night despite being in the middle of Greenwich Village.  Great transportation options to get you to every part of the city and NJ and free street parking in the area from 6pm to 8am.  

The rooms are small but not tiny and they have some closet and drawer space for your clothes and bags. The bed was super comfy and the room was quiet.  The shower and bathroom were fine with decent toiletries and good water pressure.  Finally, it was super clean.

title: Great location but amenities lacking
text: I’ve stayed at this property many times due to it’s perfect location, room sizes, and staff friendliness.   However, my recent big gripe is with no fridges in their rooms.  Covid did away with the complimentary continental breakfast, and has not returned after the pandemic.  With no fridges and no continental breakfast, there is no real option but to go out each morning.

title: Great location, great staff, my new favorite hotel in the city
text: The location and the friendly staff are a game changer. I can’t wait to go back.  If you are used to big rooms over in midtown, you are going to find the rooms here small. But on the other hand, if you are staying in midtown, you are missing out. Because West Village is the greatest neighborhood, and it is so close to so many other interesting neighborhoods. Sure, there will be that day that you grab the train to Times Square and see your show, and all of that is SO fun, but trust me, you will be so happy to call this area your landing place.  But let me get back to the hotel. There is a wonderful feeling about this place. There are only a handful of employees, and you will probably meet them all during your stay, and every one of them will make you feel happy and at home. There is a nice lounge to grab a drink or a bite. It closes early, but trust me, there is plenty else to do in the neighborhood. There are lovely tile finishes on each floor that have a groovy art deco vibe.  It’s small, so you aren’t waiting constantly for the elevator to arrive. It’s clean, clean, clean. Did I mention the fantastic location? The great staff? Oh….one extra thing that I found fabulous, that all of the big fancy hotels in midtown don’t give you: an empty, working mini fridge, which you can fill with whatever delights you find on your wanderings! Like I said, I can’t wait to go back.

title: Wonderful trip!
text: I loved this hotel. It is right by Washington Square Park and centrally located. The lobby is wonderful, staff are so friendly cy, breakfast served on weekends was very good. The price was very reasonable. My room was small but so clean and cozy. I hope my whole family returns Christmas 2024.

title: Great Hotel
text: Just home from 8 nights in Washington Square Hotel. The location is brilliant close to the park and near a few subway stations. We loved walking around Greenwich Village and found some fabulous restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. The rooms were very clean with a comfortable bed. All the staff were friendly and helpful. There is nothing negative I can say about our stay there and we highly recommend this hotel.

title: Enjoy Greenwich Village from Washington Square Hotel!
text:
Beautiful small hotel with nice furniture, beds, bath, floor and overall very pretty.
Very clean and well maintained. Super nice people working there, all so sweet!
We loved the accommodation and would recommend wholeheartedly.
Great area too - so much to see in Washington Square Park, so much to do and go out in the area. We loved it.

title: Great location close to restaurants and subway.
text: Loved the quaint hotel located across from Washington Square Park conveniently located close to restaurants and public transportation. Room was spotless, hotel staff pleasant and helpful. Will definitely stay again.

title: Excellent hotel à proximité de tous les quartiers les plus réputés
text:
Le premier critère pour lequel nous avons choisi cet hôtel restait le meilleur rapport qualité prix car celui-ci correspond parfaitement à un hôtel de qualité à prix très abordable.

Nous avons été surpris par la situation parfaite de cet établissement.
Vous vous trouverez à une dizaine de minutes du secteur du One World Trade Center et une dizaine de minutes également du secteur de l'Empire State Building.
Vous serez à proximité du Washington Square et les différents bars - restaurants du secteur.

Concernant la chambre, nous avons pris la chambre classique mais celle-ci c'est révélée très confortable et avec toutes les commodités.
Un grand lit avec une baignoire-douche et un espace vasque très confortable.

En plus, que cela soit la propreté, la disponibilité et toute autre commodité, l'hôtel était parfait.
Ne vous arrêtez pas à la réputation du quartier et foncez dans cet hôtel;

title: Hôtel de charme dans quartier de charme
text:
Très bien situé dans le village de Greenwich en plein Manhattan, calme, loin de la foule. Le quartier est jeune car c’est ici que se trouve la NY University. Beaucoup de sans-abris certes mais bon, c’est New York!
Hôtel confortable et propre, rappelle le NY des années 1900, c’est tout son charme. Les chambres sont de petite taille mais disposent de tout ce dont on a besoin. La salle de bain est de bonne taille, bien équipée.
Le personnel est sympathique.
Le petit-déjeuner au restaurant de l’hôtel est très bon mais n’est servi que le week-end. Le dîner est servi tous les jours et est très bon aussi. De toute façon, beaucoup de possibilités de restauration dans le quartier.
Bref, je recommande ce hôtel si vous voulez quelque peu échapper au New York palpitant et bruyant.

title: Great Value, Perfect location for a solid 3 star hotel ***
text:
Location! 10/10
Amenities 10/10
Value 10/10

Tons of restaurants nearby, subway is two minutes away (walking).

Bathroom has toiletries such as shampoo/conditioner/body wash etc.
Lots of towels! Fresh everyday!
Two sinks in quad room & Big and spacious
Shower has decent water pressure with hot water

Has:
blackout curtains
Fridge
Safe
Coffee bar w/decent coffee
TV
Storage for clothes
Robes/House coats
Slippers (the floors are cold vinyl)

We stayed here for a week. Quad room was spacious enough for the 3 of us (can have 4 people). Probably the biggest hotel room in NYC! We had a corner room on a lower floor with view of the street and park.
Unfortunately there was construction everyday starting at 0730 except Sat and Sun. I don’t recall being warned of this and it definitely impacted our stay. We were woken up to loud obnoxious street construction 5/6 days
All this being said, the cost of the hotel reflected this, as the room and location would have likely been double anywhere else.
The hotel is a solid 3 star hotel.
Bed is firm but not hard - I like a soft bed and this was not uncomfortable.
This is an old hotel family owned - if you’re expecting 5 stars for a 3 star price you would be disappointed.
I am very satisfied even with the construction issue we would hands down stay here again.

Honourable mentions for food nearby:
Mamoun's Falafel - so good and cheap too! 
Bombay Bistro! In the top 3 Indian food places I've ever eaten. Flavours to die for! A MUST try!

title: This is going to be our new go to
text:
This is the second time I've stayed here, and I had a great stay.

I think the caveat to this review is that one must manage their expectations. Hotels in similar locations, but with more 'frills,' will cost 3-4 times more per night. This is something we noticed when looking for somewhere to stay.

So, the hotel is fairly basic in terms of amenities, and while spotless, it's perhaps a little tired. But that didn't detract from our stay. If we wanted somewhere 5-star in this location, for our dates, it would have been about 200-300 dollars more per night!

The staff are wonderful, particularly Prescott. Everyone is so personable, greeting you when you're in and out each day.

Our room was good—small but functional with decent wardrobe space. It was very clean and had a bit of a view of the park.

The key thing for me advocating for this hotel is its location—it's phenomenal!! You're within walking distance, a stone's throw from Magnolia Bakery, Stonewall Inn, Soho, and the rest of Greenwich Village. A 2-minute walk also takes you to the metro, which is served by 6 lines. After staying in Midtown many times, never again! The vibe of Greenwich Village with its cafes and boutiques is out of this world.

We didn't have breakfast or food at the hotel, or use the TV, as we weren't in the room long enough.

title: I will come back
text: The employees are very friendly and helpful. The bathroom is newly decorated and the - not very big - room was very clean. The hotel is just on the corner of the lively Washington Square and within walking distance of SOHO, NOHO, Tribeca, the financial area and mid-town. All in all a very nice stay in a well situated hotel.

title: Location, location, location!
text:
Stayed for 4/5 nights in room 406 - a view of a brick wall from the window (ha!), but you’re barely in the room anyway - so no big deal! 

Lovely good sized twin room with comfy beds, a safe, robes/slippers, air con and a coffee maker.  Clean throughout, and a good shower with complimentary toiletries. Could only be improved by a fridge! 

The main benefit about this hotel is the location - easy walking distance to most attractions.  Beautiful streets, bars and restaurants close by.  A CVS round the corner for drinks and snacks.

A transfer to/from JFK works out better value than a can if you want to splurge!

title: Good Spot in the Village
text:
The hotel was fine, and overall I have no complaints.  My boyfriend and I stayed in Manhatten for 5 days, and we wanted somewhere with good connections to other areas of the city, and a bit of life at night.  Last time I visited NYC, I stayed on Park Ave near Central Park.  The hotel was much fancier, but also ~ double the price of this.  There also wasn't much going on around there really, as it is all hotels and offices.  Value for money doesn't really exist in NYC, but I would say that Washington Square Hotel is better value than a lot of other places.

The hotel was clean and served as a good base.  The room was cleaned daily and the bathroom was spotless.  There was also a coffee machine, TV, hairdryer, iron + ironing board, and thankfully good air con.  There were robes if you wanted to use the spa facility - we didn't bother with this.  We also didn't use the hotel restaurant or bar.  We simply wanted somewhere we could sleep and shower, as we were out for the majority of the day/night exploring - and the hotel served this job perfectly.  The staff were also polite and professional.  The corridors were a little tired and dated, and could do with new carpet and a lick of paint - but ultimately this is not something which causes problems!! 

In terms of the location - it is great for getting around NYC.  It is right by W4 St subway station which has about 5-6 lines running through it.  You can be at central park in ~ 10 mins, and downtown in the same time.  I think we even used the same subway to get to the Bronx and Brooklyn.  Getting around is easy from this spot!  It is also v close to the famous Bleecker St where there is great bars and music/comedy venues.  The area around the hotel is a student district for NYU, and Washington Square Garden is lively and entertaining (about 2 mins walk from the hotel).  I wouldn't say I felt unsafe, but there were times when we saw multiple people taking drugs, so if this is something which would bother you, then it might be important to consider.  One afternoon we saw a man injecting himself in the street moments away from the hotel.  We never had any issues, and generally the area is busy, so you don't feel isolated or vulnerable, but maybe just be aware about this and be cautious.

title: Trading on its former glories!
text: The hotel is in a great location next to the park and the history of it is fascinating with a star studded cast of musicians who stayed there in the past. But it’s probably now trading on its former glories. Carpets are worn and paintwork in need of a refresh. There is no bar and breakfast only served at the weekend. Reception staff not very welcoming.

title: Noisy, old fashioned hotel and unhelpful service
text: Except the location, this is a terrible hotel - stay away! I got a stuffy and dark room which faces the wall of an adjacent building. If you open the window there are fumes being exhausted from the pipes outside and the noise — even with windows closed — is terrible. When I asked to move a room the receptionist was very dismissive and said it’s considered a quiet room and there’s nothing he could do. The best he could do is offer me ear plugs! Totally unhelpful and very frustrating as I came here to work so really need to sleep properly before a busy working day. The decor and the rooms are very old and there are parts (like the window seals) that are quite filthy. Stay away!

title: An Urban oasis
text: Such friendly staff, such a comfortable room, such a convenient location, next to multiple subway stops and an easy, safe walk to Soho, Noho, the east village, etc. We were meeting up with family from several locations -- we loved the many playgrounds, restaurants, shady spots to sit and chat, walking to movie theatres, ice cream shops. The hotel was a respite when we needed a break -- good air conditioning, comfortable bed, spacious bathroom, window that opened.

title: Wonderful stay visiting our grandson at NYU
text: Check in was so easy. Our room, a queen deluxe, was so clean and had everything we needed. Very comfortable the only thing missing was a park view which we had requested, however as we only stayed one night it didn’t matter. The food was delicious and great value. Best of all was the staff. Every one of them was so friendly and helpful, always smiling and polite. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Wonderful staff!
text: Stayed while moving son to his apartment nearby. Staff here is absolutely the best! They make you feel like family. Rooms are clean, beds comfy, and bathrooms always stocked with plenty to towels and amenities. It's not the biggest hotel, but it is the friendliest!

title: In love with the hotel
text:
We stayed at the WSH for three nights, in two contiguos rooms. In one, my daughter (22) and boy (17), in other, my friend and I. All four of us felt in love with the hotel, because of its beauty and comfortability. 
The shower is the best, but everything was nice, clean, enjoyable.
People at the lobby were very kind and helpful.
The area is full of history, so close to Washington Square Park, but also to delicious restaurants. We enjoyed taking long walks from the hotel to the art galleries at Soho, to the High Line, to Noho, to Little Italy. It is close to Hudson yards, to Meatpaking District. We will go back!!!

title: An oasis of calm
text: 2nd time we’ve stayed at this hotel. Great location and absolutely lovely staff for whom nothing is too much trouble. We’d definitely stay here again next time 🙌🏻. They always make us feel very welcome

title: Excellent Small Hotel Conveniently Located
text: This was my fourth stay at this hotel located on Washington Square. It is an excellent hotel with friendly staff. If you have a student at NYU, there is a small discount if you call the hotel itself to book your reservation. Each of the rooms I have stayed appear to have been recently renovated and were spotless.

title: Quaint hotel in a fantastic NYC neighborhood
text: Adorable and quaint hotel on a quiet tree lined street in the village. Friendly and welcoming staff. Clean, comfortable room and bathroom. Subway close. Good restaurants all over the neighborhood. A++

title: Perfect stay
text: Front desk was very welcoming and friendly. I had a queen room which was very big and spacious for a nyc hotel room. My favorite part of the room was the bathroom it had a large vanity, other hotels in nyc there are never room to put your toiletries so this was a plus. Room was very clean and they give you slippers was is a nice touch. The location is great right next to the park and close to subway. I ate at the hotel restaurant one night outside which was nice, i ordered the burger which was very good. Overall this small boutique hotel is a gem. I will most definitely stay here again.

title: Great experience
text: This is a clean, quaint hotel in a great location right across the street from one park entrance. Staff very friendly. Prescott was so kind, check in quick, old historic building but rooms updated,clean with good AC, blackout curtains,  small but most in NYC are.Bathroom good size. Keurig  and coffee provided in room. Beds comfy. Easy to get transport,subway close and restaurants and shops right there in Greenwich . We liked it. Quiet too.

title: Quiet, friendly hotel in NYC
text: A lovely hotel with the friendliest staff. Beautiful building in leafy Greenwich Village. The staff made us feel part of a family and helped me celebrate my birthday so generously. We will definitely be coming back!

title: Great Stay
text: This hotel was perfect for visiting our daughter at NYU for the summer. It is right off Washington Square and one block from a subway station with many lines, so easy to get anywhere else in the city. The room was small but comfortable. The bed was nice and firm. The A/C was very responsive, thankfully, as it was very hot outside. Lovely little lobby with art deco tiles. We would definitely stay here again, even if not visiting someone close by.

title: Comfy, Welcoming, Convenient, and Quiet - Loved it!
text: Excellent all around.  Spacious, well-appointed, comfortable room.  Attentive, friendly, helpful staff.  Perfect location - walkable to everything the West Village offers, with convenient access to multiple subway lines.  Very quiet - we kept late hours and slept in, and the blackout drapes and quiet room enabled us to sleep like babies.  Being right on the park was lovely.

title: Great hotel - special experience
text: Great hotel - friendly, great food, great amenities, great location, clean. Honestly couldn't wish for better hotel in better location. Fascinating history too and brilliant art work and decor by the doyenne of the hotel, Rita Paul.

title: Excellent hotel in a great location
text: The hotel staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  The rooms were clean and the lobby is welcoming.  You can’t beat the location; across from Washington Square Park and the Village.  We will definitely be back again!

title: difficle de trouver mieux
text:
Un merveilleux hotel,  très bien situé. Le personnel est efficace et très agréable. Les chambres sont calmes et jolies. L'hotel est très propre. La salle de fitness bien equipée. 
Nous y sommes restés 12 nuits, on s'y senetit chez nous!

title: Old Classic
text: The staff is highly professional and the hotel (largely) well maintained. It's old and feels that way even though rennovated but good for anyone who seeks a vintage establishment. The windows open (and that's nice); it is not the fault of the hotel that the area surrounding it is filthy and noisy. Of course the location is prime- if The Village is where you want to stay. Beds are fine, AC works well, housekeeping at the highest standard.

title: Such a great place. Our home when we're in Manhattan!
text: We love the Washington Square Hotel! The staff is always great. So friendly and professional. The rooms are clean and re-furbished. We've been to the bar and restaurant and the food and drinks are excellent. We don't stay anywhere else in NY anymore but the WSH! Great people, great accommodations, great prices. Thanks everyone for making it so easy to stay in the best neighborhood in NY! - Brian Kelly and Donna Savoia

title: A great place to stay
text:
The Washingtonl Square Hotel is a great place to stay. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The staff is very friendly and always helpful.  
It was a pleasure staying there and i am definitively coming back when visiting NYC again.

title: Still my favorite in NYC
text: I reserved a non-refundable room a couple of years ago, but didn't want to travel because of Covid. Beverley Harris kindly extended my credit for a year, but I couldn't go last summer due to personal circumstances. I didn't ask, but Beverley Harris extended my credit for another year! Friendly staff, cozy rooms, but with firm and comfortable mattresses. I love the neighborhood, so it was perfect as base and for sleep. I've stayed here, and for logistics, at different hotels throughout the area, but this is still my preferred hotel and location.

title: Boutique Hotel in Charming Greenwich Village
text: Great location, walking distance to so many places, restaurants, bars, Subway station Bleecker Street, Washington Square Park is just steps away from outside the hotel. Nice clean rooms, kind of small but, really you're not there to spend a lot of time in your room. You're there to explore the best most amazing city in the world. This hotel has a lot of history. Bob Dylan and Joan Baez both lived there back in the day. The Rolling Stones, Ernest Hemmingway, Chuck Berry. The list goes on and on, all stayed there. The staff is friendly and accommodating. They have postcards in the lobby, I wrote out a couple to send to friends and family, they mailed them for me. How cool and old school is that! My stay was amazing, and I will definitely stay there again.

title: Perfect combo NYC and WSH!
text: Very attentive staff, clean rooms, safe and in a quiet  neighborhood.  Everything I needed was within a block walk! North had the best shrimp risotto! Looking forward to staying again! Owner Judy Paul knows great service!

title: Lovely little hotel
text: This is a lovely little hotel not far from the subway and right on the edge of Washington Square Park (easily recognisable from Will Smith's I Am Legend movie). The room was a little on the small side but that was to be expected in New York. Everything we needed was provided and the staff were always happy and friendly. Would happily stay here again.

title: Village mainstay, Great value
text: My third time at this hotel, and I like it for the location, helpful staff, and funky individuality. You’re in the middle of the West Village, at the NW corner of the Park. Fancy and not so fancy restaurants nearby. The rooms are small and the building is old. It would be an enormous improvement if there were a comfortable chair in each room instead of a hard desk chair. No breakfast except on weekends, but the classic Waverly Diner is a block away.  Good value for the price.

title: Lovely Family Owned Hotel with History and Location
text: We booked last minute (for the next day)  and they were able to squeeze us in.  Although the room was tiny, we were warned and it was comfortable and well appointed.  Staff was friendly, everything was clean, and the location could not be any better.  It's one of the last family-owned hotels and their pride of ownership shows.  Call for a reservation.  I found the website to be a little wonky and it was easy to just call and talk.

title: A mediocre hotel
text: An old mediocre hotel saved by its staff. The hotel is quite old and it shows. We changed rooms twice to find a decent one. First one was very noisy, you could hear the plumbing noises all night long. Next day they gave us another room with a rusty bathtub. So off to a 3rd room. Decent size room but quite dated. The hotel needs quite a lot of work to improve but I do admit that the staff seemed to be aware of this and desperately tried to overcome the problems. A 2 star hotel at best saved by its staff and location.

title: Convenient, well maintained, friendly staff, and reasonably priced. Excellent place to stay.
text: This was our third stay at he Washington Square Hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The common rooms were clean and quaint. Our room appeared to be recently refurbished and provided everything we needed in a city hotel room. The hotel is very close to NYU and, of course, Washington Square. There are lots of restaurants and cafes nearby, as are subway options. It is a great place to stay and much less expensive than many of the areas’ hotels.

title: To have so much potential squandered is so sad.
text:
At the suggestion of a follow traveler, because he felt that it was important as a long time customer (20+ years) of WSH that I share the reasons for my decision to no longer stay at the property with the hotel’s management, on March 8, 2023, I sent a detailed email to Sonny Christopher the general manager outlining my escalating dissatisfaction. I have received no response. Now I know that the failures are coming from the top down.  So, here is some practical advice offered up based upon many many nights spent at WSH:

1.  If you drop your bags off because your room isn’t ready when you arrive, come back AT 3:30 pm to check-in particularly on the weekends. Because they no longer take your credit card info and check you in when you arrive you are not a guest of the hotel.  If you have plans that consume your day and you don’t return to the hotel until later in the evening you run the risk of discovering that the hotel is full and you have no place to stay.  (Telling the front desk you will be out all day/evening falls on deaf ears.) The on-line check-in email you receive the morning of your stay is for their purposes, not yours and does not check you in. You are checked in when they run your credit card and not one second before.

2. The day front desk staff have become openly contemptuous, disrespectful, and rude. (This started before Covid. During the height of Covid they were terrific. Martha’s level of customer service should be the standard.  She was phenomenal.) If you are from out of town it isn’t a NYC ‘tude.  So when they are condescending it isn’t you, it is them. I began to think of checking in as a gauntlet of unnecessary nastiness I had to endure at the beginning of my stay.  The evening front desk staff are usually very kind.

3. Avoid staying on the second floor. Some rooms are okay but, in general, they are noisy either from the street or lobby noise (even #15).

4.  Interior rooms with no windows may look a bit odd and are cramped but trust me, as someone who has stayed in room 15 on every floor, they are spectacular for a good nights sleep.  

5.  In the winter months the interior rooms are hot, very hot, particularly on the lower floors. The colder it is outside, the hotter the room. The maintenance crew is incredibly responsive and will do the best they can to make the room’s temperature less tropical, but bring summer pjs.

6. If possible, once you’ve taken your bags to your room, take the stairs.  The elevators are old, small and slow. The stairs are faster.

7.  Don’t be surprised if one of the doormen brings up politics.  You can refuse to engage or try to change/avoid/redirect the conversation, but he will not back off.  He has very strident opinions.

8.  The room the front desk likes to refer to as the 9th floor penthouse is a kidney shape closet with a twin bed and a gorgeous view. They will claim it is one of the best rooms in the hotel. To each his own, but I stayed in it only because I wasn’t able to make it back to check-in at 3:30 pm. It was not the type of room I reserved. The front desk was very clear - take it or leave it, it is all we have left (at least I had a room). He was the only evening desk clerk I’ve encountered who had the day staff nasty attitude. Happily that weekend was the only time I encountered him.

I’ve had the pleasure of trying out 2 different new NYC hotels since my last WSH stay.  I really miss my #15 rooms at WSH and the comfort of the familiar but being treated with kindness and knowing I’ll come back to a hotel where a room is waiting for me even if my bags are being stored no matter what the hour I return is far more important.

Thank you for the many years of fond memories and the terrific staff I have enjoyed getting to know. I sincerely hope that the management improves because the property and its guests deserve better.

title: Lovely.
text:
This is the second time I have stayed at the WSH and it did not disappoint. While the rooms admittedly are small, as some reviewers note, well, that's NYC for you unless you are prepared to part with a lot more cash. 
The hotel's location could not be better if you are a walker: it's near several subway lines and is smack in the middle of the Village, directly across the street from WS Park. 
Rooms: I love firm mattresses and this one was the best I've ever slept on. Everything was spic and span, with bathroom amenities from Bigelow's an almost 200-year old pharmacy around the corner. (Check it out, it's beautiful, with everything from toothpaste to $200 hairbrushes.) This time, my room had no view, but it was super quiet. 
The gym is improved since last visit: it's small but I never see anyone in it, so you get the Treadmill and Elliptical, and free weights, to yourself. It also faces the street and gets natural light. 
As a guest of the hotel, you receive a 10% discount in the WSH restaurant, which you can access through the hotel. It's lovely and won't break the bank. Service is great. 
Finally, while some complain that the area around the hotel has deteriorated in the past few years, while that is true, this is not a function of the hotel but of Manhattan in general, where it is impossible to walk two blocks without smelling weed and working one's way around trash and the homeless, with the combined effects of Covid, the legalization of marijuana, and a stuttering economy wreaking their predictable havoc on the city. That said, the WSH is a respite from this. If you want clean, try the boring Upper East Side,

title: Perfect location to explore New York
text: Excellent hotel very clean with friendly staff. Perfect location to explore New York, easy access to the subway for exploring neighbourhoods and direct access to JFK. Couldn’t fault this hotel, would definitely stay here again, and reccomend to others

title: Washington Square Hotel. NYC.
text: Small rooms, clean. Comfortable beds. No bar or weekday breakfast. Basic. The restaurant associated with it , North Square, is good. The area has deteriorated badly over the last few years. Many desperate and homeless people in the streets and drug dealers have always used the square. We were disappointed. We know the hotel and the area quite well, had not been back for a few years and we wouldn't go back again.

title: Avoid
text: Sadly this hotel is very poor. Are room was right next to a elevator which was very noisy and going up and down late at night and early in the morning. Are room was behind a brick wall so no view we could not even look out to see any sky let alone what weather was up to. We had a coffee machine which was ok but we had to serve our coffee in papper cups . We had no drinking water in the room . Room very small barley room for one let alone to with luggage. Rooms clean and beds comfortable. The hotel lobby very shabby and dated. On check in they ask for card details and then take a 100 dollars a night which is refundable on check out. Which is a joke the restaurant was never open for evening meals . And breakfast is only served on Saturday and Sunday. And the bar was never open or on one rare occasion it was open it closed at 8.30. Its  a joke them taking this money from you when all the facilities are closed. Please go and spend your dollar else were unless you want to spend your money on what was essentially a bed . Very very poor this hotel seriously need to up there game.

title: very good and very relaxing
text: Old style hotel in new york , near a subway station, where are many homeless but they are quiet. Our room have two separate  king size bed very comfortably. In The room are present two usb power near the bed and many ac sockets. Bathroom with shower and bath. The wifi is very good. A pub, lounge room, and gym are also available. American  Breakfast is available only on friday saturai and sunday (charged 30$)

title: Our favorite NYC hotel
text:
My daughter and I had another fabulous stay at Washington Square, celebrating her birthday! (Last review-June 2022).
We arrived just before midnight on a Sunday, 4 hours later than expected, because of a weather delay at our departure airport. We were warmly greeted by a kind and professional front desk agent (forgot to get his name at the time but hotel later confirmed-Baljit). 
We direct booked with Beverley the manager and received an excellent rate for a room with a view of Washington Square Park. A bottle of Prosecco awaiting was such a thoughtful and appreciated touch. The room was immaculately clean, CO Bigelow products, slippers. 
We enjoy this downtown location so much, close to excellent restaurants, bars, and shopping, and convenient to theatre district. If you prefer boutique, European style hotels, you will love Washington Square. The rooms are beautifully appointed and space is well designed. It was so nice to return to this hotel and we highly recommend it to all.

title: Great comfortable stay, and good value
text: We had a great stay at this hotel.  First, the staff who greeted us when we arrived were very friendly and efficient. Next, our room (we had an executive king room) was large by NYC standards, and had a great bathroom with double sinks and a spacious walk-in shower.  I also appreciated the location of the hotel, and it was a good value compared to other hotels on the weekend that we visited.  We only had one meal (breakfast) at the attached restaurant and the food was very good, but it took a long time to get our beverages and our food.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

title: Great staff, clean hotel!
text: The rooms were clean, the shower was great, but really, what made the experience was the staff. Friendly and outgoing, any time I had questions about things in the area, or any requests, they went above and beyond to help me. Coming back to the hotel after exploring felt like coming home.

title: EXCELLENT accommodations
text: My experience at the Washington was EXCELLENT. The location and service was perfect. I don't plan to stay at any other hotel in New York in the future. WSH is by far my favorite and I highly recommend it.

title: Accueil très chaleureux et emplacement idéal
text: Accueil très sympa dans cet hôtel très bien situé dans le village,  le petit déjeuner est super, dommage qu'il ne soit ouvert que du vendredi au dimanche. Le restaurant North Square est très bien aussi pour un dîner rapide et inventif.

title: Great hotel, beware of which room
text: We loved the hotel and the people who worked there. The location is excellent. One room for improvement: I checked in online but we had to wait forever for the front desk staff to get to us and give us keys. Then we had to wait even longer for the staffer who was to put our luggage in storage. The biggest problem was our room - it was on the 6th floor but overlooking a dirty air shaft. I know such rooms have to exist but it was like a dungeon. This affected us even though we hardly spent any time there. They should give a steep discount for rooms like that - that was our biggest problem with the hotel.

title: I'll never stay here again.
text:
This may have been the worst hotel stay I've ever experienced. The brochure photos were WAY different than the actual experience. There were three of us in one room. We had two twin beds and a rollaway cot. The room was so small that in order to use the cot, we had to push the nightstand into the closet. Anyone wanting to use the bathroom had to step over the three beds. 

And to round out my first trip to NYC, our car was broken into.

title: Village only place to stay
text:
This is my favorite hotel in NYC.  For the location, the quality, and the reasonable price.  Room was very nice, good bed, very good bathroom, terrific shower.  Walking distance to the park, many restaurants, bars & music clubs.
A couple of additions would make it perfect: rubber mat for shower, hook on bathroom door for the wonderful bathrobe.
The staff are quite nice.

title: Another Great Stay
text: This was probably our 6th time staying at the Washington Square Hotel, and it remains our hotel of choice when visiting NYC.  This is largely due to the location in Greenwich Village - the most charming neighborhood in the city.  The Village has a local feel and is less touristy.  The hotel has remained the same throughout the years.  Rooms are small, which is normal for NYC.  The hotel is not particularly luxurious but is filled with unique history and charm.  The hotel staff is not particularly friendly, but there is a great doorman named Ronnie who always greets guests with a smile.  We simply love the neighborhood -- staying at the hotel is as close as you can get to living like a local.

title: Clean - Great Location - Charming !
text: This hotel is great! It was extremely CLEAN, the staff was friendly, we felt very cared for and had a great experience. For NYC, the price was excellent! It is definitely "vintage" and filled with character - not a big chain sort of hotel, which we liked. It is right on Washington Square Park and has a lot within walking distance. We recommend the Waverly Diner and the Bagel Pub. We would definitely come back.

title: Your charming home base in the village
text: I’ve visited the Washington Square Hotel almost ten times over the last few years with my family and on girls trips. We always keep coming back because of their incredible location, exceptional service, and spacious rooms (plus they have 10% discount for return visitors - be sure to ask). It’s located on a quiet street but within steps of all that the Village has to offer - amazing food, dreamy brownstones, cool shops and so much more. We started visiting when my sister was a student at NYU and now we will only return to this hotel as our temporary home anytime we visit Manhattan. The staff are so kind, helpful and personable. The rooms are immaculately clean, comfortable beds, and very quiet. While some run on the smaller side, they’re all well appointed for the price and the location, that’s really what stands out for us. Easy to get to multiple subway lines, taxis/Ubers quickly available, and again, you can literally walk everywhere. So much nicer than the Times Square area when many tourists end up, this feels like you’re part of a community. Stop what you’re doing and book the WSH for your next visit, you will not regret it!

title: Reasonable price and good location
text: Have stayed here twice. Rooms are decent size and clean. The staff are always helpful and the location is convenient--the subway is nearby, and the Whitney Museum and High Line are a 20-minute walk.  Many pubs and restaurants nearby. Overall, highly recommend.

title: Great hotel!
text: The staff at the front desk both behind the desk and in the lobby/out front are extremely friendly and very helpful.  I requested two quiet rooms and that is exactly what we were given.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the updated bathrooms brightly lit with ample hot water.  I will be back next month.  It's also a great deal and a great location.

title: Great Lounge, Spacious rooms and King beds! We will be back!.
text: We were so pleased with the Washington Square Hotel.  We were in town for the Whitney’s Hopper exhibit and wanted to stay in the area.  Our regular hotel was the Marleton but we were blown away how at the WSH we could have a spacious King room, COVID safe quieter lobby, and a great lounge & restaurant - for less $$. The WSH is not glitzy nor is it quite as “polished’” as the Marleton, but the room was twice the size and very well equipped with a desk for work, bathtub, and seating. Our room faced away from the street , so it was quiet with expansive views.  The two elevators to each floor meant we were never waiting from our 6th floor room.  Critical to us, was that we felt COVID safe.  They recommended masks as soon as we entered which of course was optional, but a significant percentage of people did wear masks, as did all of the staff in the restaurant at Breakfast.  The lobby was never crowded.  A big plus was having the lounge and restaurant connected to the Hotel; meaning in the cold (highs in the 20’s that week), we could simply walk through to have a drink (great Happy Hour) , enjoy the Sunday Jazz in the bar or have breakfast.  The menu was good and we were pleasantly surprised how good dinner was when we decided it was just tooooo cold to make our reservation.  The menu was innovative and reasonably priced. The standout were the desserts - and we are not dessert people - but this had been the recommendation of another guest.   The area around Washington Square is always interesting, plenty of restaurants, bars and things to do. Transportation links are strong and it was a $15 taxi ride all the way to the Met! We will definitely be back.

title: Location, location, location
text: Very nice older hotel in the heart of Greenwich Village. The NYC subway is around the corner and PATH from NJ is 2 blocks away. Easy to get to  from NY or NJ airports or train or bus stations. Staff is friendly and room was very clean. Price is good for NYC and the quality of the hotel.

title: January visit
text: Cute boutique hotel!  Very friendly staff and clean rooms. Rooms are small but you are in NY but bathrooms felt recently updated.  Close to so many cafes and restaurants. Quick walk to the subway and all many of the top shopping areas. Safe area.

title: Great Location, Good Deal
text: Located directly opposite the NW corner of Washington Square Park, The Washington Square Hotel is ideally situated. So many iconic Village destinations--The Blue Note, The Village Vanguard, The Comedy Cellar, The Chess Forum--are within a few blocks, as are dozens of bars and restaurants and other attractions and amenities. The hotel is a tastefully updated old school classic, with small but clean and well-appointed rooms, and, at least when I was there, a friendly, welcoming staff. The price is extremely reasonable for NYC; in fact, it may have been the only part of my recent stay in the city that seemed like a bargain.

title: Second Time. Still Love It!
text: Stayed here for 15 nights arriving 19 October 2022. Second trip to NYC and second time we've used this hotel. Paid for room overlooking street, and we could see Washington Square Park as well. Staff all very welcoming. Breakfast only served at weekends, but NYC is full of places to eat. Fantastic area. Subway about 2 minutes away. Greenwich Village just begs for you to meander the streets enjoying the atmosphere. Enjoy.

title: Fantastic family holiday hotel
text: We are a family of 4, two teenage sons and were in NYC for a family holiday. So we booked two rooms with twin beds. We stayed 6 nights and would have loved to have stayed longer. We researched this hotel carefully and it did not disappoint. This fantastic boutiquie Greenwich Village hotel is in an awesome cool location and we loved being on WS Park where there is always a lot going on. Also great to be walking distance to the West and East Villages and also the very cool LES. It is hard to think of any city in the world which would have so many fabulous cafes, bars, restaurants and shopping all within an easy walking distance vicinity. My sons loved the Gym, the rooms were very clean, decent size and well serviced, we loved the downstairs bar with very nice and chatty staff. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Lovely Hotel
text: This was our third stay at Washington Square Hotel.  W e had a great view of the park. The room was nicely appointed with a very comfortable bed! All of the staff members we encountered were very friendly and welcoming. I would certainly recommend WSH to anyone. Very pleasant experience.

title: Amazing Hotel Stay
text: Stayed at Washington Square Hotel while moving our daughter into NYU for spring semester.  We’ve decided we won’t stay anywhere else!   Location was perfect, room was beautiful, but the staff was the highlight of it all. Everyone from the doormen to the desk to the room service were exceptional answering any questions we had about the area and anticipated all of our needs.  I really can’t say enough about all of them.  And when we got home and discovered we forgot an item in our room, it was quickly mailed to us at no charge. They will have our business for years to come!

title: Bien mais quelques points a noter
text:
Hôtel très sympa!  La chambre est spacieuse et la salle de bain et top!
C’est propre et la femme de chambre passe tous les jours.
Je voulais mettre 4 étoiles mais malheureusement, la vue de notre chambre était … comment dire… c’était une première: on avait la vue sur un mur qui était à 1 m de la chambre donc que ça soit la journée ou la nuit, on ne distinguer pas le jour… dommage…à ce prix là!
Et l’autre étoile en moins c’est qu’à proximité on a quand même une population pas top top top, on était pas trop rassuré quand on rentrait le soir du métro à l’hôtel!
Sinon la presta de l’hôtel est bonne! Vous pouvez y aller sans problème.

title: Fantastic Hotel & Staff!
text: Our stay at the Washington Square Hotel was FANTASTIC! The staff (front desk, porter, maintenance and doorman) were all so kind and helpful!  Our room had all we could ask for & more! We’ll be back!!!

title: ** Does Not Even Merit 3-Stars - Better Options in NYC **
text:
AVOID. You have way better options in Manhattan. After booking 6 months in advance for my son’s wedding, arrived at 5:40pm (after another lost baggage incident), but chill - politely asked  for a quiet, interior King room as requested. 

Nope NOTHING AVAILABLE - gave me the smallest rundown, shoebox on 1st Floor facing a noisy side street with a pair of Twins jammed together, on an open corridor from the Lobby to The Lounge +  Restaurant via a forefoot (“Clang, clang!”)+ the Entrance outside - VERY NOISY hallway. 

Out shopping NEXT lunch hour for son’s wedding + came back late and was charged 150% of the original Room Rate for a 2nd night. 

ASKED politely, “Have all the daily rooms checked in so early?” at 3pm. Yes. No Housekeeping. Furious got to the room and asked for towels from Housekeeping which arrived twice within 5 mins. Management were LYING outright. ABOID this fleabag. 2/5 is generous.

title: My NYC Go-to
text: Lovely little spot with comfy beds, friendly service, an excellent location and reasonable prices. Great showers coffee in the room, and super quiet for a restful sleep. I'll be staying here from now on when I visit NYC.

title: Experience The Village Like a Local
text: Why stay anywhere else? For a great price, this historic, Art Deco hotel has it all: a location that's literally steps from all the action in Greenwich Village as well as the subway/food/clubs/shops/the park. Plus good-sized, tasteful rooms, a staff who actually care about their guests' experience, and on site food and drink. My fifth visit.

title: The Washington Square Hotel
text: This is our second stay this month and we love the hotel. The staff is wonderful. The rooms are immaculate. The location for our purposes- events in the West Village is perfect and a stroll through Washington Square followed by a cocktail in the cozy bar makes for a lovely day.  We will definitely be back.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: The Washington Square Hotel is an excellent hotel with a friendly and polite staff that made me feel comfortable when arrival and during my whole length of stay. My superior room was excellent, comfortable, clean and perfect. The bed was relaxing soft and all four pillows were medium firm. The bathroom was perfect with plenty of room space, well lighted and eight plus towels. The shower has a huge space with water jets, a handheld shower-head  and a sitting bench to relax. The room has a Keurig coffee maker, iron board and combination safe in the closet. Thank you so much for making my stay Excellent and Enjoyable. A loyal guest always.

title: A perfect hotel for your stay, short or long!
text: Absolutely amazing stay. Staff were all pleasant and helpful. Room was clean and perfect, and more than we even expected. They went above and beyond for my fiancée's birthday. Highly recommend this location. Easy access and reachable elevator. Great location near a park, just a few blocks walking to Astor place theatre or soho. So many things to do. Couldn't ask for a better stay.

title: Real NYC feel
text: We loved this hotel.  The rooms are the same size as the cookie cutter chains uptown, but are not cookie cutter at all.  They are clean and comfortable.  The location is amazing.  Walking out of your hotel and onto Washington Square and Greenwich Village just can't be beat.  Around the corner are many subways to take you uptown if that's your thing.  And the front desk staff and the doorman were alway pleasant and helpful.  This is how things should be.  We'll be back.

title: We’ll be back!
text: We have stayed at the Washington Square Hotel many times, since it is near NYU where our child is a student. The rooms are always immaculate and well-stocked with fluffy towels, coffee and tea, and just recently, comfy robes! The doormen/concierge are as nice as can be, and ready to offer suggestions of restaurants or call a cab for you. If you are lucky enough to be there when Ronnie is working in the lobby, you may also get some cooking tips and recipes! You also can’t beat the location of this NYC gem.

title: Favorite Village Hotel
text: The Washintotn Square Hotel is the ONLY place to stay in NYC, and the nicest affordable hotel in Greenwich Village. Rooms are nice and location.  You can walk to anyplace, restaurants, bars, music clubs.  The folks at the front desk are nice, and helpful. The doormen were friendly and good.

title: Location, Location, Location!
text: An ideal spot on a charming block in the heart of the Village. Slightly Bohemian in decor, what WSH lacks in mod cons it delivers in a weary sort of old New York charm. Within walking distance to Soho, Tribeca, half of lower Manhattan & tons of great restaurants & bars. Most of the staff go above and beyond to accommodate with the notable exception of a particularly unhappy (bitter?) daytime desk person but Mr. Ronnie Jenkins manages to smooth out the rough edges! An overall great experience, by all means stay!

title: Stately Sophisticated Greenwich Village Hotel
text: I spent two nights here in early November 2022.  Located on the northwest corner of Washington Square Park in lovely Greenwich Village, this hotel is a gem in the rough. My wife and I had a superior room on the second floor with a window overlooking Waverly Place with views of the park. Our room was small, about 150 square feet (about 14 square meters), but clean and efficiently designed with drawers and closet space to store your clothes, shoes, and assorted belongings. It contained an in-room safe. The bed was very comfortable and you can control your own heat. The bathroom was small but spotless with sufficient towels and complementary toiletries. There was a tub with shower. The water pressure from the shower was very good and there was ample hot water. The shower was also easy to operate. The interior decor of the hotel was attractively decorated with tiled mosaics throughout. There is also a restaurant and small bar on premises with outdoor seating available in the now ubiquitous street kiosks.  Although we didn’t eat here the food smelled wonderful. Staff at the front desk were extremely pleasant, friendly, helpful and efficient. With this hotel located right at the park you cannot find a better and more Central location in Greenwich Village. We highly recommend this establishment. Remember to leave enough time to enjoy the park with its many visual artists and musicians. On the day we left there was even a solo pianist playing there on a grand piano.

title: Excellent, warm and friendly, clean
text: Warm, friendly and very helpful staff; room was clean and convenient, neighborhood was great to walk in for all needs, restaurants, park, stores...a great part of NYC, room price reasonable for NYC...

title: Homey spot in a classic neighborhood
text: At the conjunction of NY.U. and the West Village, you are in the middle of the neighborhood bustle. Restaurants all around but the house restaurant is also good.  Not a touristy area. Very reasonable room rates. Breakfast only on weekends but the classic Waverly Diner is a half block away.

title: Great Option in Manhattan
text: A clean, decent hotel in Manhattan that provides reasonable value amidst the insane prices of its neighbors.  The building is dated, but my room was quiet and a good size, and the bathroom was recently renovated with an amazing shower.  The bed was also comfy, and there was an iron already in the room, which you (increasingly) can't take for granted at some places.  Service was pretty good, and the fact it isn't a huge hotel is also a plus, in my mind.  The immediate vicinity has definitely seen better days, but there were always lots of cops and NYU students around, so I never felt unsafe.  It's no bargain, and would be ridiculously overpriced in almost any other market in the country, but for anything cheaper you are either in a hostel or across the river.  So if you want to be in Manhattan, it's a very good option.

title: The best hotel in NYC!
text: This hotel is close to everything cool. We walked everywhere, spending a lot of time at the comedy cellar, Washington Square Park, Soho, and other areas in the village. This staff is what makes the place awesome. The front desk, staff, the doorman, and housekeeping were all awesome people who helped us during our time there. The hotel is historic, and so many cool people have stayed there before. It’s been totally updated and comfortable, and we loved our stay!

title: The best hotel in NYC!
text: The Washington Square hotel is the best New York has to offer. This historic hotel is charming and clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. This Greenwich Village neighborhood is quiet and peaceful but close enough to hop on the subway or visit a local eatery and coffee shop. On the corner of Waverly and Washington Square, the atmosphere is everything you imagine Greenwich Village to be. I highly recommend this hotel. It is going to be my go-to place when in NYC.

title: Great Location and Amazing Shower
text: I traveled solo to NYC to attend a concert at a club that was an easy walk from this hotel. The location was the primary reason I booked here. My room was very clean, comfortable, and well stocked. I felt the room was nicely sized by NYC standards. The room had great curtains which made for a great sleeping cave. I was not bothered by street or ambient noise at all and slept rather soundly both nights. The bathroom was sparkling clean, had great toiletries, and the shower was truly amazing. I would seriously stay here again just to use the shower. Every staff person I encountered was friendly, helpful and greeted me with a smile. It was easy to walk to the train, restaurants, the park, bars, clubs, or anywhere else nearby and I never felt unsafe. Great service, great property, would definitely stay here again.

title: The spot to be!
text:
Just the place to be when you want to be everywhere in NYC. I’ve been going back there again again. Just don’t expect a luxurious spacious room! Breakfast was great that was included in the package (only on weekends). 

*Thanks for being accommodating, WSH!

title: Good hotel...challenging neighborhood
text: The hotel is close to the park (with the famous arch, statues & fountain) but the crowd there in the evenings can be crazy.  It is also within walking distance of Greenwich Village so we took a walking tour over there.  The subway is 3 long blocks and I would step quickly in one section away from pan handlers.  So the locations has both advantages & disadvantages.  We did not travel with a car so I don't know about parking.  Our room was facing the front street and it was quiet and comfortable.  I like the decor.  We pre-purchased a weekend breakfast in the adjoining restaurant and that was pleasant.  As early risers, there were no problems getting a table.  The front desk was polite, we did not use the gym.  Overall, the hotel was good but I was a bit uncertain about the neighborhood.

title: Great location , but hotel looking very tired .
text: We visited this hotel with friends 10 years ago and loved the location. We returned a few weeks ago and indeed the location was still great but we found the hotel very shabby now and in need of a face lift . Generally staff were indifferent . Rooms were a good size and clean and the room we had was quiet for New York.

title: Impropriate
text:
Nice place, first night friendly people.
Room needs maintenance.
Cleaning….sorry.
Worst: staff laying hands on you!
In all hotels in my life never experienced before.
Never again!!
Press charges with NYPD

title: Nice historic hotel near Greenwich Village
text:
Nice historic hotel which provided a clean adequately-sized room.   The hotel was convenient to transportation and access to Greenwich Village.  Enjoyed a convenient trip to Times Square, and the rest of Manhattan.
Housekeeping was excellent, they only promised 1 clean-up in our 4-night stay but cleaned twice, when we request.
Our room was kind of tight and only had view of a light shaft.

title: Eine Woche Aufenthalt im September 2022
text:
Zuerst mal das Positive. Das Hotel hat eine gute Lage. Subway sowie jede Menge Restaurants und Bars sind zu Fuß zu erreichen. Das Zimmer war sauber und die Zimmermädchen sowie die Türsteher waren sehr freundlich.
Jetzt das Negative. Es wurde kein Frühstück gereicht obwohl dieses gebucht war. Als Lösung wurde ein Restaurant vorgeschlagen bei dem man ein paar Prozente bekommen würde. Alle Spender mit Desinfektionsmittel waren die ganze Zeit über leer, das Gym sowie eine Eismaschine waren defekt und für ein late Checkout sollte 140 $ bezahlt werden. Aus unserem Zimmerfenster hatten wir eine Aussicht auf eine ca. 1,5m entfernte Mauerwand. Tageslicht kam also fast nicht ins Zimmer. Das Personal an der Rezeption war auch nicht wirklich gesprächig oder sogar hilfsbereit.

title: Not ADA and POOR Guest Service
text: Not ADA and not helpful with guests with disabilities.  When we booked we noted that one of the guests is in a wheelchair. Upon arrival we noticed the entrance was not accessible. We understand that it is an old building and historic. I asked if there was any other way to get in we were told sorry no. At the end of our stay the night before we left the manager told us they had a portable ramp and they could’ve put that out. Every time we entered or left the building table person in our party had to risk his safety to get in and out of the building. During our stay the elevator broke. We asked if there was any other way to get downstairs and we were told no.  The disabled guest in our party had to put his health at risk by going down a large flight of stairs and I carried his wheelchair. Later we found out there was a elevator.  I specifically asked the front desk that question and we’re not told about the second elevator.  The bathroom doors are very narrow and the disabled guest had to crawl into the bathroom to use it. The floors were dirty and disgusting. It’s a self health and safety hazard but they didn’t care. I do not recommend using this hotel if you have any disability. They were unhelpful and did not care about our health and safety.

title: History and comfort in a great hotel
text: We've just spent 7 nights here and loved the hotel. Our room was comfortable and the hotel decor is fabulous. We travelled all over NYC from Washington Square with no problems and coming back somewhere comparatively quiet (albeit often strains of music from the park!) was lovely. We will definitely come back if we visit New York again.

title: Beautiful Old building!
text: Beautiful old hotel located just off Washington Square Park. The hotel was beautiful and clean, the staff were friendly, professional, and accommodating.  If you love charming historical details this would be a great choice, but if you need things like large rooms with a huge tv and free breakfast this isn’t it 😁

title: Great spot Lovely hotel
text: Our 3rd time to this lovely, non-chain, boutique hotel. Can’t find a better location to stay in the city The park is beautiful The rooms are nice We’ve stayed in the Penthouse and King Superior and both were excellent Staff are very accommodating

title: A  weekend getaway
text:
I was in New York for a weekend to meet old friends. We couldn't have picked a better spot. The hotel is incredibly easy to get to on public transport - the MTA subway station is literally a few minutes walk. The room was great, clean, a comfy bed, good shower and with a view of the park. I was actually on the lowest floor, and thought I'd get a lot of road noise, but it was surprisingly quiet. They even accommodated my request for a fridge. All the staff were professional,  helpful and friendly - perfect. 
The location is ideal, with Washington Square Park just there to relax in, and many cafes and restaurants/take outs within a few minutes walk. It takes only a few minutes on the subway together up to the busy touristy  areas of Time Square, Broadway and Central Park but you get to come back to an eclectic and quieter neighbourhood. 
I'd highly recommend this hotel and frankly I don't see why I would stay anywhere else.

title: Nice hotel in great location
text: The Washington Sq Hotel is right in Greenwich Village, next to the park & the arch.  Comfortable room, good service. Best thing is thte location.  Easy walk to restaurants, bars, music clubs.  It is the only hotel I choose in NYC.

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: We recently stayed at the Washington Square Hotel.  We chose it based on location and other reviews.  It did not disappoint.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Beverly and Ronnie were pleasant and always had a smile on their faces.  The rooms were comfortable and clean.  We have already booked to return in Aug. and Nov.

title: Exceeded our expectations!
text:
Although the hotel itself is 3 stars, everything from cleanliness to friendly and efficient service was 5+ stars.
Room was airy and light, very nice view, good size.
Staff from bellmen to front desk and housekeeping went above and beyond to make us happy and feel welcome.

title: Good location, Poor Service
text: I stayed at the hotel for 6 nights.  The hotel was in a great location, close to the Washing Square Park (with lots of life happening).  The hotel is rather dated but looked fine, but their service was something else. Upon my arrival late in the evening (with no other guest in the lobby), the door man simply stood there and watched me trying to bring my luggages in without offering any assistance.  He only moved once I asked him to help out.  My room was clean on the first day but I was cleaned/ tidied up on Day 4.  Other than than, I got no service at all- to the point that I had to ask for coffee and new towels. The level of service was unacceptable.  Even though it was a queen bed, it was actually two bed being joined (rather uneven) so it was not most comfortable.  I could also hear the person walking upstairs walking back and forth all night long :(.  The internet was rather slow and not conducive for work. The phone was so dated that I could not barely hear the front desk staff talking to me when I called them..  All and all- I got the sense that the owner/management do not invest into the hotel and hire adequate staff for quality service. I would not recommend this hotel.

title: Historic Boutique Hotel
text: We had an excellent experience from beginning to end.  From the warm greeting at the front door and assistance with luggage, to the professional interactions at the front desk, I cannot say enough positive.  The Washington Square reminded me of a European style boutique hotel which I love, beautiful and much more interesting than the national chains, with spaces designed well without being unnecessarily enormous, very interesting history.  Guest were all ages, from around the world. My daughter and I had a deluxe twin room with two beds which overlooked the residential street and a large tree. High ceilings plus two huge windows opened which was wonderful, tons of natural light to go with a central A/C system.  The room spaces were perfectly laid out with plenty of storage, safe and amenities. Many CO Bigelow products in the bathroom.  The room was spotless and the housekeeper warmly greeted us in the hallway.  I had breakfast in the restaurant which was delicious and offered until very late morning, priced well and excellent quality.  The restaurant staff was attentive and kind.  Despite being in a major city, the room was quiet at night.  We appreciated an easy commute via subway or inexpensive taxi to our show in Midtown, but were so happy to have stayed at this hotel in the Village!

title: NOT recommended.
text: I stayed here 6/12/22. Upon checking in I was assigned a very small dark room with a window looking out to a brick wall. I immediately called down and asked if I could move. I was told "no, we are sold out," which seemed odd given that the hotel and restaurant seemed empty when I checked in. To check, I went on the hotel website and tried to make a reservation for the same day, and found multiple categoies of rooms available. I went to the fron desk in person and told the man what I found. His response was that "we need to save those rooms for NYU parents." This, of course, makes no sense because I could have reserved them online... Obviously, he just could not be bothered helping me.

title: Perfect hotel for family
text: We are always looking for a reasonably priced, clean, centrally located hotel in NYC that can accommodate our family of 4. We finally found it. The location of WSH is perfect for going pretty much anywhere in the city. The rooms are quite spacious for NYC, the bathroom in particular was more than ample. The a/c worked well. Street noise was minimal, lots of great coffee shops nearby and the staff here go above and beyond to make you feel welcome. Very helpful. Overall, WSH far exceeded expectations and we will definitely stay again.

title: We love this hotel!
text: This was our second stay at the Washington Square Hotel and it won't be our last. The staff is so nice and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The location is great. There are several coffee shops close by and our favorite Brooklyn Bagel is right down the street. We love this hotel!

title: Great location and well run
text:
Wonderful staff & excellent location.  Close to subway and not in over run touristy area.  Attached restaurant was also pleasant with very good service & prices.  Rooms are good size for NYC ...

Will definitely stay here again on our next visit.

title: Love this hotel and fabulous location
text: Very helpful staff and did a great job of keeping our room clean.  Cannot beat the location in the West Village, wonderful area for walking around and excellent restaurants all within walking distance.  Love staying here whenever we visit New York City.

title: Five nights of great service and quiet sleeping!
text: The hotel is so charming and accessible. We found our room to be lovely and quiet each of the five nights we stayed. Wonderful staff in the lobby; breakfast was delicious. Very convenient location for us.

title: Excellent hotel for the price point
text: Friendly, clean, safe hotel right on washington square park. I think everyone complaining here does not understand NYC hotels. They are small... If you want a big hotel room, you are going to have to pay for it. I love this hotel, it's close to NYU and super reliable and pleasant.

title: Columbia UNIVERSITY Graduation
text:
Great easy hotel, not overwhelming but true NYC style. Centrally located but much to do within blocks right on Washington Square..  been coming for a decade.  Don't stay anywhere else.
 
Restaurant fand Bar is convenient and great for drinks and good food.   BREAKFAST fantastic!  Warm atmosphere.

title: Loved it the second time too!
text: This is a historic hotel in the West Village. Yes, the rooms are small and our room opened on to an airshaft but it was quiet in a busy location and I prefer that to a view We love the Art Deco details. Beds are comfy with lovely linens and room is clean and they have coffee, tea and hot water in the rooms.  We had great service at breakfast and a umbrella to use during the blustery weekend.  So close to great restaurants and clubs as well as the subway. Can't wait to return.

title: Sfeervol hotel op een fantastische plek
text:
Het hotel komt goed overeen met de foto's. Kleine maar comfortabele kamers. Die op de lagere verdiepingen aan de voor kan zijn wel gehorig. Wij hadden die eerst maar kon zonder problemen omgewisseld worden voor een rustige kamer op de achtste verdieping. Daarnaast hadden wij twee kamer op de vijfde verdieping. Die hadden ene klein raam en een smalle luchtgang, mogelijkheid op het raam open te zetten. Je hoort wel overal de airco's. Maar het is bijna onmogelijk om in New York en plek te vinden waar je stilte is. 
Het personeel is zoals al veel mensen schrijven superaardig. 
Het enige waar het hotel niet transparant in is is het ontbijt. NU (CORONA) is het zo dat er op zaterdag en zondag in het restaurant The North kan worden ontbeten. Dat kost $ 13,00 p.p.
