(Ex Tax en Tip). Dan mag je van de reguliere ontbijtkaart alles kiezen en je krijgt koffie/thee en jus de oranje. Prijs-kwaliteit een scherpe deal, en het ontbijt is heel lekker. We hebben alles wel uitgeprobeerd. De Pancake's winnen.

title: Disappointing
text: Stayed for the location as we were visiting our son. Assigned a room on the second floor, tiny, dark, looking out on a wall, no ventilation, coffin- like. As soon as we saw it we walked out and in fairness we were assigned a much brighter but still very small room on top floor. We did not eat at the hotel but asked for a coffee and bottle of water to be delivered but this service as not available. We had a drink in one of the outside booths which was ok - as the downstairs bar was a bit dreary. When we arrived we struggled up with our own suitcases and on departure we struggled through the door with large suitcases onto the street to try to get a cab. The concierge was at the front desk chatting to the receptionist. Overall we would not go back. The hotel may be historic but it needs a clean up and service was poor.

title: Great Location, modern hotel
text: Stayed here for the 5 boro bike tour which was perfect. The hotel rooms are small but fantastic. Ill take a small, clean modern hotel room over a huge ok one.  Planning another Trip to New York in a few months. Will stay here again.  If I had to say one negative is no Parking or Vouchers for a parking lot.

title: Location, location, location - but not much else.
text:
The location can’t be beat if you like the Village and want to be near Little Italy, Soho, etc. The staff is really nice. 

WARNING Our room (2d floor) had no natural light at all. The windows opened into an air shaft where the opposite wall was about 2 feet away; very very claustrophobic. It was quiet at night but completely dark all day. At over $300 per night (including taxes) , I’d like some natural light and fresh air. The staff said they would move us but the hotel was completely full. 
Luckily we had gorgeous weather all weekend, because staying for any amount of time in that room would have been depressing.

title: Great hotel
text:
The past week we stayed in the hotel.
It’s the favorite hotel from our tour operator Jan Doets reizen if you visit New York. And the are right! 
It’s a very nice place to stay if you visit New York.
Subway’s nearby at short walking distance 
Very nice helpful friendly people working, clean rooms etc. Great beths, nice shower and quiet. It’s a great place to relax 
We will recommend the hotel to our family and friends if the visit New York.

title: The Best Anniversary!
text: We stayed here in 2019 and again in April 2022 and were not disappointed! I am not sure which is better, the location or the staff at WSH. The staff greets you coming and going and is willing to take care of any needs you may have. The location is perfect for any visitor to NYC. If you like to walk it is walking distance to multiple subway stations, WTC, Bleeker Street, Greenwich Village, Chelsea Market, The Highline, and so many great restaurants/coffee shops! We highly recommend the WSH!

title: Staff make it
text:
Good location-  quiet and convenient. Beds were comfortable, room was cleaned beautifully every day. New towels and coffee pods replenished. The interiors of the hallways need a bit of love.

Special shout out to Ronnie who was professional, thoughtful and charming.

We had a drink in North Square - hotel bar and restaurant and they are missing a trick here. Small cocktails, no atmosphere and no happy hour? Hence why we only went once. No vegan options for brunch.

I would go again for location, comfy beds and staff.

title: Excellent Location, Clean, Comfortable
text: I've stayed at the Washington Square Hotel several times and at different times of the year. Its an excellent location for all West Village sites, restaurants, and activities (music and comedy clubs). Its close to two different subway lines to take you up or down town easily. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and clean. This continues to be my stay of choice for NYC.

title: Great place and location
text:
I loved this hotel. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The location was perfect for visiting my daughters who live in the West Village.   My room was clean and quiet and I appreciated that I could open the windows (they have safety locks which prevent them from opening too far!)
The hallways are a little funky and narrow and the elevator slow but it added a distinct personality. 
I will definitely go back!

title: Loved our stay here
text:
Stayed here with my grandson for 3 nights while we checked out Parsons School of Design as a college for him. It was an excellent choice
Had a very comfortable, clean room with two double beds, quite spacious for NYC, nice bathroom with a good tub and two sinks. It was amazingly quiet, close to the subway, and within walking distance of all the neighborhoods that we wanted to visit. Because it was easy to go out for a few hours and then return to the room for a break it made for a relaxing, easy visit instead of a stressful one. Would return again without question

title: Like coming home
text: We always stay at the Washington Square hotel when we are in NYC. Location is the best! The rooms are quiet, the beds are comfortable, andthe coffee is delicious. The staff always goes above and beyond to accommodate us and make us feel welcome and to ensure that all of our needs are met. Recent upgrades have only improved the experience. We recommend WSH for anyone.

title: Older property, good location near park, major front desk challenges
text: The hotel enjoys a unique position on the corner of Washington Square Park in New York.  Close to NYU buildings.  The hotel is an older property that has modest modernization but the decorations and feel are the opposite of a modern hotel, but satisfactory for a 3 star property.  The hotels sells rooms via Expedia and other online sales platforms, which makes the front desk coordination, check in and other aspects disjointed and challenging.  In attempting to make adjustments for dates, rooms, and the like the hotel front desk and reservation are referred to Expedia or the sales platform operator for any adjustments, making the guest experience cumbersome and complicated in terms of arrival, check in, booking, and important aspects of the guest experience and stay.   Compared to many other properties in New York City, the guest reservation and front desk experience rates 1 star and guest should understand how the front desk experience will impact and perhaps diminish the guest experience.

title: Amazing visit.
text: I can’t say enough wonderful things!  So helpful, friendly, and caring!  ALL the doormen were amazing. Helpful tips for places to go, filling out water bottles, and having fun with us. Made us feel at home. Left some jewelry in the room and it was quickly located and held for me at the front desk. Beautiful and spacious room with great shower. Can’t wait to return.

title: Very good experience
text: I recently stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and it was a very good experience. My daughter lives nearby but since she had to work some of the time this was a good solution, as the hotel is very reasonably priced. I will definitely stay there again! The location is great, too.

title: Friendly, Comfy, CLEAN!
text: My husband and I are lounging in bed having coffee at the lovely Washington Square Hotel as I type. This hotel is marvelously located, loads of places to walk to easily. The roomies pretty bare bones but we actually both agree we slept well! The bed is that perfect place between hard and soft! The bathroom is tiled in a vintage-ish pattern from floor to ceiling and the whole place is very very clean without any funky cleaning supply smell. We did have to request some regular coffee pods for the Keurig, there were a bunch of decafs, but otherwise a perfect 10! A++ to this hotel! A++!

title: Remarkable stay in the village
text:
Visiting from Belgium. We stayed with 2 of our 4 kids (young men 26 - 24) for pre-New Year and after. Saw the ball drop!
The Washington Square is family owned, ideally located in the heart of Greenwich Village. Great welcome, fairly priced, rooms are very clean and practical even though not huge. But you can’t beat it at that location! Ronny, the concierge spoiled us and gave us lots of wonderful advices for our visits. We highly recommend the hotel to everyone! Happy wedding anniversary Ronny and thank you to the whole team for being sooo nice

title: Wonderful stay at Washington Square Hotel
text: We had a fantastic stay. The location was perfect and every employee was friendly. The rooms were clean and quiet. The area was nice for walking around with a lot of restaurants. The metro station was very convenient. I would definitely stay there again.

title: It wasn't amazing but it was above ok
text:
The location is fantastic walkable to greenwich village and shops - very close to a subway line, that's well served with a few lines.

It's a 3 star so hotel so i thought i had my expectations managed - staff at check in were polite. it's presentable if a little tired in the lobby.

The beds were comfy but the place, upstairs is really run down. the room was clean but grubby and tatty. 

but i mean one only needs a place to rest their head in NYC as as far as locations go, i'd use the hotel again - because for it's faults it was a reasonable price in comparison to other hotels for December.

title: Return Visit-Total Disappointment
text:
We stayed at the Washington Square in July and were so pleased with the entire experience that I made plans to return for a special night. I reserved the same type of room-double double (quad) deluxe. The room that I was assigned at check-in could not have been more different than the one we had in July. The only thing that it had in common was two beds. It was cramped, dark, and dreary with no view. I was told by the front desk clerk that it was the only room available- I showed her the website picture for this class of room (which was indicative of the room we had in July) - The room they tried to assign me on the first floor looked nothing like it! Basically I was told “too bad” and the only solution was for me to pay to upgrade to a “penthouse”room- which I did, as I did not want to disappoint my friend (I had sent videos and pictures from my July stay and it would have been embarrassing for us to stay in the dark cramped room with one window looking at a roof!)
To add insult to injury, when I got up in the morning and tried to take a hot shower in the “penthouse” room, there was no hot water. So much for that. $400 for a night and no hit water. WTF!?!
I can’t stress how disappointing this stay was- the indifference of the clerk and the lack of any level of customer service offered. A warning to anyone considering this hotel, the photograph on the website is not representative of the room you may receive. The pictures show spacious, light, bright rooms with multiple large windows. The management of this hotel do their customers a disservice by not including photos showing the dingy dark rooms that they charge the same price for. 
I travel to NY often and used to live around the corner from this hotel. I thought I had found a gem but this experience ruined it.

title: Great location, welcoming staff
text:
This is a boutique hotel at the northwest corner of Washington Square Park. Right in the middle of NYU, and a quiet residential block only a half-block from busy 6th Avenue. Reasonable rates, friendly staff, and a really good restaurant with a local following. I really liked it.

 The only problem: my room didn’t have a comfortable chair. Hotels of the world listen! We are only asking for a small padded chair, maybe with arms? 

I ended up seated on a bed pillow on the floor, with my back against the wall. Not comfortable but better than the plastic desk chair in my room. Alas.

title: Washington Square Hotel
text: I enjoy staying at the Washington Square Hotel when visit NYC. It's located at the heart of Greenwich Village next to Washington Square Park with plenty of restaurants, shopping, park relaxation and is walking distance to the nearest subway station at the end of the block at the 4th & Waverly station. The hotel is clean, easy to walk through and the staff is always polite. The hotel has stairs and an elevator with nice long hallways that are quiet and comfy to get to your room. I love the old style vintage feel of the Hotel. It's Perfecto!

title: Long overdue review for a favorite hotel.
text:
This hotel is  not for everyone -- and that's just fine with me.  It has a style and charm that make it feel like a top-quality European 3 star hotel. 

It's an old building with beautiful art nouveau features, room decor which complements that look.  You'll never wake up and wonder what hotel and what city you're in.  And, yes, the corridors are narrow and the elevators small.  

But what really makes it for me is the operation.  Maintenance is meticulous, and housekeeping top notch.  The housekeeping and front-of-house staff are all pleasant and cheerful, and almost all have been there for years -- a rarity in NYC.  My understanding is that it's been owned by the same family for decades, and the staff stability, continuous improvements and eye for detail suggest they manage the place for the long run.

title: Needs renovation
text:
The hotel is within perfect distance of the NUY campus and the metro. Have lots of dining options nearby as well. The hotel is pretty old and some people will find it charming. For me, it was a bit claustrophobic - the stairs, the old elevator, and the very dark tones of the lobby. The rooms are quite small too, although this is NY so maybe not that surprising. I think for sure they need to invest in some renovations. I was surprised that although my rooms were supposed to get breakfast they did not offer due to Covid. But at the same time on weekends, you can pay for the breakfast. So thats weird.
Overall, I don't think I will probably choose to stay somewhere else for the same price.

title: Great location, but a little tired
text:
First, let me say that I would definitely stay here again. The location is amazing with easy walking access to so many interesting areas, shops and restaurants. The staff was excellent and very helpful. We booked a double room (2 beds) because these tend to be bigger and we were not disappointed. The room and bathroom, by any standards, were large with lots of windows overlooking the park. The beds and pillows were very comfy and we both slept well each night. But, there are some downsides...
The hotel itself is a bit run down. Some might find it charming...I thought it was in desperate need of some paint and TLC! It is clean but because it's so run down, it doesn't always appear that way. It reminded me very much of small hotels in Europe rather than North America - tiny elevator, very narrow hallways, worn carpeting, peeling paint, etc. The walls were also very thin - we could hear conversations coming from the room next to us and every step taken by the people over us. That being said, the hotels seems to cater to an older clientele so no one was partying late into the night and our sleep was never disturbed.
Being so affordable, and well located, I can overlook the faults of the hotel - but, really, these are things that could be quite easily fixed with a fresh coat of paint and some deep cleaning.

title: Wonderful neighborhood hotel
text: We have stayed in a number of NYC hotels and this is our favorite. It’s a bit off the beaten path, so you get a more neighborhood feel, which is great. It is conveniently located right next to Washington Square Park, NYU, SOHO, and the Village. The decor is fun. Our. Room was clean, fully stocked, and spacious enough for NYC! The best part is the staff. The day doorman is AMAZING and so helpful with area recommendations, the front office staff were so nice and accommodating. Our stay here was so great. We loved it and will definitely stay here on our next NYC trip.

title: A charming New York hotel
text: Lovely, quiet, well maintained hotel. Clean, simple, charming with period character. Big comfortable bed. Friendly staff. Well located for visiting downtown, and just steps away from the Washington Arch - as seen at the start of When Harry Met Sally.

title: Little Gem
text: Lovely small hotel so convenient to everywhere. Walk out the front door to Washington Square Park. We loved the Art Deco decor and intimacy of the place. Small but had everything we wanted - lush linens, great location, helpful desk and doormen and so close to subway. Our party had moms as well as recent college grads and we all loved it. The attached restaurant/bar was a bonus. This little hotel is five stars in our book!

title: I like this place!
text: Great base for getting pretty much anywhere in the city; large room and large bathroom; lots of closet and drawer space; comfortable king bed; great towels: good Keith coffeemaker. I want to convey appreciation for the slightly faded quality of the decor without suggesting that anything needs updating. Current policy is to provide full housekeeping only every third day—would have liked it on a more regular basis. Staff responsive to problems. And wished for an in-house breakfast.

title: Superb Locaton
text:
Location was outstanding, right at the corner of Washington Square Park. Great subway stop at the other corner where many trains stop at (express and local). Easy walk to many neighborhoods such as Soho, LES, Tribecca, Union Square, Chelsea, etc. The room itself was a nice size, bathroom was a little tight in my particular room but had amazing water pressure. The bathroom steamed up easily though since there was no fan. Bed was fine. Next time I will try and book a front facing room to have some sort of view, seems like a lot of the rooms look at other buildings which leads to a dark and dim room, BUT quiet!  It was fine overall since I spent most time out exploring. Staff was friendly but there were times that I felt like asking a question was a bother, there was a gentleman that worked at night on the weekend that was the most helpful and friendly towards myself. 
I would certainly stay here again, it was so nice to sit in the park and relax and then  walk less than few minutes to go back to refresh and head out for the evening. There seemed to be a lot of regulars that stayed here, quite a few people seemed to know the doorman.

title: Not as expected.
text:
The location is definitely the only factor that would  keep me coming back since it is close to my daughter’s residence.  I was disappointed that I did not get a room with a view even though I booked a room type that I was told had upper floor views. The rooms are clean and a bit roomier than others I have stayed in  the area, but without a view they are very drab and outdated as is most of the hotel. 
The service upon arrival was less than lukewarm since it was busy and only one person at the desk. He made us feel that he was frustrated with the crowd. Overall, I would not recommend unless there is a very good deal on the rate.

title: Muy buena alternativa cerca del soho
text:
Muy buen hotel. Es mi segunda estadía, en este caso con mi familia. Nos asignaron día habitaciónes en 2 y 3 piso, ambas con ventana pero sin luz natural, daban a un paredon. 
Las habitaciones cómodas y con buen espacio para moverse, el baño amplio, con ducha y moderno. 
Lo que no nos gusto es que las habitaciones las limpian cada 3 días y había que solicitarlo. 
La ubicación espectacular, al lado de la Washington Square y la 5ta avenida. Linda zona y bien concurrida.

title: We loved it!!
text: So glad we stayed here! We loved everything about this place. The location is perfect, the employees were super nice and helpful, especially our buddy Ronnie! He gave us so many suggestions and tips with an infectious happy attitude. Our room was small but super clean. Great water pressure and nice hot water that we did not have at the bigger "nicer" hotel we stayed in for the other half of our trip near Central Park. We will definitely be back!

title: Nice hotel with a good location
text:
My wife and I have travelled to New York several times, usually staying in the Times Square area.  Three years ago we decided to get away from the large crowds and try a different location.  We stayed at the Washington Square Hotel and were glad we made the choice.  This month we stayed here again and found it as nice as the first time.
   The hotel is located in Greenwich Village, right next to Washington Square Park.  There is a subway station just around the corner, so you can easily get anywhere in the city with just a short walk.  There are many restaurants nearby including one at the hotel itself.  
   Due to the pandemic breakfast was not being served at the hotel.  The Waverlly Restaurant, only one block away, serves meals throughout the day.  We ate breakfast there several times and thought it was very good.
   We stayed in a king room which overlooked the street in front of the hotel and had a view of the park.  The room was very large and the bed was comfortable.  The bathroom was also large with double sinks and a walk-in shower.  The shower was excellent, with plenty of hot water and good pressure.
   The staff treated us nicely and took care of our needs.  They booked a ride to the airport for us, which arrived promptly with a courteous driver.
   If you want to get away from the large crowds and save some money this hotel is a good choice.  We would definitely stay here again if we return to New York.

title: Thank you to Beverly, Charles and amazing staff - for a great holiday getaway in a unique NYC neighborhood
text:
Where do I start with the superlatives?

My NYC July 4th vacation was long booked to be a little closer to the touristy area thanks to a great price attained in January. But as it got closer to my trip, I needed a viable alternative as I had concerns regarding my original hotel or the trip would be not happening.

Enter Washington Square Hotel...voila. Even though I booked on a third-party site, I was treated, from the get-go, like a VIP guest. When I called upon booking, just to see if it might be possible to get a refrigerator, I almost dropped the phone because Charles answered on the second ring. No, there were no phone trees or menus, this is a hotel with real people who are truly awesome and helpful. Further was amazed when Charles said he would ask that my room include a refrigerator upon arrival.

Of course, upon arrival, a room was blocked that had the refrigerator and I was all set for a nice 3-day stay. As it turned out I had such a great experience, this day extended an additional night as I just did not want to leave.

Why? From the awesome front desk staff including Charles and Beverly to the amazing doormen - such personable, upbeat, friendly and just all-around genuine nice folks. Almost felt as if I was a guest in their home.

Great location by NYU/Washington Square Park plus Greenwich Village and easy to pretty much get everywhere else with a subway stop 1/2 block away (plus another line 3ish blocks away). Amazing eateries, shopping, and scenery. Plus for the most part, in a very residential neighborhood with a different side of NYC that you would encounter in the more touristy areas.

The room was well appointed, with a very comfortable bed, the best water pressure ever shower, and super-quiet. This is my new favorite NYC hotel, as long as rates are within my budget.

Did a ton of touristy or just other fun under the radar kind of stuff, and this hotel was such a perfect base of my adventures. Have had a lot of challenges with personal and work life recently, and this was such a great escape thanks to this amazing hotel - with even more amazing staff like Beverly and Charles.

Thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you... appreciate your kindness and genuineness. I realize this is just who you y'all are - you made quite an impression. Bravo!

title: Dark, dingey hotel in a great location
text: I have to post this review because I replied heavily on the reviews here to book my stay and I was so disappointed. The room was dark and felt dirty, the lobby had the feel of a low scale hostel and the attached hotel restaurant/bar was just nothing special.  We stayed in a room off the lobby that involved a decent set of stairs to get to and no one offered to help with our suitcase or getting stroller up the stairs. Although the location is awesome, I just think they need to do major updates to bring this hotel to life.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: Charming hotel with so much character. Friendly staff, spacious room (for the city), comfortable beds, and quiet room.  I was traveling with my teenage daughter and we felt very safe here. The hotel was very close to the subway.  We actually took the Airtrain/subway to the hotel from JFK without any difficulties. It took just over an hour. We will definitely return!

title: center of the village, great rooms
text: We originally were booked to stay April 2020. The hotel was very generous in letting us use our "non-refundable" room credit well over a year later. We will be back. Great location for seeing a part of new york with far more charm than midtown or either side of the park. Easy walk to some of NY's best restaurants and bars, or easy subway access to the rest of the city. Room was generous size compared to many other places we have been in NYC at this price point, and staff was great with every request.

title: Good hotel, great staff, reasonable price
text: Nice small hotel across the street from Washington Square in Greenwich Village.  Great location with very helpful staff.  Got free upgrade to king room.  Very comfortable.  Located near many good restaurants.  Definitely recommend.

title: Charming Classic Boutique Hotel
text: I am biased as I used to live in Greenwich Village in the first decade of the 2000s and this is the hotel where I had all my visiting guests stay. And I'm also not sure how helpful this review will be for sightseeing tourists as I wasn't here as one but for those of you travelers looking for a NYC-relative quiet typical-sized room at a NYC-reasonable rate near public transportation in a charming Manhattan neighborhood, this hotel may be just right for you as it was for me. The hotel building is old so expect beautiful art deco decor in the lobby, classic (small/slow) elevator, carpeted hallways, and thick walls.  My room was a mix of classic and modern with newer hard surface flooring in the room and art deco tile in the bathroom.  Shoutout to the housecleaning staff for my room being spotlessly clean.  The linens and mattress were so comfortable. And I had enough open space to not feel the least bit cramped. The hotel staff was friendly, efficient, and still wearing masks.  Their other Covid protocols are still in place as well.   As I arrived at 6pm on a Friday, I scored a parking spot right on the tree-lined street out front of the hotel.  But I believe they validate if parking in the nearby parking garage. There is a large citi bike station to rent bicycles on the side of the hotel.  And loads of restaurants and shops in easy walking distance (10-minute radius). And only a few minutes walk to the West 4th Subway station besides all the buses.  I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

title: Great hotel, great staff, great location, great value
text: Had a deluxe room with two doubles on the first floor; have also stayed in a room with two twins in the past. The hotel is charming and unique; the staff is professional, cordial, and helpful; the rooms are clean and quiet (even on the first floor!), and the location can't be beat for walking to anywhere in lower Manhattan. If you like typical hotel chains this isn't for you, but if you want a safe, clean, convenient location with a local NYC vibe, stay here.

title: Good value for money for NYC
text:
The hotel is what you would expect for this price in NYC.
The good: 
- the doorman is super helpful and always in good sprits! 
- the location: right next to Washington Sq and NYU.
some rooms on the 9th floor has stunning views towards the Empire State Building.
- quite quiet for NYC
- rooms are small, but clean.

The not so good:
the corridors are old with old carpet. The elevators are small and slow.

title: Clean, comfortable, nice location…
text: Stayed 4 nights at Washington Square Hotel in mid- July to take care of some personal business in the area. Booked a standard Queen room. Pleasantly surprised at the ample size with good closet space, safe, hair dryer, coffee maker; decent-sized bathroom with great shower water pressure.  Room looked like it had been fairly recently updated, and was very clean.  Comfortable bed with crisp white linens. I thought the WSH slippers and the CO Bigalow soaps/shampoo to be a really nice touch.  Air conditioner was a modern split duct on the wall. Barely noticed the sound and it kept the room quite chilled (even needed to turn it off).  Good Wi-Fi.  Since I was busy throughout the day, the hotel provided a welcome respite after a busy day.   WSH has its own restaurant/ bar/lounge, with outdoor seating.  They made a fine Manhattan in the bar.  Location is a quiet street but the subway is only a block away. Tons of restaurants in walking distance in all directions. Staff was very helpful/ front desk is staffed 24/7. The hotel is still operating under COVID safety plans, requesting face covering in the common areas, and limiting housekeeping activities, but not an issue for me.

title: Excellent Hotel Choice
text: Found this hotel through Foder's Travel and we loved our stay here. The location, staff, room - all great. Coffee and slippers were a welcomed amenity.  Subway is right around the corner. Price was reasonable, great restaurants nearby and we could walk to so many other areas to explore.  Main reason for visit was to go to the New York Botanical Garden, easily reached catching the nearby subway and not even needing a transfer. even with it being in the Bronx.

title: Flooded room
text:
We were checked in to a room with a flooded floor. No attempt was made to solve the problem — we were just given some dirty towels to mop the floor — but the ceiling was dripping.

Really poor response to an obvious problem. Definitely not recommended!

title: Clean, comfortable and Cozy
text: Clean and comfortable room. Bed was super comfortable. Helpful and friendly doorman (Ronny?). Great location in Greenwich village. Sad the Breakfast was only on weekends. Close to NYU, Jazz Club The Blue Note, Washington Square Park and the hi-line.

title: Great hotel and great location
text: Just finishing up 5 nights here at Washington Square Hotel. Highly recommend.  Booked a standard Queen as expected to be out and about and wasn't worried about a beauty view. It was plenty large enough for two people,  luggage and room to move. Room looked like it had been freshly updated.  Air conditioner was a modern split duct on the wall.  Barely noticed the sound and it kept the room chilled.  Bathroom NY smallish but clean and great water pressure.  Hotel is still operating under COVID safety plans but not an issue. We are big kids and know how to make our bed. If we needed towels or anything additional,  they were quickly provided.  Location is a quiet street but the subway is only a block away. Tons of restaurants in walking distance in all directions.  Staff very helpful.  Seriously cannot go wrong staying here.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: This hotel was perfect for our week stay in NYC. The location was excellent with a subway  within a three minute walk up the block. The staff was awesome and we looked forward every morning to seeing the doorman that always had great tips about NYC.

title: Perfect! Old NYC comes alive!
text:
Are you ready to stay in a place where the management and staff treat you like a VIP? What a wonderful stay while apartment hunting for our daughter! We stayed in an updated room that was perfect - modern but still had the feel of a spectacular old building. Shout out to manager Beverly - kind, professional, and over-qualified! :) Ronnie at the front is a treasure! Miss good old-fashioned hospitality? Find it here along with a one-of-a-kind building that transports you to all the best of old NYC!
And... location, location, location!!!

title: Excellent!!
text: Everything here is excellent.. people , rooms , location, restaurant. I was in a king (302) and it is a excellent room, spacious nice bathroom and view.. as you’ve probably checked,  walking distance to Washington square park and numerous restaurants.

title: Great hotel in the heart of the Village!
text:
I have stayed at this hotel twice now, and each time was just perfect. The rooms are comfortable and the bed and linens are outstanding as are the bathrooms with beautiful updated fixtures. I have already made another reservation for my birthday in August and plan to be a regular guest going forward.

The North Star restaurant and cocktail lounge are also great and my only complaint is I wish they were open later(!), but that might change as the pandemic subsides. 

Highly recommend this Greenwich Village gem!

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text:
Looking for a great hotel to stay at in NYC. The Washington Square Hotel is where you want to be! Location, price and staff can not be better. You're in the heart of Greenwich Village, less than a block off the 6th Avenue subway line and taxi's going north. You can walk to the West Village, SOHO, Union Square, the Highline, etc...
Has a great restaurant (North Square) on the first level. And you are right across the street from the restaurant, Babbo. AMAZING Hotel!!!

title: really great location but needs to step up
text: I have stayed here about 4 times over the years and I stayed in September and just this week.  In September they did not clean the rooms, I understood, it was the middle of the virus.  But NYC is now open for business, yet, on my check in, there was a note they wouldn't clean the room for the first three nights, although you could call for towels.  This place is fine, nothing fancy, but has character and history.  Come on, get your act together for over $300 a night, at least dump the garbage can.  And the staff needs some training, too, restaurant not open for breakfast and the only place the front desk person could send me to was the diner.

title: Lovely hotel in a great location
text: The hotel has a fantastic location, just a few steps away from Washington Square.  We stayed in the penthouse suite and loved it.  The views of the city from every window were fantastic.  This lovely hotel has upscale everything - a big, beautiful bathroom, a fully stocked shelf of toiletries, an umbrella in the roomy closet, a very comfortable bed and huge, fluffy pillows.  The staff is friendly and very proud to share its history.  It was built in l903 as the Earl Hotel and many celebrities have lived and stayed here.  The art work in the art deco lobby was done by the owner's family.  It was a wonderful experience.

title: Reservation System Flawed
text:
The website says that you can book 5 nights and then get one free. However, when going through the booking process, the 6th night does not come up free.
When I called the hotel to inquire about this, I was simply told that I was wrong, and the woman bizarrely hung up on me.

title: Smooth1
text: This is a smooth hotel! It's team is second to none but understated. Justin, the doorman, is friendly but not pushy. The front desk staff was always kind and helpful. Our room wasn't large, but included a king bed and a perfectly planned bathtub to help smooth the muscles we used in navigating NYC. The location is too smooth too! Easy access to all the sites, especially  the too smooth Village.

title: Great hotel ! Great location ! Fantastic staff !
text:
What a find ... 

One night stay for a tipsy city night away from the kids. Stumbled across this hotel on Google of all things, staff really friendly and a great covid rate of 120 bucks. Room was huge by NYC standards. Lively area with some decent bars and restaurants close by. Much nicer than mid town where we stayed last couples night . It’s opposite Washington square park so lots going on. Room super clean, good water pressure and bed was v comfy. Staff really really nice , will 110% use again. Thanks

title: Ronnie is the best!
text: Ronnie is the Captain of the hotel and he is a blast. Knowledgeable of all things NYC, friendly, welcoming, humorous, charming—at all times. He takes WSH from great to extraordinary! I will miss him the most.

title: Everything we wanted
text: We needed a Covid break & being about 40 minutes outside NYC we decided a few days in Greenwich Village would be perfect. Wanted to be close to Washington Sq Park so after looking at reviews & pics for Washington Square Hotel, we decided to book it. Took the King Executive (room 302) & we couldn't have been more happy. Right next to the park with so many restaurants, cafes, BAKERIES & bars. The staff were very eager to please & friendly. Room was excellent & actually much better than the picture led me to believe. Plenty of space & the bathroom was great. Excellent shower in large stall. Will definitely return.

title: HIGHLY RECCOMENDED!
text: Warm and friendly staff made us feel at home every time we walked in the lobby. RONNIE went above and beyond with his hospitality and reccomendations for the area. Great rates and location couldn’t be better!

title: FEEL AT HOME!!!! EXCELLENT SERVICE
text: My family and I  are returning guests to WS Hotel and love to stay here.  The personnel is courteous, friendly and very helpful in any things we may need.  We fully recommend this hotel.  Even with the NYS measures of COVID-19, they made efforts to make us feel very comfortable and taken care.  Their restaurant North Square gives great service and food, too.

title: A very nice hotel run by very nice people
text: Just one night, but our room was ready early, and we were well looked after during our 2-day stay by the hotel staff who were all very friendly and helpful. We ate at the hotel's restaurant (next door), and the food/service was excellent. The room was comfortable and clean.

title: We highly recommend the Washington Square Hotel
text:
We highly recommend the Washington Square Hotel just across the street from Washington Square Park in the heart of Greenwich Village.  We live in NYC, but we stay there when family comes to visit and we give them our Village apartment. The area is vibrant with universities and attractions, close to SoHo and Chinatown for shopping, has great outdoor dining (for these COVID days), and easily accessible public transportation.

We especially like the top floor king suite with views of the Empire State Building and the park across the street.

title: Beautiful tile decorations enhance decor
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our second stay at WSH.  The staff and particularly the doorman were extremely friendly and helpful.  The hotel is decorated by tile pictures and designs that were apparently painted by the owner.  The rooms are well equipped and have pictures of famous accesses from the '40's.  It is right off Washington Sq and the restaurant at the hotel is very good.

title: As always, my home away from home
text: My late husband and I have stayed in the WS Hotel on and off for over 20 years.  It is always a pleasure, from being greeted by Ronny in the lobby, to the helpful desk staff, to the cleaning people.  It speaks well  for the management that there is a low turn over with the staff.  The rooms are super clean, as is the lobby, and it is extremely safe, as is the Greenwich Village neighborhood (I was born there, so I understand the street carryings on.) Even during Covid, there is lots of good walks to take and historic buildings to see. Washington Square Park is across the street from the hotel.  Always sights to see there.   I would not stay anywhere else, it is absolutely (especially since my husband passed) my home away from home.  North Square, the hotel's restaurant, has excellent food and a good wine list.

title: Concert in Washington Park
text: The perfect location for an event we attended in Washington Square Park! Our room overlooked the park and simply crossing the street got us to our event! The room was clean and delightful! The staff very friendly and helpful! Our overall experience was easy, fun, safe, and enjoyable! Thank you!

title: Perfect winter stay in the Village
text: The historic feel of this hotel and location are big pluses.  The room was clean, updated and the bathroom had beautiful classic tile that appeared to be very well kept yet older.  It was quiet and the staff was nice.  Breakfast was included, but we didn't take advantage of it. We were here in late January able to walk many places and take the subway into midtown to catch a Broadway show.  My husband is vegan and there were many restaurant options nearby.  I'd definitely stay here again

title: Perfect Location, Clean & Friendly
text: My son and I spent a quick night in the city and the WSH was a perfect spot for our visit. It was clean, convenient and comfortable. The bathroom was brand new, the linens and towels clean and plush, and the 4 layers of window coverings kept out both noise and light extremely well. The staff was SUPER friendly and helpful. Ronnie / Ronny? entertained my son a lot and we even left with a few goodies from him for my son to take home. So sweet. We will  be back.

title: Thank you Charles!
text:
I have to say Charles at the front desk made my stay an incredible time. He put effort and care into the finer details that made me feel welcomed. I needed a last minute booking and it was my last night in NYC, I was leaving to Tokyo in the morning. Charles made everything perfect and I won't ever forget it.

Thank you WS Hotel and thank you Charles!

Also, sorry about the state of the room when I left, we partied like it was our last night not just in NYC, but in the world.

title: Pour l'endroit et l'accueil
text:
un "petit" hotel dans lequel on se sent bien pour visiter tout le sud de Manhattan.
le cadre Art Deco est superbe, une belle chambre confortable.
et tant de choses à voir autour!
pas convaincu par le petit dejeuner, pas de buffet, juste à la carte et très lourd...
le prix est new yorkais mais sans regret!

title: Favorite NYC hotel
text: Have stayed many times - historic hotel with lots of character. Great location away from Times Square and FiDi - feels like a neighborhood - 1 blk to  A,C,E,B,D,F,M stop (R,W and 6 short walk) . Next to Washington Square Park and NYU. Easy walk to restaurants on McDougal, CVS,Chase, CapitalOne. Rooms always spotless, great front desk staff, restaurant and housekeeping staff. Some rooms have ESB view (Penthouse Suite is great!) Free chocolate chip cookies in the early afternoon.

title: NYU Visit
text:
Great location for visiting NYU and right next to bustling washing sq park.   We were able to walk the neighborhood enjoying the sights and weather. 
Breakfast was perfect in morning. Front desk service outstanding.  Upgraded us when our room wasn’t ready

title: She’s the best!
text:
I’m so glad I was introduced to the WSH.  At the NW corner of Washington Square Park—-perfect location for a base in the lower island area. Subway entry & convenience store at other end of block.  15 min walk to  Chelsea Market, Chinatown, Union Square—just pick a direction & you’ll hit another cool neighborhood. 
  My imagination has me comparing WSH to a cool great aunt...sturdy, old school, holds her age well, refined, funny, experienced & loving and wanting to share it all. Translate all that into the facility, the vibe & the awesome staff and you’ll want to check it out.

title: Interesting area, quiet street, and good subway @West 4th.
text:
This  historic,  family run hotel  is a perfect place for friends and family visiting  New York University:   the campus buildings are  close by, and Washington Square Park  always seems to have  something interesting to watch.
The compact,  quiet bedrooms have crisp white bedding,  toweling robes and slippers:  the bathrooms  gleam,  and have been  elegantly  re-designed.

The  style of bedroom decor seems  to recall  the 1940's and '50s: peachy beige painted walls, black and white framed  photos of long gone film stars, polyester drapes  in shades of muted plum, and early, blue hued, energy saving bulbs    in the bedside  lamps

A well supplied continental breakfast is  included, and can be enjoyed  in a quick stop format, with good coffee:  or  steps away in in their North Square restaurant for  a full  and varied menu.

Have stayed here a few times,  as  family  near by:   and  discovered  that   the room rates  can fluctuate enormously.   Happy  to find  $139 + tax on a Sunday night in February - pay ahead, no changes allowed.    Do suggest booking  directly - their website works well .

title: Très bien situé,  très confortable et très accueillant
text:
Hôtel historique du village sur Washington Square donc super bien situé. 
Bien équipé,  très confortable,  tout pour un séjour urbain - gym - resto ...
Le service est très chaleureux et parfait. Plusieurs options pour le petit déjeuner, donc ce qu'il convient à chacun.
Le quartier est beaucoup moins bruyant que d'autres à NY, donc pas d'inquiétude pour le bruit.

title: Great location, super friendly staff
text: The staff here are universally friendly and helpful, especially the doorman, who uses wizardry to hail a cab in less than 10 seconds. Our room was very clean, and relatively comfortable. And, the location is perfect: practically right on Washington Square, within walking distance to everything in The Village and not far from subway stops.

title: Simple the best
text: This is without a doubt our favorite hotel in NYC. The best location , service and people! Near the Washington Square Park . Most historic area in the city. Jazz clubs, restaurants and street food. Staff excellence!

title: Friendly Staff and Great Hotel
text: The staff was so friendly from the moment we arrived.  Everyone in the front lobby were happy and up for conversation.  The decor of the hotel is beautiful.  The rooms were comfortable and very clean and surprisingly quiet for being in a city.  Great location for walking around and sightseeing and close to a subway station.  I will definitely stay here again when visiting.

title: Friendly
text:
One of the best and most friendly and welcoming hotels I have ever stayed at.  
WSH is a hotel that feels more like a home than a hotel. It was quite obvious that many of the guests have stayed here many times and they have many reasons to.
I only wish we could have stayed a couple of nights more.

title: home again
text: incredible place. great food and service   i lived there for years and felt like I was at home.  the rooms are nicely upgraded qnd I had a view of the arch.cant wait to go back again.  such a great location with tons of history

title: Great Stay in NYC
text:
I've been to NYC many times so I wanted to stay somewhere a little more quiet & quaint. I love Greenwich area and there are not a lot of hotels there. We've stayed here before & the location is perfect.  We have 2 kids (8 &11). The park across the street was perfect for them.  They loved playing there & it seem like there is always something going on there.  'I am Legend' was partly filmed there as well so it's neat to see.  You're minutes away from Soho & a 18 minute walk to Chelsea Market. WSH has a bunch of places to go in the area...they posted it on their website which is fantastic.  i'd like to add Kesté pizza on Bleecker to the cheap eats for $5 pies that are amazing & you cannot beat the price or the taste. 
 
WSH has a continental breakfast in the am...fruit, toast, coffee, OJ, yogurt, scones, muffins, jam, peanut butter, nutella, granola, pastries. Which is great. It's near impossible to find any hotels that offer complimentary breakfast in Manhattan and that saves you money because everything is so expensive.  

Only complaint are the beds.  We took a room w two double beds for 4 ppl.  The beds are tight. We were ok with it tho as everything else was perfect.  The elevators are small...I mean small. Maybe 4-5 can fit in the one, 8ppl in the other comfortably. The hotel is in an Art Deco Decor - which is probably the era of when it opened. The hallways are a little dated. Everything is clean and tidy. We stayed on the 9th floor and the view was amazing. We pulled up the shades at night when the lights were out & its a beautiful view. This is a boutique hotel. It has character but it is smaller.
 
Ron at the front desk is great!  He is a wealth of knowledge & helped us out a lot. We would definitely go back to this hotel.  I emailed before I went to have a fridge put in & when we arrived one was in our room.

title: Superb location and friendly staff make for a very pleasant Greenwich Village stay
text:
I was intent on preparing a birthday get-away that would be geographically focused on Greenwich Village and anyplace we could WALK within roughly 30 minutes so this hotel seemed to be a good base.  I booked the King Penthouse and my understanding is that if you really want to go all out you could book it and the adjoining queen or double penthouse and you would have one HUGE space.

As other reviewers will tell you, this is not your fancy corporatey-feeling hotel.  It is relatively small, the furnishings are simple but here's the thing: the staff is super nice and helpful; the location is outstanding (you literally can walk right out the door and be at great restaurants, historical spots, bakeries, park, etc. immediately) and the price is extremely reasonable for what you get.

So if you are going to be disappointed that your room doesn't look like a Doubletree or Hilton or Ritz, probably shouldn't go here.  If you are looking for great value, supporting an independently-run hotel, would recommend you go for it.  

I don't know how big the other rooms are - I suspect not as large as the king penthouse - which by the way has three windows, each of which looks out in a different direction.

My ONLY negative comment is that there was one sort of sketchy looking person who seemed to just be roaming about the hotel - every time we took the elevator, this person magically appeared out of nowhere, which seemed a bit odd.

title: such a nice hotel!
text: 조식 제공 시간이 길어서 좋고 위치가 뉴욕대와 가까운 것이 가장 큰 장점. 직원들이 친절한 편인데 영어를 하기 나름인 것 같습니다. 영어로 제대로 물어보셔야 원하는 정보를 얻을 수 있습니다. 가격은 비싼편입니다. 뉴욕이긴 하지만 미드타운이 아니라서 관광지 접근성이 떨어지기 때문입니다. 맨하탄 가려면 지하철 타거나 걸어가야 합니다. 뉴욕대에 행사가 있다면 가까워서 좋습니다. 저는 뉴욕대에 인터뷰를 갔기 때문에 이용했고 만족합니다. 조식은 숙박에 포함된 조식은 달걀이나 베이컨은 별도 비용 청구 됩니다.룸 컨디션은... 뉴욕치고는 나쁘지 않은 편이나 완전히 깨끗한 편은 아닙니다. 룸에 캡슐 커피 머신이 구비되어 있으나 이용은 하지 않았습니다.

title: Good Value for Location and Qualtiy
text: Was one of the cheaper hotels to pick from in the area. Came with simple free breakfast. Room was clean and comfortable. Typical size for NYC hotel, slightly smaller than your average. Staff was friendly and helpful.

title: The best location in Greenwich Village.
text: It's the best location in Greenwich Village, close to great restaurants, fantastic jazz club and there is always something going on in Washington Square Park. The rooms are good and relatively spacious for the area. Continental Breakfast included.

title: Very good value, right in Greenwich Village
text: Having stayed here several times over the past 10 years, you start to recognise familiar faces. Very friendly and helpful staff. Well run, clean and good size rooms (for NY). Downstairs the in-house restaurant is popular, with a jazz-brunch Sundays in the downstairs lounge attracts many local regulars so you need to book. Right on the NW corner of Washington Sq. West 4th St Subway is 100m away on corner 6th and Waverly Pl, also busses uptown. If you want to have breakfast out, try the Waverly Restaurant on 6th. Macdougal St has plenty of restaurants, bars, comedy. Pretty much everything is a short walk actually, so its perfectly located for Village life. Although there is a bar downstairs and on the ground floor, they were rather quiet (except Sunday jazz), but there are plenty of bars around if you need that. Overall exceptional value and location. Hotel will arrange $65 JFK transfer (includes tolls, but tip the driver).

title: Amazing location, amazing hotel
text: I booked a last minute stay at this hotel for 2 nights and was SO pleasantly surprised! The hotel is in an amazing location, just one block from a subway station, CVS right around the corner, tons of amazing restaurants right nearby. It is literally kitty corner form Washington Square Park. I was greeted & my luggage carried in by a super nice man. The elevator is quaint with marble floors & beautiful art, both in the elevator & throughout the hotel. My room was quite large for a NY hotel, nice sized bathroom with full tub, tiled heated floor! The entire place is art deco, clean, quiet  and a real find. I DEFINITELY recommend staying here and will continue to talk it up.

title: Pre Xmas in New York
text: We visited New York pre cruise.   Having booked a deluxe room, on entering the room my friend was ready to go back to reception and complain but realised that this was the deluxe room!  Very small in comparison to other hotels we’ve stayed in over the years, on a positive note it was lovely and clean, the shower room was small,  recently renovated and immaculate.  The beds were very comfortable, lovely white quality bedding.   Breakfast was tasty and plentiful.   It is quite a way out of the city 2.6miles so it was necessary to use the subway a novel experience, plenty of helpful folks around to help us gain the tickets, the nearest station is only a 3 min walk from the hotel.  We ate at the hotel the second night, food was delicious as were the cocktails, approx £100 for 3 courses and a couple of cocktails each.  Staff were very friendly and helpful, The hotel is well thought of by the New Yorkers.  I would be happy to return to the Washington Square Park hotel.  We chose to stay at a peak time so found the hotel expensive in comparison to others we have stayed in, but realise that was due to the time of our visit.

title: If you know what is good for you please stay here!
text: I’ve been staying at WSH since the late 70s. Such a friendly staff at this homey deco style hotel. Clean rooms in a true and historic neighborhood in NYC. I love how it’s so close to the park where you can breathe and a block away from just about all of the subways and connections where you can explore this great city!

title: Great location, helpful staff
text: would definitely stay here again. clean, great location and everything you need.  also, huge thanks to charles and the team for going well beyond the call of duty with a sticky lost cell phone situation.  looking forward to my return!

title: Nice neighborhood hotel
text: We’ve been staying at the Washington Square Hotel in Greenwich Village for a couple years now because of its close proximity to NYU. It’s convenience, friendly staff and complimentary breakfast all add to its appeal. They have a great Happy Hour with $1 priced oysters! I will continue to stay here when I visit my daughter at NYU.

title: great location, good quality matresses,
text:
Washington Square hotel is perfect if you are looking for an old fashioned style hotel in the Gramercy Park Area.
Direct access via underground and A train to JFK. Friendly reception, right next to the Washington square and places to drink high quality coffee and do yoga. Bathrooms are outdated, but mattresses are new!

title: Wonderful hotel
text: This is a beautiful hotel in a perfect location. The staff are wonderful and the rooms are clean. The shower in the bathroom is one of the best I’ve experienced. I highly recommend it for any visit to manhattan.

title: Amazing as always
text: WSH always delivers high quality service, friendly and professional employees.   When employees have worked “their entire working career” - at a place - it speaks volumes for the management/owners, of the property.  Happy employees - deliver excellent customer service.  My favorite place to stay while in NYC.   Location just 3 subway stops from Rockefeller Center - close enough to walk to Times Square - but tucked away so you can enjoy  -  the peace, calm and quaintness of Greenwich Village.  WSH has an Excellent breakfast - quaint bar.    Thanks again to the entire staff for making our Christmas stay with you - the best Christmas ever!

title: Perfect Weekend!
text: Once again, we thoroughly enjoyed our weekend stay at WSH.  Staff is polite and pleasant, rooms are clean, and the location is great!  We like to explore The Village when we stay at WSH - everything is walkable - good restaurants, great entertainment venues, and the neighborhood energy is fun and uplifting!  Thanks again and see you soon!

title: Ms.
text:
The best place to stay, the best neighborhood, the staff is friendly, professional, extremely accommodating… I’ve stayed here before and it is now my favorite to stay when I’m visiting New York. You can’t beat the neighborhood, the rooms are large and comfortable with every modern amenity. The friendliness of the staff really makes it have a small-town quality. You don’t feel like you’re in New York City ;You feel like you’re in a quaint village surrounded by the big city. It’s the staff that gives it an old town homey feeling.
It was my birthday and they sent up a bottle of Prosecco! So kind!
The rooms are large and spacious and the bathroom had a spa shower!
I was upgraded to the executive king and almost didn’t want to leave!

title: Family trip in NYC
text: While the hotel was pretty central of the city it did not look like the pictures that were posted online! The reception was sadly not very helpful and happened to be rude throughout our stay. The food was okay but we were overall not very happy with our stay !!

title: Beautiful property, great location, fantastic staff
text: Everything about this hotel is done right...rooms are cozy, with lovely amenities. I stayed for a week...every staff member I met was friendly and extremely helpful. Location is superb...the Village and Soho are an easy walk, and both Eastside and Westside subways are close by.

title: Wonderful
text:
We spend a wonderful stay in the hotel. Very quiet and calm. 
Thank you so much for your help and your care! 
Breakfast is very great and room too. 
We will come back it's sure!
Thanks for the gift ;)

Anaïs and Vincent :)

title: BEST HOTEL IN NYC
text: This Hotel is NYC best kept secret! It was located in a quite neighborhood with wonderful access to restaurants and subways to anywhere in the city. The adjacent park is very peaceful.  The floors/ rooms are quite.  The staff goes out of their way to be helpful, It is centrally located to the NYC tourist sites.  We stayed 6 nights and will definitely be back

title: Very good
text: Overall our experience staying in the hotel was very good. Staff were friendly, the hotel was clean and well maintained. Location was good, walked to most places and on lazy days took the subway which was around the corner.

title: Perfect Stop
text: We stayed there for 5 nights Perfect location to stay when you love the Greenwich Village environment as we do. Comfortable rooms, super friendly front desk staff, and within an easy walking distance to so much.  We will be back in the spring

title: We will not be coming back.
text: I took a chance on this hotel because Of the reviews.  I really wanted to love it. The front of the hotel is very pretty and I was excited when we arrived . It was clean and the location was great because it was so close to the subway so it was convenient.  The bed was horrible and felt like we were sleeping on a box spring mattress. For the amount of money we paid I expected at least a comfortable bed to sleep after we ran town all day.  We were so happy to leave the hotel and go home to get a good nights rest.  The floors have been redone in a what looks like cheap laminate flooring . I felt like it was a step down from a cheap motel. Really not what I expected at all for a boutique hotel.

title: A second visit and as good as the first
text:
This was our second visit to New York and we stayed in the Washington Square again.

Not much has changed since 2012, including the fake plants on the landings...

The room was small and for the price, not great. When you are paying north of £300 per night, I think that one could expect something more comfortable than a single hard chair in the room. But, the rooms are small, so there's not much room to put anything more comfortable.

The windows have been replaced since our last visit, so the room was quieter.

The included breakfast was just fine for us although paid for extras are available.

The staff in the bar in the evening were excellent.

If we were ever to visit New York again, we would probably try somewhere else, despite the excellent location of the WSH.

title: Pleasure
text: Come to NY once a year and always stay at WSH. It is convenient, friendly and a great value. I love this place and would not stay anywhere else. Close to subways and buses, great central Village location in the midst of wonderful restaurants and performing arts venues.

title: I Always Return to the Washington Square
text: I'm a frequent traveler, and I rarely stay at the same hotel twice.  I make an exception for the Washington Square Hotel.  It is the best value in NYC (especially for family trips or girls trips - they have several double-room options).  The location is excellent - very charming West Village neighborhood close to shops, bars, restaurants, and the subway.  The rooms are not ultra-luxurious, but they are clean, the beds are comfortable, and they have newly upgraded marble bathrooms.  And, the hotel serves a complimentary continental breakfast.  We always receive a warm welcome by the doorman and the front desk staff.  Couldn't be happier with this hotel.

title: Lovely hotel great location
text:
Stayed here 5 nights in October. 
Its a lovely hotel. 
Believe all the nice things said about it here. I would have given a 5 star but for the size of the room which is very small. 
Everything else was really great. From the friendliness of all the staff to the great breakfast included in the price. You just wont beat the Washington for value and location.

title: Historic and classy old school hotel in the heart of Greenwich Village
text: On the Northwest Corner of Washington Square Park, this hotel is a perfect location for seeing the best of downtown Manhattan and avoiding mid-town congestion and through the roof hotel prices. The rooms tend toward being small but well maintained and the hotel remains an elegant memory of old Greenwich Village when it was frequented by movie stars and famous rock bands.  The North Star Restaurant in the hotel has good food and the cocktail lounge is reminiscent of classy '50s night clubs.  I love the place.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: We spent six nights at this hotel and loved it. The location is perfect and the hotel is an old, beautiful Art Deco hotel. Ronnie, the Concierge, was a wonderful source of information and was always friendly and smiling. We would choose this hotel again.

title: Great hotel in great location!
text: Very happy with our hotel. Location is great, very close to Washington Square Park and subway station. Decor is very appealing, hotel room was very clean with a nice sized bathroom. Good shower with good water pressure. Temp controls are perfect. Price was very reasonable for New York. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great Location
text:
Hotel is perfectly situated in the Village, in walking distance to many restaurants, a Chase bank, a CVS and of course the park.  Housekeeping is on point with cleanliness and plenty of towels.  Front desk was friendly and accommodating to store my luggage until my room was available as well as for a slightly later check out in the end.  Continental breakfast is standard bread products, yogurt and fruit.  The hotel gym is packed, perhaps a bit too much, with equipment, so there isn't much space to do free weights or floor work/yoga though I was the only using it each time so an area was found.
The actual rooms vary greatly in quality, though.  First room I checked into was quite small.  There were two beds that took up the whole space; don't even know how two people could maneuver in the room, with the bathroom being the size of a closet.  Nothing like what was pictured on their website.  I booked the room based on what I saw on the website to meet my needs for the long weekend stay, which included having professional in-room hair and makeup done for an event.  In this tiny room, that wouldn't be possible.  I called the front desk and politely asked what happened.  I was initially told the hotel was fully booked though I could be moved to a larger room by the end of the next day.  Luckily the front desk staff then talked with a manager, and called me back within minutes to say that they were able to move me to a slightly larger room at that moment.  The next room (221) was as seen on the website.  It was also much larger, not slightly larger, then the initial room.  The bathroom was large with two sinks.  The room had three windows for good natural light as well as a vanity.  The shower had good water pressure and plenty of hot water.
As its an old building, the walls/ceiling are thin and noise from neighboring guests may be heard.  Also, being on the 2nd floor was convenient to be able to take the stairs rather than the elevator though it was also closer to the city street noises.
The beds and linens were comfortable and afforded a good nights sleep.

title: Great Hotel in Greenwich Village
text:
We stayed at the Washington Square Hotel for a few days that went by way too quickly.  The location is excellent and the attention to details that has been clearly put into the hotel is evident. The staff are friendly and helpful and make you feel most welcome.  

We hope to return soon.

title: Great location!
text:
Located very close to the subway and also to many restaurants.  Very walkable neighborhood right next to Washington Square Park.  Included continental breakfast.  

Helpful staff, room was adequately sized.  Only complaint was that there was no fan in the room.

title: A gem in the Village
text:
This is an historic little hotel strategically situated on the west end of Washington Square Park in Greenwich Village, within easy walking distance of at least 100 excellent restaurants, numerous clubs and bars and in the heart of the NYU campus (if NYU could be said to have a campus!) It is somewhat less expensive than some of the other hotels in the neighborhood. It is small, but well maintained and nicely decorated - great old movie star pictures in every room...nice restaurant and lounge. The staff is friendly and helpful.
The history of the place, which dates back to the beginning of the last century, is fascinating, to say nothing of the previous guest list - the Stones, Dylan, Baez, the list goes on. The story goes that Nora Jones was "discovered" doing karaoke in the lounge! If you have plans to stay in the Village, this is the place.

title: Hôtel très agréable!
text: Nous avons beaucoup aimé notre séjour au WSH. Hôtel Art déco très agréable, personnel aux petits soins et efficace, chambre très propre et calme, nous étions pourtant côté rue. Le petit déjeuner est continental et copieux.  L'hôtel est idéalement situé à Greenwich village, à proximité de nombreux restaurants et non loin des stations de métro. Je le recommande donc et j'espère y retourner!

title: Washington Square Hotel review
text: This hotel is in a great location in the West Village. Very comfortable room and bathroom, with coffee maker in the room. Very friendly and helpful staff. Nice bar (not much atmosphere in the bar, but good bartender); very good breakfast. Reasonably priced.

title: Love the WSH
text:
I have loved this hotel for 30 years now...  Staff is exceptional...  professional and super helpful with all things local.  Hotel is clean quiet and in he perfect spot in the village.. next to the park and a hundred great restaurants..
Also the restaurant downstairs serves amazing food...  great breakfast and tremendous burgers!!!

title: Great location, executive rooms are huge
text:
We were in New York for a wedding and booked 3 rooms for our family. All were executive king rooms and we were totally satisfied with them. First of all, they are really huge, and not just compared to other New York hotel rooms which are generally small. It seems that each floor has one executive room (number 2, so we had rooms 202, 502 and 802) and those rooms look out across the front of the hotel. The beds are comfortable, the bathroom is large and well-appointed. The closet is a bit narrow, but there are lots of drawers and shelves, so plenty of space to unpack your things. Bathrobes, umbrellas, a Keurig machine with plenty of pods are some of the useful features of the rooms. The only complaint would be that with all that space they could add more furniture. There is one leather reading chair, but it has no arms, one ottoman, and a desk chair. There is room for more seating.

The complementary continental breakfast is very good and if you take it in the dining room you can always add items like eggs for an additional cost. 

The small fitness room is well equipped with machines, weights and yoga mats. There isn't much of a lobby - really just 2 sofas for waiting for people. But the staff is very friendly and we always felt comfortable there.

The location is great, just on the edge of Washington Square park and a short walk to the subway.

title: Location,location,location!
text: We had a weekend in NYC after a 3 week trip around New England so we had quite a lot of luggage. The room was so small we had to repack just to allow us to stack our suitcases so we only needed one and that was the top one. Also "Art Deco" rooms?, it just looked like my Grans, old and uninspired, with a grim view. It was however spotless and there was a bath tub and this, along with the location, made up for the disappointing space. Breakfast was good too as were the Reception staff. So, overall Very Good.

title: Great location, pleasant stay
text:
Smallish room as expected in NYC.
No view on this stay, but on a previous stay I had a room with a view.
Very pleasant and helpful staff.
Very interesting neighborhood, easy walk to west and east village, SOHO etc.

title: I love staying at this hotel
text: The Washington square hotel does not pretend to be anything other than what it is - well located in a cool neighbourhood, comfortable-but not pretentious, friendly and value for money in expensive New York. If that is what you are after, then definitely stay here.

title: Hotel sympathique dans un quartier agréable
text: Le Washington Sqare est un hôtel nouvellement rénové situé dans un quartier agréable et près de tout. Accès facile au métro à proximité. Les chambres sont petites mais propres et confortables. Le déjeuner continental inclus est un plus. Tout le personnel est sympathique, en particulier le concierge Ronny qui nous a assisté dès notre arrivée et nous a fourni plusieurs bons conseils concernant les meilleurs restaurants, lieux à visiter et transports. Nous retournerons certainement à cet endroit.

title: Family wedding
text: If you are in New York, staying at the Washington Square Hotel is not a bad idea.   However, the rooms are uncomfortably small even for two.  That being said, the staff was very friendly and professional and  the location is very good; close to everything in the village.

title: Quaint NYC Hotel!
text: The Washington Square Hotel, a nine story hotel, is located near NYU in the Greenwich or SoHo area of NYC.  Our room was small, but bathroom relatively large, and everything clean.  Staff was very friendly, helpful and glad we were there!  Hotel offers continental breakfast, and has a bar/lounge and restaurant.  While my husband and I did not patronize the restaurant, we did enjoy drinks at the bar, which were good but pricy (hey, it is NYC!). We were comfortable and location was accessible to everything we needed and wanted to do.  We would stay here again.

title: A little Haven
text: When selecting this Hotel, I chose the rooms with no view for our group as we planned to only sleep in rooms, and why a window. Good choice. Washington Square Park is Just steps away from the front door where we were able to experience life around us, Greenwich Village and West Village were just down the street. Easy access to subways and buses if you didn't want taxis. Staff was helpful and the hotel's restaurant menu was great.

title: Location location
text:
We stayed at the WSH for 6 nights in September.
Hotel was great, stayed in room 702. Great room, spacious with good views of Washington Square Park.
Staff were amazing, couldn’t do enough to help. The hotel is situated close to McDougall st and the heart of Greenwich Village meaning restaurants cafes bars and entertainment were right at our doorstep.
I would definitely stay at the WSH again.
Highly recommend

title: Loved It!
text: Stayed here for seven nights arriving 4 September 2019. Our first trip to USA. We were in room 217 which gave us a view of the street and Washington Square Park. We had booked a deluxe as we'd noted other room grades might mean no view. Staff were delightful during our stay. Enjoyed the breakfast, included in room price, and paid extra on one morning for a cooked option. Staff overcharged us, but rectified and apologised immediately this was pointed out. Bed very comfortable. Good bathroom with lots of hot water for the tub. In room safe a nice bonus. On our last night we were awajkened by a phonecall at 05:00 AM asking if we still wanted our airport transfer? We'd actually booked this for 4:30 PM, so receptionist apologised. Then got an alarm call at 06:00 AM which we hadn't booked. Overall this didn't detract from our enjoyment. Nice area. Park nearby. Store a few hundred yards away for snacks and water. Subway station about 2 minutes walk away. We hope to return to NYC next year, and have already decided that we'll look at booking WSH again. Lovely hotel. Lovely area.

title: Perfect location, comfortable, friendly and good value
text:
Beautifully restored Art Deco lobby with helpful staff on the front desk.
Admittedly, hadn't expected view of wall and a/c workings, but our room on 4th floor was spacious and we weren't expecting a sea view, so we just closed the curtains!
I appreciated the bath and the shower was fine too. I loved the very mellow under basin light for a nocturnal pee! 
The bed was extremly comfortable and we were never disturbed by corridor noise.
Breakfast was terrific: yogurt, fruit, delicious bread, bagels, pastries - AND a paper bag so you could make a sandwich for daytime snack.  Coffee absolutly disgusting - but that's my overall view on US coffee.  
This isn't a snazzy or sexy hotel, but it felt clean and reliable - and the location meant we didn't need cabs.
I'd happily return.

title: My favorite hotel in Manhattan!
text: This is a seriously wonderful little hotel! I lived in NYC for 40 years, so I know the city. I recently relocated but I return often and I wouldn’t stay anywhere else. It’s super friendly, very clean, and in a fantastic location — the heart of the Village and just a half block from the West 4th St subway. It’s also incredibly reasonable for Manhattan. And the restaurant is great! Perfect!

title: No Window
text:
I’ve stayed here a few other times and have always had more expensive rooms.  There was a great price (for NYC) advertised, and I took advantage of it.  Factoring in the location and breakfast, it was worth paying a slightly higher price than staying in Queens as I usually do.

A few hours before arriving, I received an email offering express check-in.  I took advantage of it, but I don’t think anything was different than it would’ve been otherwise.  I waited in line and presented an ID and credit card, even though my room was prepaid.  No big deal.

The room was small but larger than I expected from reading the reviews.  The decor was clean and contemporary.  The shower was amazing.

It was 3:30 in the afternoon, and the room seemed dark.  Since it was a “cheap” room, I didn’t expect a view, but I didn’t expect my window would look into an air shaft.

I lived in NYC for a decade, so a view wasn’t important, but this just surprised me.  All I was doing was sleeping there.  I am aware that deluxe rooms are better.  It definitely wasn’t worth upgrading and adding another $100 to me for the 10 hours I spent there, but be aware if that’s something important to you.

The bed was very hard.  The staff, TV, WiFi, toiletries, coffee, and complimentary breakfast were excellent.  I’m sure I’ll stay here again (and not be surprised by the [lack of a] view.

title: 5th Time at WSH
text: Consistently an excellent experience. Very friendly and helpful staff, from the front desk to those keeping the coffee warm and (particularly good) orange juice fresh..and the muffins stocked! Room was pleasant - and when made reservation requested a room with light and while that's usually my request, not all hotels grant it.  Highly recommend.

title: Not a good experience
text:
I travel to this part of New York very often for work and have been trying a few new hotel options. For this 2 night visit I opted for the Washington Square Hotel based on some good reviews, proximity to the office/local amenities and I like supporting independents rather than chains.

Sadly it has made me want to go back to the soulless but consistent chain down the road which actually works out cheaper.

Arrival
Simple check in, they took my card info but never presented costs or paperwork just a slip for me to sign. It was ready on time. The door/security staff were super friendly and a saving grace for the whole stay to be honest. I felt safe as a lone female traveller knowing there was someone downstairs.

Main Room
The room on the 8th floor was fairly small but I didn’t need much space. The bed was a twin pushed together, however as both beds where on wheels they moved around a lot!!. The door isn’t exactly into its frame so there was light from the corridor coming into the room with the lights out. The room isn’t soundproofed so you hear a LOT from the surrounding rooms but a good bonus is there is little traffic noise. Generally everything is a little scruffy, marks, not super clean and dated. There wasn’t enough desk space for me to work which was a big disappointment.

Bathroom
The water in the shower never got hot, and I ran it for some time!! Liked the toiletries though. The bathroom was clean but small.

In room service/amenities
There is no room service here, and rooms come with a coffee machine and water only. There were robes and slippers which was a bonus. Safe was good and worked. TV ok but very high on the wall!!
I should mention the room cleaning after day 1 - for some reason rubbish wasn’t cleared so I had to leave it outside the room over night. The cleaner also spilled shampoo all over my toiletries and left it - which was annoying as it ruined a compact.

Lifts
Don’t use the smaller of the 2 - it does t always work. Which means the main lift is busy.
