Breakfast
I only needed breakfast 1 of the days I was there. It is meant to start at 7.15 but at 7.20 nothing was put out yet but I was told i could go down to the kitchen? The guy could not have cared less!! The croissants were pretty stale.

Check out
This was the oddest part - I came down and was presented with the bill - no good morning, how was your stay, can I get someone to help with your bags. As I was paying he answered the phone to someone else so I wasn’t sure if I was done - so no goodbye........ it’s company money so I’m not going to complain or ask for a refund or anything but it would have been nice to get some acknowledgement.

Whilst I wouldn’t stay again, or recommend the hotel based on the room - even if I did, the service killed it for me!

title: Descanso y ubicación
text: Un buen hotel, con una ubicación privilegiada, las habitaciones tienen todo lo necesario resuelto, es la segunda vez y todo está limpio y disponible, además que a diario están pendientes de lo necesario. El internet es bueno y el restaurante tiene un menú accesible.

title: The perfect hotel in the perfect location
text: A beautiful restored Art Deco hotel across from the square.  They maintained all the great features when modernizing and it is truly a unique hotel.  The rooms are average size for New York and they are in process of updating all of them...ours was already done and was very nice.  Here is what makes it perfect...8 subways to catch within 2 blocks...some truly awesome restaurants including Michelin starred within 3 blocks...not the hustle and bustle of Chelsea or midtown etc...busy but calm....and the staff was great...all helpful and very pleasant.

title: Consistently Good
text: Another wonderful stay at the WSH; a great location; and if you like taking pictures, Washington Square offers one so much! Easy access to the subway; really good (free) breakfast; and the help (Ronnie in particular) a great hotel staff!

title: Greatest Location Old fashioned style and decoration
text: I stayed there for a week during induction of my daughter st NYU. The location is perfect. Right on the northern corner of Washington Square . Breakfast really nice and also they offer express breakfast near the lobby which is very convenient when in rush. Stuff friendly and cool. Service very good. Décoration, style and furniture very standard. A little bit old fashioned. Not impressive but right for the job.

title: Great Location for Pride Visit July 2019
text: Washington Square Hotel was an excellent pick as it was within walking distance to a lot of the Pride activity locations, namely the Stonewall Inn!  There were many restaurants and bars nearby to choose from.  The hotel was clean and our room was immaculate and big by NYC standards although the bathroom was a bit outdated.  The airconditioner worked great and boy was it ever needed as the temp outside reached 99!  The only disappointment came in the hotel bar: they didn't have Baccardi Rum. We would definately stay there again!

title: Our favorite place to stay in NYC
text: This hotel just does everything right, from the friendly staff that greets you to the room amenities that are always kept restocked and the delicious complementary continental breakfast with your choice of self serve or being served in their restaurant.  The ice machines are convenient in the lobby.  The place is kept spotless.  Nice to have a widely acclaimed restaurant and bar (North Square) - a long time favorite of our friends who live in Greenwich Village.  They accommodated our room request.  Just a warm, friendly place that “gets it” in all aspects of hospitality and comfort.  The central location to all things New York and proximity to beautiful Washington Square Park is a particular bonus.  We will be back!

title: Great location!
text: Excellent staff who were very friendly and accommodating. We moved our daughter into NYU, and you couldn't beat the location. Room was small, but had everything we needed. Will definitely stay again when we are visiting our daughter.

title: Goed hotel, perfecte ligging
text: Net terug, 10 nachten in dit hotel verblijven. Heel fijn hotel, goede bedden, superdouche. Schoon, rustig en kamer niet zo klein als ik gedacht had. Ontbijt ook prima(bagels, crossaints, brood, yoghurt, fruit etc. en prima koffie). Ligging is onovertroffen, heel centraal en toch rustig, aan Washington Square Park en 200 meter van metro. Zou er weer heen gaan als ik naar NY ga. Personeel supervriendelijk. Let op, het hotel ligt niet direct aan het park(ivm kamers met parkzicht) maar net een straatje verder. Als je aan de straatkant zit en uit het raam hangt kun je het park wel zien maar dus niet direct aan het park. Al met al Super hotel!

title: Excellent Value
text: From the moment we arrived it was a great experience. The front desk staff were friendly and professional, the room was nice - perfect size, clean, quiet. Overall an excellent stay. Another plus is the proximity to The New School, which was the reason for our visit. An easy walk to Greenwich Village.

title: Great spot for a short stay in Greenwich Village
text: This hotel is a great spot to park yourself for a short stay in the heart of Greenwich Village, NYC. I say “short stay” because the rooms are not large, so it could get claustrophobic after 6 days. It’s in a quiet spot right off the northwest corner of Washington Square Park, with easy access to many subway lines and PATH trains. Very quick trip to and from Penn Station. The service is friendly, and they have a free continental breakfast in the morning (though the breakfast room is pretty cramped). The elevators are small, and there are only two of them servicing 8 floors. The biggest shortcoming with this hotel is the gym. It is cramped and not well-ventilated (steamy in August), and the equipment is old and frankly kind of grim. They really need to spend some money to update the entire thing. Still, the price is very modest for a NYC hotel, and the location cannot get any better if you want to spend your time experiencing all the Village has to offer. I’d definitely stay there again, maybe for a long weekend getaway.

title: Convenient for NYU
text: Booked this hotel as I wanted to be closer to NYU.   Rooms are fairly small which is expected for NYC.   There isn't much natural light though as there is a wall next to the window, and rooms look outdated but kept nice and clean.   However, the location is superb if you have things to do in NYU and you'll be spoiled for choices of restaurants - casual to fine dining.   Soho is also at walkable distance.   The doormen were great, especially Ronnie.   Front desk staff could use some customer service lessons from doormen/concierge.   The included breakfast isn't much (cereal or muffins or fruit & yogurt) but again there are so many options close by that it wasn't a big deal.  Didn't use subway during this visit but there's a subway station closeby.

title: EXCELENTE CUSTO BENEFÍCIO
text:
Procurei um hotel pela região, west village e por questão de valores optei pelo WSH, é superou minhas expectativas, foi EXCELENTE! 
A localização é ótima, a região é deliciosa para caminhar, há vários restaurantes/café e para todos os bolsos, além de oportunizar fazer muita coisa a pé. 
A estação do metro fica muito perto, cerca de 1/2 quarteirão.
O atendimento foi excelente, todos sempre muito antenciosos,  além do inglês o espanhol está sempre disponível, e para minha alegria havia uma recepcionista brasileira, que foi maravilhosa!!!
o café da manhã, para o perfil continental americano, estava excelente, por que além do tradicional café e pao, havia granola, iorgute, suco de laranja, salada de frutas, geleias/nutela/pasta de amendoin. 
O espaço do quarto, considerando se tratar de um hotel em Nova York, achei muito espaçoso, havia uma penteadeira com um grande espelho, além do guarda-roupa ser amplo e ter espelho, havia a disposição no quarto: tabua de passar, ferro, guarda-chuva ( q foi muito útil no verão).
super recomendo e se voltar a Nova York ficarei lá novamente!!

title: Mitigé
text:
L’hôtel est très bien placé dans Greenwich à proximité des restaurants et de plusieurs stations de métro. L’accueil à l’arrivée n’est pas vraiment chaleureux, le strict minimum. Les chambres sont très petites et ne correspondent pas vraiment aux photos sur le site. La chambre familiale est annoncée avec 2 queen bed. Ces lits sont en 120cm de large mais toutefois très confortables. Les chambres sont vieillottes et mal entretenues. 
L’hôtel par lui même a beaucoup de charme. La touche art déco nous plongent dans l’univers de Coppola.
Côté petit dej, celui-ci est assez limité mais de bonne qualité, l’essentiel y est. Le service et professionnel et aimable. 
Compte tenu du tarif et de l’emplacement, cet hôtel reste un bon rapport qualité / prix pour New-York

title: The best
text:
This was my third stay here and it is always enjoyable. The location is the best close to nice neighborhoods and lot’s of nice restaurants. The staff is friendly and the service really good.
The rooms are not really big but clean and nice with comfortable beds.
Breakfast is included wich is unusual for NYC. Will definitly stay here again and again and again.

title: Great staff
text: We stayed here overnight celebrating a girls weekend. Lovely hotel, nice staff, clean, comfortable and amazing location right next to the park. They very kindly stored our bags a few hours before our check-in and a few hours after we had to check out, which was a big load off. Would stay again!

title: Excellent hotel and location
text: Tremendous value for money in this superb offering in the heart of Greenwich Village. Within 1 block of West 4th St subway to get anywhere in the city (incl elevator at 3rd St allowing easy JFK AirTrain transfers). Walking distance to West Village, the High Line, Little Italy, to name a few choice places to visit. Great hotel!

title: Great location, helpful staff, good experience
text:
Great location in Greenwich village close to all nice restaurants and bars.  Fantastic helpful staff - when checking out we asked if we can leave our suitcase in their storage room for couple of days (we were going to Niagara Falls and didn’t want to take too much luggage). Even though on return we weren’t staying in this hotel the lady checking us out agreed.  Quite nice continental breakfast included in the price of stay.  Generally very clean hotel
Room didn’t have proper natural light, the window was looking into the wall.  The room is small though it is pretty normal for New York

title: Excellent
text: Loved this hotel , small but comfortable in a great location in Greenwich village close to great bars , restaurants , cafes and music venues ... ask Ronnie the concierge for more information he knows his stuff ! Guys in the bar do great cocktails and the breakfast was great with plenty to choose from , price isn’t to bad considering the location of this hotel. Will definitely return!!

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Really lovely hotel in an excellent location.  Good clean rooms and lovely staff who are knowledgeable and willing to answer any queries.  Breakfast was included in our stay and was good food well presented.  A cooked breakfast could also be purchased.  Situated near the subway for up or downtown travel.

title: Charming Oasis in Greenwich Village
text: This is one of my favorite locations in NYC; situated on a quiet street, which makes it even more of an urban unicorn, the venue can't be beat for charm and walkability, shops, restaurants, and proximity to subway lines. Be aware that some of the rooms can be dark and pokey as well as cold and damp, even in August; the bed insanely hard and uncomfortable (and I love a firm mattress); and the bathroom so tiny that if there are 2 of you in the room, you will have a tough time fitting both of you in the bathroom at the same time. BUT, the front of house service is lovely and accommodating (although the housekeeping staff kept shedding dark hair when they cleaned the bathroom each day). Still, if you can snag one of the bargains, it comes with breakfast, and the hotel comes with tons of history. In this age of soulless, cookie cutter travel options, WSH has all the modcons, but transports you back to Greenwich Village's literary, artistic, and cinematic past.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: We stay at the WSH at least two weeks every year for the past several years and wouldn’t stay anywhere else in NYC.  The hotel is in a perfect location to go anywhere in the City with subway stops within a block or two.   Washington Square Park is across the street and lots of great restaurants and coffee shops all around the hotel.  The restaurant in the hotel is also fantastic and there is a great happy hour in the bar.  I love this hotel!

title: Glad we found this boutique hotel!
text: My daughter will be entering her Freshman year at NYU this Fall, so we took a quick trip to the city to pre check things out!  The Washington Square Hotel is very close to her dorm, so we thought it would be convenient.  Upon arrival we were greeted by the wonderful doorman.  Funny and charming guy!  The lobby is small but that's ok because it has the look of the sophisticated 1920's era.  Tile, lighting, staircase, the works.  I was impressed right there.  The rooms are on the smaller side but not too small.  Everything was clean, bright, and we definitely liked the view of the park!  Breakfast was included and the food/drink was good.  Typical breakfast style.  Enjoyed not having to go find breakfast places.  We will most likely use this hotel as our go to while visiting our daughter over the next few years!

title: Amazing hotel!
text:
We stayed here for my husbands 50th birthday trip to see a Yankee vs Red Sox game.  I cant say enough good things about this hotel.  I emailed in advance and found a bottle of champagne waiting for us in our room!
Room was very clean and spacious for NY.  We were on 3rd floor facing Waverly St in a deluxe Queen room.  People watching was great from the room.  Staff was wonderful, especially Ronnie the doorman, and he overnight doorman. Wish I had gotten his name.  Location is perfect. Quiet street, but just steps away from everything you need.  Subway, coffee shops, CVS, and restaurants, restaurants and more restaurants.  This was our first trip to NYC, but wont be our last.  We will definitely always stay here when we come to NYC.

title: Friendly Stay
text: Clean hotel with friendly staff. Breakfast items were always well stocked. Clean rooms and common areas. Rooms are a bit small, but it is NYC. Close to public transportation options, restaurants nearby, and Washington Square Park is just up the block.

title: Excellent place to stay
text: This is an excellent updated "old school" hotel to stay in right in Greenwich Village and at reasonable rates. It's relaxed, and the restaurant and bar are both great. The continental breakfast (free) isn't all that, nor is the gym, but the rooms are good and you're right in the middle of all the fun.

title: Great stay
text:
We stayed here for World Pride weekend and had a great time. (Book early if you plan to attend the festivities for Pride)
The hotel was within walking distance to a lot of good restaurants. And easy to get around, close to the subway stops.
Doormen and the rest of the staff were very friendly. The room was small, as expected for old NYC hotels, but clean and amenities were good. Area also not noisy and crowded like Times Square.
I would stay here again when in town.

title: Great Hotel
text: This is a fantastic hotel in a great location. Loved the history of the hotel and area. Definitely will return. Very clean and all hotel staff vary accommodating. A couple of blocks away from some great restaurants.

title: Washington Square Hotel, gerne wieder
text: Sehr nettes kleines Hotel im Greenwich Village. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Das Frühstück bietet alles, was wir uns gewünscht haben. Die Lage des Hotels ist gut. Verschiedene Metrostationen sind gut erreichbar.

title: Great Spot...feels very safe.
text: Last  week I spent a few nights at this hotel with my 14-year-old granddaughter celebrating our birthdays. We were only in the lobby for five minutes and when we said it was our birthdays, Ron, who works there came out with baseball caps for us and gave us a birthday gift! Who does that? Then Tatiana, at the desk was more than friendly and helped us check in. The room was nice and tidy and the continental breakfast was more than I expected. The neighborhood feel safe, and there a re many restaurants in the area. We happened to hit a heat wave so we did not do a lot of walking in the area but there are loads of jazz bars and the park is beautiful. I highly recommend this place to stay and it certainly will give you a feel of old New York with it’s art deco look.

title: Great place to stay
text: Loved staying here.  Great place to stay.  Loved the shower.  Rooms are small but the decor and atmosphere here makes up for it.  Great bagels and scones.  We stayed here six nights in Room 322.  Loved visiting with the pretty lady from Poland.  She was really nice and helpful.  Highly recommend it.  My husband and I stayed here 6 nights.  We would stay here again.

title: In Greenwich District
text:
Located on the edge on Washington Square and over summer period many activities take place.Easy walking to subway or Bus 
The rooms clean and tidy set out. Dinning room for all meals located on the lower ground floor.  Continental breakfast include in tariff. Choice of food for dinner was pleasing and enjoyable. You can be assured that the meals offered are excellent when a fair proportion of the guests dinning are locals living around the Hotel
The only problem I en counted was from the 3 nights we stay was a lack of laundry service or in house facilities. You had to take your own laundry to a laundry company located in streets near by. My final comment is care needs to be taken if walking at night due to homeless on the streets

title: My gf and i stayed here for a week
text: My gf and i stayed here for a week and it was Fantastic. Clean, beautiful room, nice continental breakfast, a few feet from the park, fast and reliable wifi. What more could anyone ask? The staff was friendly and kind, and responded to requests swiftly. Highly recommend and would stay here again, no question

title: We loved it!
text: We stayed for six nights with our two sons and couldn't have been happier with our choice.  Firstly the staff are uniformly friendly and helpful and make you feel really at home from the minute you walk in the door. Ronnie is an exceptional door man - he should be on the stage!  The location is incredible - a walk or short metro ride from everywhere - and the hotel's proximity to  Washington Square Park in the summer heat was a real bonus.  As was the incredible selection of excellent bars and restaurants in walking distance.   The rooms are simple, very clean and comfortable with excellent showers and aircon.   The included breakfast was much appreciated as New York is very expensive for Brits at the moment and the WSH was excellent value for money all round.   We'll definitely be back!

title: great NYC location
text: This hotel is right off of Washington Square Park.  The location is great--lots to walk to and the subway is nearby to get you everywhere.  The hotel is clean and the staff very friendly and always helpful.  This is a typical older building so rooms and bath are on the small side, but it had everything we needed and was very clean. Free continental breakfast and its location was great.

title: Well-priced and great location
text:
Hotel rooms in NYC are tiny and expensive, but not here. I also prepaid to save even more. Breakfast is included although there's not much on offer, and the coffee is not the best. But overall I must recommend this hotel. The staff are friendly and it's located close to quite a few subway stations - we never had any issues getting to where we needed to go. Washington Square Park, which is right across the street, is also a nice place to sit and relax.

There were times when I was awoken by traffic or people outside but that is normal for a city this big. Unfortunately, the hugely inconsiderate idiot in the room above us who threw their shoes on the floor every night (or dropped large boulders) is not excused from this.

When you are spending time in Manhattan, you must stay at this hotel!

title: Glad we gave the WSH another chance
text:
In January I wrote a review about the WSH which was very critical, with good reason.  Sonny, the manager, contacted me directly and invited my husband and I to come back.  We visited NYC in June and stayed at the WSH, which is in Greenwich Village convenient to our activities.  Our room and bathroom were very comfortable and a good size for NYC.  All of the staff were super attentive and pleasant.  The complimentary continental breakfast was really all we needed to start the day.
Also, we ate dinner one night at the attached North Square restaurant and the food was very good.  At first the ambience appears dated but you get the feel that all the locals eating there like it just like it is.
We would definitely stay at the WSH again. Thanks to Sonny and staff.

title: Perfect Hotel near NYU
text: It’s not the ritz but don’t have any complaints about this hotel. Friendly staff. Great Location only 2 blocks from NYU. Great restaurants within walking distance and the subway is only one block away.

title: Stay at Washington Square Hotel
text: This was an excellent location for our visit to New York City.  Close to so many things, especially in Greenwich Village.  The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was very clean and very nice.

title: Excellent lodging and location
text: The Washington Square Hotel is conveniently located in Greenwich Village. All pictures of the hotel show window AC’s in every room, which is not the case. (They really need an updated photo!) Our room, sort of overlooking Washington Square Park, did have a non functioning window AC unit. The hotel is on central AC which cools beautifully. Our room was NY small, but very functional for the little time that were in it.  The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable! The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely book this hotel if I go back to NYC.

title: Excellent stay!
text: We loved the personalized treatment from the doorman and front desk; the free breakfast (till 11:00am!); and the coffee in the room. Great location - near the West 4th & Christopher Street subway stations. Nice to be there in pride month steps from the Stonewall Inn. Will definitely be back.

title: Excellent hotel with a great vibe
text: Stumbled upon this fantastic little hotel and was not disappointed. Staff welcomes you like family from the minute you come through the doors.  Loved the history of the place and the tile art throughout. The rooms are clean and comfortable. We will definitely return.

title: Favorite NYC Hotel!
text: We booked 2 rooms for ourselves and sons, 16 and 22, while visiting NYU.  Location cannot be beat, and the decor is so cool.  Bathroom was awesome with a huge shower, and the king bed was great.   Mr. Ronnie is incredible and made us feel right at home.  Love the old style of it and the quirky halls connecting the 3 buildings.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Just too cramped in a room that was supposed to be for 4 people
text: We stayed here to check out Greenwich Village. Having done that, we wouldn't stay here again. I know rooms are small in NYC, but we had 3 adults in a 4 person room and it was uncomfortable. We asked for a larger room and they didn't say they didn't have availability, they said they didn't have any larger rooms. The toilet was very small for no reason - there was room for a normal toilet. Also no place to sit comfortably in the room. There was one tiny chair that was very uncomfortable. The staff was very nice and dinner in the restaurant was good.

title: Miss
text: I cannot say enough good things about this place, of course you have the location, in the heart of Greenwich Village, with a view of Washington Square, Park, surrounded by NYU, and a walk to the Highline etc. etc. etc., but the Decour and old time small-town quaint historical feel; I don’t think you can get in any other hotel in the city… The hotel staff went above and beyond my expectations, the rooms are very posh with an antique Decour, yet all the modern amenities ... there isn’t anything that the staff would not do to make you have a more pleasant stay. I really feel like I took a trip through time, I cannot say enough good things about this hotel, please make it a point to stay here during  your next visit to New York City!

title: Best hotel I've stayed at in NYC!
text:
We have been searching many years for the perfect nyc hotel that we can stay at each time we go and not have to search and read reviews anymore. I'm glad to say this hotel is it. Perfectly located in neighborhoods and not tourism central, walkable and bikeable to everywhere, the citibike rack is a 10 second walk from the front door and THE cleanest hotel I have probably ever stayed in.  
There wasn't carpet in our room but rather wood laminate floors which were squeaky clean, I loved not having to think about nasty carpet under my feet. 
There was plenty of floor space and area for keeping suitcases in our room (#310) did not feel cramped as other city hotel rooms I've stayed in. 
Extremely quiet, no sirens or car horns, no hallway or elevator noise, no noise of any kind.
Extremely helpful and friendly staff, always someone standing in the main lobby to answer questions or help in any way. We called down for housekeeping two times to swap out our dirty towels (in the evening) and both times they delivered them in well under 5 mins. 
This is a fantastic old building that is extremely well cared for and it shows. You get to enjoy the quirks of a building that age with narrow winding hallways, a gorgeous staircase bannister, small elevator (works like new) the lovely tile (CLEAN) in the bathroom and the water pressure was perfection....there is nothing bad to say of this hotel!

title: Großartig übernachten im Village
text:
Seit Mitte der 90er besuchen wir in unregelmäßigen Abständen New York City, dabei haben wir immer im Larchmont Hotel in der 11ten Straße übernachtet. Leider wurde das Larchmont geschlossen und wir mussten uns ein neues Hotel suchen. Es musste unbedingt im Village liegen, denn gerade abends ist es der schönste Ort. Jede Menge Restaurants, Cafés, Clubs. Alles in kleinen Straßen, für Manhattan sehr ruhig. Genau das Richtige, um nach einem aufregenden Tag ein wenig runterzufahren, ohne sich zu langweilen. Da im Village kaum Hotels sind, waren wir froh, das WSH zu finden. Die Lage direkt am wunderbaren Park ist ein Traum. Und das Hotel ist auch großartig. Leider deutlich teurer als das Larchmont, für New Yorker Verhältnisse aber immer noch eher günstig. Abgesehen von der sensationellen Lage bietet das Hotel saubere, gut ausgestattete Zimmer, sehr nettes & hilfsbereites Personal, ein leckeres Frühstück (absolutes Muss: das homemade granola) - in der Auswahl nicht riesig, aber nach unserem Geschmack absolut ausreichend. Alles, was man braucht. Der A-Train bringt einen noch dazu direkt vom Flughafen JFK zur nächstgelegenden Subway Station (West 4th) und auch die Path-Train-Station (Newark Airport) ist nicht weit. 

Wer abends nicht im lauten und grellen Trubel von Midtown oder Uptown wohnen möchte, aber trotzdem ein lebendiges Nachtleben um sich herum möchte - der wohnt im Village. Im Washington Square Hotel! Wir für unseren Teil haben zumindest unser neues Lieblings-Hotel gefunden :-)

title: Excellent boutique hotel
text:
We've stayed here twice before and really like this hotel. It's a bit quirky and very different to most NYC hotels which tend to be quite anonymous. The decor is very Art Deco and the rooms very comfortable, if not terribly spacious. The "free" breakfast is very good though basic. Excellent coffee, fresh fruit and OJ, bagels, croissants, etc. The staff were all great and very eager to please. 

The main plus point for us is the location right in the heart of Greenwich Village, our favourite part of Manhattan. The buzz of 6/7 Avenues is a stones throw away and the subway (A train) literally at the end of the block. You may not get the excitement of mid-town but this is by far the most characterful part of town.

title: Excellent little hotel, perfect location
text: This is a comfortable, clean little hotel with lovely quirky decor in a great location - all at a reasonable price.  The staff could not have been more helpful and on top of all of this, you have Washington Square and Greenwich Village literally on your doorstep. It suited us perfectly and we'd strongly recommend it to other travellers.

title: nyc
text: a very nice small hotel just across from the park, it close to the subway station on 4th st and has a nice staff. It has a nice little breakfast shop and is very close to the Waverly coffee shop, and some nice little shops and NYU.

title: Great location for NYU business
text: The Washington Square Hotel rooms are large but they are clean, nicely appointed, and comfy.  The location can't be beat if you are doing anything at NYU, and it's close to the subway stop and the PATH station if you are coming in from New Jersey/EWR

title: Comfortable hotel in a great location
text: The hotel is perfectly located--right across from Wash Sq Park, in the fabulous Greenwich Village. The room was about the same size as all other regular rooms in NYC, It was nicely appointed, comfortable bed, spic and span, and nice bathroom. It was also very, very quiet. And it was a great price! Couldn't ask for more.

title: Great little hotel in great location
text:
I stayed in a twin room with my teenage son. The room was a little small with beds very close together and had no real place to store bags or clothes but the room was nice and clean. 

Location is terrific. The hotel is across the street from Washington Square Park and the area so so lively and close to lots of restaurants. It was a short walk to the nearest subway station (W 4th) and lots of lines went through.

The hotel also provided a great free breakfast and we went to the lounge a couple of times - there was a huge selection of wines to choose from.

My only complaint was having to always ask for the coffee pods to be replaced as you only got 1 or 2 each day.

title: Delightful hotel
text: Stylish hotel in great area and within walking distance of lots of restaurants. Staff mostly friendly and helpful. Rooms a little small however that was not a problem. Safe area and with being next to Washington Square Park a lovely place to sit and enjoy the music.

title: Great, great, great!
text: Great service, great location, great room. From check-in to check-out super friendly experience. Rooms are small, but expected that. Very clean, efficient bathrooms. Awesome concierge (Ronnie!). Anyone that worked at this establishment was friendly and helpful. The lobby and breakfast area were very comfortable to "hang out." Lots of places within walking distance. Awesome to be able to walk across the street to enjoy Washington Square Park.

title: Beautiful Hotel, great location
text: Service was second to none, the staff were very helpful and friendly (hello Ronnie!). The room was slightly smaller than we expected but the decor, location and amenities more than made up for this.The food and service in the restaurant were also very good. Added bonus a minutes walk to bars, restaurants and music venues in a nice relaxed area...whats not to like?

title: Best of New York
text: Washington Square Hotel is a beautiful hotel in the heart of the village.  The facility is beautiful and unique.  The staff are second to none.  I have stayed twice and it does not disappoint.  It is easy to walk to Soho from the hotel.  The subway is on the same block.

title: Great Boutique Hotel in fantastic neighbourhood
text: We very much enjoyed our stay at Washington Square Hotel! The staff was extremely helpful when we needed help planning our itinerary each day. We loved being so close to Washington Square Park where we soaked up the vibe every morning and evening. Our room on the 4th floor was very quiet and we had a great view of the park entrance. The bed was very comfortable and the room spotless! We wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.

title: Small and quiet
text: Located by Washington Square Park,nice quiet neighborhood.Check in a little slow,not much information offered. King size bed took up most of space in room,but these smaller older hotels sometimes don’t offer king size beds.Room clean and functional ,breakfast good.

title: Old charm and excellent location
text: Far from the madding crowd, in a quiet location across a park, but with very easy access to subway lines, walking distance from 5th, 6th avenues and Broadway. very helpful staff, courteous and available 24/24. Beautiful intimate décors reminiscent of Art Deco; very good value for money, to be unreservedly recommended!

title: Wonderful old place in a perfect location with a fantastic staff
text: We couldn’t have been happier with our stay at the Washington Square hotel. We have stayed Midtown and uptown many times but we will never do that again now that we have stayed at the Washington Square hotel. It is charming and old world. The staff is incredibly helpful with everything and super friendly. The location is amazing right at Washington Square, Park and one can work anywhere from there. Plus it’s also very handy to subway stations that will take you anywhere in New York.

title: グリニッジヴィレッジのカジュアルな雰囲気が味わえる、1泊３.５万のリーズナブルなホテル。冷蔵庫無し
text:
ストリートミュージシャンが演奏し、ニューヨーク大学の建物に囲まれたワシントンスクエアパークに近接する、小ぎれいなホテル。
大学エリアなので若者が多く、ブルーノートやブルーマンの劇場が近く、リーズナブルなレストランも多い。有名なマレーズ・ベーグルも歩いて行ける。少々歩くが、北の方（14丁目）にあるユニオンスクエアパーク周辺でショッピングも堪能できるし、少し南に足を伸ばせばSOHOエリアで先端ショッピングができたり、西に歩けばミートパッキングディストリクトで先端な食事やチェルシーマーケット散策、話題のハイライン見学も可能、と楽しめるものが周囲にたくさんある。
地下鉄駅も近く、最近話題のブルックリンにも2通りの行き方でアクセス可能。
ホテルは、年季は入っているもののきちんとメンテされており、快適に滞在ができるし、1階では簡単な朝食が取れる。スタッフもフレンドリー。安い部屋だった（とはいえ1泊3.5万だが）からか、冷蔵庫が部屋になかったのだけは残念だが、スーツケースも広げられたし、スリッパも1つだけだが付いていたので、満足度は高かった。
観光客が押し寄せて滞在する場所ではないので、ニューヨークのカジュアルで先端な雰囲気に触れるのに、適したホテル。

title: Anniversary
text:
Love this Hotel! Nice staff, good breakfast and the best location. This was the second stay here and we’ll be back❤️
The only problem was trying to get in contact with the Hotel. We tried to Mail in different ways but didn’t succeed. Now I hope we’ve got the correct contact information.

title: Charming, perfect location!
text:
I recently stayed here for 6 nights. My room was on the 9th floor (908) and I had a stunning view of the city and the Empire State building. I took a course at NYU Stern and really enjoyed my morning walk through Washington Square Park. I had never stayed in Greenwich Village before and absolutely loved it. I found a place to get a mani/pedi close by, had dinner at Rosemary, and frequented the CVS around the corner for items I forgot.

Calling Washington Square Hotel "home" for the week was an absolute pleasure. My only wish was that my room had a mini-fridge. It would have been nice to keep water cold, as well as some leftovers in there. The staff were all friendly except for the man working luggage storage who barely looked at me, did not say hello, and seemed annoyed that I had 3 bags to store on my last morning before my flight. I'm still giving this place 5 stars because the stay was fantastic and I'd definitely stay again.

title: It was like staying with family/friends.
text:
This hotel contributed to the wonderful holiday we had in NYC. 
The location is fantastic. We were able to walk to most of the restaurants, shops and venues we needed to get to. And if we couldn't, the subway is minutes away. Or you just walk out and there are loads of cabs going by.
We appreciated the breakfasts being free and they were delicious, nutritious, fresh and kept us going until dinner time. 
The room we had was spacious, comfortable and clean. The bathroom was large and we were able to do washing as there is a line for hanging up clothes to dry. Our room looked out over Washington Square park and was light and airy. We had 4 seasons in one day as far as weather went so appreciated the warmth of the room when it was cold and the air con when it was hot.

But the huge attraction of this hotel is it's staff. It is so personal. We stayed for 7 nights and then had a couple of nights in DC. When we came back for another 5 nights we felt like we were returning to family or friends.
Thank you so much to Charles who was incredibly helpful when I was at the booking stage. Assan was super welcoming when we arrived in the small hours of the morning. Curtis was a sweetie and Nate was so helpful with a great sense of humour. Assata did an awesome job keeping our room lovely and clean and we loved our brief chats we had with her. And lastly, Ronnie. This man is such an asset to the hotel. He gave us so many tips and directions on where we needed to go. He made us laugh and was so considerate of us and our holiday. 
Thank you soooooooo much WSH; I will always recommend you and if ever I come back to NYC I will definitely stay with you again. 
Michelle Anderson New Zealand.

title: Art Deco Meets The Village
text:
Old world accommodations with an art deco favor. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The room I booked was smallish but well appointed. But then again, when in New York, and especially in The Village, one should spend less time in the room and more time out and about.
Continental breakfast was included, however, the room where it was served was far too small. A minor inconvenience.
Booked my stay through Trip Advisor and saved over $1000 off the hotels website prices.

title: Neighbourhood Hotel
text: Hotel is in an excellent location just off Washington Square. The hotel itself is in an old building and the lifts are as you would expect in a building of this age. The rooms are small (again as expected) but clean and the beds were comfortable. The shower was good even if you had to wait a while for the hot water to come through. The staff were friendly and very helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Another Great Stay
text: I decided to come back after my first visit for two reasons. The first time was impeccable, and I wanted to see if it was a fluke. It was not. Sure the rooms aren’t exactly sprawling, but who comes to New York to lay down? The staff are still great, and most importantly genuine. I am recommending it to all my friends and colleagues.

title: Avoid room 331 and the front desk
text:
The bellmen and cleaning staff were absolutely lovely, great location, and was pleasantly surprised by the breakfast. 

Unfortunately, the room and the front desk staff left much to be desired. After getting off of an 8 hour, international flight, we came to the hotel. It was too early to check in, but in my experience, it's sometimes possible to check-in a bit early. Since it was nearly 3:00, I asked the front desk and the gentleman met me with such disbelief that you would have thought I asked to kill his cat. We left and came back after 4 and asked to check in and was met with "I'll see if the room is ready". 

The next morning we were awoken to the smell of gas (propane?). The window was open, so we closed it and left for the day. The same thing happened that evening, so we closed the window and went out for dinner. When we came back, the smell had dissipated, so we just decided to keep the window closed for the rest of the visit... another 3 days.

Unfortunately, the vent in the bathroom wasn't able to adequately vent the shower, which was apparently also drawing from the source of the smell. This was compounded by the cleaning staff opening the window (I am sure to air it out because of the shower). By the time we got back to the room, after spending 5 minutes in the room, we both had a headache and went down to let the front desk know. 

I spent nearly a decade in the hospitality industry, including the Ritz and Amangani, and if I had ever responded to a guest the way I was spoken to, I would have been looking for a new job. When I informed the front desk that the room smelled like gas and I suspected it was seeping in from the "courtyard", he rudely asked me what kind of gas. After bickering with me for a few minutes, the other gentleman indicated that they would go check it out. When we got back to the hotel after getting a bite to eat, they indicated that they had brought in the ozonator and aired out the by opening the window. I was then told that was all they could do because the hotel was at capacity. No apology or compassion of any kind. We quickly ran up to the room and shut the window to avoid the smell and kept the light off when we took a shower to avoid activating the fan. 

This hotel was recommended to me by frequent visitors who have always found the hotel accommodating and charming and who were extremely disappointed when I told them what happened. Honestly, for nearly $300, the stay was absolutely appalling.

title: Charming, friendly 'old world' hotel in Greenwich Village
text:
I highly recommend this hotel. It is well located close to all the north south subway lines. There are many restaurants and of course Washington Square Park nearby. I have been staying in this hotel since 1993 and look forward to staying there later this year;.

I stayed for a week in a deluxe king with a lovely view of the Park. The breakfasts are good and I had lunch and dinner in the downstairs restaurant a number of times. The lunch and dinners were excellent and staff were very friendly. A continental breakfast is included with your nightly rate.

I like that the hotel is more than 100 years ago so the building had it charms.

The staff were also friendly and welcoming every time I was in the lobby.

title: Excellente expérience
text:
Hôtel propre et très bien situé près du parc Washington square.  
La chambre était très confortable et silencieuse même si nous avions les fenêtres côté rue.
Le personnel est très charmant et bien efficace. Déjeuner continental bon avec des options santé.

title: Good location but found lacking
text:
We booked 2 rooms at the Washington Square Hotel based on its local in the area we wanted to be based and the reviews we had read. 

Unfortunately it felt short of the expectations we had and at $329 plus taxes per room per night was much too expensive for what it was so decided to cut our losses, pay for that night as we had checked in and found another better hotel nearby for the same price which did meet our expectations. When spending a week in New York, it’s important that your hotel is the place you’re comfortable coming back to and feel relaxed in and for us Washington Square Hotel wasn’t that place. 

When we arrived from the airport, our rooms weren’t ready as we were ahead of check in so needed to wander for 2.5 hours until they were meant to be ready. Arriving back at 3.30pm and our rooms were still being inspected so had to wait again. The person on reception said he was arranging two spectacular rooms for us on the same floor so we hoped it would be worth the wait. Eventually we got into our rooms. 

One has a bright window over the street with the park off to the left but was very small despite being described as a Deluxe Queen Room. It was clean but wardrobe was small and there was nowhere to store our suitcases. Bed looked like a double not a queen. 

The other was even smaller with two small side windows which looked onto other hotel room windows or if looked to the left you could just see the corner of the park. The room was pretty dark as a result. The wardrobe was tiny with 2 coat hangers only so very limited storage space.  Not quite what I call a deluxe queen room with a park view. 

Overall it turned out to be somewhat basic for the high price being charged and lacking the amenities we were expecting. The staff were friendly. I can understand it is well located for NYU so good for parent visiting their children but not what we were expecting on our week visit from the UK.

title: NYU College Visit
text: Great hotel, perfect location and reasonably priced!  The rooms are small but super clean and beds are comfortable.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.  The free breakfast was a great perk.  Highly recommend!

title: Fantastic location / Nice rooms / Friendly Staff
text: Located adjacent to Washington Square this is a smaller boutique type hotel on the edge of Greenwich Village.  Very quiet area, lots of retaurants nearby as well as the 4th St subway station (go anywhere in the city from here).  Small rooms (not a big surprise for NYC), clean, with all the basic amenities.  The elevator is small and slow, so if you're the impatient type get a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor and just take the stairs.  The price and location make this hotel a standout.  No hesitation about staying here again.

title: Very enjoyable stay!
text: The hotel is located in a great location next to Washington Square.  The hotel is on the small side and with seven floors.  It is quiet and comfortable and has a very nice small restaurant called North Square.  We enjoyed a very nice and updated room that was spacious and had and outstanding, well lit bathroom.  It was the best hotel experience all around that we have had in NYC.  The staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Good deal for NYC
text: We were very happy with our stay. Small room, as expected for New York and not new, but clean, well located and with very friendly staff. Even the complimentary continental breakfast was better than I am used to seeing in NYC. I heard other customers commenting that this was a great deal too. The doormen were all extremely friendly and one everyday would bring a gift to my kid.

title: Staff, Facilities and Location Were All Wonderful — Above and Beyond
text: As a female traveling alone in the Big Apple, I couldn't have felt more taken care of. Shout out to Charlie at the front desk who guided me to the best pizza/Italian restaurant nearby and made check-in a snap. He and the other employees showed their personality, which made the stay fun. It was rainy during my stay, and my umbrella broke. I discarded it in the trash can in my room. The next day voilà, it was fixed! Someone in housekeeping had taken the initiative to make it workable again. What was once trash is now a treasured memory. Not that a broken umbrella would be a problem since the hotel provides an umbrella in the hotel room anyway, but I was very impressed by the effort! I didn't try out the hotel-provided robe, but it looked soft. The bed was a bit hard for my liking, but was only a slight annoyance. The location was great—quick to get to the subway and so close to NYU. I will definitely come back for another stay at Washington Square Hotel.

title: Charming Hotel in Perfect Location
text: This was my third or fourth stay at the Washington Square.  I've never been disappointed by this quaint yet modern place.  The staff is very friendly and helpful, the room is clean and well appointed.  And, for this last visit, the new shower system was just amazing.  Highly recommended for the perfect combination of value, location and charm.

title: Charming hotel in the Village
text: Hotel is old world but clean, charming, and updated bathroom/shower. Excellent location in the Village right off Washington Square Park, and only a block from a commonly needed subway station. The staff are very friendly and helpful with their information. There’s a great restaurant for dinner and a nice lounge for happy hour. If the rates don’t go up too much (New York is exorbitant) we would definitely stay there again. We had a wonderful week.

title: My favorite place to stay in NYC
text: Fantastic location, super friendly and helpful staff, clean and quiet rooms, generous breakfast. Love everything about this hotel but the staff is really what sets it apart from every other place in NYC.

title: hotel charmoso e bem localizado
text:
Gostei muito do hotel, bem localizado para quem quer ficar longe da Time Square, quarto ótimo e muito aconchegante, equipe muito prestativa, um bom café da manhã, enfim, eu super recomendo o hotel! 
Além disso, pedimos um late check out e eles foram super atenciosos e nos atenderam prontamente

title: great location very charming
text: I stayed here in July and will happily go back again. An old style new York hotel that is across the road from washington square. The staff were terrific and very helpful. The rooms are small but comfortable and access to the subway is half a block away.

title: Great location and lovely historic hotel
text:
We visit NYC about once a year, and generally stay in mid range hotels in midtown.  This year, we decided to try staying in Greenwich Village. This was such a wonderful experience that we plan to do it again next year.  The hotel is right off Washington Square Park, close to lots of restaurants and a subway stop.  We walked to the Lower East sdie Tenement Museum, the Whitney and the High Line walkway.  We enjoyed the historic building and the excellent service.  Since this was a birthday celebration, we stayed in a large, king room and it was very comfortable.  Our son and daughter-in-law came up for one night and stayed in the least expensive room.  It was small but quite comfortable.
 We especially enjoyed the continental breakfast each morning which is beautifully served in the restaurant.  Highly recommended!
One note: Guests with mobility issues should ask if there are steps involved in getting to their room. Accessing our son's room involved three steps.  Not a problem for us, but it would be for some.

title: Wonderful service
text: This hotel is quaint and located perfectly next to Washington Square Park.  The staff was exceptional!  The doorman even gave my friends son a NY hat!  They even stored our luggage very professionally until it was time to check in.

title: Best hotel in the best neighborhood in NYC
text: Sure, this isn’t a luxury five star hotel, but it is a fabulous comfortable and clean hotel perfectly situated in one of NYCs best neighborhoods. The value can’t be beat, the staff is friendly and the free breakfast is a nice bonus. We stay there frequently and will do so again and again. Love the WSH!

title: Excellent location
text:
Excellent hotel location -  very close  to NYU and Washington square park.
Clean room & spacious. Easy to get transportation - taxis. Friendly and helpful staff.
Good value for money at that location. Continental breakfast so variety not much.

title: A bit dated but location can't be beat
text:
The location of this hotel is fantastic - right across the street from Washington Square Park, near NYU, surrounded by restaurants, bars, clubs, shops, etc. The location can't be beat. The room itself was a bit older and could use some updates. 

The hardwood floor was lovely but also it was uneven. You could feel it walking in and a dropped pen rolled across the room. Not a huge major problem, but it was a bit harsh and disconcerting at first. The bigger issue that I had was that there didn't seem to be much sound insulation, both regular sounds and impact noise reverberated through the room. Sounded like the people above us were doing aerobics in high heels! You can also hear discussions in the hallway and out on the street (we were on the 2nd floor so maybe it's better further up). Just like living in NYC!

We adjusted the thermostat lower and lower but it was still pretty hot in the room. I don't know if the thermostat was broken or if the surrounding rooms had the heat cranked up and therefore also affected us. Of minor note, the grout in the bathroom seemed pretty dirty and in need of a deep clean, but I'm sure they mop in between guests so that's mostly just an aesthetic. Still, for the money, I expected it to be kept up a little better.

The linens were nice, fresh, clean. The soaps/cleansers were good quality. The staff were very nice. I am a regular visitor to NYC and tend to stay in the Financial District so I probably won't stay here again, but it's not bad if you want the convenience of staying right in the West Village. I prefer a more modern hotel.

title: Good location for NYU
text: Stayed here while visiting NYU and location is perfect, right off lovely Washington Square. Very friendly staff. Hotel is a little “long in the tooth”, I.e. a bit dated. Rooms are small and not nicely appointed but comfortable bed. There were little holes in linens. Bathroom very small. Maid service not great, not sure they vacuumed; left behind garbage. Luckily I spent no time in room other than to sleep so served purpose.

title: Great find
text:
My husband, teenage daughter and I stayed here during a recent visit to New York for some college tours. Greenwich village was such a calm respite from the rest of the city, and this hotel was centrally located to great restaurants, bodegas, the subway...we felt right at home.
The rooms are a decent size, we had one room for the three of us with two double beds and were quite comfortable for the three nights.

title: Good... maybe great!
text: VALUE FOR MONEY & LOCATION...Very good location - depends if one likes Greenwich village, NYU area... 20-30 mins to most areas... and a GREAT Washington Sq nearby. Quaint well maintained typical old & fresh feeling together. Front desk is welcoming..overnight parking good... plenty of famous NYC street food ...

title: Lovely Extended Stay
text:
Washington Square Hotel is a hidden gem!  We originally booked for 3 nights and were upgraded to the King Executive room.  Probably the biggest room we have ever stayed in while visiting NYC.   Its not very often that you get a double sink and a view of Washington Square Park at such a value.   The beds were very comfy and we had no problem falling asleep each night.  No noise from the street below.   Our room was actually right next to the elevator, and never had a problem with noise.  
Every single staff member we came into contact with was extremely nice.  Check In and out was quick and dropping our bags off was easy.   We were always greeted by at least 3 employees whenever we walked in or out.  
Breakfast is included and they have an express breakfast on the lobby level, or a sit down meal was in the attached restaurant.  If you decided on the sit down option, there are two sides of the menu.  The free breakfast was cereal, toast, bagels, fruit, yogurt, and juices. I was very surprised to see they have gluten free toast and muffins available. If you wanted a warm meal, they did charge more for this, but the prices were reasonable.  Honestly, we like to grab a quick breakfast before heading out and walking all morning.  That saves room for all the good food in the city.  
Our last day in the city was a messy one with Winter Storm Maya making its way across the East Coast.  Most of the flights out of the area were either delayed or canceled.  Luckily we found out early our flight was canceled until the next day and the hotel had a room available for us.  The staff helped us feel better about not getting home on time and worrying about what to do in the situation.  Even though the second room was smaller, we still had a great room and time.  The only complaint in the small room is the shower curtain, why have fabric shower curtains, the floor was soaked in minutes.    So don't put anything on the floor of the bathroom you don't want to get wet.  
The location was amazing with two subway stations within minutes of the hotel.  Restaurants and nightlife are within a block or two with the Comedy Cellar just 3 blocks away.  Easy walk to East Village bars, SOHO shopping, and West Village restaurants.  Could not ask for a better place.
We will be back to the WSH when we visit NYC!!!

title: really enjoyable stay
text: I stayed there for four nights this month. The service was perfect, always smiling and accommodating. The room was also nice with a comfy bed and a large enough bathroom. There was also a continental breakfast offered in the morning (with small but enough choice). The location is superb to visit Greenwich village, Noho, West and East village, TriBeCa and even downtown manhattan (if you like walking a bit, like I do). I was there for a business trip at NYU, which is located less than 10 minutes by walking from this nice hotel. The hotel is basically touching Washington square park where a lot of activities happen during the day. The cost was also reasonable for New York (about $165 a night), but it may be due to the room booking from a US federal agency.  Definitely a place I would like to come back (with my family) in a near future.

title: Room and hotel were perfect!
text: Our room was very quiet and the staff were all super friendly. Upon arrival, they gave us 2 subway passes that another guest left intentionally for the next guests. So we didn't pay for transportation all week. Also, the staff helped us with how and which trains to use while going around the city. They went above and beyond to make sure our stay was amazing. The location of this hotel was perfect because it was walking distance to time square but not too close to hear all of the commotion. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Winter weekend in the Village
text: Everything about our stay was delightful. Because of the time of year, we were lucky enough to be able to check in early; when we went out to wander the Village some more after check-out, they graciously, and safely, secured our bags for the day. Dinner in their restaurant was delicious, and we met the most interesting locals, who know the neighborhood, yet choose to eat here! Our room was small, but clean, comfortable, and quiet. 'To go' materials were provided at the Continental Breakfast so we could take our breakfast either across the street to the park, or up to our room. When we returned after a day exploring, fresh baked chocolate chip cookies and hot tea and coffee were waiting - delightful! We will be back!

title: Best kept secret
text: I do not want to give too glowing a review for fear of giving away my chances of getting a room next time I travel to NYC. Incrdeibly friendly staff. Good sized room (for NYC). comfortable bed, great amenities and a delicious breakfast experience.

title: Nice spot but did not get what I was promised
text:
I booked a Penthouse King room for 2 nights.  The website says the room has "sweeping views of the park and city."  It did not.  There was a glimpse of the park from the corner of one window and a partial view of the Empire State Building from another.  Nothing sweeping about it. 

The room itself was a decent size, as was the bathroom.  To get to it we had to meander down some narrow hallways.  

Staff seemed friendly.  Continental breakfast (included) was fine - fruit, yogurt, granola, bagels and pastries in a small room off the lobby.

The location is fantastic.  All the great cultural, shopping, dining and drinking experiences of Greenwich Village are within walking distance and the subway stop is just a block away.

title: Eine positive Überraschung
text:
Wenn man in dem Preislevel in Manhattan ein Hotel bucht rechnet man normalerweise mit dem Schlimmsten :-)
Hier wurde ich aber angenehm überrascht. Sehr gute Lage, gute Zimmer, freundliches Personal und gutes Frühstück.

title: Another Excellent Stay
text: For a Greenwich Village hotel these rooms are huge!  A good sized bathroom with a bath tub not just a shower stall, a decent sized bed, two windows with a nice view, and a large closet.  If you expect more be prepared to pay twice as much!  The hotel is nicely appointed and clean.  Many attractive details.  The lounge is pleasant and the breakfast is very good.  Everything is clean and the location is superb.  But what's best is the service.  There are always plenty of staff people around to help patiently with any issue that arises.  I've stay here before and will never stay anywhere else in NYC!

title: Small but superb room near NYU
text: The staff was helpful and the hotel was perfectly located for my visit to NYU. The building was nice and clean, and the room was lovely. (People not accustomed to NYC might be surprised by how hotels in NYC are nothing like hotels elsewhere in the US, so don't come in expecting this to be like a Hilton in Indiana.) The square footage of the room was small -- there was a bed, a dresser, and one small chair, with a TV mounted on the wall -- but it was clean and pleasant and everything I needed was there. The bathroom was nice (again, small), and the shower was probably the best shower I've ever experienced ... it took a while to figure out, but it was totally worth the time. The continental breakfast wasn't particularly special, but it was free and it fueled me for the day. For a room that was less than $200, it exceeded my expectations. I would absolutely stay here again.

title: Love this hotel
text: This is my second visit to the Washington Square hotel. The accommodations and the staff are wonderful. Most of the rooms have been newly updated and are always very clean. The staff goes above and beyond to accommodate their guest. There is a restaurant in the  hotel and they offer a continental breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the West Village area  as it is close to the subway and has many fine  restaurants within walking distance.

title: Friendly staff Amazing location near NYU
text: This hotel has an incredibly warm and inviting staff.  The location is excellent just a block away from the A C E line on the subway for easy access to Times Square uptown and World Trade Center area downtown.   Just a block from NYU.   Only down side with our room was no exterior windows -- so no natural light, but was not a deal breaker for me.   Nice free continental breakfast -- and you could also go to the restaurant and have anything on the continental menu for free while your companion eats from the menu if they want something heartier.   Also, a great diner right up the street near the subway --The Waverly Restaurant.

title: B.Fazio
text:
Washington Square Hotel is not only in one of the best locations in the city, the accommodations so clean and price is great! The staff are so helpful friendly and professional! My husband and I stay every time we visit NYC. Looking forward to our next trip!
👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼❤️

title: Wonderful long weekend in Greenwich Village
text:
I've never been to Greenwich Village so I picked a hotel that will put me at or close to the area.  Washington Square Hotel is a perfect location to explore The Village. I had been traveling for more than 14 hr on an international flight and called the hotel from baggage claim to ask if they have early check in.  To my delight, they said my room was ready!  I really appreciated that.

Location: A few steps away from Washington Square Park and NYU. I walked all over - to restaurants, food stores, bakeries and even to Chelsea and Chinatown. The hotel is also close to a subway station.  
Room: My room had 2 twin beds on the 7th floor. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable.  The bathroom was well=appointed.  The hotel provided robes and slippers.  There was an ironing board and hair dryer. The only thing I would have liked is a small fridge because I like to drink milk before bedtime so a fridge would have been nice to store milk, or other goodies available from the great bakeries nearby. Because this is an old hotel, sometimes I can hear the plumbing and some voices but the sounds are not really startling and I drifted back to sleep with no problem.

Reception desk/sfatt: Very easy check in and check out.  The staff is very helpful, pleasant and accommodating.  They made my stay worry-free and relaxing.  Requests are handled promptly and cheerfully.  One of the staff even waited for my taxi with me and made sure it was the taxi I called (via Curb app).  The staff gave the hotel an easy feel and really made me want to go back.

Extras: An ample continental breakfast was provided with granola, Chobani yogurt, fruit cups, bananas and an assortment of bread and pastries, plus of course coffee or tea.

I gave this hotel an Excellent rating even though there were some things I would have liked to have (like the room fridge) because of the overall experience I had.  It contributed to a very memorable long weekend in Greenwich Village.

title: I Should Keep This A Secret
text: I did extensive research on the perfect location for our 4 night stay in NY. This was it! Washington Square Park is clean and welcoming. In the early morning hours it was nice to see all of the local dogs gather there. Great restaurants, eateries and watering holes within a 2 block radius. The subway entrance is on the same block. We walked everywhere and the Chelsea Market and the High Line are worth seeking out. The hotel staff here are on top of things. You are greeted with smiles every time you encounter an employee. Our room was on the 9th floor so we had an incredible view. The bathroom is on the small side but extremely clean and very well appointed. The beds were firm, comfortable and cozy. Perfect space to relax and recoup for the next day of walking. I highly recommend Murray's Cheese Bar just 2 blocks or so away. Perfect trip on so many levels.

title: Another Warm and Welcoming Stay
text:
I have stayed at The Washington Square Hotel before and would absolutely stay there again.  The location is superb for transport links and comedy clubs, music venues and great restaurants. 

The warmth of the welcome from all members of staff - who really seem to care that you will enjoy your stay - is outstanding.  My room had a recently refurbished shower room which was excellent.

title: Outstanding experience from check in to check out
text: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times in the past 6 years and I have consistently experienced outstanding service from check in to check out.  I’ve also noticed familiar faces over the years which tells me they care for their staff as well.  Warm and welcoming environment!  Highly recommend!

title: The Washington Square Hotel literally left us out in the cold!!!
text:
This is a story of outrageous treatment and poor follow-up customer service.
I booked this hotel because it is a short walk to the venue where we were to attend a very important family event the night of Dec 8th.  Our flight was delayed coming in but we arrived at the hotel in time to get to our room, freshen up, change our clothes and take the short walk to the event.  It was pretty cold so we were glad to get inside to check-in.  I gave our name to the desk receptionist and he immediately told us that unfortunately the room being held for us had a plumping problem.  I thought he was going to tell us they were working on it or that he was going to upgrade us to another type room.  But no!!!  He told us he had booked us a room at the Chelsea Holiday Inn and would pay for a cab to get us there.  He handed me $10 and had me sign a voucher for it and that was it--not even goodbye!
It took almost 10 minutes for the doorman to hail an empty cab as we stood on the sidewalk in the freezing cold with our bags.  We were literally dazed and confused as to what was happening and worried we weren't going to make the event on time.
Did I mention it was a Saturday night and the night of SantaCon???????
It took more than 20 minutes to crawl the 11/2 miles to the Holiday Inn and cost $15+tip.  
The Holiday Inn is pretty shabby yet they charged us close to the same rate as the Washington Square Hotel and they aren't within walking distance to the venue we needed to get to.  This is not a hotel we would have chosen to stay in and couldn't believe the Washington Square Hotel thought this was the right thing to do to a guest.
We then had to Uber through SantaCon crowds and Saturday night traffic again to head back to the venue which was less than a block from the Washington Square Hotel, where we had started!  We were late.
When we got back from the trip I called the WSH to get the manager's email and was given contact info for Sonny.  I emailed Sonny Dec. 10th and got back a quick response.  He apologized, told me he was traveling and would get back to me in two days.  I thanked him.  That was the last I heard from Sonny even though I reached out to him 2 more times.
So not only were we treated badly and uncaringly by the desk staff, but also by management who had promised to address our poor treatment.  
The point of this review is that if they would to this to us they would do this to another customer and apparently not care one bit.

title: STAY HERE if you can!!
text: The rooms were super clean and updated! The staff was amazing, kind, and wonderful! Will definitely stay here again! The doorman, the bell man, the check in staff and the chocolate chip cookies were all pluses in our book!

title: NYE stay
text: Loved this hotel ! The rooms are a bit outdated but you are not in them for long enough to really care. The rooms are clean and the customer service of all staff is second to none. Location is great with a few nice bars and restaurants near by and easy access via subway to the main attractions.

title: Lovely stay
text: Stayed for 4 nights the week before Christmas and had a lovely stay. Clean and comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Get to know Ronnie for us the very soul of the hotel. If you want to know anything about Manhattan he's the man to ask. Will definitely be back to New York and I will stay here. Close amenities. Supermarket, pharmacy and most importantly the subway by far the best way to get around Manhattan. Love the history of this hotel also. You won't be disappointed

title: Definitely made the right choice
text:
After several years of wanting to make a Christmastime trip to New York City, I finally got to do that in early December. I chose the Washington Square based on reviews I read here, and am glad I did. As other reviewers pointed out, the rooms are on the smaller side, owing to the fact that it is an older building, but they are totally comfortable. I slept great all three nights. Except for the occasional distant siren, it was very quiet. The bathroom was spotless and had everything I needed. The folks at the front desk were friendly and helpful. They assisted me with printing out my boarding pass for my return flight, and there was no hassle checking my bag for the final day when had time to go out and explore some more before heading to the airport.

Aside from all of that, it was very convenient having a subway stop so close. In short, I will be coming back to NYC at some point -- I was there for four days, but could have stayed for four weeks and still not have seen everything. I certainly will look here first for my accommodations.

title: If you want a decent hotel in Greenwich Village
text: Superb location if you want to be in Greenwich Village or close to NYU. Right by Washington Square, the W4 st subway stop and the Waverly Diner.  Rooms are well appointed and comfortable, especially the bed.  The retro beige decor can seem drab, however, and some rooms have only a wall for a view.  Breakfast is excellent and included in the room price unless you order something cooked.  I was grateful for the arrangement of a decent limo to JFK at 4.30 am at a reasonable price.  There is only a small reception area but desk staff and concierge seemed to have everything under control at a very busy time before Christmas. Highly recommended as an alternative to the midtown and downtown chains.

title: New York Jazz Trip
text:
Just back from 5 nights in this hotel in NYC. We went to hear Chris Botti at Blue Note Jazz Club but also to visit other jazz clubs. This hotel in Greenwich Village is perfectly located for a jazz experience.

The hotel staff were very welcoming and helpful.  Our first room had no external window and after asking to move they found a room overlooking the front of the hotel for the next 4 nights.  If visiting it would be worth checking on this.  Both rooms were small but warm and comfortable as were the beds.

Breakfast can be taken self service in a room adjacent to the hall or waiter service in the restaurant in the lower ground floor, the latter can be continental or full breakfast.

We had dinner in the  North Square Restaurant which is part of the hotel and the food was very good; we also had a jazz brunch before leaving and this takes place in the bar/lounge every Sunday lunchtime.

title: Art Deco hotel
text:
Our duration was for 7 days at The Washington Square Hotel. It is an art deco hotel that suits the area in which it is located. The room was very clean, with all the usual extras, coffee machine, bath robes, toiletries etc. The staff were very helpful and friendly. For example, one evening we could hear a "clicking" sound in our room which we could isolate. We contacted reception and within 10 minutes the problem was fixed; it was in the broom cupboard, adjacent to our room.

There was two criticisms that I have regarding the room; that being that the cups for the coffee machine are waxed paper cups; which looks cheap and tacky. Ceramic mugs/ cups would be better in that they can be re-used and dosn't look cheap and tacky. Also regarding the coffee maker; UHT milk is better than Coffee Mate for the tea that is provided in the room. Other than that this is a good place to stay.

title: Best little secret
text: Enjoyed our stay again this year at Washington Square Hotel.  It's a great little hotel in the best part of town.  There is a part of me that doesn't want to let this secret out, but I want others to have a positive experience in my favorite city.  The location was great for us . . . we were going to a show at the Blue Note.  There are plenty of restaurants nearby, the room was clean, the beds were comfortable, breakfast in the restaurant downstairs was convenient and good, staff was professional and very accommodating.  No complaints here!  Thank you WSH for a wonderful weekend!

title: Great location
text:
We spent 5 nights at the Washington square hotel, 
Pro’s - The staff were superb and the hotel location is perfect for exploring both uptown and downtown Manhattan with a subway station 200 yards from the hotel, breakfast was ok with the usual croissants, toast cereal, fruit juice, coffee etc, Ronnie the doorman will give you all the information you need and they will allow you to leave your cases at the hotel on your leaving day, they also arranged transport back to the airport for us at $60
Con’s - The rooms and particularly the corridors need updating - artex walls from the seventies and chipped paintwork on the corridors, some mould on the window sills, and rust on the shower curtain, not much but enough to make you think they are in need of decorating or replacing 
Having said that we had a great time in New York and it was not spoilt by the few gripes we had with the hotel

title: Great Place; Nearly a 5 star
text: This is an older hotel with possibly the narrowest hallways I've ever seen in a hotel. Nonetheless, it is very well cared for, the rooms are small, but nice,the staff is helpful and depending on your plans, the location is good with excellent subway access, My deal included a Continental breakfast.  By New York standards, the price was reasonable.I'd stay there again.Parking is available nearby, half a block away at around $24 per 24 hours which seems fairly standard.

title: Nice place to stay; great staff!!
text: The location is close to restaurants, the subway and Washington Square.  The rooms are very clean.  I was taking my mother (75) to NYC to see the tree and Christmas windows, and we enjoyed our stay.  I was impressed with the staff - they were helpful and friendly.  On our last day, I became VERY impressed with them.  Three "gentlemen" were in the lobby screaming at the young lady behind the desk demanding their room be free because their key card hadn't worked when they went back up to their room.  She addressed their concerns calmly, and they responded by getting louder and more threatening.  All that noise because their key became de-magnetized.  She and the other staff handled it wonderfully, and the gentlemen left and went on to terrorize a taxi driver parked outside that was waiting on a patron who had stopped to get luggage.  I would absolutely stay here again.

title: Washington Square Hotel
text: What a fabulous hotel to stay for our 14 days in New York easy to get to subways which helped us to get around all the sights we visited and friendly staff nothing too much trouble well recommended at all times.  Clean, warm and friendly with all the staff could not do more. Will be back next year definately.

title: ニューヨークブルーノート近くのホテル
text: ワシントンスクエアでジャズの演奏を聴き、夜はブルーノートで本場のジャズを聴くににとても便利なホテルです。とてもシックなホテルで、夜も静かです。朝食はフルーツとパンとヨーグルトがフリーです。ミッドタウンのホテル料金が高いの対してこのホテルはとてもリーズナブルです。

title: Don't stay here
text:
I have stayed at this hotel a handful of times.  It has been close to things I needed, but it has delivered everything else poorly.  It is quaint, but that also means SMALL beds, among other items.  
It has separate HVAC controllers in the room, but they don't actually function.  It has air or heat pushed by the hotel.  This last week, I stayed in two rooms, and both were extremely hot. 
Also, the windows don't lock.  We were placed on the first floor the first night, and requested to move for our security. The hotel moved us to the third floor, but the window didn't lock in that room either.
Lastly, USE the SAFE every time you leave the room. In my haste one morning, I left earring out on the desk, only to have them stolen.

title: Amazing boutique hotel
text: We have just returned from a 6 night stay in this beautiful hotel in the heart of the trendy Greenwich village neighbourhood.   The lobby is welcoming and staff very friendly, especially the concierge who goes out of his way to chat and make local recommendations.   Nothing is too much trouble for the staff. Rooms are small but spotless, as are the lobby and breakfast/afternoon tea room.    Staying here, apart from lovely complimentary continental breakfast, loctation and great staff, there is a tranquillity here you don't get mid and uptown but a 2 minute walk to subway and 5 minutes in you are in the heart of Times Square etc.   We loved the peace of this area, but still surrounded by fabulous bars and restaurants.  Would absolutely stay here again and highly recommend.

title: Lovely Hotel
text: This historic boutique hotel in an incredible location is all anyone really needs in NYC. Sure, there are more sumptuous spots, but Washington Square Hotel has charm, warmth, and all of the essentials and then some - such as a very nice included continental breakfast. Our room was small (like most NYC rooms) yet exceedingly well appointed and comfortable. I liked that our room had a bathtub; many renovated and new hotels are foregoing tubs - but there's nothing like a good soak after hiking miles and miles through Manhattan's streets. We were thoroughly charmed by this lovely hotel and its friendly staff and will return. Loved the holiday twinkle-lit bedecked front entrance and Christmas tree in the lobby.

title: Clean, Spartan, Friendly
