text: You know, I love this little hotel and will gladly return.  I traveled to NYC for Thanksgiving and stayed here 5 nights.  GREAT staff.  The continental breakfast is very adequate.  The decorative theme is Old Hollywood, so there are photos and artwork in the lobby, bar/restaurant and the rooms of Lana Turner, Jimmy Durante.  I got Joan Crawford.  Anyway, I recommend this place absolutely. I wanted to stay in the Village and be comfortable (really FEEL like I was on vacation).  Boom.

title: Excellent hotel, restaurant and location!
text: Stayed here 4 nights in late November. Location fabulous--not far from subway on 7th Ave. In-house restaurant excellent for breakfast and dinner. Friendly staff. Pleasant room. Great walking neighborhood--adjacent to Washington Square Park, NYU and lots of great restaurants. Not far from Chinatown, Bowery, West Village and Union Square.

title: Is this a joke ? What a nightmare.
text:
From what we start ? Let’s start from the room. This place has old furniture and very old room. 
Inside the room it was still dirty from the guest before in fact i found coffee residues  in the drawer under the coffee machine Room very basic and dark inside. 
It’s unbelievable that they charge more than 200$ for this room. Completely disappoint. 
The staff wasn’t helpful at all. 
Breakfast supppose to be included instead I had to pay 15$ 
In the bathroom there is rust in the shower. 
Completely disappointed. 
My suggestion is don’t waste your money in this place. For the same price, even cheaper, you can find way better than this horrible place

title: Nice place to stay.
text:
Very clean, very friendly staff, always available to assist in any way. Good location. Good restaurant
  on premises. Breakfast was enough to start the day.
 Very quiet. We have stayed at this hotel several times and have never been dissapointed. 

.

title: All Round Lovely!
text: WSH had great service even before I arrived in NYC. The front desk was super helpful and gave me great tips on how to get around NYC. Continental breakfast was great and the room was lovely and quaint. The location was perfectly easy to access via subway or bus. The hotel overlooks Washington square park which is great plus the street totally comes alive over the weekend with all kinds of pop-up shops which I totally did not expect but loved. I definitely recommend!

title: Another great stay at WSH!
text:
We stay at the Washington Square Hotel every time we visit New York. The staff are very welcoming and the complimentary breakfast has everything we need before heading out for a busy day exploring the city.  The rooms vary in size and view depending on which room type you book but they are clean and well supplied. 
The hotel restaurant, North Square, has great food and wait staff..and shout out to bartenders Christopher and Jag in the North Square lounge!
We look forward to our next stay at the WSH!

title: Excellent Hotel in beautiful location
text: This hotel made our visit to NYC perfect. Located in the beautiful Greenwich of Village next to Washington Square Park. The rooms were fairly  spacious, with a nice bathroom and comfy bed. The breakfast was ok but not exceptional, the corridors could do with an update.  Excellent reception and door staff, especially Ronnie who always greeted us and gave us some brilliant recommendations for NYC. He was always on hand to give us tips and always made us feel good! The location is brilliant, with the park on the doorstep, so many top class bars and restaurants. My wife was also happy to find Samantha’s apartment in Sex and the City a few streets away.  It’s not hard to see why so many celebrities live in this area! We will definitely be back.

title: Great location but room was not so great.
text:
Firstly, this hotel is in such a great location. Very central and close to a subway. 
The hotel itself is lovely and well presented. The gentlemen on the doors were very very welcoming.
Check in was easy, but the young lady who checked us in did not look happy. She didn't smile or make us feel welcome.
Our room was on the 2nd floor. It was OK in size, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was also clean and stocked with all essentials. 
The downside, the only window looked out to a brick wall which meant the room was in complete darkness 24 hrs a day. It may not seem like a big deal, but as an international traveler staying for a full week, it makes you very disorientated as you can never tell what time of day it is and your body clock is confused. 
Overall, a great hotel in a great location if your only staying 2-3 nights. But, purely because there is a chance of getting a lower ground room with a brick wall as a view....I would not stay here again.

title: Bon emplacement
text: Bon accueil. Chambres pas très grandes mais bien équipées. Très beaux petits-déjeuners, avec un grand choix. A proximité de 4 stations de métro. Le quartier est assez agréable, avec un grand chois de restaurants et bars. Prix très compétitifs pour New york

title: Washington Square Hotel
text: We stay at the Washington Square Hotel every time we come to New York City because it is adjacent to NYU where my daughter is a freshman student. The unfortunate thing is the hotel property does not offer any substantial student our family discount so it can get quite expensive staying there! That being said, the location still can’t be beat as it is across the street from the NYU and adjacent to Washington Square Park and Arch. The waitstaff is very attentive with the doorman opening the door and greeting each guest upon arrival and departure. A daily breakfast is served in the downstairs restaurant area, while a ‘grab and go’ version is available off the hotel lobby on the main floor. The hotel also has a nice happy hour with reasonably priced items - including $1 oysters - that is worth going to. Overall, the Washington Square Hotel is a nice option in Greenwich Village and close to a lot of amenities.

title: Cozy Gem in the Village
text: I was in NYC to visit my son who lives in the Village. The Washington Square Hotel was the perfect spot overlooking the park and near many intimate restaurants. The room was very comfortable and clean with a remodeled bathroom. The complimentary breakfast was easy to access and just enough to start my day. Friendly staff too! Highly recommend!

title: NYC BOUTIQUE HOTEL AT IT'S BEST
text:
Overlooking the Washington Square Park, this is a lovely hotel. Don't expect the big luxurious NYC hotel, but instead, a very clean, fresh, friendly boutique hotel. For the money, under $300, you can't beat it for a place in the Village.

We stayed there for the Halloween parade which is a MUST!!

title: Wonderful
text: This hotel was in a super great location as we could see the park from our windows. The room was very spacious for NYC and spotless!!! I would go back here in a heartbeat. Staff was so very friendly and always welcoming!!! The location was far away from all the touristy Times Square hustle and bustle and therefore quiet. Loved walking around here as there are many great restaurants and bars to explore here. Soho is close by and the East and West Village are all walkable distances. Thanks for a memorable stay! We will be back again!

title: Great place to stay
text:
Fantastic location in the village, good rooms, tasty breakfasts and friendly staff, there is not much more that you can ask for at the price!

We loved our stay here and can’t wait to return as soon as we can.

title: AMAZING!
text:
I genuinely don’t think I would stay anywhere else in NYC... the whole experience has been amazing from start to finish. 

The staff are incredible... each and every one has been happy, chatty, interested and just lovely! oh, and extremely knowledgable and helpful; pointing us in the right direction to make the most of our time, as well as making local suggestions and reservations on our behalf. 

The hotel is in an incredible location right next to Washington Square, yet it’s so quiet! The hotel and room were spotlessly clean, and the bedding and towels were just lush! 

Coffee and tea for the room restocked every day and the express breakfast was just fab; had something for everyone (yoghurt, fruit pots, bagels, toast, and pastries) and was always well stocked. The coffee was delicious too! 

Just couldn’t ask for more 😁

title: Best Hotel in NYC!
text: Great, Safe Location with solid simple breakfast and clean boutique rooms. Great staff and away from cheesy tourists.Easy access to parking and cool, out-of-the-way shops like Hamlet's Vintage and one of the coolest parks around where something's always happening.

title: Great Hotel!!!
text:
So incredibly glad we chose this hotel (blindly off the internet) 
Decent size room, Large bathroom...... Very friendly and attentive staff, Excellent location in the Village
Always was Thrilled to find out that the room we stayed was the room Joan Baez and Bob Dylan lived in , in 1965!
(If you know the song Diamonds and Rust ---
 "Now you're smiling out the window 
Of that crummy hotel 
Over Washington Square )
This will be our new GoTo hotel in NYC 😄

title: Best hotel in best location
text:
Always loved the hotel. I have known the hotel for more than 20 years since I lived around the corner , and it is the best neighborhood  on Manhatten.

This time I brought my boy, we had such a great time. We loved the express Breakfast at the hotel. The location is perfect for everything, we walked up to Empire state building and down to the ferry to statue of liberty. And W4 subway station is on the same block, so we also took the subway to Brooklyn and days we didn't walk. The staff was all super nice and helpfull, and my boy loved the cap he got from one of the guys :)

title: Excellent location, quiet at night, good service, everything as presented
text:
The hotel is located in the NW corner of Washington Square Park, There are three stations for several major subway lines nearby. Broadway is a stone cast away. Around the hotel there are e.g. lots of nice restaurants. It's a decent walk to Highline at Meatpacking District by the Hudson River, to SoHo, Union Square etc. The neighborhood of the hotel is characterized by the strong presence of NYU. 

The hotel personnel was very attentive, polite and helpful. The rooms are rather modest and smallish, yet do their job well and the cleanliness was excellent. The beds were comfortable. The free WiFi was excellent. You do not travel to NYC to stay in your room, don't you?  The continental breakfast offered in the room price was very good and the service in the breakfast room was excellent. In addition, there was also an express breakfast buffet.  The room price including the amenities offered free of extra charge is competitive in NYC terms.

The hotel arranged our airport transfer as we left and kept our luggage stored for a few hours after we vacated the rooms.

The best quality of the hotel was the generally very nice atmosphere, we really felt at home there. The hotel was exactly what we expected from the accommodation of our one-week city break. All in all a very positive experience.

title: Beautiful hotel is great location in NYC.
text: Room is quaint and functional, comfortable bed and complimentary breakfast a real treat to energize one for the sites of NYC.  Staff very friendly and helpful.  Added plus is an on site very good bar and an adjoining wonderful restaurant "North".  Would definitely stay here again if the opportunity to return to NY arises.  Highly recommend the neighborhood  While traffic in NYC is a nightmare, and you can actually walk faster than taxies or Uber, there is a close by subway which works great for long treks, along with buses.  Take the time to learn it, you will save much time, even if $$ is not an issue for you. Stay here, you won't regret it.

title: Excellent hotel in quiet central location
text: Beautiful hotel in a great central location by Washington Square close to subway stops but also walking distance of some attractions. Good priced clean quiet room. Option of a quick serve yourself breakfast or table service even for the included breakfast. Staff very welcoming and helpful. Will definitely be staying again when visit the big Apple again.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Great room, with full breakfast. Spacious room, and bathroom. Very clean, and nice people who work here. I though it was going to be loud, as we were right on the street. Quite at night, and comfortable bed. Thanks for a great time in the city!

title: 3 Tage in NYC
text:
Das Hotel hält, was es verspricht. Ruhig, gepflegt und in toller Lage. Subway ist nur ein paar Schritte entfernt. Aus dem Zimmer ein gigantischer Blick auf das Empire State Building. 

Das Frühstück in North Square Restaurant ist inclusiv und ist sehr gut. 

Insgesamt sehr zu empfehlen.

title: Very friendly staff
text: The staff in the reception area is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are rather small, a bit stinky and should be freshed up a little bit. The hotel is excellentely located, good for going out - Greenwhich or  Meatpacking - but also in walking distance to all subway lines.

title: Great location
text: We stayed five nights at the Washington Square Hotel. It's a great location just off Washington Square Park, close to 6th Avenue, the subway and the rest of Greenwich Village. It's an easy walk to Bleecker Street, The High Line and Chelsea Market. The staff were very helpful, especially the concierge. The rooms were fine - clean, small but perfectly-formed bathroom, safe, aircon, TV etc. The attached restaurant serves a good breakfast, and the dinner we had on the first night was nice too. There was also a free self-service coffee/water area available all day. Would recommend if you want to be in 'The Village' or near to NYU.

title: Pleasantly surprised
text:
Our first visit to NYC as a family flying from England staying in a Queen room and cot/crib for our 11month old son. The reviews were an accurate reflection of the accommodation and I was pleasantly surprised and overall happy.

The hotel is conveniently positioned in a nice neighbourhood close to a subway stop just one block away (2-3min walk). Local amenities are in close proximity to pick up the odd essentials. The Washington Square Park is an attractive and cultural/diverse place, and also has nice views of the World Trade Centre.

The rooms were clean and presentable. The interior is a little dated in appearance though has aged well giving off some character. The beds are comfy and there is very hot water on demand. The bedroom we stayed in overlooking the rear courtyard is quiet (with no view), which at first we thought was unusual being situated in such a busy city. The rooms were a good size, just big enough to lay out two cases. The passesnger lifts (elevators) were quick, which is refreshing when contending with a pram/stroller each day. 

Continental breakfast served from 7:15 is good, particularly the bagels together with a side of cheddar cheese. Simple but effective morning calories with a side of orange juice. The restaurant staff are fairly robotic but occasionally crack the odd smile. Staff were helpful in providing a high chair each morning (we stayed six days) and bananas to leave with for a snack for our 11 month old. 

Reception staff were generally helpful and friendly, even when I called in advance flying to check our booking information. One down side, the manager found it offensive to display our 'birthday banner' in the restaurant during our breakfast for my 30th, which was a kill joy. 

Good money to value and would recommend. Would I stay again? Yes.

title: Good mid range hotel
text: For the price this was a real find. Bang in the centre of Greenwich Village it’s ideally located for travel all over Manhattan and the subway is only 2 mins from the hotel. The area around the hotel is full of shops, breakfast diners, restaurants and bars so if you just want to stay local you’re well provided for. The hotel itself is a cute boutique style, the rooms however are tiny. A double bed, chair, small fitted wardrobe and desk are about the only things that fit into the room so we had to perch our large suitcases on a chair in the room as there was nowhere to store them. Perhaps not the hotel to choose for a long stay unless you upgraded your room to a larger one. Other than that little niggle, the bed was comfy, the shower was powerful, room was spotless and you had a hairdryer, well stocked coffee machine and iron in the room. For the price I was a happy camper.

title: Ligger super godt
text: Beliggenheden er rigtig god, selve hotellet er ældre og lidt slidt, men værelset stort og rent. Også på badeværelset er der god plads. Morgenmaden serveres i restauranten i kælderen og er fin kvalitet, men bliver lidt ensformet over flere dage. Dog skal man ikke klage, når man kender prisniveauet i NYC og her får morgenmad inkluderet i værelsesprisen. Et stort minus er, at der ikke er tændt på værelset og der kan altså godt nlive køligt her i efteråret. Ved henvendelse i receptionen afviste de blankt at gøre noget, for at afhjælpe dette - det havde været rart at se i det mindste et forsøg på at være i,ødekommende og venlig.

title: Wonderful as always
text: We stay at the Washington Square every time we visit NYC which is about twice a year for the past 15 years.  We LOVE this hotel.  The staff are incredible, the rooms are VERY clean and comfortable.  The housekeeping staff is great, the restaurant is WONDERFUL!   It’s in a perfect location with subway stops around the corner, great restaurants and coffee shops everywhere.  Washington Square Park is across the street and always a great place to people watch and take a break.  The room renovations were a great touch (new hardwood floors, double pane windows which blocked all street noise and ductless split AC/Heat).  I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great NYC experience.

title: Excelente hotel!!!!
text:
Fui con mi hijo desde el 14 al 22 de septiembre y nuestra estadía fue maravillosa!!
Buen hotel, muy limpio, servicio de cuarto todos los días y ante cualquier problema que solo fueron dos muy pequeños, solución inmediata.
Lo recomiendo sobretodo su desayuno en un lugar agradable y servicio a la mesa.
Felicitaciones 
Catalina Chile

title: A timeless experience of Village life.
text: The location was wonderful, right in the Village and near subway stops to anywhere we wanted to go. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms tastefully appointed. The adjacent restaurant, North Square, is one of the best restaurants I have experienced and for the quality of the food and presentation, quite reasonably priced. Saw an amazing concert by Cliff Eberhardt and Louise Mosrie at Richard Barone's Village Nights in the intimate setting of the North Square Lounge. Great staff. Will always stay here when visiting NYC!

title: Checks all the boxes
text: The WSH provides everything you expect from a hotel, and it even has bonuses: a historic connection to Bob Dylan and Joan Baez, art deco designs (by the owner's mother I think), a strategic location near great jazz venues and Public Theatre.

title: Nice hotel, good location
text:
My wife and I spent four nights at the Washington Square Hotel.  During past trips to New York we have stayed near Times Square, but we decided to get away from the huge crowds in that area this time.  We were so happy with this hotel's location in the Greenwich Village area.  Washington Square park is just across the street.  A subway station is just around the corner, so you can get anywhere in the city quickly.  There are many nice cafes and small restaurants in the area within walking distance if you don't feel like taking the subway.  Everywhere in New York is busy, but this area is easier to get around in without the crush of people in the high tourist areas.
   We stayed in the penthouse king, room 912.  Even though this is the most expensive room in the hotel it is very large so you get much more for your money than in many of the uptown hotels.  The rooms we have stayed in on past trips were similar in price, but much smaller.  I'm sure the other rooms here are a better value, too.  Our room was nicely decorated with a sitting area.  The air conditioning was good.  There was a coffee maker in the room.  The king bed was comfortable.  The bathroom was very large with double sinks and a huge walk-in shower.  The shower had good pressure and plenty of hot water.  Both the bedroom and bathroom were very clean.  The added bonus of this room being on the ninth floor was an unobstructed view of the Empire State building...especially beautiful at night.  
   We booked directly with the hotel.  A continental breakfast was included consisting of orange juice, coffee, yogurt, and pastries...enough to get you going in the morning.  There is also a restaurant on sight.
   Check in went smoothly and the front desk stored our baggage until our room was available.  The staff is very helpful and available at all times.  We will definitely stay here again the next time we travel to New York.

title: Cool but small
text:
Its an iconic hotel, in a great location, but is rather dated in its interior.

Very handy, location wise, but I feel it needs an update.

You are in the village, near the subway, and can walk strait up to the Empire State Building, like I did.

title: Wonderful stay: welcoming staff and excellent breakfast!
text: Thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay here. Great location, lovely room, welcoming staff and delicious breakfast. And all at an affordable price. Who can ask for more? WSH is a wonderful option to consider.

title: Warm, Friendly, Homely
text: We could not have wished for anything more, genuinely friendly and helpful staff throughout, absolutely nothing was too much trouble at any time. We arrived very early, far too early for check in but they held our suitcases for us and invited us to relax with coffee, orange juice, croissants on-the-house, and we were then able to get on our way for a day out in NY. After checking out at 11 am, the standard check-out time, again our cases were looked after and our internet connection continued to work until we were eventually picked up from the hotel at 7pm the following day. We spent 2 nights but in reality we had a very relaxed 3-day stay at this hotel as a base for doing all that we'd planned to do in NY on this trip. NEVER have we felt more at home in any other hotel anywhere else!!!

title: Lovely, clean, and comfortable hotel in a great location
text: I greatly enjoyed my stay at Washington Square Hotel and wish I could have stayed longer -- and that's not usually how I feel when I visit New York. The hotel was very clean and comfortable, the staff were so kind and helpful, and the location was perfect. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the Greenwich Village area.

title: So glad we stayed here!
text: WSH is the perfect location for this area of Manhattan. Subway access is easy but it really is nice to be able to walk most anywhere within a mile (Gramercy Tavern, Flatiron, Chelsea Market & Highline, Balthazar, and more). Our room (2 doubles, top floor) was spacious for NYC and the bathroom was roomy as well. Both were very clean and comfortable. The amenities were top quality and the complimentary continental breakfast in the North Restaurant was a great way to start the day. We felt very welcome from the beginning to the end of our visit.

title: Buona posizione, poco pulito
text: Ottima posizione, personale gentile e disponibile, servizio di pulizia scarso e poco attento. Comfort in camera mal distribuiti. Colazione nella norma, niente di eccezionale.  Tre stelle solo per la posizione.

title: We loved it!
text:
This hotel was perfect for us. A great place to use as a base if u are out and about everyday. The rooms are small, as per the pictures. Our room basically just had a bed and one small chair but a wonderful window ledge to sit on and watch the world go by. The bed was immensely comfortable and the hotel was very clean. The location is 10 out of 10. A short walk to the subway. And what surprised me the most, it was quiet at night. No street noise, no sirens and no hustle bustle noise. The complimentary breakfast was adequate to start the day. Only negative comment on this is the dining room for the complimentary breakfast was really small and was busy every day so it was a bit crammed. The daytime concierge (not sure of his name) was super helpful and friendly. We owe him some kangaroo jerky 😁
Overall i totally recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in a safe and quiet area of Manhattan yet still within easy reach of all the tourist hot spots. We will definitely return!

title: Great hotel in a great part of NYC!!
text: Great hotel. Rooms are small but have everything you need. Breakfast is excellent! Very friendly staff. Love to go there again. Greenwich Village is perfect for a night out in one of the many clubs and bars.

title: What a great place
text:
The hotel is in West village right next to the park (Washington square park). Very quiet area and still walking distance to almost everything (Ground zero, high line, soho, east village etc.) Very, very close to the subway with several different trains. We had a deluxe twin room which was spacious enough. The free breakfast included toast, bagels with Philadelphia and jam, fresh fruit, cereals, porridge, youghurt, juice, coffee and tea. We were very satisfied with this. For an additional cost you can get different eggs, pancakes, bacon etc.
The hotel restaurant serves good food and it’s very practical when you’ve been out all day to just be able to walk down and get a good meal. All staff were very friendly and helpful. I will absolutely return!

title: Small yet adequate.
text: This hotel is in a fun location- right off Washington Square Park. The Park felt very safe as it’s busy with neighbors and NYU students all the time. Our room was modest in size but comfortable. We appreciate the Keurig coffee service, the lovely lavender & peppermint toiletries in the bathroom and the very comfortable bed. Our one complaint was that we came back to our room just before 5 pm and the room had not been made up. So we had to wait for 15 min in the lobby.

title: Greta Garbo enjoyed here - so did I!
text: Great location next to Greenwich Village. Lot of restaurants and easygoing, gay-friendly area nearby. Hotel was wonderful with nice breakfast! Room was quite small but stylish and cozy. Very friendly and helpful doormen with big smile :) You feel very welcomed here!

title: Hôtel de charme
text:
C'est la deuxième fois que je réside dans cet hôtel (dix-huit ans d'intervalle!), et j'y retournerais bien volontiers. Sa situation, tout proche de Washington Park, est idéale pour découvrir les quartiers qui ont été les berceaux de la beat culture, Greenwich village, Soho, Chelsea, East village... Puis pour les moins téméraires le métro est au bout de la rue. Le soir, les restaurants vous tendent la main ( à noter le North square jouxtant l'entrée de l'hôtel), les clubs de jazz aussi, comme le mythique Village Vanguard ou encore le Blue Note.
Vous pénétrez dans un hall art déco et tout sera de cet acabit. Au fond la salle du petit déjeuner avec des serveurs prêts à satisfaire vos requêtes si besoin est, un service bagages bien commode, Bois, marbre, céramique peintes, puis l'ascenseur pour vous déposer à l'étage (demander les élevés, jusqu'à neufs). Les chambres sont spacieuses, la sdb parfaite, l'insonorisation aussi. Le service est assuré à la demande d'où une propreté absolue. Le personnel est aimable. 
On se croirait dans un film de Woody Allen.

title: Quiet clean historical boutique hotel
text: Stayed 5 nights at the Washington Square Hotel.  Friendly & very helpful hotel staff & doorman.  Safe neighborhood.  Room was clean & large enough by NY standards.  Bed not the most comfortable.  Continental breakfast was adequate.  Would definitely stay there again.

title: Ideal location good breakfast
text:
We spent 6 nights in this hotel. It is ideally located, within 5 minutes walk of all subways, east or west of the square. Loads of restaurants options around as well.
The room are spacious enough, the bathroom a bit small (but it is not where you spend most of your time). Quiet neighborhood as well, and all so clean and knit in the hotel.
The breakfast offers one of the best Orange Juice, and several options for food.
We definitely recommend it.

title: Great location with great employees!
text: We found the hotel online.  We were very pleased with the process from reservation through checkout.  The doormen on duty were VERY helpful.  The front desk staff was also GREAT!  The room was small but I am told that is New York.  The room was clean as was the entire hotel.  We really enjoyed the artwork and the stories we were told about the hotel.

title: Fabulously Friendly
text:
Just got back from our third stay at the Washington Square Hotel.

We live this little gem in the heart of Greenwich Village.

The staff absolutely make this hotel.  Look out for the wonderful Ronnie.  Warm, funny and an oracle on all things New York.

We can’t wait to return.

title: Friendly staff, very clean hotel
text: I can't say enough about the friendly and helpful staff. The lobby staff especially so, even shared a favorite recipe with me. So patient and familiar. The basic rooms are very small, but very clean. As I used to travel for work I always check a room thoroughly, even under the mattress, and this room was immaculate. Immaculate. The complimentary included continental breakfast is very good. On the last day of our stay, we enjoyed some delicious fresh whole wheat Blueberry pancakes in the downstairs Cafe, at a very reasonable price. I would love to return.

title: Great location but the hotel could be better!
text: Stayed a week at this hotel. The rooms are newly renovated and comfortable with good A/C and a large bathroom with good lighting. We were on the 8th floor and at the rear of the hotel and it was very quiet. The down side from the room restorations was that the mattresses on the beds were not replaced and in need of retirement. Consequently sleep quality was poor. We had 2 singles and the side that you enter the bed on was low and you could feel the tendency to roll to that side when sleeping. Secondly, I cannot comprehend how you can completely renovate a bathroom and reinstall the old make up mirror that is rusted from top to bottom on one side? The continental breakfast, we had read about and knew it was not elaborate was a disappointment. One morning we overheard an older gentleman complain about the toaster that was broken and in need of replacement to be told, and I quote " the owner did not want to replace it". Every customer, including myself had to try to use the bread tongues or a metal fork to poke down inside the toaster to retrieve your toast and it was almost impossible never mind the safety issues coming into play! The location is excellent, very safe and is surrounded by NYU campuses and a good central hotel for sight seeing. The employees were not overly friendly except for housekeeping. Not a great experience but not a bad one either! Just replace the toaster, improve the continental breakfast and replace the mattresses and smile more and you have a great hotel.

title: Ok
text: Great location and a hotel with history. Asked for a room change when we arrived as, there was no extractor in the bathroom and we could smell damp . We were very disappointed . We were moved to another room on the same floor which was much better. If you book this hotel , please ask for a room which doesn't face onto a brick wall. It didn't really mattter to us as we were out all day, but it would be good to have more light in the room. Breakfast was very basic. The only hot thing was drinks and anything which could go in the toaster. The breakfast area was very small indeed. Not qeven sure why the milk was not kept on the hot drinks table.

title: Excellent Downtown location on Washington Square
text: Lovely old downtown hotel with a history! But in need of a facelift! The hallways are dark and dreary, the room was clean, but our room smelled of old smoke. When we  asked about the smell, (even though there is a no smoking policy) we were told that our room could be changed, but there would be no window. Old naugahyde headboards and pictures of old movie stars was the decor of the room. Continental breakfast was included and the staff was friendly. With a little TLC to update it, this place could be wonderful as it is in walking distance to all the old and new places in downtown New York City and has easy subway access.

title: Loved it!
text: Loved the location close to subway and Washington square park! Requested quiet rooms and got them on high floors and a special birthday surprise in both rooms,  Thankyou! Hotel has a wonderful history and we loved it but if you want modern spotless anonymity it’s not for you! Ronnie was awesome and so helpful and wonderful with our kids, always with a smile! We were directed to express breakfast and I enquirer about gluten free options for my son and was told just the blueberry muffins, I was disappointed as I had checked website menu and it had gf toast and cereal too! The breakfast guy could have mentioned we could go to the full restaurant downstairs and get more there. My 12 year old ate a lot of blueberry muffins and fruit and we bought our own bread to toast! Maybe the guy in there needs lessons from Ronnie! The afternoon cookies and lemonade were really delicious too! Would not hesitate to recommend and would definitely stay there again!

title: Washington Square hotel is charming
text: Utterly charming beautifully renovated hotel in the heart of Greenwich Village. Fantastic staff. Warm greetings every time we walked into the lobby. Wonderful service. Lovely breakfast included. My favorite hotel in all of Manhattan.

title: Good Value
text: We paid nearly£1400 for 6 nights with Agodo and was expecting more than we got . We arrived and was given a room which was at the back of the hotel and not that clean. The brown carpets were depressing as hell and the room was fairly poor .We were massively disappointed so complained to reception who then changed our room for a better one. The room though was very dated and not that great when you consider the money spent but this is NewYork and we should of known that the usual standard we expect is probably north of three hundred dollars a night. The staff are good, the breakfast is a welcome bonus and we had some great food served by great staff. All receptionists were friendly , efficient and courteous . The door guys are very knowledgable and go out their way to help. The maintenance guy fixed our lock and was very competent and polite. The hotel is in a great location and I would recommend this if you’re looking for value, security and a friendly hotel team.

title: Excellent Stay!
text:
Have just returned from a five night stay at The Washington Square Hotel. The staff here are really friendly and always happy to help. Ron on front of house is a great asset and his knowledge of the local area was excellent. What a lovely person. Cheers Ron.
If you wish to experience the real culture of Greenwhich Village everything is on your door step, Jazz Clubs, music venues, cafes & bars. Subway near-by and easy to use. 
The Hotel is part of this areas history and culture and we would love to go back there in the future.

title: Honeymoon
text: Fabulous hotel. We had such a lovely time. The staff were brilliant especially Ronnie. Wonderful location with the park, restaurants and the subway just around the corner. We had a twin double bed room which only just fits 2 adults and a child but we didn't spend our holiday in our room!! It was kept clean and tidy with plenty of clean towels etc. Breakfast is continental and was always available. We used the restaurant sometimes for breakfast which was very good and made a change. The service was very good. I agree that some of the staff in the express breakfast area could improve their communication skills with the customers and each other. Front desk staff were very helpful especially when our flight home was cancelled. Excellent area and hotel for children. The park is great and a lovely place to play and chill out after a day of sightseeing.  No where is far to go or difficult to get to as bus and subway options are just around the corner and taxis are always available. We were never disturbed by noise inside or out and the beds were very comfortable. The room was small, the breakfast area is also small unless you use the restaurant but it's a lovely, friendly, clean, quirky and full of character hotel which we loved coming back to after a hard day's sightseeing! We highly recommend this hotel.

title: Cute and Comfortable
text: This was our first trip to NYC. I always wanted to stay in Greenwich village area and this is the perfect spot. The area was away from the hectic noise of Times Square. The hotel was clean, the room was cold during hot summer days, and breakfast was included. We will book this place again!

title: 2nd visit. Disappointed.
text: As much as I liked this hotel when I 1s visited it years ago, this time I was checked into another section of the hotel and it was so noisy.  room 229.  I can hear all the whereabout of the visitor above us, coming back at night late, walking around in his room, when he removed his shoes, and when he turns in his bed we could hear him... Our bed was cracking too!  In the middle of the night last night there was such a huge noise I thought it was the fire alarm and woke up my daughter, to realize it was only water from the flushed bathroom above, old pipes! People coming back late could be heard through doors.  The room is too small, It should be discounted.  Plus I believe we had access to more TV channels from Cancun Mexico than this hotel.  We had access to only a few channels. Very small room. I paid $1121 for 3 nights, 370$usd no view. We had a view on some corner roofs with ladder and windows.  We kept the curtain down all 3 days.  You get a better view in TimeSquare for that price.  I think they are too pricey. Nice breakfast continental set up.  I felt like if it was a different management.

title: Pleasant stay for Thanksgiving week-end
text: Great location and friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff.  Several good late night snacking and entertainment places within walking distance.  I would recommend Washington Square Hotel.  Subways within an easy walk.

title: nice staff, convenient location, small rooms
text: We stayed here when visiting my daughter in Greenwich Village.  It couldn't have been more convenient as it is right on Washington Square with other very nice buildings.  it is a nice area. .  The rooms are small as with most of the smaller NYC hotels.  The staff was very friendly.  our room had a tick layer of dust on the floor near the closet.  They offer breakfast if that is important for you.   It is across the street from Babbo, a fantastic NYC restaurant.

title: Very pleasant stay
text:
We are former NYC residents and we had to sleep in the city for just one night on our way to the west coast. As we used to live in the UES we decided to pick this hotel to try a different area and we are happy we did it! The hotel is in an old building but it is very well kept and clean. Our room was small but ok for one night, beds are comfortable and there is everything you need.
The complimentary breakfast is definitely a plus: there is not a huge choice but the quality of the products is definitely above average.
The staff is welcoming and the price is good for the area.
We couldn't ask for more

title: Great hotel!
text:
We stayed in a quad room for 6 nights - the room was small and a bit of a squash for 4 people, but it was perfectly clean and tidy. 

The location is perfect, close to west 4th subway which will pretty much get you anywhere, and lots of cafes, bars and restaurants in close walking distance. 

The staff were all really helpful and friendly- special shout out to our new friend Ronnie- he is an absolute LEGEND! Always made us feel so welcome and had lots of ideas for where to go and what to do. 

This was my 7th visit to NYC  and I’d absolutely choose this hotel for my future visits.

title: Hôtel idéal sans prétention
text:
Hôtel bien situé, calme et à l'atmosphère un peu désuète.
Personnel accueillant, parlant pour certains français.
Les couloirs nécessiteraient un petit rafraîchissement. La chambre familiale un peu petite mais correcte. Idem pour le petit-déjeuner.

title: luxe calme et  volupté
text: idéalement  situé  en  bordure  d'un  magnifique  parc  , cet  élégant  immeuble, abrite un  hôtel  ou règne  le  luxe le calme et  le  volupté  (  décor  art  deco, belles  chambres  d'un  très bon niveau  de confort, avec  de jolies  salles  de bains  et  produits  de beauté)  j étais  dans la  chambre  au    9  ème  étage  ( vue sur l'empire  states  building).petit  déjeuner    a dévorer et  consistant

title: Pleasant stay
text: We only stayed here one night before flying home.  Our room was clean, modern  and comfortable, although the corridors looked a bit tired and the breakfast was good enough to keep us full until we got on the plane. The hotel is well situated for excellent restaurants and the subway station. Staff were pleasant enough and we had no complaints.

title: Situation parfaite
text:
8 jours passés dans cet hôtel idéalement situé, proche des stations de métro et à 20mn de la plupart des lieux à visiter.

Chambres pas très spacieuses mais propres, l'hôtel a du charme et mériterait un petit coup de frais dans les parties communes.

Nous avions pris une offre avec petit déjeuner, le choix inclus à la cartr est très correct avec des produits frais (bagels, muffins, jus d'orange pressé etc...). Possible d'avoir en sus des choix copieux à la carte.

Personnels très agréables et à l'écoute,  seul un problème de tarif de transfert vers JFK pourtant confirmé par mail nous a un peu agacé...

En conclusion un rapport qualité prix plutôt bon dans ce quartier calme et agréable.

title: I would give it 10 starts if I could!!!
text: I travel the world. I was super impressed with this hotel. A staple of older NYC apartment building brilliantly transformed into a wonderful hotel. Across from Washington Square Park. All of the restaurants, clubs, places to see, people watching all right there. Clean rooms! Perfect location. Clean and well kept bathrooms. Hotel staff ALWAYS had a smile and a welcome for us whatever time of the night or morning we returned or left. The doorman or greeter (sorry cannot remember his name - shame on me) made the stay even better if that was possible. You are not going to get a skyscraper view. You get an authentic NYC Greenwich Village view from windows (which they are updating). I know I lived there 40-60 years ago! Continental Breakfast every morning,

title: Outstanding stay at Washington Square
text:
My wife and I just returned from  a 4 night stay at Washington Square Hotel and it was everything we could have asked for. The people there were awesome and professional. The room was small but clean and comfortable. The breakfast was nice and easily accessible. 

Nothing, however, can beat the location. In the heart of the village, across the street from Washington Square Park, close to subway stations with plenty of dining and bars nearby. You can't beat it!

I felt their rates were reasonable and the service outstanding. This was our first stay in the village, and I think this will be our base for all of our future visits to the city. We are already looking forward to going back.

title: Stale
text: I recently stayed at the WSH for the second time and unfortunately my time there was just like the first - abysmal. Shame on me. The rooms are small with a brick wall for a window view, the so called maître de is tired and sarcastic and annoying, the restaurant staff have no issues in scolding each other in front of patrons. The only good thing was the two gentlemen bartenders in the lounge; they gave wonderful service and were a joy to sit at the bar with and have a chat. 5 Stars for them, 2 for the hotel.

title: No hay justificación.
text:
La ubicación es perfecta, situado prácticamente al lado de la estación de metro Washington Square, donde paran un número importante de líneas permitiéndote desplazarte a cualquier punto de la ciudad.

El personal en su gran mayoría atento, profesional, amable y cercano.

La habitación era de vergüenza caracterizada por el olor a humedad y donde la limpieza y la ventilación dejaban mucho que desear. Las ventanas daban a un pequeño patio donde había una chimenea de cocina y multitud de aparatos de aire acondicionado. Si conseguías abrir las ventanas, el olor era irrespirable. Teníamos que elegir entre la peste a humedad de la habitación o los gases que entraban si abrías la ventana.

La limpieza dejaba mucho que desear, el baño está muy viejo y debería limpiarse más a fondo, además la bañera tenía cortina, que unido a la moqueta de la habitación daba sensación de suciedad.

El confort no era el adecuado ya que el colchón de matrimonio no ofrece toda la comodidad que debería, demasiado blando y transmite todos los movimientos de tu pareja.

A pesar de estar en la ciudad de New York, el precio no se corresponde con la calidad del alojamiento que ofrece este hotel.

title: Unique  location
text: We were visiting NYC for a wedding, and this was the hotel which the wedding party was staying. Location is everything and this hotel has it ,convenient to the wonderful Washington Square Park which you can visit to to relax and do some people watching. The hotel's location is also convenient to a  subway stop, so it's easy to grab a Subway and head out to tour NYC. This hotel is quiet ,but you do hear a good bit of Street noise from the windows however they are doing some upgrading of the windows to cut down on the street noise. the room in which we stayed was small but adequate the bathroom was wonderful the shower was excellent, the beds were comfortable as well. We stayed on the first floor and it was very convenient to the lobby. We have no complaints about the room. When staying at the hotel a continental breakfast is free, just off located just off the lobby. The hotel staff was very friendly the rooms were very clean. The hotel staff was also very forthcoming with ideas on what to see while in New York as well as locations to get good food. This hotels also has a history of many famous musicians and stars staying at this hotel. So stay in this unique , classy Hotel in a very quiet in neighborhood, you won't regret it

title: Fabulous position
text: Staff amazing. Breakfast lovely.  Clean and comfortable room.  Park beautiful across the road, which is rare in New York. Subway less than 150 meters.   Short walk to wonderful restaurants and shops.  Great atmosphere, very relaxing

title: Super hôtel pour visiter NYC
text:
Nous sommes restés 13 nuits dans cet hôtel très bien situé à deux pas d’une bouche de métro qui permet de circuler dans toute la Ville. Nous avons été très bien accueillis, la chambre était très propre, petite mais c’était largement suffisant pour le peu de temps passé dedans.
La salle de bain très propre également. Le petit déjeuner est assez simple, plutôt type français, petites viennoiseries, café, yogourt, céréales, confiture etc.
Nous recommandons cet hôtel à tous les couples venant visiter NYC et ayant besoin de tranquillité le soir pour dormir. Le Quartier est super chouette, calme et il y a pas mal de petits restaurants a proximité !

À refaire 😊

title: very friendly and comfortable place to stay...
text: So you cannot beat the location. Just in the heart of Chelsea.... We booked two rooms one with two single beds and one with a queen. The bed was amazingly comfortable and the room quite large for a manhattan boutique hotel. The room with the two single beds had a huge shower with multiple settings and very upscale... our room was well appointed. The Televisions were a bit small... but you do not go to NYC to watch tv! (Sound like my mother!) We arrived early and one of the rooms was ready, so we put all of our luggage in there and did our thing. We checked into the second room late that night and everything was perfect... the complimentary continental breakfast was nice... simple but nice. The staff was amazingly friendly... and when we left our luggage the next day they held it until 11pm with not a mention of how late it was. We would go back and we would recommend it to anyone wanting to be in the heart of Chelsea!

title: Great location, Relation price/quality is ok, but need improves!
text:
If you took out Ronnie and Priscilla (people from front desk was ok too), all others need to take a course to know how to serve and how to deal with customers.
Serving customers with caps is unacceptable! The sympathy and availability to the customer doesn´t exist! And the breakfast service was too slow... only when Priscilla was there the service were up to the standarts. You can not serve the customer in a diferent way having the tips expectation as a gold!
The breakfast itself was ok, but if you want eggs, pancakes, and other stuff like that prepare to pay...it´s not included in the free breakfast.
The cleanliness of the room was poor too. Lots of hair left in the bathroom and the bath tub rail... it´s better not even talk about it! The bathroom was old and needs quick update.
Location is excellent, but you need to update the hotel quickly. I know it´s a "Kitch" hotel and you you want to keep that "Kitch aurea", but you can update the hotel keeping that aurea.
Overall, the relation price/quality is ok, but need improves in lots of areas fast!

title: Mauvais rapport qualité/prix. Hôtel à rénover.
text:
C'est suite à un séjour de 8 nuits que je souhaite laisser un commentaire concernant mon expérience au Washington square hôtel. C'est sur base de la note élevée de 4/5 sur tripadvisor et de 8,6/10 sur booking que j'ai réservé une chambre.

Hormis la façade en rénovation, ce qui est monnaie courante à NY, la première impression fut bonne. Le réceptionniste était agréable, le hall d'entrée conforme aux photos sur internet. Vint ensuite la désillusion : la chambre d'hôtel. Bien que de taille correcte, avec une salle de bain tout autant convenable, séjourner dans cette chambre nuit après nuit fut une épreuve à elle seule. Le premier bémol vient du tapis apposé au sol. Il est vieux, dégage une odeur extrêmement nauséabonde, et n'est de toute évidence jamais nettoyé comme en témoignait un morceau de céréale sur le sol présent de notre arrivée à notre jour de départ.

Le deuxième problème vient de l aération, qui était tellement mauvaise que le lit tout comme nos affaires étaient moites. En témoignent des feuilles de papiers tellement humides qu'elles ont filé à la poubelle. On fait mieux pour dormir dans de bonnes conditions. Nous avons également dû faire face à un bruit constant, comme celui d'un frigo allumé. Peut être est-ce le cas dans tous les hôtels à NY, mais je n'ai pas pour habitude de devoir mettre des bouchons d'oreille quand je séjourne à l'hôtel.

Vient ensuite le problème de propreté globale de la chambre et de la salle de bain. Outre le tapis jamais aspiré, la salle de bain n'a pas eu droit à un meilleur traitement et était tout aussi sale, comme les cheveux que nous avons dû nous même ramasser faute de nettoyage. Je ne considère pas les femmes de ménage comme des bonniches, mais il me semble tout de même normal de passer un petit coup de serpillière dans les chambres dont vous avez la responsabilité. 

Autre problème : la propreté des essuies et des draps. Tâchés, et au look pas frais, ils ne vous donnaient pas l'envie de vous essuyer ou de dormir. L expérience m'apprendra à ne plus jamais aller à l'hôtel sans mes essuies, à défaut de pouvoir prendre mes draps également. 

Dernière déception : le petit déjeuner. L'offre est extrêmement limitée, encore plus si vous y aller trop tard, les produits n'étant pas renouvelés. Ainsi, à 10h, vous n'aurez par exemple plus de croissant - seule gaîté du déjeuner - ni de banane.

Je terminerai ce commentaire par le positif; la localisation de l hotel ainsi que le personnel. L'hôtel est très central, situé à côté de deux stations de métro qui permettent de faire quasi tout NY. Un chouette parc est situé à proximité et les environs plus calmes permettent de se reposer un peu du centre bouillonnant de times square. Quant au personnel de la réception, nous n'avons rien à redire. Tous étaient très serviables et gentils, spécialement Ronnie, toujours souriant et disponible. 

En conclusion, je ne mettrais qu une note de 5/10, pour un hôtel qui mériterait une rénovation totale de ses chambres.

title: Charming spot in a great neighborhood
text: This is one of our Go-to hotels when in NYC.   Right across from Washington Square Park, it provides a peaceful place away from the noise of Midtown Manhattan.   Put your walking shoes on and you can go anywhere (but our favorite trek is to Nolita and Soho).   Be sure to stop at Rocco's on Bleecker for a pastry and cappuccino.

title: Superbe séjour de 9 nuits
text:
Nous avons passés un séjour de 9 nuits au sein de cet hôtel en mars 2017. J'avais oublié de mettre un avis à notre retour, mais je n'ai pas oublié ce charmant hôtel. 

Tout d'abord la situation dans Manhattan nous paraît parfaite : le quartier a une vraie vie de quartier, les immeubles sont à "taille humaine" (toute proportion gardée), les clubs de jazz sont nombreux dans le secteur (le pur bonheur), un arrêt de métro se trouve à 50m de l'hôtel (il y a même 3 lignes de métro à proximité), et les restaurants aux alentours 4/5 minutes de marches sont abordables et corrects. 
De plus l'accueil de l'ensemble du personne était très bon, amical tout en restant professionnel, nous nous sommes sentis très bien accueillis. 
Les chambres sont petites, mais nous sommes à New York. Nous étions dans les étages supérieurs et donnions côté cour (la fenêtre donnait sur un mur). Cela ne nous a pas gêné car ainsi la chambre était au calme. Et oui à New York la vie / la ville / et donc le bruit ne s'arrêtent jamais. Donc pour revenir sur la taille de la chambre, en le lit prend toute la place, on doit être dans une chambre d'environ 9 mètres carrés. La literie étai très bonne. 
Nous n'avons pas testé le restaurant de l'hôtel mais il semble bien noté ! 
Pour le petit déjeuner, nous avions une formule "buffet" avec peu de choix, mais cela nous suffisait pour entamer notre journée ! C'était sympa de manger la petite salade de fruit tous les matins.
Bref je recommande cet hôtel principalement pour son emplacement, son personnel, et son calme !

title: Not bad
text: Stayed one night in this lovely B&B in the heart of North Beach. Very nice accommodations, small European style but nicely done. I got there just in time for the wine and cheese at 5, which was well done. Rather a minimalist continental breakfast, croissants,, boiled eggs, and toast with jam, but all fresh and tasty. Besides, there must be 30 restaurants in walking distance, mainly Italian but some nice bakeries as well. A very nice place to spend the night.

title: Great hotel with fantastic location!
text: We had a great stay at this hotel and found it to be a wonderful location for shopping in Soho and walking around Greenwich Village. It was very conveniently located to be able to take the subway to Dumbo. The area is really great, with the Comedy Cellar and Blue Note just a couple of blocks away. The rooms are very small with some of them having more recent renovations, but the main reason for staying here is the location and it’s very clean with great decor. The breakfast is included although limited, but very good.

title: Decent standard, good location
text: Easy reach from the Subway for all connections. Located just off Washington Square Park, close enough to all the local amenities including the bars and eateries of Bleecker Street. Also nice to be away from the immediate hustle and bustle of many other areas of the city, which helped make it more relaxing. Couple of nearby small supermarkets which were handy 5th and 6th Avenues were a short walk either side of the square too giving bus route options as well as the Subway. Check -in hassle free and welcoming, lovely decorative lobby area. Room practical and decent standard. Nice to have a good coffee machine and safe. One or two nice extra touches like slippers, umbrella if needed. As with the coffee making items the (quality local) toiletries were excellent and always replaced and well stocked each day. Really good room service each day though the wooden (effect?) floor could have done with a better clean now and then. Shower/bath good.  Impressed with the air-con system too when needed. Assume it was one the new systems which are gradually being installed but worked really well. Self-serve breakfast was fine near the lobby. Decent enough choice but if you maybe want a more leisurely breakfast time wise the other option in the downstairs restaurant was nicer.  Ronnie in the lobby gave us some genuinely helpful tips and always engaging with everyone. All the staff friendly and pleasant. Would definitely recommend and be happy to stay again in the future.

title: Not more than average
text:
Small building with small room and tiny restaurant which makes lots of things go a little different here. Service is ok of course.
We came with 3 ( as booked with Booking.com) where there is only place for 2. One single queen bed and nothing available to add a bed for the 3rd person. No mattress, needed to beg for a couple of winter sheets extra to create my own 3rd bed on the floor.... which makes you sleep far from ideal..
Breakfast is not a buffet but served once you order your toast. Kind of a la carte. You can get an egg but need to pay more which I think is a joke internationally speaking.
Would not go back to this place although location is quite good, close to blue ACE subway lines.
Do not expect a view from the room other than a brick wall.

title: Lovely
text: A really lovely hotel in a fantastic location. Walking distance to bars, diners and restaurants. Right next to Washington square park and 2 minutes walk away from West 4th Street subway station. The hotel staff were very helpful and polite. The style of the hotel and its rooms are quite dated but they are clean and comfortable. A great place to get your head down after a day of sightseeing. I would definitely stay here again.

title: A quiet hotel; great location
text: We had a wonderful stay at the WSH. The hotel was clean, quiet, comfortable and a perfect location for our needs. The location was next to Washington Square Park which was ideal for a quiet morning walk; convenient to the subway; close to shops, sites and wonderful restaurants. Highly recommend!!

title: Great Location
text: As a graduate of NYU I must have walked by this place 1000 times without noticing. Now, years later, it has provided me with a comfortable, restful, reasonably priced venue in the heart of the village. Staff was friendly and the Deco-ish room was clean. The free breakfast area got crowded early and the adjacent restaurant was convenient and adequate. Not five star in an area with tons of competition, but satisfactory nonetheless. Will probably stay here regularly now.

title: A good little hotel
text: This hotel is very well located, right between Washington Square Park and the subway. Everyone was very helpful and my room was great (231). I overlooked a ventilation shaft, and was at the end of the hallway, which for someone who needs a quiet room, was ideal. I had trouble getting the bill at breakfast, but everything else was smooth. The price is good for NYC.

title: Only hotel you want to stay in Greenwich Village
text: This small art deco hotel is a gem.  It is in Washington Square and convenient to many great music venues e.g. Village Vanguard and many great restaurants.  The front desk staff are professional, helpful, and knowledgeable. The rates include a continental breakfast with an array of choices.  The hotel is spotless.  All the staff from lobby attendant to housekeeping made my stay extraordinary.  After staying here you will not want to stay anywhere else in NY!!

title: Para quem quer fugir do stress de Manhattan e ficar no coração do West Village
text: Ótimo café da manha, recepção amigável e bem informada, quartos limpos de bom tamanho e com decoração moderna e ainda tem a avantagem de ter um jantar simpático, caso esteja sem opção. Além dos mais sua locação fica em frente ao parque histórico West Square, no coração do West Village, perto do East Village(onde se encontram os mais cotados restaurantes de custo médio da cidade) e do Soho( ainda o paraíso das compras) que podem ser cobertos a pé. O único se não que as estações de metro não são muito perto.

title: Great little hotel with character!
text: Found the hotel online and we were very pleased upon arrival. Even with our late arrival, we were greeted with smiling, helpful staff. Small room but it was very clean with everything we may have needed (slippers, robes, safe, umbrella, pod-style coffeemaker, great smelling toiletries). Also was quiet, considering we were in NYC. Great little continental breakfast with healthy options of fresh fruit and yogurt. The bellman on shift during our stay was so personable, helpful and made an effort to interact with not only us, but our daughter. As it is an old building, be prepared for narrow hallways and tight staircases. Would happily recommend!

title: Wonderful hotel and will return
text: Had an amazing stay at this hotel. The location was perfect for us, loved the village atmosphere and park. The staff at the hotel are so friendly and helpful, especially Ronny. He’s amazing and makes the guests feel special. Room was bigger than expected and the bathroom was large and up to date as well. Restaurant in the hotel was excellent as well. Nothing but good things to say!

title: Loved WSH!!
text:
We stayed at WSH while we were in NYC for the Belmont Stakes. We were a group of 4 and stayed in a 2 double bed deluxe room; it was a little tight, but it NYC and was very comfortable and worked well for us. The front desk was very helpful and quick to respond to an issue with our door lock. They also offered great suggestions and made us feel very welcome.

We had the complimentary breakfast each morning and were very happy with the offerings. 

The location is perfect, close to several subway lines and terrific areas to explore are very close by (east village, Greenwich village). Lots of great food and drinks nearby, as was a cvs. We all agreed this is our fav hotel and location in NYC, we will not look elsewhere for return trips!

title: Good small & Quaint hotel
text: Small and Quaint.  Right next to NYU, Wash Sq Park and close to the Salgamundi club. Small rooms and very quiet cause we didn’t hear the traffic at all. Air worked fine and hot water came quickly.  Fit our needs easily.

title: WSH has Location and Modern Style
text:
This review follows our second stay at the Washington Square Hotel in NYC.  We returned because our first experience was excellent, and our second was equally as good.

Located in Greenwich Village, the WSH has ample eateries and shopping nearby.  Being a boutique-style hotel, it has the necessities you would expect from a good hotel, but smaller rooms.  However, if location and a good night sleep is what you are looking for, then this hotel would be a good choice.  The staff are always courteous and helpful (from front desk to concierge and kitchen staff).  Across the street is the Washington Square Park, which is great for a walk. 

NOTE: there is no parking at the hotel.  However, a short 2 block walk provides the closest parking garage ($50-60 for 24 hrs, at this writing).  Also, if the reason for your visit is a Broadway show, expect to cab ($7.50, at this writing) or Uber to the show as it's a distant walk.

SUMMARY: Yes, we would return again (... next time).

title: Love this hotel
text: Have stayed in this hotel twice, albeit a number of years ago.  Great area to base yourself, small but nice rooms, lovely art deco lounge and a tasty breakfast.  Have looked to stay again and feel it has got a bit pricey, but would nevertheless if the opportunity arises.

title: 1st trip to the big apple
text:
This is a great location to stay, the staff were very helpful and friendly, it was away from the hustle and bustle of uptown.  With it being central with the use of the subway, nowhere was too hard to get to, there is a stop at the end of the steet.
There are plenty of bars, restaurants , food carts, deli’s right on the door step, the park is just across the street.
Would we return?
Yes we would 👌🏼
Thanks

title: Great stay, great location, great staff, great breakfast.
text:
My wife and I stayed here for 6 days. The location is perfect. We had several options, took this one and didn't regret it. The room was spacious, bathroom clean, and we had a breakfast included. Breakfast was very nice, at the hotel restaurant which accommodates external diners as well.

They had a little misunderstanding when we checked-in which they quickly sorted out. The staff was very helpful, always welcoming and cheerful, gave us tips about where to go and what the quickest way is, they were exceptional.

When checking out and heading to the airport, I recommend asking for their help. They got us a reliable ride for a good price. The rate is not cheap but this hotel is worth every penny.

title: Fantastic Location, Great Vibe
text: In a city filled with mostly fungible hotels, WSH stands as one of the few unique options which, itself, can shape a visitor's NYC experience.  Located in the heart of Greenwich Village, across from Washington Square, this place is really part of the wonderful web of an amazing neighborhood.  Don't stay here if you are looking for a large or more than acceptable, comfortable room.  Stay here if you want to be part of the Village, receive great service from great staff and rub elbows with an interesting, international group of guests.

title: Vacanze a New York
text:
L'hotel si trova in uno dei migliori quartieri di Manhattan, Greenich village, ed è adiacente all'omonima piazza, ricca di verde e ben frequentata. Ottimamente posizionato per i collegamenti con le metropolitane e moltissimi ristoranti buoni e a buon prezzo nelle vicinanze.
La colazione è buona e abbondante, anche se purtroppo di tipo continentale. Se si vuole quella tipica americana occorre pagarla come extra ed è cara (si può arrivare anche a 30 dollari). La camera è sufficientemente ampia, confortevole e ben arredata. Bagno sufficientemente spazioso e pulito. C'è la cassaforte ma non il frigobar. Vista pessima però: la finestra della mia stanza (n. 608) da sul muro di fronte che dista circa due/tre metri. Ma poichè a me non interessava la vista considerato che eravamo sempre in giro.. non l'ho considerato come elemento rilevante. Le camere con vista sulla piazza costano di più. Nel complesso soddisfatto e se non trovo offerte migliori ci tornerò.

title: Love this park!
text: This beautiful park accommodates folks who want to sit, read, people watch, and those who enjoy street entertainment - music, art, comedy. Along with the smaller replica of the L’Arc de Triomphe in Paris, there is a large fountain, walking paths and many benches. The park is adjacent to NYU so there are always young people about. Nearby are mostly older venues to buy food or eat in. We love the Washington Square Hotel too!

title: Great location and excellent service
text:
Stayed here for our final night of US road trip holiday 
It is in the heart of Greenwich Village so could not be beaten for location. The park is over the road and is alive with activities.
Staff were very friendly and booked us a car for trip to JFK which was actually cheaper than a yellow cab!
Comfortable room in a hotel which oozes history.
Nice breakfast is served until 11:00. 
All in all an excellent choice

title: Situation exceptionnelle dans Manhattan
text:
Passé 9 nuits en juin . Très bon accueil du personnel aux petits soins. Chambre au 9e étage coté cour. Très calme. Chambre confortable, très bonne literie. Restaurant proposant une cuisine recherchée et pour le petit déjeuner, pas de buffet mais un service à la carte avec beaucoup de serveurs, un grand plus. La situation géographique est excellente dans Manhattan avec 3 lignes de métro à proximité.
Saviez vous que Bob Dylan et Joan Baez y ont séjourné dans les années 60 et que c'était le camp de base des Rolling Stones lors de leur première tournée US ?

title: Great Location/Expensive/Needs Work
text:
PROS:
1. The location. It is great for visiting NYU as it is walking distance to dorms and many NYU buildings. Close to many subway stations. Greenwich Village is a great area.
2. Friendly doorman.
3. Good response to the issues we had while staying there. Broken hair dryer was replaced right away and an in room hot water issue was fixed but not before I had a cold shower! An adjustment was needed in our room after a hotel wide hot water shut off. 

CONS:
1. EXTREMELY small room - maybe 2 feet on either side of a double bed and 3 ft from foot of the bed to the wall. Room and bathroom were dark and old. One tiny window that faced an outside wall in the room and one frosted window in the bathroom. Tiny TV.
2. Very limited seating in the lobby. This was a huge problem as we took the red eye from the west coast and arrived in the morning but our reserved room was not going to be ready until check in time. It would’ve been just fine to wait, but there was nowhere to sit. 
3. 8:30 am hammering, drilling, and loud talking in the room next door. It was a full blown construction zone. We checked out of WSH this day and in to another hotel that night.

Sadly, I will not stay here again. Prices here are outrageous for what you get. I just checked some dates in September and couldn’t believe my eyes! See picture. The full size room we stayed in looked nothing like the website picture.

title: Come a casa
text:
Hotel decó, decisamente vintage, ma pulitissimo e con un suo fascino. Personale gentilissimo e attento, hanno conquistato mia figlia con un regalino il primo giorno. La colazione è ricca e compresa nel ( già decisamente buono per NY e per la zona) prezzo. Durante il giorno bevande e biscottini sono disponibili   al bar. Chi desidera cenare in camera puó tranquillamente ordinare da fuori. Io portavo in albergo la pizza da Dominos e la mangiavo al bar. Nella mia stanza non c’era il frigo bar. 
Posizione stupenda in Washington Square, linea arancione e blu a due passi di numero, in pieno Village.
Il taxi per JFK è un servizio privato a 60$, su richiesta.
Il mio Hotel a NYC!!!!

title: Great location, very very nice hotel.
text: The WSH was a perfect location for a long weekend visit to the city. The hotel is comfortable and clean. The rooms have all one needs-although they are on the smallish side-expected in NYC. Rates are reasonable, breakfast included. A wonderful history to the hotel. Staff were lovely.  What more can you ask. I hope to come back in the fall.

title: Great location
text: The best part of this hotel was the great location and the super friendly staff. The rooms were small and in our case, not updated. Our family had another room with a newer bathroom. For NYC it’s a good value and again, great location

title: Fabulous hotel in great location
text: We have been to NYC a few times and always stayed in different areas. Loved it here the staff were very friendly and  the room was perfect size. Continental breakfast was included free and was perfect start to the day. Subway was basically at the end of the street so could get anywhere in the city from there. Right next to the park and lots of cafes and restaurants nearby. All in all a perfect location to explore the city.

title: Can't find anything bad to say...
text: My husband and I love NYC and like to stay somewhere different each visit. We will definitely be back to this hotel and cannot find anything negative to say! This was an anniversary trip and we booked a king executive room but on check-in were upgraded to the penthouse king which was awesome! Great views of the park and city - at night the Empire State Building was lit up so we loved that! The hotel is beautiful - yes it's old - but we loved the character and vibe. Our room was recently renovated and the bathroom was huge and brand new. Every single staff person we came into contact with was tremendous. Rodney especially was great at offering suggestions and recommendations each day. Subway is a block away so you can get anywhere you want in the city plus fabulous restaurants, bars and of course the Washington Square Park nearby. Continental breakfast at the hotel restaurant was great because you have the option to order other things on the menu or simply get the continental which was completely free. The location is the best because it's not in the hustle and bustle of midtown. With NYU close, lots of students and so many great things to see. We walked to SoHo, Flatiron District, the Highline and Chelsea Market as well as to our anniversary dinner at Tom Collichio's Craft restaurant. Can't say enough about our experience! Can't wait to go back!!

title: Great & Super Clean
text: Stayed on the 6th floor and felt right at home.  For NYC, the rooms are good size - about 3 feet clearance on one side of the bed, 4 feet on the other side and at the end of the bed.  The bathroom was an okay size too - it even had a tub.  It was very clean.  The towels were great as was the shower.  The shampoo and lotions are nice - they’re from the Bigelow pharmacy that’s nearby. This pharmacy makes its own line of scented things with lots of other scents - go check it out!  Also, Babbo restaurant is across the street (loved it) and Washington Square Park is out the front door.  One more thing - the doormen are awesome.  I’d stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Not bad
text: I like this hotel better than some of the other reviewers. It is true that the rooms were dated. Really dated. But I liked the old fashioned charm of the hotel. I really liked the lobby. More importantly to me, my daughter is a student at NYU, and this hotel is literally on campus. It’s less than a 5 minutes walk from many of the freshman dorms. Even if you are not visiting NYU, there is a ton to do and see I this neighborhood.

title: Igenkänd
text: Litet art deco hotel alldeles bredvid Washington Square Park. Lite små rum och badrum,men man är ju inte så mycket på hotellet. Väldigt sköna sängar, täcken och kuddar. Bra frukost. Utmärkt läge vid parken där det alltid händer något roligt. Ett utmärkt hotel att ladda batterierna på efter en dag på New Yorks sevärdheter. Trevligt med ett litet hotel där man blir igenkänd.

title: Great Room & Best Shower Ever!
text:
Okay, I have to state that I was with a group, and someone else paid for my room.  Had I been paying $300+ per night, I may have been more critical.  However, I'll start by saying that everything was great!  Our king room was spacious, and the bed was super comfortable.  The shower was amazing.  You'll definitely feel clean after a day of being in the City.  We enjoyed the Bigelow toiletries and in-room Keurig coffee pot.

The complimentary breakfast was excellent and very convenient.

Our group of 11 had dinner in the restaurant on Saturday evening, and the food and service were exceptional.

The location is wonderful.  It's a quick walk to the subway, and Washington Square Park is literally across the street.  We enjoyed having coffee and pastries on MacDougal Street in the evening.

People not familiar with NYC may find the street noise disturbing, but it's New York.  You'll have that anywhere.

title: Wonderful hotel in a great location.
text:
Stayed here with my son for 6 nights. It’s a great hotel with welcoming and helpful staff. Very close to the subway. Breakfast was very good, especially sitting in the restaurant downstairs where the service was excellent.
The room was small but completely adequate for our needs. Even had a bath tub and shower with hot water at all times.
The concierge was so friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again. It has a lot more character and charm than some other, larger NY hotels.

title: Good sized room, excellent location
text: Stayed 3 nights on business. An older hotel with some charm, the room was large. Rooms were well cleaned and bed comfortable. The desk staff and concierge very friendly. The seating in the lobby breakfast area was limited and the selection as well, but the sit-down service downstairs had more options if you have the time. The location is the biggest selling feature. My room had a window onto a wall, but fine.

title: NYU Graduation!
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights as we were attending our daughters graduation ceremony at NYU.
The hotel is in a great location. Perfect for our stay. The rooms are on the small side but having said that they are perfectly adequate.  The bathroom is large. 
Breakfast is included in the room cost which is a bonus.
Perfect location to explore the Village and lower side of Manhattan.
Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will be recommending to others.

title: Cozy Hotel in a Great Location
text: Although I've stayed at the hotel before, my most recent trip was to meet some friends who were visiting New York, and they were staying at the hotel.  As always, the hotel was comfortable, very clean, had great service, and a really good restaurant (great menu and reasonable prices).  My room this time was on the 9th floor with nice views of downtown and Washington Square Park. The location is convenient to everything in the village and just a few blocks from the 6th Avenue subway for trips uptown. It's a lovely hotel. Also, the friends i was visiting with  love the hotel.  They stay there whenever they're in New York.  Their room, with a king sized bed, was very large with a beautiful, roomy bathroom.

title: Super friendly staff and great location!
text: We stayed at the Washington Square Hotel last week for two nights during NYU graduation. We found the staff to be super welcoming and our room, while not swanky, was comfortable and fine. The continental breakfast was good as well. And as with all real estate, location, location, location, is absolutely perfect! I recommend!

title: Charming Hotel
text: This is a charming hotel right on Washington Square making it easy to get anywhere! The staff is attentive, room was clean and comfortable, service was excellent. The environment is beautiful with all the Art Deco. Good continental breakfast for those in a bit of a hurry, but also the option for full breakfast in restaurant.

title: Graduation at NYU
text: We recently stayed at the hotel to attend my daughter's graduation activities. This hotel is so wonderful and I always look forward to my stay. The staff is so friendly and accommodating.  The doormen are especially friendly when they greet you.  The rooms are always immaculate and I have never experienced any surprises.  Beds are so comfortable.  Toiletries supplied by the hotel smell wonderful.  The dinner we had at the hotel restaurant was worth 5 stars.  I would most definitely recommend this hotel if you like the personal touch and are tired of the huge impersonal chains.
