title: Motel or hotel?
text: Upon entering, the lobby looks sheek and gives you the idea that the rooms will follow. False advertising . We had a standard room on a lower floor and as soon as we walked in we got hit with a strong chemical smell. Seemed like it was coming from the bathroom and we had to air it out because it was so bad. Makes me wonder what they were cleaning that they had to drown it in bleach ? Not a good first impression. Room was small which was to be expected , however the bed was terrible. Rock solid. I’ve stayed at hotels all over the country and world and this was the absolute worst. Layout of the room was not thought out, bed rock hard, bathroom was stuck in a time warp and gave a creepy feel almost like you were in a prison or hospital? Very strange. Needs renovation . Definitely not worth the money. I almost didn’t want to shower because it looked so dingy. I wouldn’t stay here again if you paid me .  I should’ve taken pictures because the real room looked NOTHING even close to what they advertised . Happy to speak management if asked to further discuss especially regarding the chemical smell because thats a health hazard and needs to be taken up with the cleaning crew. Moral of the story is, plenty of hotels in the city with similar price points, keep your sanity and stay elsewhere.

title: Atmosphere and Quality
text: I just stayed at the Washington Square Hotel for the second time and will do so again, during my frequent business trips to the City.  The atmosphere of the hotel is gives you the sense of taking a step back in time, to a NYC art nouveau building with character.  There is quality of  service, room amenities, and a free breakfast!  The staff make you realize that you are not staying at a large chain hotel, through their friendliness and warmth.  Highly recommend the hotel, but perhaps, not too much.  I want to make sure I can still find a room!

title: Great Staff
text:
The hotel is small and somewhat not like most modern hotels as it relates to amenities , look, features ect.  Buy for its price point and location it was ok. 

The rooms were small but comfortable and the beds are really comfortable. The staff are always willing to help and are always welcoming. I will definitely stay here again.

title: Great location
text: We had a great time here. The hotel is located opposite Washington Sq Park and close to subways. The staff were friendly and helpful and the bar and restaurant were excellent. The room was a little small and lacked adequate clothing storage which is important if you are staying for a few days but other features compensated.

title: Love this hotel
text:
I’ve stayed here 4 times.  My most recent visit was for three nights.   Location is superb.  Service is excellent.  Rooms recently renovated and well maintained. 

Now a little request of my fellow Trip Advisor viewers and reviewers.  Be courteous and tip appropriately the hard working and often minimally paid service staff that make your stay enjoyable.  If you can afford to stay at this hotel, you can afford to leave at least a couple of bucks each day, left on your unmade bed.   Tip the service staff in the restaurant, even if the breakfast is included in the room charge.   

These little things can make a better world and you’ll feel good knowing you helped those that helped you.

title: Posizione fantastica ma albergo caro, fatiscente e sporco
text: Abbiamo scelto l hotel per la posizione ma siamo rimasti delusi. Servizio inesistente ( neanche aprono la porta o salutano), caro (300 euro a notte con colazione misera, stanza minuscola e letto corto e in pendenza). Sporco. Da dimenticare

title: dans le village le plus in
text: Difficile de choisir un hotel à NY : il y en a tellement et dans tellement de quartiers avec plein d'avantages et inconvénients. On finit par s'y perdre. J'aime beaucoup cet hotel,  à l'atmosphère unique. Situé dans Greenwich, au coeur de cette atmosphère inégalée de Washington square, proche de tout mais dans un coin tranquille, l'hotel est parfait pour un couple que time square n'intéresse pas ou plus, ou pour les amoureux de NY qui ont déjà vu les grandes attractions. Les chambres sont belles et propres, décoration un peu vintage, tout y est.Salle de bain impéccable. Le petit déjeuner inclus est délicieux, le personnel serviable mais un peu anonyme. La cuisine du restaurant est délicieuse pour qui ne veut pas sortir ailleurs et le bar plutôt agréable. Le mélange de la clientèle de quartier et des clients européens font que c'est très cool.

title: Great location!
text: We have loved this hotel ever since our first stay in 2006 and have been back several times. In particular, the location at a corner of Washington Square Park, is a real plus, with access not only to the park (always something entertaining and interesting ongoing) but also fascinating and funky neighborhoods.  An easy walk, for example, to the Whitney Museum of American Art, and many, many very good restaurants. The hotel itself if of historical interest and the ambiance is art deco.  There is lovely tile work and accents throughout.  Rooms are small, as often the case in NYC, but well appointed. Rooms toward the back on the McDougal Street side may be a bit larger, and certainly quieter. And a real plus is the complimentary breakfast in the adjoining North Square restaurant. We've been very pleased over the years and will return.

title: 8 jours à New York
text:
Je recommande cet hôtel situé dans un quartier très agréable à l'abri du bruit .
La chambre était très confortable ainsi que la salle de bain. L'accueil est très satisfaisant
Le petit déjeuner du restaurant est extra
et copieux

title: Exceptional across-the-board
text: We had such an exceptional stay at the Washington Square hotel. I’m adventurous and love to try new things, so I almost never stay at the same hotel twice even if I had a good experience. But my husband and I will decidedly be back to New York City and agreed without a doubt to stay at the Washington Square hotel again when we return. Your staff was above and beyond kind to us. They held our bags on several occasions, noticed when I had coffee in my hand and ran to open the front doors for me, constantly greeted us with warm welcome, and were just exceptional across the board. Thank you for making us feel so at home. I will strongly recommend this hotel to all of my friends.

title: Great Location for NYU!
text: My son and I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel while visiting NYU for an admitted student event. The hotel is a right on campus - a perfect location.  Our room was clean, roomy and the beds were extremely comfortable. The hotel was incredibly quiet at night due to the residential neighborhood.  For some reason, we had no shower curtain, but the front desk resolved the issue quickly.  Breakfast was adequate and the staff was friendly.  The subway stop back to Penn Station was just down the street.

title: Bon emplacement excellent rapport qualité prix
text:
Nous souhaitions un hôtel calme dans Greenwich village. Le WSH correspond bien à cela. Un hôtel un peu dans son jus mais très confortable, les chambres sont grandes, ainsi que la salle de bain
Le petit dej est correct et complet 
Le personnel est assez efface mais gentil

title: Grade A Awesome
text: Can’t say enough good things about this place. Everything was just perfect. Highly recommend if you want to escape the sterile environments of midtown. Restaurant is pretty good too. Will definitely be back again. Shout out to the staff for taking care of us.

title: My first NYC trip
text: Great place to stay. Great location, easy subway access, easy walking distance to many sites. Rooms were clean, well stocked, irons, hair dryers, umbrellas, safes, slippers and robes. Nice bedding and towels. Staff were friendly, professional and efficient. Ronnie made us feel so welcomed .

title: Friendly staff, clean hotel, bigger rooms than I expected
text: The sheets were fresh, the soaps were fragrant, the room was clean, and the best thing of all is the staff at the WSH.  Ronnie, one of the Door Men, took great care of our mothers as they stepped from cabs and into the hotel.  Ronnie treated these two women like royalty.  The hotel is on one edge of the lovely Washington Square Park - I never heard any noise from the park, though.  The complimentary continental breakfast is SO GOOD, especially liked the homemade muffins and blueberry yogurt.  Would stay again if Greenwich Village is my destination!!

title: If you could take this hotel on your travels you would.
text:
Our first time at this hotel and it had pretty much everything. Situated in Greenwich Village on the corner of Washington Square it boasts many famous guests - too many to list here. 

The rooms are clean and well serviced - with ironing board, safe, bath robes etc. We had a Queen room in April for $212 plus taxes a night which included breakfast. There is a restaurant in the evening and a small bar, as well as coffee lounge free for guests. It is surprisingly quiet roundabouts so sleep arrives easily and stays the night. (Only one criticism for me which is common to many mid-priced hotels is door closing late at night and early morning. Surely a polite reminder is not too much to expect)

Star turn in the lobby is Ronnie who knows pretty much everything about the area and delivers information at quick fire speed and with smiling charm all his own. 

Check out the square itself for improv entertainments and some fine music. Our favourite pub was the Half Pint - lively and noisy but fun. Jazz spot was the Blue Note. Eating and evening jazz is Arturo's (our definite favourite ) 

A great hotel in a great spot in a great town.

title: Good and not so good
text: There was a lot about WSH that we liked but also some significant drawbacks.  Location was perfect since we were visiting NYU - can’t be beat. The free breakfast was very nice and of high quality. Room was clean and bathroom was large.  However we didn’t sleep well due to small room and beds, location on first floor resulted in a lot of traffic noise, and difficulty controlling the room temperature.  If visiting NYU, its a great choice. If using as a base to explore NYC, I would choose another hotel.

title: Incompetent staff
text: I stayed here a couple years ago and had a terrible encounter with (who I believe was) the manager at the front desk. She was shrill and rude, and often interrupted the few conversations we had. I am writing this review late because a friend told me he stayed there recently and was made aware that there are many dishonest people who work there in terms of how they handle your money. I would be careful and double check all your statements, etc. The only good thing was at the time when I made my reservation, the lady who I spoke with was nice and accommodating. Just stay away and don't stay here!

title: A great hotel!
text:
This was my 5th visit to NYC, having stayed in a different hotel each time. This time I stayed for 5 nights in a Double Bed Superior room in the Washington Square Hotel. I arrived around 1am and was received by helpful, friendly and informative staff who made the check in process a breeze.

The room and bathroom was well equipped, comfortable, clean and with an extremely comfortable bed. The window was small and only provided a view of an interior lift shaft but this wasn’t an issue for me as I wasn’t planning on spending much time in the room and I knew when booking that the Superior rooms only have a partial or interior view from the window. If you want a Village or Park view then choose the Deluxe room or better....in my opinion not necessary as it is easy to walk outside and enjoy Washington Square.

The express breakfast was self service with coffee/tea, orange juice, yoghurt, granola, toast, muffins, croissants and fruit available to select eat in or take away. It was included in the room price and ideal for starting the day.

The hotel is perfectly located for enjoying Washington Square and Greenwich Village with a subway station just around the corner. On previous visits I have stayed in hotels North of Central Park and around Times Square....this is the best located thus far as it is within the Greenwich Village area and close to NYU and with a large number of delis, coffee shops, restaurants and bars within easy walking distance. 

I throughly enjoyed my stay here and would recommend the hotel for tourists and those travelling on business. When I return to NYC there will be no need for me to look around for a hotel as I will again be booking the Washington Square Hotel!

title: Third time also a charm
text: We were in room 224 again. We like low floors. This had a view of the park and a window that opens. This hotel has a very nice self-serve continental breakfast. Our room looked updated. The only funny thing is the labyrinthine halls, but we figured it out quickly. The dog runs in the park are a hoot.

title: Great part of town, average hotel.
text: A reasonable price for a good location.  Rooms, common areas, and staff are all just a little bit off from what you expect in most hotels in the city.  From here you can get to lots of great parks, restaurants, and shopping.

title: Great place to stay when touring NYU
text: We loved the Washington Square Hotel! The staff was very friendly and helpful, our room was clean, and the shower was very nice and updated. The continental breakfast was yummy. Our room had a beautiful view of Washington Square park. Great boutique hotel in a perfect location!

title: Good location and helpful staff
text: Very good location - subway within a minute's walk. Clean and tidy room, comfortable bed. Perhaps slightly more luggage space might help, but not bad by local standards. Free breakfast buffet helpful - coffee / pastries etc. Front desk staff were pleasant, helpful and friendly. Would return.

title: NYC Business and Pleasure
text: Excellent location, with wonderful care and cleanliness. The hotel is spectacular with a great breakfast and front desk help. I will be staying here again and again as I travel to NYC in future years. Close to everything in lower Manhattan and next to a subway line.

title: Good Value
text: First time travellers to New York invariably choose to stay midtown to enjoy the brashness of times square.My friends and i decided on Greenwich Village because of its ambience and amenities such as restaurants and fascinating bars and shops.The Washington Square hotel is perfectly located next to an entrance to Washington Square Park.As in the case of virtually all New York Hotels the rooms are small,however they are nicely done out with attractive bathrooms the restaurant and bar area are very appealing and the staff are just terrific.On my next trip to New York i would certainly choose this hotel.

title: Comfortable hotel, right next to NYU
text: I've stayed at this hotel a few times when visiting NYU.  The location is terrific for access to the university -- couldn't be closer!  Tons of restaurants in the area, especially just south of the Square.  Rooms are comfortable if not a little small, but that is typical for NYC.  Bathrooms are large compared to the rooms, with good water pressure.  Breakfast is included; it's good, if not a little on the light side, especially if you are there for a few days.  Overall, though, I will definitely keep returning.

title: Tired, good price, nice location
text: I recently stayed 3 nights in this hotel. It is an uninspired and tired place. But it's in a nice neighborhood and the price is right. A continental breakfast comes with a reservation. Rooms are serviceable, desk staff are friendly.

title: Built in 1902 & just as elegant today, Friendly Staff
text: The WSH is a fantastic place to stay whilst in NYC. In the middle of Greenwich Village on Washington Square Park. The decor is beautiful throughout the hotel. All arranged by the current owner's family. The uniquely decorated tiled walls with such beautiful pictures. Each room has large black & white pictures of the stars of the 30's/40's/50's. Every member of staff were really helpful & friendly. They could not do enough for Philippa & I. Our room, 220 1st floor was more than large enough, very clean & comfortable. The house keeping staff made sure it stayed that way during our 5 night stay (Thank you). Continental breakfast was perfect for us (cooked breakfast was also available at cost if needed). A variety of cereals, toast, bagels, fresh fruit, yoghurt, muffins & cheeses, fresh juice, tea's & coffee. Either in the North Square restaurant or  a smaller self service dining area. We ate Sunday Jazz Brunch in the NSR. It was perfect. The band were brilliant. The restaurant has a huge vase of freshly cut flowers to enjoy each day. The WSH is ideally located for the best jazz clubs & some very good restaurants. We visited the Blue Note & The Village Vanguard Clubs. Only minutes walk away. By the way only a few years ago, a young waitress who served Sunday Brunch in the North Square Restaurant, offered a CD of her music to the management, they liked it and offered her a gig or two on Sundays.... It was Nora Jones... Well done WSH. Whilst in the area you must visit McSorley's Old Ale House. Have a Liverwurst, onion & mustard sandwich, with light or/& dark ale. Also Arts & Crafts Beer Parlour & have a hot pretzel with beer cheese dip (you wont get it anywhere else).We ate in other local restaurants, Malay food so authentic & delicious, The  Rasa. Oh & The Meatball Shop is a must too. We walked the length of Central Park in the snow one day & took the metro upto Harlem & walked the length of 5th Avenue back down to Washington Square. We also took the metro to Brooklyn Bridge City Hall & walked over Brooklyn Bridge & had lunch in Brooklyn Heights. From the WSH the metro stations are just a short walk away. The WSH was perfect for us made that much more comfortable by all you lovely staff members, Thank you ALL.

title: Cozy hotel in fantastic location!
text: WSH is lovely. It is located in the village, easy walk to everything, yet situated in a quiet spot. The staff was friendly and warm and so accommodating! The room was clean and comfortable. We will definitely stay here again!

title: NYU visit
text:
My son and I arrived on a red eye from San Francisco to the hotel hours before check in. We were warmly received by the staff who held our bags for us and directed us to the complimentary breakfast in the lobby. The dining area was clean and lively while the bagels were fresh and coffee was hot.

We checked in after a school tour and lunch. Our room was clean and well appointed.  The beds were very comfortable and we slept well. The location is perfect for visiting NYU. The proximity to the subway station is also a plus. I would highly recommend staying here.

title: A perfect choice !
text: We came for a few days family tourism with my elederly mum and liked everything about this lovely boutique hotel : the location in a quiet street close to beautiful sites and well connected by subway, the rooms (small but confortable and well heated, great beds, nice shower), and above all the staff, who were all pleasant and helpful (special note for Leodi at the bar). Not overpriced. We strongy recommend !

title: Back for another great stay
text: We stayed here in November and liked it so well we came back for a four night stay visiting our daughter and grandson. This time we stayed in the Penthouse king. What a treat this is. The room is large with great views of the city including the Empire State Building and Washington Square Park. There is a comfortable king bed, a huge bathroom with walk in shower and a sitting area with table and two chairs. This will be our go to room for future visits. Staff are friendly and helpful. The included breakfast is yummy.

title: Wonderful stay and hope to return.
text: Very well situated, nice bistro, great concierge and overall extremely helpful staff.  Charming decor.  While family friendly, probably better suited to adults and older kids.  My adult daughter and I LOVED it.

title: Hotelito impecable en ubicación privilegiada
text: Un hotel perfecto, pequeño con atención personalizada y esmerada. Desayunos súper abundantes y habitaciones impecables pero pequeñas (como en todo Manhattan ) en la mejor zona: Greenwich Village. Cuando vuelva a NYC me hospedaré de nuevo aquí sin dudarlo!!! Viajamos en familia: mi marido mi nene de 5 años y yo en Octubre de 2017

title: NYC TRIP
text: I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel recently while I was attending an event at NYU School of Law.  The hotel's close proximity to NYU and all things Greenwich Village makes it ideal.  I had a King Room on the top floor and the room was newly renovated and very comfortable.  This hotel has heaps of old world charm and the staff was very friendly.  The only thing missing is a business center with a computer.  Even a small space in the reception area with a desk/computer would cover this base.  I hope management will consider adding something like this as I was in need of a computer/printer during my stay.  That's the only thing that was lacking.  Simply put, there's no place else I'd rather stay when visiting the Village.  Lovely all the way around.  I will be back again soon! Two thumbs way up!

title: Favorite NYC Hotel
text: We have stayed at the WSH a few times over the last year and a half.  It has become our "go to" NYC  hotel. The staff is wonderful--polite and helpful--and the accommodations are comfortable.  The hotel is family owned and operated, and it feels that way.  Small and cozy, with touches that make a difference.  On the last visit (Jan. 25-29, 2018), there were hot apple cider and fresh baked chocolate chips cookies in the lobby lounge in the afternoon--just what was needed after trudging around on a cold January day. We stayed at the WSH during Christmas week (2016), and had a wonderful experience, too. Breakfast at North Square Restaurant or in the lobby lounge is included and substantial. In addition, ala carte items on the breakfast menu are very reasonably priced.  Restaurant staff is wonderful, too. The North Square lounge is a cozy little gem--with a great wine selection and a fantastic happy hour with unbeatable prices on substantial appetizers and drinks.  During our last stay we had a double room on of the interior the building--which was very quiet, with a comfortable bed and nice strong shower.  Bigelow toiletries, plush robes and slippers, and a Keurig coffee maker are provided, too. We have stayed on the ground floor, facing the street--in June (2017) and had zero problems with street noise.  Location cannot be beat.  Right on beautiful Washington Square in the heart of NYU/Greenwich Village--conveniently located near a bunch of train lines. Can't say enough good things about the WSH!

title: Great location in Chelsea and Soho-area
text:
What an excellent hotel! We are staying for 4 days, but the location of this hotel is perfect for the lower part of Manhattan. 
The full breakfast in the basement of the hotel is really nice, and the service is good. The rooms are clean and has everything you need. The gym is ok. 
The staff at the front desk are polite and nice. Would definitely come back. Great value!!

title: Posizione ideale
text: Hotel vintage ma un classico a nyc. Camere standard comunque spaziose e con un bel bagno. La nostra aveva vista sul retro ma non ha influito molto visto che praticamente rientravamo solo per dormire. Colazione inclusa, cosa assai rara, e piacevole e ben descritta in altre recensioni. La posizione dell'hotel è davvero fantastica per chi desidera fare lunghe passeggiate su e giù per Manhattan. Il prezzo è davvero competitivo. Consigliato per chi non cerca un hotel moderno in una zona perfetta per visitare la città.

title: A Nice Friendly Place in the Heart of the Village!
text: I love this place! Have stayed here numerous times in the last 5 years. A very European style hotel that's comfortable, clean and friendly. You walk out the front door into the heart of the Village. Can't say enough about the place.

title: Lovely and friendly
text: We spent a night at the Washington Square Hotel earlier this week. It was ideally situated for our visit to the NYU campus and surrounding area. The lobby is cheerful and the desk staff were very friendly. Our room was compact but comfortable. True to most properties of this vintage the bathroom was not spacious but had the essentials we needed. I'd pick different colors for the decor but we weren't living in our room, merely sleeping there. The happy hour and complimentary continental breakfast in the restaurant were a nice touch. The most striking aspect of our stay was the staff. They couldn't have been more helpful or cheerful They really seemed to enjoy serving the guests. We'd go back in a heartbeat!

title: Love this place
text: A cozy hotel with lots of history. Attentive and sincerely friendly staff. Great location...just steps away from Washington Square Park, many restaurants, shops and bars. Several subway stops within walking distance.

title: Will Stay Here Again
text: This hotel is in a great location in the Village. The staff is friendly and helpful. When I needed a couple of things for the room, they were delivered in about 5 minutes.  They have a continental breakfast with coffee, OJ, fruit and yogurt and offer fresh baked chocolate chip cookies during the day. The room was clean with plenty of storage. A great experience.

title: Great location and staff. Old but nice.
text:
Washington Square Hotel is an old hotel, so if boutique hotels are your thing don't bother. Besides that, everything else is nice. The staff is very friendly and are always willing to help. Ronnie Jenkins, the doorman, is a character!
We got a simple queen bed room and it was more than enought for us. Despite being old, everything seemed to work fine.
Continental breakfast is...well, you know. Don't expect much. Few but good option.
Location is great if you like lower Manhattan! Me and my wife HATE Times Square, Midtown, etc, so this is a nice place to stay, close to SoHo, Village, etc. Lots of great restaurantes, fewer crazy people walking around, nice parks.
I recommend. Gave it 3 stars but it is not average, I'd say it's "good".

title: Quaint and reasonably priced hotel in a great part of Manhattan.
text: I liked this place. There is no such thing as a cheap Manhattan Hotel, but this was reasonably priced. The staff are charming and helpful and the location is magic. One complaint only - the mattresses seem to be very hot! Are they latex or something that doesn't air? I felt like I had an electric blanket on, when I didn't.

title: NEW YORK
text: This was a very dissapointing Hotel in that the room we were in and I believe those rooms available to booking agents was extremly small and the view out of the window was a brick wall ony 1m away. To see what the weather was like we had to go outside the front door of the hotel. Situation Good Breakfast Reasonable. I asked to pay for an upgrade but nothing available.

title: Ligt in een gezellige buurt.
text: Art Deco hotel, met in de kelder een prima restaurant.Park naast het hotel, waar toevallig een India festival plaats vond.Op loopafstand van het meatpacking district.Dat is een hippe buurt met trendy eethuisjes in oude industriële panden.

title: Thank you!
text: Wonderful experience at the hotel while attending the Women in Dance Leadership Conference at NYU.  Very friendly and helpful staff, fabulous breakfasts and clean, airy room.  I love the ambiance and the Art Deco feel. Thank you!

title: Nice balance of spiced up with its old identity
text:
I used to live across the street from the Washington Square Hotel which no doubt biases my judgment. But i'd book it again and again.

Location comes first, but the remodeled hotel is actually pretty high quality, albeit with a lot of variation in rooms (some are very small). The bar and restaurant are both excellent. And hey! This is Greenwich Village! I really laughed at the Trip Adviser query about whether it offered a golf course!

What it offers is a decent place to stay in walking distance to the Blue Note (and a number of other things, though the neighborhood is increasingly just the NYU campus).

title: Quiet, clean, old-fashioned hotel on Washington Square
text: A quiet, clean, old-fashioned hotel with a wonderful location on Washington Square in the Village. Quick walk to the subway, cute local shops and restaurants. Room are reasonably sized for New York, staff are friendly and helpful, good (free) wifi, and continental breakfast included. If you're hungry and don't feel like going out, you can get a really good hot breakfast, or plan for dinner, in the downstairs restaurant, which is light and airy and full of flowers.

title: over priced closet size room
text: Very over priced with a room the size of a closet,an a closet almost non existent.The room was so hot had to leave door open for air,since the so called window was more of a crawl space ,than a window.The bathroom was beautiful,an wish they had used space for bedroom.The staff was very friendly .We felt that a room special as advertised was actually over priced to begin with. The room was very noisy at night .Great location tiny renovated room

title:
College visit Film
At 11
text: First , wonderful pleasant staff ready for our late arrival . Old school charm, dining room and breakfast alcove . Rooms has beds you could push together or pull apart . Literally 4?minutes to NYU. Hotel has been in movies before and favored by celebrities . Held bags for days, we came back and changed. Had Greer rates midweek January . Good for romantic , business , maybe small for families. Close to downtown can hit Chelsea Union Square TriBeCa 9/11 memorials, Chinatown , little Italy . Retail shopping and restaurants as well. Enjoy or as staff greeted us : Namaste

title: Тихий отель в тихом Манхэттене
text: Милый небольшой отель в тихом районе, удобен для пеших прогулок по Манхэттена, до Центрального парка примерно 1час неспешной хотьбы. Хорошая звукоизоляции, континентальный завтрак, в здании свой ресторан. Приветливый персонал, были в морозы - в номере было тепло, устойчивый интернет. Дали купон на 15% для следующей поездки.

title: Great stay at Washington Square Hotel
text:
Really lovely hotel, great restaurant, great location and very clean, warm and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again - thank you!

Would also recommend it to anyone who is looking for a "perfect" hotel.

title: Better than we expected
text: This hotel was better than we expected.  We typically stay at large hotels in the middle of midtown, but we were going to the Blue Note to see a show and the location was better for us -- and actually the whole experience was better for us!  The beds were comfortable, the rooms were quiet, staff was friendly and the location was perfect.  There is a part of me that doesn't want to let this little secret out, but I love NYC so much, having a little gem like this makes the visit so much more enjoyable.  Thanks Washington Square Hotel!!!!

title: Greenwich Boutique Hotel
text: Excellent location one block from the subway. Good breakfast included. Pfofessional staff. For the city and area fair prices. Great restaurants in the area. Easy to get to Broadway theaters via subway.

title: nella norma..
text: L'hotel non è modernissimo .la camera per gli standard di ny non è piccolissima e tutto sommato funzionale. buona la colazione. la struttura è collocata in una zona tranquilla e anche se non vicinissima a times square noi siamo arrivati ovunque a piedi ..

title: Struttura media, personale gentilissimo
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel da Natale a Capodanno. Albergo estremamente vintage. La camera da letto piccola per una coppia con bambino. Avendo aggiunto la culla, lo spazio per muoversi diventava minimo.
No frigo bar.
Pulizia ottima e cambio asciugamani giornaliero.
Colazione nella sala all’ingresso molto buona. Croissant,bagels, muffins, yogurt, cereali frutta e ogni sorta di bevanda ad eccezione dell’espresso italiano.
Unica pecca la temperatura interna non costante poiché è un locale senza porta di fronte all’ingresso. Per cui si passa da una buona temperatura al freddo.
Personale gentilissimo e molto disponibile.
Non dispongono di un servizio pick up ma sono disponibili a chiamare un taxi per voi qualora lo necessitiate 
Ottima posizione per raggiungere il centro

title: Sweetheart of a hotel
text:
We loved our stay at Washington Square Hotel. The art, decor and location make this the perfect spot from which to explore NYC. We especially enjoy the neighborhood feel of Greenwich Village.  All our best to you and we can’t wait to get back this spring. Give our regards to Ronnie.
David and Amy from NC

title: Another Love Letter To WSH
text: As massive gentrification continues to chip away at the last bits of character, spirit, and temperament that have made New York the most amazing city in the world, the Washington Square Hotel stands strong as a symbol for these traits.  If you yearn for a time when New York City was full of character and grit, you owe it to yourself to book your room at this hotel.  This was our second stay at WSH, and we can't imagine booking anywhere else.  The soulless tourists who desire cookie cutter, chain hotel charm can have Times Square, I won't go anywhere near it.  Staying at the Washington Square Hotel is like having your own small flat in the middle of the charming neighborhood that is Greenwich Village. Historic Washington Square Park is across the street and it's so quiet at night, you'd think you were in the country.   Moreover, a subway station one block away will carry you anywhere in the city.  Yes, the hotel is over 100 years old and the rooms are small, but they have been tastefully remodeled with excellent bathrooms. The Washington Square hotel oozes character!

title: Cosy Boutique Hotel
text: Stayed twice in month of December. A cosy family run boutique hotel. Staff is warm and hospitable. Rooms are not very big but then it’s New York. Location is best if you are visiting NYU and neighbouring Greenwich village area. Close to subway and several restaurants at walking distance. Will stay again.

title: Great small hotel on Washington Square
text: We liked this hotel a lot. The room was small but very clean and quiet. The location on the northwest corner of the square was great for walking around Greenwich Village. The hotel bistro served an excellent lunch.

title: NYC Christmas 2017
text: Great hotel, convenient and friendly staff. Excellent breakfast to start a busy day touring Holiday Markets. Close to transit, many restaurants and shops. Room spacious, bed comfortable. Closet small.

title: Centrally located boutique hotel
text: The hotel staff were very good, rooms were small but clean.  The subway stop is approximately 2 blocks away; Washington Square Park is across the street; the hotel is an easy 20 minute walk from Little Italy and Chinatown as well as SoHo.  NYU is all around the hotel.  A free cold breakfast is available in the lobby room.  Starbucks and Stumptown coffee places are around the corner from the hotel.  Mario Batali's Babbo restaurant is across the street.  Would recommend this hotel to travelers.

title: Great Hotel
text: This Hotel is fantastic. Located in the Village and near subways. The people are so nice and helpful. The rooms are adequate and the restaurant is superb. I highly recommend this Hotel. The prices are great and it is a boutique Hotel that is surrounded by great history of NYC

title: Wonderful Stay
text: Was unsure how we would feel about staying here as it’s not a chain hotel. We were very pleased. Location is fantastic for exploring New York. Being next to New York University created a college type atmosphere in the heart of NY City. We walked to restaurants and comedy club and felt very safe. Park was across Street and breakfast was so easy and cheap/free. Hotel is old but in pristine condition. Rooms are small but comfortable. For me and my wife it was just right. Really enjoyed staying at WSH, the staff were great. Would definitely return.

title: Ubicacion y servicio
text: Es una buena opcion si uno busca una opcion estrategica en Manhattan , algo mas alejada del bullicio del Midtown. Se trata de un hotel con historia, por lo tanto, algo viejo en su estructura y con habitaciones pequeñas. Se compensa con la ubicacion , ideal para explorar el sur de la isla a pie, a 5 min de SOHO Nolita W Village,etc, y por la calidez de atencion de su personal.

title: God beliggenhet, god pris
text: Jeg synes man får mye for pengene på dette hotellet. Beliggenheten er super, i en stille gate i et sentralt og hyggelig strøk. Rommet ok, wifi god, behagelig dusj. Betjeningen i resepsjonen er hyggelige og profesjonelle.

title: Highly recommend!
text: We stayed here for 6 nights and would absolutely recommend this hotel. Like all big cities, you pay a lot for a very small space but that's New York! We had a twin room; small but very clean and comfortable. Coffee in the room and free wifi. They offer a continental breakfast in the lobby which is a fantastic way to start the day; coffee, tea, bagels, fruit and yogurt. All of the staff were very nice and Ronny in particular is great with directions! What we really enjoyed was the neighbourhood; very relaxed and friendly. Washington Park across the street. Subway station down the street. Within walking distance to Chelsea market, Soho, Union Square, east village. Felt very safe walking at night.

title: Great location, Great staff, lovely room despite small size
text: We usually end up in Midown when we visit but this time opted for the less crowded and less hurried area in and around The Village and are so glad that we did. The Washington Square Hotel is in a great location, on a relatively quite street and easy walks to restaurants, etc. The staff (especially Ronald) were very friendly and helpful and clearly enjoy working there and know the area well. The room we had was down some narrow corridors but was perhaps the quietest room we have ever enjoyed in NYC; room was small (not unusual in NYC) but clean and comfortable with a nice bathroom and good shower; pillow choices and a pillow topped mattress that made for a good night's sleep. and that is why we all stay on hotels, motels, etc ...to get a nice night sleep. Washington Square met our needs and more, we shall return.

title: NYC Christmas
text:
Nice clean hotel but double room was small.  Staff was very friendly. 
Biggest complaint was that our room was very hot, finally had to turn the system totally off, couldn't even run the fan.  Complained 2 times about it.  Someone came to look at it and said that he would be back, don't know if he did because it was still hot with the system on 63, the lowest temp.
Complimentary breakfast was muffins, bagels, fruit, yogurt, cereal... OK.

title: Nice hotel, nice staff, nice location
text:
If you're looking for a place away from Midtown, this  is it. 
Really great staff. They mixed up our reservation, but got it straightened out in a few minutes. We had driven in to the  city, and were there on a Sunday. The concierge suggested we look for a parking spot on the street because  it's free on Sunday. We did, and saved $50. 
Ate at a private party in the Lounge. Food and service were excellent.

title: A must visit!
text:
Spent a good few hours just relaxing in the Park. So much to see and such a history to hear about.  A lady who knows about and promotes the Park kindly gave us a (free) comprehensive resume on the Park. She was obviously proud of the area, rightly so. 

A fine area to spend a relaxing time in, loads of artistry, artisans and such a fabulous place just to meander through. 

Take a seat and enjoy the ambiance. Don’t miss it.

title: Nice little hotel
text:
Location is central to NYU, the desk staff were helpful and knowledgeable about local restaurants and running routes.
The rooms were small but clean, bed was comfy.
I give them an average because I had 3 hiccups with them.
1) they mixed up our reservation, booking 1 room for 2 nights instead of 2 rooms for 1 night
2) when I did check out, they checked me out of the wrong room. They did quickly issue a refund.
3) A mysterious charge appeared on my card that they initially they had no record of. It took a few calls, but eventually it was 'found' and they issued a refund. 
Everyone was nice and tried to be helpful, but it was not the smoothest stay.

title: I just keep coming back
text: I have been staying at the Washington Square hotel for the past 12 year. Sometimes i even stay twice a year. I love coming back, it´s like a home away from home. The staff is super nice and welcoming, the rooms are clean and well looked after. And the location in the Village is the best. I can´t recommend this hotel enough. I just love It.

title: Great stay in the heart of Manhattan
text:
For this trip to NYC we wanted to stay in the Village. Choosing the Washington Square Hotel was definitely the right decision. 

Location is perfect. The neighborhood is really nice, with many many different places to grab a coffee or have dinner. The hotel is just next to Washington Square and close to public transportation.

It's a quiet, cozy boutique hotel with small but well-furnished rooms. All the personnel was really nice and helpful. We will definitely come back!

title: Great breakfast
text:
Stopped by as off the street customers (weren’t staying in the hotel), enjoyed all my breakfast, from the muffins to the coffee, to the bagels and the eggs McDougal. 

Would definitely recommend and return myself as well. Not too pricey either, $20 dollars for coffee, muffin, bagel and a couple of eggs with salmon on English muffins - cheap I say!!

title: Central Location
text:
The Washington Square Hotel was the perfect base for walking NYC.  We were a short distance from the 9/11 Memorial and Battery Park to the South and Equal distance to Time Square, The Plaza, and Broadway.  The Staff is courteous and kind.  

The local area is vibrant with plenty of shops and great restaurants.  We enjoyed the flare of Washington Square Park which provides plenty of free entertainment.  

Our room was a Deluxe Twin - perfect for my Aunt and me. 

We highly recommend this hotel.

title: Wonderful "Village" Experience
text: This 'boutique" hotel is great, we stayed here 4 nights. The location, "kiddie corner" from Washington Square is a great location. Staying in the "Village" is a real neighborhood experience. The staff was helpful and courteous. The room was clean and comfortable. We slept like babies in the queen bed. The TV is up high on the wall so it is easier to watch while laying in bed. There wasn't a view of anything but other buildings, but we did not expect a view. Breakfast was included in the price of the room if one stayed on the left side of the menu. We really liked the bartender, Salvatore, he is a wonderful mixologist. He made us a special drink on our last night there. There are lots of restaurants, bars and nightclubs within easy walking distance.

title: Localización TOP y desayuno incluido
text: Pasé una semana en el WSH, y la experiencia es más que positiva. Elegimos la opción de habitación con vistas, y menos mal; no escuchamos ningún ruido. El cuarto es pequeño pero suficiente (está bien para ser NY), y todo muy limpio. El personal muy amable y correcto, y el desayuno incluido es de carta, la mitad de la carta exactamente. Es cierto que los pancakes y los huevos no están incluidos, pero si quieres pedirlos no tienen un precio desorbitado. LO MEJOR, la localización. En 10 minutos estabas en pleno Soho, y al ser la zona de la NYU, está muy muy bien conectado por metro. Más que recomendable.

title: Hidden gem
text: I have stayed here on business many times. Cute, boutique hotel. It is an older hotel, so the rooms are small. It is not a luxury hotel. The location can't be beat - across from Washington Square Park Hotel and near many great restaurants.

title: Very nice hotel with excellent location
text: Washington Square Hotel is located next to the Washington Square Park and located in a calm area near NYU. There is an abundance of restaurants nearby. The subway is also nearby with several lines. The staff is very friendly and are a real plus for the hotel. The breakfast is included and quite nice. I can really recommend this hotel for "budget" stay in New York, IMO you get more than you pay for.

title: Det perfekte familiehotel i NYC
text: Hotellet ligger perfekt i et roligt hjørne af Washington Square. Tæt på subway, shopping og universitetskvarterets mange hyggelige restauranter. Værelserne er store og velholdte. Der er morgenmad i hotellets restaurant. Personalet er utrolig venlige og hjælpsomme. Vi kommer helt sikkert tilbage.

title: perfect location
text: we booked this hotel for our honeymoon in NYC. having been before i knew i wanted to stay somewhere around the village to be close to great bars, restaurants, activities etc. this hotel is a perfect location! close to a subway and within walking distance of east and west village, the highline, china town and little italy. the staff were always friendly and helpful and booked a car for us to go to the airport as well as helping us do the onling check in for our flights. the breakfast provided is all fresh and tasty with to-go coffee cups so you can set off into the city fully prepared. the rooms may seem a bit basic and dated if you are more used to modern hotels but they are very comfy, clean, and quiet. there were loads of families staying here too and i would recommend it for anyone coming to NYC looking for a great location, clean, comfy hotel with friendly staff and a bit of history about it.

title: I'll Never Stay Anywhere Else in NYC!
text: I've been to New York many times and had resigned myself to either staying somewhere inconvenient or having a room the size of a closet for around $300 a night.  But now I finally know that there is a place that is perfect for me and this is it.  It couldn't possibly be more convenient for all I like to do, and near many subway stops.  For about $250 a night we had what for any big city was a very large room.  There was a big closet and lots of drawers and shelves, really enough for two people's stuff for a week or more.  Great lighting, windows that open, a big bathroom with a bathtub as well as a shower, seating for two, nice decor, and a thermostat and heating that were accurate and worked well, good pillows and bedding, soft towels, nice toiletries.  The restaurant is good and the free breakfast was excellent.  Surprisingly it was very quiet, more so than our apartment in Portland. Oregon.  I never expected that in New York City!  The staff were very nice and Beverly made us feel at home.  One of the best hotels I've ever experienced!

title: Consigliatissimo
text: Appena tornato da 5 gg a New york, ho alloggiato al Washington Square Hotel. Bello, tenuto bene, pulito, stanze spaziose e silenziose. Chiedetene una ad un piano alto, se hanno disponibilità ve la daranno senza problemi come hanno fatto con noi dopo la prima notte in una stanza al primo piano. Posizione super, a 50 mt dalla metro in una zona bellissima, piena di verde, viva ma non caotica. Se volete la comodità e un posto tranquillo dove tornare la sera è il posto giusto. Certo non è economico ma d'altronde è in una delle zone più pregiate di Manhattan. Inoltre, aspetto da non sottovalutare, la colazione è inclusa (o almeno lo era nella nostra stanza) e sono almeno 20 dollari a testa al giorno risparmiati. Non aspettatevi la colazione "all'europea", non ci sono prodotti freschi, però è abbondante e varia (pane, cereali, yogurt, frutta, bagel, marmellate, ecc.) e si può scegliere se farla "self service" al bar o serviti nella sala ristorante. Personale cortese. Insomma se dovessi tornare a New York non avrei dubbi e lo sceglierei di nuovo.

title: Nice hotel in a great location
text:
The Washington Square Hotel is located in Greenwich Village, next to Washington Square and not far from a subway station. The hotel is located between 5th and 6th Avenue on Waverly Place in Lower Manhattan.  It is also close to the NYU campus and there appeared to be parents of staying here. The Washington Square Hotel has been home to writers, artists and visitors to Greenwich Village for more than a century. It was even home to Bob Dylan and Joan Baez back in the day (for a short time). 

I stayed here with my wife for 2 nights in mid-August and generally thought the hotel was nice and I loved its great location. Our room was small and came with an undersized queen sized bed. While every room was non-smoking I thought our room had a strange smell (kind of a wet towel like smell). The bathroom was not very modern and could have used a facelift (in addition it was small). The cost of the room was about $295 night plus about $45 in taxes. The hotel staff was very friendly and efficient and the doorman was really friendly.  They even let us check in early which was greatly appreciated since we arrived after an early morning flight.

Overall I thought the Washington Square Hotel was nice and I recommend it. I enjoyed staying in this neighborhood versus a less interesting neighborhood in mid-town. To make it even better the continental breakfast was pretty good and was included in the price of the room.  The best part of this hotel was the location since the room was nothing special. The art deco lobby was interesting and helps give this hotel a cooler vibe.

title: Excelente ubicación
text:
Es un acogedor hotel con habitaciones pequeñas pero muy bien decorado. El baño completamente remodelado y moderno. 
Buen desayuno.
La ubicación inmejorable, al lado de washington sqare, perfecta.
Volveré mi próxima vez en NY.

title: Beliggenhed i det skønneste kvarter med parken lige overfor. Gode og rummelige værelser med fin betjening
text:
Vi nød i den grad at besøge dette hotel. Dejlige store værelser i forhold til hvad vi før har prøvet i NY og Boston eks. Meget venlig betjening. Skøn morgen mad på hotellet .værelserne trænger nok  til et lift mht gulvtæpper og gardiner. Håndklædeskift hver dag 
Beliggenheden i top med Washington square park lige overfor. De omliggende  kvarterer er så hyggelige og fine arkitektoniske. Mange gode spisesteder i gåafstand .
Anbefalelses værdigt sted.

title: Disappointed in service
text:
I love the location of this hotel, but I was extremely disappointed by the service. Upon arrival we were told that the room would not be available before 3:00 pm, which is totally understandable - that's check-in time. I tried to distract my 5-month old baby until then. I called at 3:00 pm, and I was told it would be ready in 10 minutes, so I gave them 20 to be on the safe side, and arrived with my exhausted baby ready to go to our room, only to find that it wouldn't be ready until nearly 4 pm. Then I saw the crib. I had been assured days before booking that they had a good crib that they could place in the room. The attached photo doesn't show how terrible it was - tiny, with a mattress that wasn't really a mattress, hard as a rock, and with the "protection" all broken, so it was just a hazard to place a baby there. 
To finish up the stay, I had to get off work and go back to the hotel because they didn't pay attention when I asked them to swipe the credit card I was giving them upon check-in. They said they only had the one used when booking, the person at the front desk hadn't registered the new card. 
Except for only one guy, the ladies at the Reception desk were always in a hurry and not at all nice. Very poor experience.

title: Super beliggenhed, ok værelse
text:
Hotellet ligger perfekt til vores smag. Rigtig hyggeligt område, der er en blanding af NYU-universitetsstuderende og kreative mennesker omkring musik/spisestederne i Bleecker Street. Vores værelse var ganske fint og rent til prisen, men ikke mere end det.
Behageligt personale, der hilser med et smil og gerne hjælper med tips eller praktik.
Vi brugte ikke morgenmaden på hotellet, hvilket vi heller ikke vil anbefale, udvalget i nabolaget taget i betragtning.

title: Emplacement idéal
text: Cet hôtel est idéalement placé au coeur de Greenwich Village et tout près de NYU. L'hôtel a un certain charme et le personnel très serviable. Par contre les chambres sont vraiment petites. Le breakfast est assez moyen mais les options à proximité de manquent pas.

title: NYU campus visit
text: It is right in campus and at the corner of Washington Square Park so great location. The rooms are neat and clean and a nice size. Most of the staff is super friendly. They were not able to accommodate an kind of early check in though they said they would, took others in front of us. Also, you have to pay for use of the safe. Continental breakfast pastry was dry but coffee was good.

title: Perfect hotel in the perfect location
text: Our second stay at Washington Square Hotel was just as delightful as the first. The location is so convenient for many things we enjoy and the staff is beyond pleasant and helpful. Great space and we are planning another visit in the coming months.

title: Another wonderful stay at WSH!
text: We've just got back from NYC and another wonderful stay at the Washington Square Hotel. In a great location by the park with many good local eating places and local shops, yet with the convenience of nearby subway stations connecting you easily to the rest of the city.  The hotel staff are professional and friendly and nothing is too much trouble. A historic hotel that retains many art deco  features.  The rooms are clean with high quality mattresses and bed linen, plenty of complimentary toiletries and coffee machine. Will definitely stay again on my next New York trip.

title: Washington Square Hotel
text: This hotel has vintage charm mixed with modern amenities. Although not spacious, my room was squeaky clean with luxury linens and a comfortable bed. The location is fabulous, right on the famed Washington Square, and within walking distance of great restaurants, SoHo, and many other Greenwich Village attractions.

title: Great Location, clean, well maintained but slightly musty room, adequate breakfast, excellent restaurant, great location
text:
Located a short walk from several subway stations, in midst of NYU, very close to numerous late night food options typical around many college campuses. We felt safe walking the neighborhood at all hours, and the lovely Washington Square Park is only steps from the hotel entrance. Furthermore, the hotel restaurant is exceptional, at least for dinner.

Our room (710) was small, clean, has a nice size bathroom and a well designed shower tub...meaning the shower head worked well, the tub drains promptly, there were plenty of places to put stuff. The windows in bath and main room open easily, but not far, and there is a small desk. Two caveats: 1) The room consistently had a slight, but distinct, musty odor which was minimized, but not eliminated, by leaving the windows open while we were gone. 2) while the mattress was comfortable, with 6 pillows to choose from, it is protected from bodily fluids, or spilled wine, by one of those waterproof mattress covers that caused us to sweat in bed (while sleeping) nearly every night.

The breakfast area is small, often requiring either a wait for a seat, or the use of the restaurant where essentially the same breakfast is available, but from a waiter, which is nice except when in a hurry. The included breakfast offers nothing hot, but there are bananas,  fruit cup, bagels, small muffins, yogurt, and an excellent granola. Tea, coffee, orange juice, cold water to drink.

We would stay there again. Did I say the location is great!?

title: A Wonderful Hotel In a Perfect Location!
text: This is a historic hotel that is completely updated, but retains so much character. The front desk and all other personnel were so helpful, professional, and friendly, even when we came straggling in at 12:30 at night! They provided us with tips about the neighborhood and beyond, cluing us into secrets we wouldn't have known about otherwise. The night before our return flight home they even printed out our boarding passes! The rooms was very comfortable and spotless. Breakfast was excellent and the extra touches (like afternoon lemonade) were just wonderful. Can't say enough good things about this hotel!

title: Merveilleux
text: Accueil très sympathique. Une chambre de grande taille et une sdb magnifique. Un quartier que l on a adoré, tres jeune et tres vivant. Le washington Square est superbe avec ses petits écureuils. Le meteo est tout proche. Bref on a beaucoup aimé on y retournera

title: Nice Little Indie
text: What this hotel has going for it -- great location, cool vibe, has the basics down (good staff, clean rooms, etc.). It's an older property so be ready for slow elevators and tiny closets. I would stay again without hesitation.

title: Nice plays to go
text: Well located place to go. The breakfast was quite nice, you can choose to go to the restaurant, where is a service or to café where you have a bufet. The staff is very helpful too and there is a wifi in the hotel available.

title: A Wonderful Surprise in Greenwich Village
text: We stayed here for a six night trip to visit our daughter and grandson.  We usually stay in the urban canyons of Midtown and found this location to be delightful.  It was an easy way to our daughter's apartment and the neighborhood is fantastic and a great change of pace from the hustle and bustle of Midtown.  Babbo Ristorante is right across the street and is a must stop place. We were worried about the size of the room given other reviews and when we first arrived we were concerned about the lack of space.  The room worked out well for us.  It is well laid out with ample closet space, a small desk and chair and a single chair for sitting. The two twin beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was outstanding, with a large walk-in shower and incredible shower heads and water pressure.  The room was always clean and the friendly staff and great bathroom made up for any concern over room size.They were very accommodating at check-in and allowed us to check in early after a red eye flight from San Francisco.  Ronnie, the door man is a real asset.  He is super friendly and welcoming and had great recommendations from restaurants to shopping.  We are staying here again when we return in February.

title: Super Hotel
text: Great, safe location.  Walked to Greenwich Village, Little Italy, and Chinatown.  Close to the subway for other sites. Super friendly and knowledgeable front desk.  The gentleman in the lobby who helped with our luggage was an invaluable source of knowledge on what to see and exactly how to get there.  Great restaurant.

title: Perfect NYU location!
text: While the rooms were small (very European), they were clean and well appointed. The beds were comfortable and bathrooms were fine. The breakfast was much above your usual continental fair.  We especially loved the fresh fruit and bagels.  The concierge was outstanding.  He found us sitting in the lounge one afternoon and came in to give us many pointers about the general area and NYU specifically!  He really made our stay!  We definitely plan to follow his advice and book early for graduation since we were already too late for parents weekend!

title: An amazing hotel
text: My sister and I stayed here to celebrate her 40th birthday in New York. The location is fantastic and the hotel itself is beautiful. The staff are all very helpful and friendly too. In fact nothing seemed too much trouble at all for them. The room was very clean and well suited to our needs. Also would heartily recommend the restaurant, North Square! Breakfasts were delicious and again the service was brilliant. We would also recommend that you try them out for an evening meal too.

title: great location...hotel could use some TLC
text:
Great location in the Village...that says a lot. The hotel is always busy, this was my second visit, and I think the staff was overwhelmed. It's not a swanky place, I knew that, but it seemed a bit run down. They ran out of coffee cups one morning, housekeeping is incredibly slow--they don't arrive until ten and sometimes our room was still unmade at 4:00.I heard other guests complaining about that, too. The front desk does as best it can, but aren't well informed as to restaurants in the area. By the way, Babbo is across the street!!! Stellar spot.  Book it in advance. The Knickerbocker is a Village landmark, but no one at the desk knew that or if they did , they didn't offer it as a suggestion.

The whole place seems tired.
If you decide to stay there, make sure you book a room away from the elevator.

Ronny is great, always friendly and informed.

Sadly, I will not be staying here again. My friends tell me the Marleton is better.

title: Muy pequeño
text:
La atención es muy buena pero la habitación muy pequeña muuuuuuy. También muy ruidoso el entrar y salir de los demás clientes de sus habitaciones. Buscaría mejores opciones. 
El desayuno muy pequeñito y tarde. Solo pude probar para llevar.

title: Washington Square Hotel
text: A well location Hotel right in the middle of Manhattan with a cafe attached below open for breakfasts. Our room was small but we only needed it for sleeping at night which was fine and for a Hotel right in Greenwich Village, it was affordable.

title: Hotel perfetto per la mia prima volta a NY
text:
Sono ancora nella camera per la mia ultima notte qui, ma ho deciso di scrivere subito. Andiamo per argomenti: 
1. Grandezza della stanza: Non enorme, ma con lo spazio per mettere la valigia, un piccolo armadio a muro, un mobile con cassetti, bagno grande con doccia in cui ci si sta in sei! Sono stata in stanze molto più piccole a Londra!
2. Pulizia: Pulitissimo. Non lasciatevi ingannare dalla moquette anni 70 dei corridoi: No moquette nelle stanze, letto candido, bagno splendente.
3. Vista: Ho prenotato una camera interna per risparmiare perché tanto sono stata in albergo solo dalla notte tarda alla mattina presto! Se volete una vista sul parco dovete spendere di più ma...vi serve davvero?
4. Letto: Comodissimo, grande il giusto nella Queen size prenotata.
5. Servizi: Wi-fi gratuito, a disposizione in stanza phone vero!! Ferro da stiro, ombrello!, accappatoio, cassaforte. Non c'è frigo bar but who Cares? 
6. Colazione inclusa: Una rarità a NY. Muffin, pane e bagel da tostare, marmellata, nutella, macedonia, yogurt, banane, biscotti, bevande calde. Per chi voleva colazione continentale nel ristorante annesso.
7. Location: Semplicemente perfetta. All'angolo del parco, ad un passo dalla metro, vicino i migliori localini jazz, la libreria Strand, molti ristoranti e locali, insomma: Il village. Perfetto! Ero sola e spesso sono tornata a piedi di sera, in tranquillità.
8. Staff: Gentilissimo. Mi hanno aiutato per ogni richiesta ma anche rivolto parole carine all'occorrenza. 
8. Il deposito che prendono per eventuali danni è di soli 50 dollari. 
9. Tariffe: Migliore offerta prenotando direttamente con l'albergo. Prenotato 10 giorni in anticipo, pagando tutto, ho ottenuto uno sconto del 15%.
10. Check-in alle 15, check-out a mezzogiorno con possibilità di lasciare il bagaglio. 
Non vi resta che prenotare. Io lo farò di nuovo la prossima volta a NY!

title: Excellent Hotel, Perfect Location
text: The headline above says it all. The rooms are not large, but mine was immaculate and all I needed. The bathroom sparkled with white tile. If you want to be in or near the West Village, I highly recommend it.

title: Ótima experiência
text: A experiência no hotel foi excelente, o quarto era super confortável, organizado, limpo, apesar do espaço ser pequeno, o quarto era bem aconchegante. O banheiro era espaçoso e confortável. Os atendentes eram super educados, atenciosos. Tem estações de metro próximas, o parque fica a 2 min caminhando, a localização é boa. Foi uma excelente experiência, recomendo.

title: Small room but great staff and great location
text: Room was SUPER small, i could jump from one wall and hit the other,  but quant. Staff goes well out of their way for everything, very impressed. But the true positive of this hotel is the location, right across the street from washington square park, it is beautiful, i highly recommend this confining gem

title: Great!
text: The hotel is old but has been renovated into modernness. They have an amazing sushi restaurant downstairs. And very convenient to time square. The people at the front desk were cool as well. Overall is was great

title: We enjoyed our visit to NY and our stay in Washington SQuare hotel was great
text: we had a great experience. Room was comfortable, breakfast great, location was fine, and customer service excellent. We will be back. We always comeback to this hotel when we come to visit NY. Front desk is friendly and helpful.

title: Pleasant stay but rooms could use a refresh
text:
Washington Square Hotel is a fine boutique hotel in a prime location in the heart of Greenwich Village.  The building has some history, but you're not really staying here for that.  You're not particularly staying room size or amenities either, which, to be honest, are both a bit lacking at this price point.  Of course, what you're staying here for is the location, which for Greenwich Village, is about as good as it gets.  Having everything within easy striking distance, and one of the finest parks in NYC at your doorstep to boot, is truly wonderful.

We stayed for 10 nights in July and despite the rooms' limitations ($265/night and no in-room fridge ... seriously?), we nevertheless had quite a pleasant stay. Hotel staff and management in general are very good, and they make you feel right at home.

You'll also enjoy dining at North Square, which does a solidly consistent service both for breakfast and dinner.  Staff are courteous and helpful, both in the restaurant and the lounge, and prices are quite decent.  Overall good value which we made plenty of use of during our stay.

Overall, at the WSH, the pluses (location & service) outweigh the minuses (room size & lack of amenities), and as long as your expectations are realistic, you should enjoy your stay here.

title: Great location, and great stay!
text: We were in NYC just for a weekend, and the Washington Square Hotel was actually booked for us by our hosts. The location can't be beat. So nice to be steps away from the park! And the staff was absolutely lovely - friendly, helpful, and accommodating! Rooms are small, but this is to be expected in the city, where square footage is at a premium. However, the bed was super comfortable, and the shower had great water pressure. Thanks for the great stay!

title: Great location, UNCOMFORTABLE bed!
text: Location is ideal, but one of our two double beds was extremely uncomfortable. Even with a double dose of melatonin, it was very difficult to sleep. Otherwise a great, historic hotel, but not being able to sleep is a HUGE issue. :(

title: Best place honestly ever
text: So I lived here for six weeks and honestly this hotel felt like home for so many reasons!! The staff are some of the nicest people you'll ever meet, the room was always clean, the bathroom was great, the location is totally bangin and did I mention the staff were the best?? Could not be keener about this hotel, best six weeks of my life!

title: Absolutely super location, Absolutely Average Hotel.
text:
This is a super location to be in if you are visiting New York. This area had tons of restaurant options, the area was lively with a great fun atmosphere. One of the best neighborhoods in New York and only a block away from the subway makes this ideal for getting anywhere around the city during your stay. Just in case you need to know it is really close to NYU, so if you need to visit the school, this would be a perfect choice. 

The hotel on the other hand was not as glamorous as the area. The hotel felt old. The rooms were small, the bathroom was small, towels were average. I was challenged to find outlets for my phone and computer.

The lobby area felt dirty, even though I know it absolutely wasn't. It probably is more aesthetics. Check in was great, staff was extremely friendly. There was a continental breakfast available in the morning. 

Overall, I would stay here again because the location makes it absolutely worth it, but due to room size plan on getting two rooms if you are a family.

title: Excellent, if it wasn't for the carpet
text: Good location next to Washington square, the very nice Greenwich area is all within walking distance and metro station as well. We had an executive double which was very spacious, even for non New York standards. Comfortable beds, friendly service and OK breakfast. The hotel is a bit dated which has its charm but our room had a carpet which smelled like a bad burger joint. They tried to clean it after we reported but with little success. We got some money back but if you check into one of these rooms don't assume the smell is from a next door restaurant and will go away because it doesn't. Needs some maintenance.

title: Great location. Lovely hotel👍
text:
We were so happy with our stay here. The accommodations were  lovely. The Restaurant, north square, was delicious! This is situated in a great location....right across from the park.
Staff very friendly and accommodating. Will stay here again for sure!

title: Beliggenhed beliggenhed beliggenhed
text: Et OK hotel. Velfungerende med lidt små værelser. Vores værelser havde udsigt ind i en gavl c 2 m fra vinduet. Så det var ikke udsigten der trak. Men et godt mellemklasse hotel med god morgenmad og så ikke mindst en dejlig beliggenhed.

title: Great Location!  Great Hotel!
text: We had a great stay at The WSH!  Very close to NYU and Washington Square!  Easy to get to all things NYC and Brooklyn.  The staff was very helpful and accommodating.  Great amenities in the room.  Very clean. The daily breakfast was just perfect.  Great way to start our day!  Highly recommend!

title: A great NY base
text: The location of this hotel is great-easy access to all the sights of Manhattan. The rooms are a little dated, but clean and have everything you need-safe box, iron, robes etc. There was no mini bar, but you are in central NY so unlikely to need! Knowing that NY hotel rooms are typically small, we paid for a slightly bigger room. It was still small in comparison to other hotels we have stayed in other cities however totally acceptable. Staff were friendly and helpful-for example on our first night due to flight delays we didn't arrive until 3am-we were still met with a friendly welcome. We stayed for three nights and loved the location and will definitely stay here again on our return to NY.

title: Location, location, location
text: This is a wonderful choice for a stay in NYC.  It is on Washington Square right next to NYU.  The price is excellent for NYC.  The staff is extremely friendly.  There is a small breakfast buffet each morning with bakery items, coffee, yogurt and fruit which is included with the room.  The rooms are small but that is typical of NYC.  I would definitely recommend this hotel

title: My home away from home.
text:
I stay here every time I'm in NYC if rooms are available. I just stayed there nine nights and they make me feel like family. Everyone from the maintenance, cleaning, front desk, and restaurant staff made my stay quite enjoyable. I have a custom motorcycle that I parked on the street and the staff were very watchful of it to which I appreciated. 

I have to mention my man Ronnie...he greets you as you walk in and greets you as you leave. He is a great ambassador to not only the hotel ..but to NYC. I love this guy, he is what makes staying in a boutique so special.

title: Exceed Expectations!
text:
I thought about not telling anyone about this gem that we found near NYU because I don't want to fight for rooms when I return.  But they deserve the publicity and the compliments.  This historic hotel was quaint but updated, super clean, superb location steps away from subway, Starbucks, drugstores and markets.  Perhaps the greatest part of the experience was the staff.  This is their neighborhood and their property and they are proud of it.  They treat everyone like old friends.  They go out of their way to provide you with whatever you need, recommend local amenities, and just generally make you feel like they are taking good care of you.  You are immediately greeted by the most charming gentleman I have ever met (Hi Ronnie!)  I've stayed in many parts of Manhattan, but I will now continue to return to the Washington Square Hotel.  

As a reference, I reserved the double twin room for my daughter and myself.  The room is small but not claustrophobic and very well laid out.  The beds are literally side by side so could serve as a king if desired but was perfect for our needs.  The beds were quite firm, which we normally stay away from, but I'm telling you we slept like logs. Bathroom was small but again very functional, including a tub and a window, which is rare and refreshing.  No mini fridge or microwave but I don't know if larger rooms are equipped with these.  We just visited the local market and the ice machine and we were fine.  Did have iron, small ironing board, keurig, hair dryer, robes, nice tv.  No safe in room, but I'm sure desk would hold items if you desired it.  Very quiet rooms, didn't hear neighbors at all.  We had a 6th floor room and I recommend higher levels for better views, but even lower rooms wouldn't be bothered by street noise because this is a nice quiet neighborhood.  Nice restaurant downstairs which I didn't try so can't comment on, but nice option.  Cab ride to JFK was about an hour.  Sorry I didn't take photos to share, but trust the hotel site photos...they are accurate!  Also, I thought this property was a great value $$

I can't say enough.  We love you guys and will be back soon!!

title: Good location, comfortable room
text:
I stayed here for 3 nights in July.  It was very hot outside, but a/c worked perfectly. The room was bigger than I had expected, with lots of space to unpack. Elevators worked quickly. The continental breakfast included fresh fruit, yogurt, and normal breads. Good coffee. Staff was fine. 
I enjoyed walking around the neighborhood, subway and bus stops were convenient. There were plenty of restaurants and coffee shops around. 
I paid extra for a room with "park or village view". Not sure that's what I got.

title: Friendly and best location
text: The location could not be better. Right across the street from the lovely and entertaining Washington Square Park. In easy walking distance to great restaurants and subway.  The staff is very friendly and helpful. Very comfortable bed. Great restaurant on premises. Complimentary scones and muffins in the a.m. Pleasant, cozy lounge. The negatives: There was a bad, musty odor in the room yet the room looked very clean. The TV did not work properly and the channel choices were poor. The room was very tiny but it was the least expensive room ($179) so a step up might get a larger room.

title: Comfortable, convenient, clean, and courteous NYC digs
text: Enjoyed a lovely 2-night stay here recently.  I booked a room through an on-line booking service which only registered as a 1-night reservation in the hotel's system.  No worries, there were rooms available for the 2nd night--and at a better rate!  Ended up being upgraded to an upper floor room with views of the park and uptown, and a nice bathroom window too.  They secured my laptop for me (giving me the key to the locker)and stored my luggage in advance of check-in time and after check-out as well.  Nice address. Nice service. Clean and comfortable.  And decent coffee served with the complimentary continental breakfast.  You can't go wrong here!

title: Great Hotel
text: We stayed here for our first anniversary in July of 2016. The Penthouse suite was roomy, very clean, and had wonderful views. The hotel even had an iced bottle of wine waiting with a note that said Happy Anniversary. The bed was very comfortable, and I absolutely loved the Shampoo ect. I have since purchased them from the store on 106th. I would have liked a bath tub in our room, and the additional shower sprayers had a bit too much pressure. Other than that we had a wonderful stay and have recommended it to friends.

title: Great place!
text: I highly recommend this hotel. Even though I had an interior room without a view, it was a lovely stay. The room is clean and the decor is updated. The staff is very friendly and the continental breakfast is perfect for a small bite to eat. It's location on the corner of the park is quaint and it is very close to the subway. I will look to stay here the next time I am in NYC.

title: A great stay and a great location
text: I chose Washington Square Hotel for the location and reasonable rates (including the complementary continental breakfast), and it did not disappoint. My two children (ages 13 and 9) and I shared one room. It was small, but since we did not spend a lot of time there, it was fine. It was very comfortable and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would have preferred if the front desk staff had been more knowledgable about local restaurants and the best ways to travel around the city, but they were great and efficient about searching online for suggestions, and also printed something for me that I needed in hard copy. The best part about the hotel is the location. It's a lovely neighborhood, very walkable, and great for people who don't want the noise and crowds of Midtown, but still want to be able to get to other neightborhoods easily.

title: Brilliant as always
text: First visited the hotel 21 years ago, still the coolest hotel in New York❤. Brilliant location and excellent staff! Room 321 was double aspect with a great view of Washington Square park! Loads of great restaurants within easy walking distance and less than one block from the subway!

title: Don't touch the telephone
text: This is an excellent hotel, perfectly located, and with a fabulous restaurant attached to it. But they still maintain the fiction that long distance calls should be charged as though we are still in the 1950s.  $180 for a ten minute call to Dublin in order to resolve a problem with a bank card is ludicrous and leaves a very taste about the experience as a whole.

title: Amazing stay at Washington Square Hotel
text:
We stayed in Washington Square Hotel for a little less than a week and we had the most amazing time. Greenwhich Village is in my opinion the best part of New York and the hotel staff made the hotel feel like our home away from home. 
They helped us with wonderful recommendations on restaurants, shopping, what to see and what to do. And Ronny, the guy working in the reception, felt like an old family friend by the end of our stay and it felt sad to leave. Be sure we will be back!

title: Another wonderful stay
text: I have stayed at the WSH on three previous occassions and was once again delighted. The service is great. The included breakfast while not expansive is more than a good way to start the day. A huge plus to the hotel is the location in the West Village. Close to MANY restaurants and shopping. The subway station less than a block away is probably the best part though, it serves several lines including the Orange lines and the 1.
