title: SUCH AN AMAZING, AFFORDABLE HOTEL!!!!!!
text: My husband and I have stayed here twice while our daughter has been interning in NYC. We cannot say enough great things about this hotel. The staff, the room, the comfort, the cleanliness, the location...everything was perfect. And soooo affordable. I think my favorite part of the hotel by far was the staff. They were all so friendly, which especially for NYC, is almost unheard of. Forgive me, but people on the street do not even acknowledge your existance!! But everyone at the hotel made small talk and had smiles. Very refreshing!!! Would stay here over and over again and would recommend it for anyone!!!!!

title: ASK FOR BLACK OUT CURTAINS
text: This hotel is in a great location with wonderful staff along with restaurant and bar.  However, we originally were checked into the 4th floor room, remember NY small, but with a very bad view of ac units and roof.  But the very worst part of this room only had a pull down semi shade to cover the window that faced the East.  I called the front desk and they said there was nothing we could do.  We woke up with the morning sun and my husband begged the front desk for a different room.  They were able to get us another room with a better view and black out curtains.  Our vacation was saved.

title: Great Location, quaint and pretty.
text: Stayed here 3 times summer of 2016. Efficient rooms, smaller sized, outside facing a must, lobby, and staff were welcoming. Breakfast included. Two steps from Washington Square Park, rental bikes close by. Just walk out and stay in the neighborhood with plenty to do, no subway necessary.

title: Super beliggenhet
text: WSH er et fint hotell med perfekt beliggenhet. Bra strøk, kort til gode restauranter og underholdning om kvelden. Hotellet ligger også nærme subway som er en stor fordel. Veldig fint hotell å komme tilbake til etter en lang dag ute i byen. Og de serverer en bra frokost. Vårt andre opphold på WSH.

title: Great location but a bit used
text:
2th visit in 10 year at this hotel. I choose it because I had a 2 night stay in NYC where I know that I would not use the hotel facilities at all. When that is said…

The check in at the hotel went nice and easy.. we arrived at 1 o’clock at night.

The room was really really small (Even for NYC standards) and the window was facing an elevator shaft! So if you opened the window it was all smelly and dark outside. When I booked the room this was not stated. The smell was really stuffy.
The decoration of the room and the hotel in general is very out dated. So outdated that it is not even nice or fun anymore. The closet was really old. The doors could hardly be closed and 
The bathroom is of a newer date. And worked well. 

Had the quick breakfast in the hotel. But no need to do that.. there is a Starbuck just around the corner. 

The door men and reception is very nice and welcoming.

I will not stay here again. I really do like the district but the hotel I will not miss.

title: Great Value!
text: Given its location, amenities and service, this hotel exceeded expectations.  The rooms are NYC sized (i.e., fairly small) but they are comfortable and clean.  The staff is friendly and helpful, the continental breakfast included is excellent, and the building is beautifully maintained.  A real find!

title: Perfect for a Mother-Daughter trip to NYC
text:
I visited NYC with my 14-y-o daughter and stayed at the WSH for 4 nights.  Although small, the room was clean and comfortable.  The 2 twin beds were literally side-by-side, but that was fine with us - no fighting over the covers!  The bathroom is spacious for an urban hotel and well lit with nice toiletries.  Wifi signal is good.

Three big pluses are:
1. The rooms are dark and quiet at night.  Even the air conditioning is quiet.  I slept very well.
2. The continental breakfast is healthy, filling, and got us out the door fast.
3. The location is terrific!  There is so much to see and do in the neighborhood - the square is lively, good restaurants are a short walk away, even SOHO shopping is not far.  Subway stations are minutes away and trains run to locations convenient throughout the city.

All-in-all, I highly recommend WSH for a reasonably affordable, yet gracious and elegant, hotel in a thriving, vibrant neighborhood.  The staff is friendly, helpful, and professional.

title: The Power Of A Friendly Atmosphere!
text: The front desk and housekeeping staff present as genuinely friendly; this is a great service quality (with priceless marketing value).  The "security" and maintenance staff were OK enough but the difference from their energy against that of the "front-line" staff was palpable.

title: Great location!
text: Was in the area recently for business and stayed here for two nights. I think the price is very reasonable, especially for such a great location. When I'm next in town for leisure, I will seriously consider staying here again. The hotel staff was very friendly. The restaurant (North Square) less so. Service at breakfast was very slow and the meal itself was not great (try OatMeals a couple of blocks away for something tasty and healthy). My room had one of those infamous interior views to nowhere, but that was OK. Mattress was very comfortable and firm. Room was impeccably clean. Bathroom quite roomy (by NYC standards). Loved the C.O. Bigelow goodies. My major quibbles are the thin carpeting on the floors:  If they just added thicker carpeting, it would eliminate the noise from above that woke me up way too early each morning. Also, the hotel's HVAC system does not remove humidity well. But it's an interesting property and, truly, the location cannot be beat.

title: Lindo hotel. Lejos de times square. Tiene desayuno!
text:
El hotel es lindo y las habitaciones son un poquitiiiito mas grandes que lo habitual en los hoteles de Nueva York. Tiene desayuno y es buneo, cosa que no es habitual que este incluida en NYC. 
La ubicacion es buena (al lado de washington square) cerca del subte pero si pensas en ir y venir de times square facil te queda lejos.
La relacion costo-beneficio esta bien.
La atención muy buena y no cobran por recibir paquetes

title: the most exceptionally helpful staff I have encountered in any hotel.
text: The hotel is beautiful with original mosaics throughout. Staff was very helpful in offering advice on transportation and entertainment.   The continental breakfast was excellent.  The location was phenomenal.

title: Great experience
text: First and foremost: location - location - location! Situated near Washington Square Park and the Village, close to subway station (Waverly & 6th Av), great restaurants, bars and neighborhoods within walking distance. We absolutely loved our spacious room (park view) and the shower (water pressure was perfect). Breakfast (with service, in the restaurant downstairs) is very good. The staff is among the friendliest in New York City - doorman Ronnie even got me a NY baseball cap and a bottle of his special Jamaican hot sauce for my boyfriend as a goodbye gift :-). For our next NYC trip, we won't hesitate for even a second to book a room at the Washington Square Hotel again!

title: Perfect location in the West Village
text: Comfortable, clean, quiet, quaint hotel perfectly situated on a lovely tree lined street in the West Village area. One block away from most subway lines. Staff kind and friendly (they put up with my chatty ways!). Yes, rooms are smaller, more European style (old school), but more than plenty for me and my adult daughter. We walked everywhere, Chelsea Market, Soho shopping and up to Union Square Park. And a short train ride from uptown and downtown. It is such a wonderful location, more of a neighborhood feel, and I would (and will) stay again.

title: Great updates from several years ago's stay
text: The Washington Square Hotel is a great place to stay in the village.  Rooms are clean and quiet, and the breakfast is wonderful.  We visit the hotel to visit our family in New York and it is perfectly located for the Greenwich Village area as well as NYU.  Loved our doorman/bellhop and all the activity in the area.  We noticed how nicely they had updated the hotel since our last stay a few years ago.

title: Terribly Rude Bell Hop
text: From the moment I walked in, the bellhop was rude and the front desk staff offered no assistance. He was short and abrasive and set a terrible tone for my stay here. The grout is dirty. The ironing board was disgusting.  I would definitely look elsewhere for my next trip to New York. Hopefully you never go here to begin with.

title: A gem of a small European style hotel in Greenwich Village
text: I stayed here with 3 friends who were coming together from all parts of the world to reconnect.  We all absolutely enjoyed everything about this hotel. If you don't like small rooms, this will not be the place for you but the location, staff, comfortable beds and immaculate condition are the qualities I choose everytime.

title: Classic New York charm
text: Second visit, wonderful place.  Perfectly appointed rooms, comfortable beds and robes, and can't beat the location on the corner of Washington Square.  Quiet Village neighborhood although back in the day it had quite a distinguished history of visits by musicians ranging from Dylan to the Stones.  Great being able to open a window for fresh air and to better observe the activity below. Toiletries by local CO Bigelow add a nice touch.  Although an excellent breakfast is included (with a generous time span of 7:15 to 11), we found a special offer on their website that included a full 3 course dinner and a nearby jazz club cover charge. The restaurant was the adjacent North Square - the food was superb and the restaurant atmosphere warm and inviting - again, vintage NYC. The package price came to a few more dollars than the room alone, an incredibly good deal.  Checkout is noon and they will hold bags for you. Wonderful, authentic boutique hotel.  Can't wait to return.

title: Wonderful boutique hotel on Wahington Square
text:
My granddaughter and I had a wonderful 2night stay at the WSH in early June. The location was great, with lots of restaurants and shops near by. Our room, while small as are boutique hotel rooms, was perfect for us. The bathroom was very spacious and sparkling clean. Our interactions with the front desk were very pleasant, and the breakfast room staff was welcoming and attentive.
We were pleased with the continental breakfast choices, the toast in particular was wonderful and grainy. There were certainly choices that met our needs.

I will definitely stay here again, and will recommend this hotel to others. As a travel agent, I am always happy when I find a property that I can recommend without reservation.

title: Quaint and comfy
text: I love this hotel -- walking out to see Washington Square Park after a good nights sleep in a downy bed makes me happy. The staff are friendly and helpful. If you like boutique hotels, you'll like it here!

title: Always a great stay!
text: Conveniently located across from Washington Square Park and NYU. Easy to get to the subway and walk to Soho, Noho, Greenwich, Battery, and Meat packing district. Nothing fancy but definitely worthy of 4 stars.

title: Home away from home
text:
Its the second time I've stayed at the WSH and frankly I wont bother looking to stay anywhere else. We had an extended 9 night stay in May and once again enjoyed the hotel, the public areas, the low rise ambiance, the staff, the location and the breakfasts!
The hotel is in a lovely tree lined street, minutes to the very well connected W4th subway, foot steps to the park and totally surrounded by great restaurants and bars and excellent blues and jazz clubs. Compared to the madness of much of New York, the Village setting is a welcome reprieve. Highly recommend the hotel if you like modest comfort, warm greetings and a terrific location. We will be back!

title: Voyage par affaire.
text: Hôtel très bien situé, les chambres sont propres et les lits confortables. C'est la deuxième fois que j'arrête dans cet hôtel par affaire et je ne suis pas déçue. Très bien situé, près du magnifique Washington square, une vie de quartier avec pleins de restaurants sympa et les boutiques de soho à proximité.

title: Lovely hotel
text: This is our first stay and we will definitely be back! Beautiful charming hotel! The staff is great. We were upgraded for free! Room is quaint and actually, much larger than I anticipated for NY. Comfortable bed, clean room, immaculate bath and wonderful CO Bigelow lavender peppermint bath products. We had lunch in the restaurant (North Square) which was also quaint and very good! Otherwise, location at Washington Sq is amazing and lots of fun! Great people watching, dining, shopping and entertainment! I couldn't ask for more! Highly recommended!

title: Bon hôtel pour visiter NY
text:
Hôtel sympathique et très propre en face de Washington square.
Chambre petite mais très confortable.
Salle de bain parfaite avec douche à l italienne.
Personnel charmant.
Emplacement parfait à Greenwich village  pour visiter NY et à 2 minutes à pied du métro W4 Washington square.
Petit dej continental excellent pour lancer la journée. 
Seul bémol, une fenêtre donnant sur un mur.

title: Hotel consiglialto
text: Ho trovato il soggiorno in questo hotel molto gradevole, lo staff gentile e disponibile (mi hanno mandato del prosecco in camera dato che era il mio compleanno), la camera abbastanza grande e pulita, la doccia fantastica (cosa rara), e la colazione  (inclusa nel prezzo della stanza, rarissimo a NYC) buona anche se non eccezionale (non è a buffet). L''hotel, che dispone di wi.fi gratuito in tutta la struttura,  è ubicato nel Village, uno dei quartieri più belli di NY con tanti locali per sentire la musica, il parco di fronte e tanti negozi.  La metropolitana è a 100 mt. e ti porta ovunque. Quando tornerò a NYC per la terza volta prenoterò ancora questo hotel.

title: Location couldn't be better
text: We stayed here for five nights during our trip to NYC. The location in Greenwich Village is superb, it almost makes you feel as if you're living in the city yourself. The location right next to the park is also really nice. The staff was very friendly and helped us out with information about taxi's, restaurants etc. The only downside of this hotel that we experienced was that it was at times a bit noisy. We could hear quite a bit of noise coming from the rooms above and next to us, although it was never that loud that we felt the need to make a complaint. Overall I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel!

title: Hotel encantador en óptima ubicación.
text:
Me alojé varias veces en este hotel. Siempre con gran satisfacción. 
Está ubicado en el corazón del Village, a una cuadra del metro con línea directa desde JFK,. El tamaño de las habitaciones y baño es suficiente. La mayoría no tiene vista, pero son muy confortables. Todo decorado con muy buen gusto y personal siempre atento y diligente. Nosotros tuvimos que cancelar una noche ya que perdimos la conexión en San Pablo. No sólo no la cobraron, sino que nos dieron la habitación a las 9 am (lo que no es usual en USA) y el desayuno. 
Por cierto, muy completos los desayunos incluídos en la tarifa. 
Uno de mis hoteles favoritos de NYC

title: Idéalement, personnel charmant mais prestations faibles
text:
L'endroit est parfait le personnel est accueillant et chaleureux certes... Mais pour un hotel de ce prix, les chambres sont décevante. Les filtres du climatiseur ne sont apparemment pas changé régulièrement et le mobilier est très daté... Les moquettes sont de la meme époque à mon avis...

C'est vraiment dommage car l'hotel à un charme fou

il est typique du New York de Scorsese et de Woody Allen...
On à la meme salle de bain que de Niro dans Raging Bull...
Franchement dommage

Un entretien plus rigoureux et renouvellement du mobilier rendrait à cet établissement son caractère exceptionnel

J'ai voulu mettre 4/5 sincèrement mais ce ne serait pas cohérent

title: Four night visit
text: Love the location of this boutique hotel, across the street from Washington Square Park in Greenwich Village. This was our second stay at this hotel. Small but clean rooms. Nice bar and restaurant. Express breakfast included with room reservation. Within walking distance to good restaurants, NYU, The High Line, and close to the subway. Would recommend this hotel for it's wonderful location.

title: Home away from home in NYC
text: Full of history, attractive decor, excellent service, comfortable rooms, perfect location at the entrance to Washing Square Park and close to NYU, good restaurants and the Village. I never stay anywhere else.

title: My little home in the Village
text: I love staying at the Washington Square Hotel, for its coziness, personal attention, and fabulous location. The rooms are a little small but always comfortable and clean. Its old-fashioned style feels homey to me. There's a tasty sit-down, table-service continental breakfast included with the room price, but you can add a la carte selections from the menu at extra cost. Best of all is the location: Right on Washington Square Park in Greenwich Village, just a block or two away from the subway, and perfect for strolling the charming old streets of the Village or wandering into Soho or the East Village or up to Union Square. It's in the very midst of the NYU campus and an easy walk to the High Line, the Whitney Museum, and unlimited bars, clubs, and restaurants, both cheap and fancy. Cozy, comfortable, and personal.

title: superb
text: Fabulous. Fabulous. Great location. Very clean.  Old school. Excellent staff.  Try to get reservations to Babbo Restaurant across the street!   We just Love the area. Easy access to the West and East Village.

title: Lovely place to stay
text: I was staying here while attending a conference at NYU.  Great location in Greenwich Village.  The quaint hotel was clean and well maintained.  The rooms are updated.  I chose an interior room with no view and while I looked at the side of the building next door, the room was still nice and well kept.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Close proximity to many good restaurants and attractions.

title: Run Don't Walk to Washington Square Hotel
text: The Washington Square Hotel is now my FAVORITE boutique hotel in NYC.  Excellent location, quiet and charming building right on the square, modern/contemporary/updated rooms, friendly and helpful staff.  This hotel is an NYC gem in beautiful Greenwich Village. A solo woman traveler, I felt safe and well cared for.

title: There are many things to like about this hotel
text: As they say: location, location, location. This place is in a great part of NYC in the middle of Greenwich Village and within close proximity to many wonderful sights, restaurants, and parks, and especially the High Line.

title: Generally downtrodden and a miserable atmosphere
text:
We arrived early, so expected some issues at check-in, and to be fair they did try to accomodate, but the room was more of a stress-resistance test than a relaxing experience.  If you're offered the ground floor, do not take it.

Following protestation, we were moved upstairs to another room with a concrete wall and anti-pigeon spikes for a view.  At least this was quiet, though.

Breakfast was hastily consumed in a small windowless box, and then we got out of there into the city for the day.

The main issue really was the attitude of some of the staff, the unhelpfulness of one of the ladies on reception, and the downright sullen silence of the baggage porter just made us want to leave and never come back.  (We won't).

In summary, cannot recommend, but the location is good.  That is all.

title: Great little hotel
text: This small hotel has staff so friendly you'd think you were in the Midwest. Everyone was very helpful and so nice. Right on Washington Square, it is a great location for everything. Just a block from the subway. The rooms are small, all with one queen bed, but well appointed. Not sure where one would put children - maybe a crib would fit?? They have nice Keurig coffee machines and good coffee. The breakfast is included; in the basement, the free selection is quite extensive (yoghurt, fruit, granola), and one can also order eggs, etc. for a fee. Again, very friendly service. We left our luggage there before check-in, and then they kept our luggage there after we checked out. They encouraged us to use them as a base, use the bathroom, get water, both before and after check-out, and that really extends the stay in the city as you come and go.

title: Charming with a lot of character
text: Located on the corner of Washington Square Park in the heart Greenwich Village, this iconic hotel was perfect for us.  The bell hop Ronnie was knowledgeable and friendly always checking in with us to get us to where we needed to be.  The atmosphere is artsy, with old world charm.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  The location was perfect for Manhattan easy access on and off the subway, great restaurants nearby and right there in the heart of NYU.  The hotel has a restaurant with generous continental breakfast which is included or you may order something off the menu.  The hotel has a lot of history and everyone we encountered were professionally polite.  The chic tile murals of Silver Screen actresses gave the hotel a warmth as did the decor.  It was nice coming off the hustle and bustle streets of NY to this safe calm and beautiful oasis of The Washington Square Hotel.

title: Boutique Hotel with great location
text: This hotel is in a great location--central to many activities and sites as well as close to two subway stations.  Washington Square is a block away and is a great place to people (and dog) watch.  The rooms are on the small side, but the staff are extremely helpful and go out of their way to ensure guests' needs are accommodated.  The restaurant has a small but tasty menu; the continental breakfast is ample for most folks.  The bed is incredibly comfortable!

title: Family Owned Gem
text: Excellent location right off Washington Square; small but well appointed rooms; underrated restaurant mostly frequented by locals. The staff is friendly and helpful.  If you are visiting NYU this is the place to stay.

title: Mycket bra!
text:
Bokade hotellet efter rekommendation från två, oberoende av varandra, vänner. Läget är grymt. Nära till tunnelbanan  om du snabbt vill komma till teatrarna och Times' Square eller om du bara vill hänga runt Washington Square Park med Christopher Street runt hörnet.
Jättetrevlig personal och bra frukost. Att vi blev uppgraderade gör ju ingenting😊Tack Washington Square Hotel!

title: Nice Hotel in the Village
text: The WSH is in a central, lovely location in the Village, right on Washington Square Park. The rooms are small but recently renovated, and the service and staff are top notch. Would definitely recommend after 4 visits.

title: Fantastic location, comfortable rooms, good service
text: Very comfortable hotel in a fantastic location next to the park and wonderful restaurants. The staff is very helpful. We were able to print some attraction tickets for free no problem which was quite useful.

title: Great location; Feel like a local
text: Can't beat the location - at the heart of Greenwich Village. Subway less than a block away with easy access downtown and uptown. The amenities of the actual hotel are sparse, but it is a charming little place. Rooms are small (expected), and could be cleaner (mostly dust). This place allows you to file in with the locals, away from the tourist areas. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Perfectly sited hotel for NY
text:
We stayed at the Washington Square Hotel for 5 nights and were extremely pleased with both the accommodation and service. We had a comfortable double room on the 9th floor with a view across to Washington Square (from the bathroom) and were amazed how quiet it was at night compared to other places we've stayed in Manhattan. Breakfasts (included in the cost) were excellent and choice of being served or DIY was very useful. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful (especially Ronnie who we met by chance on the subway platform and he made sure we got on the correct train for JFK). The hotel is in an excellent position both for Greenwich Village and surrounding areas and close to a subway station which is very convenient for ACE trains going further afield (if you come out at the right exit, which we didn't when we arrived!) 

I strongly recommend the hotel and would certainly use it again if we return to that area.

title: Close to Subway
text: Google doesnt seem to know all the subway stations. This hotel is literally around the corner from a station. Within walking distance of shops and restaurants. View of the Freedom Tower from end of the street. On the corner, you have Washington Park. Friendly staff and comfortable rooms. Only thing they need are recycle bins.

title: A wonderful Hotel
text: I can not say enough about the staff and beautiful large, clean, and quiet room we were upgraded to. We love the location allowing us to walk to all the areas we enjoy in and around the Village. We can not recommend the Hotel enough. Thanks for a terrific stay.

title: The hotel was lovely, quiet and clean.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.
text: I chose the location to be near NYU.  The hotel is in a very old building, so my room was small, but well appointed with a bureau and night table and a decent sized closet.  Great decor - the furniture was art-deco. The bathroom was modern and clean and had plenty of room.  We had dinner in the restaurant and it was delicious!  Great desserts as well.  And breakfast was very nice.  I look forward to staying here again.

title: Hotel de famille
text:
un hôtel qui contraste avec les grandes chaînes.
on s'y sent comme chez soi
On vous connait, la réception, la femme de chambre.
l'Hôtel est bien placé, proche des métros, le meilleur moyen pour se déplacer à New York. On a apprécié le petit déjeuner compris dans le prix de la chambre.
Un seul regret les chambres sont un peu petites mais c'est ce qui arrive quand on transforme un hôtel pour pauvre en boutique hôtel.

title: AMAZING LOCATION AND STAFF
text:
This has been my third time staying at this Hotel and all I can say is WOW!
My complement to the Hotel and their Staff , specially Rita who kept our room
looking so great and for making us feel so welcome .

To Ronnie, Thank You for helping us with our Suite case as we were checking
out and for getting us the Taxi to go to the Airport .  I will see you next year again.

title: Hôtel très bien
text:
Bel hôtel en plein coeur de Greenwich village très bien situé par rapport aux transports 
Bon accueil attention certaines chambres ont des fenêtres qui donnent sur un ...mur donc faire attention 
Pour le petit déjeuner le prendre dans le coin  express si vous voulez un petit déjeuner tradi car l'autre option est limitée chambres bien ménage et linge de douche  changé tout les jours. 
Bel hôtel donc addition qd même salée 
Jean pierre

title: Location + excellent staff = win
text: Staying in the Village is perfect for those of us who love walking to destinations or taking the subway. So many great restaurants in the neighborhood to enjoy. Proximity to beautiful Washington Square Park is a bonus.

title: Quiet and comfortable!
text: We were very happy with our stay. The staff is very helpful, knowledgable, and cheerful. Our room was very quiet and had everything we needed to make our stay great. The hotel provides easy access to 9/11 Memorial, Statue of Liberty, and NYU.

title: Fabulous location and clean, quiet room
text: This hotel is a clean, quiet place to stay in the heart of Greenwich Village. The location is unbeatable -- close to the subway and unlimited restaurants/shops. We walked to Gramercy, Little Italy, Chinatown, Soho, Nolita, the Seaport, and even Battery Park. The price is higher than the least expensive places in the area, but the lower priced options tend to be shared bathrooms and have lower quality appointments. Our room was great -- clean and fresh, comfortable bedding, good water pressure. Not exactly spacious, but definitely plenty of room for 3 adults/luggage in a room with 2 double beds. The cleaning staff was very good, and the front desk was helpful and pleasant. Charles was particularly great. For a hotel of this star level, they do a great job.

title: Pour une évasion romantique
text:
New York est une ville pleine d'énergie et propice aux aventures culturelles exaltantes, fébriles et stimulantes.
Parfois, on veut se retirer du rythme fulgurant de Manhattan.
L'hôtel Washington Square est un lieu idéal pour vivre le New York romantique, presque bucolique. Le cachet de l'hôtel, la gentillesse et l'empressement du personnel, le confort et la tranquillité des chambres ( pas très grandes mais plus que convenables) ajoutent à l'expérience. L'hôtel est à une jetée de pierres du parc Washington Square, près de bons restaurants ( dont le Babbo ) et à 10 minutes de marche de l'incontournable High Line Park.
Bref, un séjour au Washington square Hôtel est une belle expérience à vivre.

title: great place
text: fantastic location right off Washington Square, beautiful historic hotel with modern amenities and rooms, and great service from the entire hotel staff. This hotel aims to please and they succeeded. Will visit again.

title: Easter vacation
text: We just keep coming back to this lovely hotel year after year. Reason is the familiar and friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms, location close to everything you need and much much more. We will come back for sure. PS: thanks Ronnie for the sample  of "Papa´s Special" :).

title: A nice little hotel in a great location
text:
Stayed here 5 nights for Easter. The hotel is small'ish and kind of unassuming from street level, but the rooms are nice, and the people very friendly and helpful. The concierge is (seemingly) always there, and always has a kind word, a helpful tip or pointer, and in general lights everyone up a bit. We stayed in a "deluxe queen". It wasn't huge, but was fairly spacious still. Clean, well kept, and to our liking, so we were happy. 

The location at the corner of Washington Square park and right in the divide between Greenwich and West Village is fantastic. The whole hotel and park has such a relaxing feel to it. I wish I'd had more time to just lounge in the park for a day, because it was so vibrant and chill at the same time. Loads of people using it all day long (the park has NYU buildings on all sides, so lots of young people around). 

The room  got new towels and the bed made every day. One weird thing was there was one, and one only, waste bin in the entire room, and that in the bathroom. And anything not in that bin, like an empty wrapper or soda can wasn't tidied away. A bit weird, but not really something I felt the need to spend any kind of energy on. 

All in all, I loved it, and would absolutely, hands down, stay there again!

title: Lite gammaldags
text: Läget är utmärkt nära mysiga Washington Square Park i ett område med inte så många hotellalternativ. Rummet, nr 803, var väl litet och inte så praktiskt möblerat. Endast en riktig stol för två personer är inte bra. Badrummet dock rimligt stort och välutrustat. Trevlig och hjälpsam personal.

title: Wonderful hotel in the heart of the west village
text: Spent four nights in a superior twin room. On the second floor with a view of Washington Square Park.  I was concerned about noise being so close to street level but it was very quiet.  The staff were efficient, professional and friendly.  The location is fantastic, very close to major subway lines, great restaurants, shopping and we really enjoyed  being in the west village.

title: Not great
text: In any business, the reception received marks a first impression. Upon arrival, the front desk briefly welcomed us, gave us the room card, and then we took our luggage to the room up ourselves!  On several occasions, we asked information about directions or recommendations. The 2 women at the desk were 1) not helpful,  2) not friendly, 3) gave us the WRONG directions to a very local restaurant, 4) and when asked questions, several times they'd look at each other (for help in answering the question). They'd admit they're "not really sure," and would voice an "I think it's ...."  but did NOT make the attempts to find-out "for sure."  The complimentary breakfast was not what we expected. Bagels were stale. We went elsewhere.  The rooms small, but almost all NYC hotel rooms are. We didn't spend much time in the rooms anyway. But they were clean, and the beds were comfortable. The tv was not working well - garbled audio - but like I said, we weren't in the room much. The light beside each bed had PINK bulbs (????) that put out almost NO light through the shades. No way could you read a book with both bedside lights on. There WAS an overhead light - useful when entering the room - but glaring as most overhead (ceiling) lights are.  Okay, the hotel is not a "bad" place to stay. It's in a great location. None of the above mentioned seriously effected our stay.  But if we had planned a trip giving us free time to "chill" in the room (we did not. We were only there 2 nights), we would have been much less satisfied.

title: Beautiful West Village Hotel
text: This was a New Year's Eve visit. The staff is among the friendliest I've experienced. Beautiful décor, clean rooms that are decent-sized, clean bathrooms, no bedbugs, and if you're lucky you may be able to snag a free parking spot on Waverly or any of the nearby streets. They have a restaurant on the corner that opens at 5, and it is virtually impossible to walk a block in any direction without hitting a bar, club, or restaurant. Cool little diner down the block services anything 24 hours. Diagonally across from Washington Square Park and the beautiful Washington Square Arch. Absolutely would stay here again.

title: Second time also a charm
text: We were in room 224. We like low floors. This had a view of the park and a window that opens. This hotel has a very nice self-serve continental breakfast. Our room looked updated. The only funny thing is the labyrinthine halls, but we figured it out quickly. We will go again.

title: We'll be back
text: Everything from the convenient location to friendly staff to comfortable beds and rooms and large (NYC) bathrooms was great! It was easy to get to the subway or use Uber or a cab if needed. We were able to walk to a variety of restaurants and appreciated the included Continental breakfast. The room rate was fantastic and far better than anything else you can find in New York, especially in such a safe, convenient location. As friends with two to a room, we loved the twin beds!

title: sink hole beds
text: Great hotel and superlative restaurant and bar--great location of course! but HORRIBLE BEDS with sink holes---Barely slept..........nowhere to hang anything---closet is large enough for one winter coat or a few clothes but NOT BOTH -- and for a room for two people, we had no where to hang coats. Clean and good quality sheets and towels.

title: Perfectly located
text:
Washington Square Hotel is situated in a perfect location for people wanting to explore Soho, Noho and Greenwich Village. There are 3 subway stations within very close proximity to the the hotel, making it easy to venture Uptown, Downtown and over to Brooklyn. The friendly, accomodating staff ensure a stay at this hotel is a pleasurable experience. We'll be returning to this affordable little gem in September. Loved it.
Elaine & Ron.

title: Great location, tired rooms
text: We stayed here over a weekend due to the proximity to who we were visiting.  The hotel lobby was nice when we entered and the location was great.  The hallway's (we were on the 5th floor) were VERY narrow (hard for 2 people to pass) and the rooms small (as most hotels are in NYC).  The decor is tired and the rooms dark.  We were disappointed that there were no comfortable places in the lobby to lounge or read the paper.  The continental breakfast that is included is minimal, but was fresh.  Great place to stay if you need to be close to anyone that is near Washington Square Park.

title: Undiscovered gem
text: A small hotel, off the beaten track, in Greenwich Village.A very nice experience.  Charming place, modest but adequate rooms, very reasonable prices, friendly and helpful staff, nice continental breakfast (free).  Excellent restaurant.  A few housekeeping glitches: hair pin in room carpet (lack of vacuuming?), dirt encrusted TV remote, torn bathrobe, lack of slippers (supplied in other rooms).

title: Great location, not luxurious but nice
text: This hotel is around the corner from NYU in the heart of Greenwich Village. Luxurious it is not but we've stayed here several times and like it each time. Depending on how much you are willing to spend, the rooms are either cozy (i.e., small) or comfortable (i.e., bigger) but all are clean and well equipped. The free continental breakfast works well for us but if you want a full breakfast the restaurant is attached and very good. In fact, the restaurant is a local gem and we often have dinner there especially on travel days which says a lot given the choices. Very friendly staff and rates are very competitive.

title: A fine downtown hotel
text:
We needed to be near NYU for one night, and the reviews for this hotel were good. For the purpose, its location could not be better, as it is at one corner of Washington Square Park.  My wife had to be at an early session of a conference, and the hotel was very accommodating; there was a room available(414), and they allowed me in at about 9:30 a.m., at no extra charge.  It had no view to speak of; I expect that the rooms with views had been occupied, and thus were not available yet. Not a problem.  The room is small, but not extraordinarily so at this price point.  Everything worked, there is a small closet and a bathroom. Furnishings have an art deco vibe. It was an extremely cold day, and I watched TV for a while, until it was time for me to leave. 

There is a passage from the hotel lobby to the hotel's restaurant, which was very convenient on a frigid evening.  Dinner there was excellent (reviewed separately.)

Next morning, we had breakfast in the small cafe area off the lobby, where the offerings included bagels, small croissants, bread, small muffins, fresh fruit cup, jellies, Nutella, coffee, juice, etc.  If you wish to go beyond the free continental breakfast, a full breakfast menu is available in the restaurant (in addition to the continental breakfast buffet).

The staff was quite friendly and helpful in all respects.  If I needed to be in the downtown area overnight again, I would not hesitate to stay here once more.

title: Pictures are better than the actual Accommodations
text: We were looking for a hotel near the area of NYU and we found this hotel for a very nice price and apparently with great accommodations based on the pictures and the reviews. We arrived, and to our dismay the rooms were quite small and not at all what we had seen. The rugs were disgusting, to the point that we did not take off ours shoes in the room. The amenities look cheap; I would be better off sleeping in my dorm room. Very disappointed with this place, I totally do not recommend staying here. There are far better hotels in New York for a better price.

title: Very nice experience
text: This hotel has a great location. Rooms and hallways were small, but that's to be expected. The staff was exceptionally nice and friendly. The free breakfast was above average, including waiter service rather than a buffet.

title: Nice, small, quiet hotel
text:
Was very happy with the hotel, with the caveat that it may not be for everyone. It is small, not "hooked into" the major chains, and doesn't have the usual polish that you'd get from a Hilton/Intercontinental/Marriott. I like that, and really don't care much for the generic faux-glam of it all, so this was perfect for me. The staff was friendly and accommodating and the room clean and comfortable, if a bit spartan. But everything was available that we needed, including wifi. 
The neighborhood is really the selling point: it's at the corner of Washington Square Park, and easily walkable to great neighborhood interests and restaurants, if it's not freezing (which it was when we were there, but there's nothing to do about it!). Metro/Subway is at the end of the block.

title: Charming
text: A small hotel full of charm and character, and  neat and pleasant as well. The staff was helpful. The coffee maker was supplied with black and herbal tea as well as coffee, which I appreciated. I enjoyed strolling in Washington Square Park, just outside.

title: Very good hotel that could easily be better
text: Our room, among the largest in the hotel, was on an upper level. It was quiet, even with four windows that opened. The bathroom was huge by NYC standards, with a tremendous shower, two sinks and a window. The TV was substandard, but who watches much TV in New York? The lack of competition among hotels in the heart of Greenwich Village may explain why this very good property does not merit a rating of excellent. It really wouldn't take much -- training from the top down in attention to the smallest details, and a touch-up here and there to the interior design and amenities. Still, there is nothing that would prevent us from staying here again, as the location and accommodations are first-rate.

title: Weekend Jaunt
text: We had a fantastic time at the Washington Square Hotel.  The rooms were perfect, with a lot of character.  The staff were so hospitable and always smiling, especially the doorman!  Everyone was very accommodating and helpful.  We had both the continental breakfast and a full breakfast in their restaurant.  Both were delicious.  I would highly recommend this hotel!

title: Great Weekend Stay
text:
My wife and I stayed here for a three nights for a long weekend.  We had reserved a room with two double beds in the hopes we would have a little more room.  No complaint there.   However, the first room we were put in had a wall that was adjacent to the elevator shaft.  The noise from elevator going up and down bothered us all night and the hotel was able to put us in another room far from an elevator the next day.  It was much better even though we could some street noise, but that did not bother us.  Management was kind enough to send a complimentary bottle of wine to the room as one of the days was my wife’s birthday.

We had taken a taxi to the hotel from the airport so I cannot say much about where to park if you are driving.  You have your typical NYC street parking and I did notice a parking ramp around the corner about a block away.   A subway station is also located about a block from the hotel.   We did stay in on a rainy night and ate at the restaurant in the hotel.  We did not have anything fancy, but what we had was good.   My wife did use the workout facility a couple of times and found that it was equipped with what she likes to use.    The room price included a breakfast buffet which we really did not take advantage of, so I cannot comment on that.   When departing, the hotel made arrangements for a limo service to pick us up to return to the airport.

There are all kinds of restaurants and shops in the area, so if you like to get out and walk, things are close by.

For an older hotel, the place is in pretty good shape with the remodeling that has been done over the years.  We enjoyed our stay and would return again.

title: Quaint hotel in prime location!
text: This is a great hotel in Greenwich Village.  The location could not be any better.  Right next to Washington Square Park and close to a main subway hub.  The rooms are nicely appointed and their robes were great to use while staying.  The continental breakfast was on point. Overall a great value and would highly recommend to anyone!

title: Fantastic!!
text: We loved our stay!!  It's a great location and the staff is amazing!!  The place is clean, comfortable and really a cool place!!  Housekeeping does a great job, and the staff in the lobby is super helpful.  We will definitely be back!!

title: Washington Square Hotel
text: WSH is our favorite hotel in NYC. We have been staying here for years and we love everything about it. It is located in a great section of the city, with Washington Square Park right across the street. You have 100's of restaurants within walking distance. The subway is less than a block away. You won't find a better place to stay in NYC.

title: Great Location
text: This boutique hotel is in a great downtown location near the subway. There are many restaurants within walking distance and Washington Square Park is right outside the door. My room; cozy but had all the basics including free Wi-Fi! (this is huge in NYC). Also important, everything was clean and people were friendly. The only issue with my stay was that I was made to pay upon arrival rather than after. I have a debit MasterCard that I use as a true credit card but they didn't honor that and treated it as a debit card (which forced me to pay upfront). I agree that a reservation is a contract, but I also think that a guest should be able to pay after services are rendered satisfactory in any method they choose best for them.

title: NYU Audition
text: Great location on park/near transit, restaurants, NYU. Clean, stylish (and comfortable!) hotel. Especially appreciated the good air temperature control and lighting in room/bathroom. Staff at all levels was especially helpful and friendly. Best experience I have had in NYC hotel in years. Will definitely return!

title: Vacation
text: This hotel is great. Clean accessible to great restaurants, soho and parks. We love staying here. So friendly. The neighborhood is fantastic. The room we had was just remodeled and it was great very spacious. Love this place!!!!!

title: Supert hotel og beliggenhet
text: Vi hadde et fint og lyst dobbeltrom i 8 etg. Hyggelig personale og spesielt hyggelig "doorman" som kom med masse gode forslag til spesielle opplevelser i NY. Enkel, men god frokost. Super beliggenhet, både sentralt men rolig og trygt i området. Hotellet ligger rett ved Warshington Square Park som er veldig hyggelig, masse som skjer der på fine soldager.

title: Fantastic stay at WSH!
text: We stayed here for 2 nights last weekend and had such a great stay!  The rooms were very clean, beds were very comfortable!  The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful.  The continental breakfast in the morning was great and well stocked.  Our visit was for a girls weekend and there were several of us staying at the hotel.  We loved that we could gather in the lobby lounge area and just chat in the morning with coffee.  The location of the hotel was also great; close to the subway, lots of restaurants and shops near by.  The Washington Square Park was one block away and was nice to walk through.  No complaints here and will be sure to return to WSH the next time we visit NYC!

title: Love WSH
text: The location of the hotel is wonderful, but the people are the major draw.  Everyone with whom we ever came into contact treated us like family.  Our room was lovely, and there is nothing about our experience that was anything less than perfect.  They went out of their way to assist in ways in which we didn't even know we needed assistance.  If there is a better hotel experience to be had, I am entirely unaware of what it would be.

title: They Treat You Like Family
text:
For a wonderful option to the hustle and bustle of Midtown's toney hotels, this Boutique gem on the edge of Washington Square
in Greenwich Village is perfect.
the staff could not be more friendly and accommodating, especially the Front Desk Staff 
and housekeeping.
Be sure to enjoy the delicious restaurant in the hotel called
North Square.

title: Great place to stay.
text:
I stayed here while visiting customers at NYU. I found the staff very welcoming. The room itself was quite small but adequate for my needs. Coffee machine, ensuite with shower over bath and TV what else could you want.  
Watch out for the breakfast options. There is one on the first floor which is very basic but included. If you go for the restaurant downstairs there is a better choice and part of the menu is included in the room fee. Specials like omelette etc.. is extra. No complaints about any of the above.
I will definitely stay here again when visiting the area.

title: Greenwich Village hotel
text: Perfect boutique hotel in one of the greatest villages in Manhattan. It is very quiet, has great service, homey feel, and amazing location. It is right next to New York University's main campus and across Washington Square Park. You can walk for around 5 minutes to get to Union Square.

title: Perfect
text: We booked this hotel for one night of R&R, found it based on proximity to the Village Vanguard where were going to hear the Vanguard Jazz Orchestra.  The hotel is charming.  The room was huge, nice king sized bed, really nice shower.  Our only complaint was that we had trouble making the temperature in the room comfortable.    Even though it was February the room was too hot but if we turned the A/C on (there's a wall unit for heating and cooling) it was too cold.  There were also points during the night when we could hear people outside in the street.  I'm taking off 1 star for those two items.  The hotel is very well located and there are so many places to eat nearby it's difficult to choose.  I'd stay here again and next time I'm going to book some of the spa amenities they offered.   It's a really beautiful place.

title: Great location and price
text: We stayed for my daughter's audition at NYU. Great price, great location. The room was small but nice, clean, had everything you need. Hotel provided free wi-fi and breakfast. Staff was helpful with everything.

title: Very charming and delightful hotel.
text: Charming hotel. Excellent decor. Very clean rooms. Excellent service. Terrific location. We had a wonderful experience and would be happy to return. The breakfast, which is complimentary, was very good; and the service was fine.

title: Perfect location, restful stay
text: The location can't get any better if you want to be in the West Village. The hotel is right off of Washington Square Park, near the subway and everything the Village offers. Free wifi, in-room safe, free breakfast (muffins, croissants, bagels, fruit, yogurt). I stayed in a deluxe room and the size was just right. The bed was comfortable, if a little too high (hate that trend), and the bathroom was updated. Hallways are single file only if that matters to you. I stayed here years ago and hadn't been back in a long time. I won't wait so long to go back next time.

title: A real gem in the Village
text: My new top choice for accommodations in NYC, with rooms, service, amentiies, location and price all unbeatable for this neighborhood. Family-owned and newly renovated, the care shows and the staff carries out that care as well.  It's hard to find two days/nights of perfection at any hotel, but this one really delivers.

title: SILENZIOSO,,,
text: Silenzioso,,posizione ottima x poi andare in giro a piedi,rapporto qualità-prezzo x NY,ma,,camere piccollissime e caldissime,niente frigo-bar,quindi niente acqua fresca!!colazione giusta,ma se chiedevi una cosa banale in più tipo espresso,si pagava a parte,8DATO CHE IN QUESTO HOTEL LA COLAZIONE ERA INCLUSA,9)atipico x NY.conveniva andare al vicino Le Pain Quotidien veramente delizioso,personale corretto,cmq in questa città si va più volte-  alla prossima

title: Iconic New York hotel.
text: The Wash. Sq. Hotel is like a second home for us.  We are New Yorkers who retired upstate, but I still have projects to do that brings me to Lower Manhattan.  From the moment we arrive, the doorman helps us with the bags (we are not as young as we once were), the desk clerks are friendly and promptly take care of us, our room is peaceful and clean.  We like to 06 line that has a walk-in shower.  It is in an excellent, safe location that is central to transportation.  The restaurant, North Square is divine, and the breakfasts are excellent.  Be aware that most of the rooms are on the small side, but who comes to NYC to spend much time in the room?  The more expensive rooms are larger, and the penthouse is very nice.  The hotel is across from Washington Square Park, which is a great place to take an historic stroll or an early morning run.  The 1860's row houses on the north side of the Square are mostly owned by New York University, and the facades are kept in their original condition.  If I could afford it, I would just move in, knowing I would be well-taken care of.  One thing, there are steps up to the lobby, and down to the restaurant, but my husband, who has trouble walking, can manage them, and the staff always tries to help.

title: Sympa
text:
Hôtel sympa avec personnel agréable... bémol sur la climatisation qui fait du bruit. A deux pas du Washington square garden et bien situé. Chambre agréable et charmante. 
Parmi des centaines d'hôtel à NY prix correct

title: Highly recommended, great hotel and location
text:
Next time we're in NYC we'll try and stay here again.

The WSH is in an excellent location for wandering around by foot. The staff are friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and the bathroom was clean - both room are bathroom were much bigger than other places we stayed in NYC.

Breakfast was great as you could take a few yogurts, fruit cups, some granola and a coffee and go enjoy it in the park right opposite the hotel.

It can get a bit noisy at night (on the street outside) but this is NYC where I'd imagine you'd hear this type of noise anywhere in the city. It wasn't enough to put us off. Would definitely go back. Great value for money.

title: Great location, excellent hotel
text: My family and I came into the city for a weekend of relaxation, good food and music. I chose this hotel primarily for its location and based on reviews. We were all very pleased! This is an older hotel which has been subtly updated to maintain its connection with its and the neighborhoods history. The beds are very comfortable and the bathroom is clean with nice amenities. The staff is very friendly and Ronnie at the front door is charming, gregarious and a wealth of info on the surrounding area. The complementary continental breakfast was an unexpected treat. The location can't be beat! Washington Square, jazz clubs, great restaurants, Greenwich village all a short walk. My new go-to hotel in NYC!

title: Everything about this hotel was a pleasure!
text:
After trying to book a hotel room with two beds near NYU on various travel websites, I had almost given up (rooms either were not available or were way outside my family's travel budget).  Then I contacted the Washington Square Hotel directly and found that rooms were indeed available and were very reasonably priced.  When we got arrived, we were treated very graciously by the concierge and the bellman and checked in without a hitch.  The hotel lobby is gorgeously decorated in black, white and reds.  This is an older hotel with vintage decor (a print of John Singer Sargent's Portrait of Madame X hangs in the lobby!).  Our room was spotless and very nicely decorated.  The room was well-heated and the beds were comfortable.  The room had a safe, a travel ironing board and iron, bathrobes, a well-stocked coffee service, and television set.

The hotel's location is absolutely perfect for families visiting NYU, Greenwich Village and SoHo.  It is directly across Waverly Place from Washington Square Park.  It is centrally located for excellent shopping and dining.  

As we checked out, the concierge handed me a rewards card for a free night after five nights.  We will be sure to come back to the Washington Square Hotel when we next visit New York.

title: Прекрасный Отель!!!!
text:
Отличный отель для путешественников.
Я второй раз в этом отеле и хочу выразить благодарность владельцу отеля и его персоналу. Очень учтивый и обходительный персонал. 
Номера очень хорошие со всеми удобствами. 
В номере даже есть фен и утюг. 
Расположен Отель в 1 минуте ходьбы от станции метро West 4. 
Рядом русский ресторан Onegin, где можно хорошо покушать и на выходных потанцевать под зажигательные диджей сеты.
Вы можете смело выбирать этот Отель. 
Красивые люди должны отдыхать красиво в волшебном месте. Отель Washington Square Hotel именно это место!

title: Wonderful stay in the city
text:
My daughter and I stayed for five nights.  The staff was wonderful.  They helped with dinner recommendations, car services and ideas for things to do around town.  Thank you to Charles and Beverley for making our stay extra enjoyable.
The rooms are small but since we didn't spend much time there it was perfect.

title: Perfect Location
text: I choose this hotel because my daughter had an audition for NYU and I wanted a hotel within walking distance. This hotel the perfect choice. The first thing my daughter mentioned was that it has a "Great Gatsby" feel to it. It was an older hotel, with charm. I was impressed with how clean our room was, even though it was older. The room was small, but it was fine for just me and my daughter. It would have been too small if my husband was there also. The hallways were pretty small but big enough to get through with our luggage. The entire staff was very nice and helpful. The subway was a block away, and super easy to get to Times Square using the subway. I got an excellent price because I paid in advance at the time of booking. The only thing that wasn't great was that the beds were a bit hard, and I could not get the pillow comfortable. One pillow was not enough, but two were too much. Not that much of a huge deal though. I would stay there again.

title: Great location and good value hotel
text: Well situated just off Washington Square and reasonably quiet. Good quality bed and decent bathroom well stocked with towels and stuff for bathing. Heating in room efficient and quiet. No noise from adjacent room. Coffee capsule machine in room. Staff and lobby helpful. Feels like a small hotel. Room rate includes free and good wifi and a buffet breakfast room, where the choice is reasonable. There is another room for breakfast with waiter service with much more choice, and is an extra cost. Easy walk to 5th Avenue and Broadway so situation is really good. Strongly recommended

title: Tiny Rooms but Great Location
text:
This hotel is perfect for those who are interested in staying near Washington Square Park and are not picky about room size. The continental breakfast is more than adequate and the location was perfect given that my meetings were mostly in the SoHo area. However, my room was barely big enough for one and while my bed was very comfortable, my male colleague told me that his feet stuck out of the end of his bed. 

I would stay here again if the price is right, but I would hesitate to stay here if my husband is with me given the space issue.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: What a great find. I have stayed in big chains on past trips to the city. Wanted something different this time. Was a holiday trip for my daughter who had just turned 21. The staff had a bottle of champagne and a card upon arrival and upgraded. All of them were very nice and helpful with recommendations. So nice to have a quiet retreat away from busy days in Midtown. Spent News Years Eve at Comedy Cellar nearby. Reminded me of European small hotels. Would recommend staying here for sure!

title: Perfect location
text: We stayed here for New Year's eve, we didn't stay a long time but it was a nice home based. The staff was extremely nice and the room was very average but comfy. Very old furniture but characteristic. We even found out the breakfast was included ;) The location is perfect, right next to Washington square park which is amazing if you want to stay out of the hustle and bustle of midtown ;)

title: Love Letter to The Washington Square Hotel
text: This was our 3rd trip to NYC, and prior to this, we had chosen chain hotels (Hilton Garden Inn, Fairfield Marriott) due to finding deals on travel websites.  For this jaunt, we wanted to stay away from chain hotels and opt for a more local feel.  The Washington Square Hotel was the perfect option.  If you're looking for a cookie cutter chain hotel experience, the WSH hotel may not suit you.  The historic property is 100+ years old and is somewhat dated.  However, if you're seeking a property with CHARACTER, HISTORY, and CHARM, you're in for a treat.  Due to massive gentrification, NYC is quickly losing the character that has made it such a fascinating city.  The WSH is one of the last family owned hotels in the city.  It was delightful staying in a hotel with so much character and history.  Joan Baez and Bob Dylan are rumored to have lodged in Room 305 in the 1960's when the property was a flophouse (see Baez's song "Diamonds and Rust" written partially about their time in the hotel).  Fortunately, the current proprietors have renovated the property.  While the paint and carpet are still dated in some rooms, the property is kept EXTREMELY CLEAN considering the age of the building.  The quiet stillness at night would make you forget you're in NYC.  Yes, the hallways are narrow, but this is characteristic of most hotels in NYC.  It always amuses me when tourists complain about the small size of NYC hotel rooms.  You're in one of the largest cities in the world, small spaces are expected.  In fact, the rooms at the Washington Square Hotel are rather large by NYC standards.  It was wonderful to GET AWAY from the bland madness of Times Square Tourism and Mid Town Chaos with a retreat to the WSH in tranquil Greenwich Village.  Oh, if those walls could speak, the stories they could tell.  For the first 3 days, we stayed in room 810 with a view of the park.  Deciding to extend our stay another 4 days, we were assigned room 310, which only had an interior view, but was just fine.  We asked for one of the new renovated restrooms, but the staff were unable to accommodate that request.  All in all, we had an excellent stay.  The room included a safe and coffee maker, and housekeeping did a great job daily.  I'm a NYC history fanatic, and I sadly lament that the city is losing so much of its history and character to gentrification.  I would rather spend my tourist dollars supporting independently owned properties like the Washington Square Hotel to ensure that class and character continue to exist.

title: Good choice, no frills
text: This is a fine hotel if you do not expect anything fancy. It's a good choice with basic clean, rather small rooms. Everything seems a little dated, but it's working. It's a rather cheap hotel for NYC and the location is perfect. Don't book the cheapest room category ("superior with partial view") as the only view you'll have from their windows is a wall and there's almost no natural light coming in. Take a superior room with full view, they are only a bit more expensive and offer great views over the City.

title: Another great stay!
text:
We had stayed at Washington Square Hotel several times. We had not been to NYC for several years and made reservations for a week. We were not disappointed!
The room was clean and comfortable. Love staying near the park. Staff was very nice and friendly. Will stay again on our next trip.

title: Great room renovations
text: This is my third time staying on business. I previously found this hotel to be a bit tired, and was pleased to see that the management have made efforts to upgrade the rooms (at least the room I was in this time). The bathroom in particular was well done, with all while marble/tile, modern glass shower doors, and a multi-faucet shower arrangement. The white color gave the feel of a larger space. The room itself was also upgraded, and although still a bit dark by my tastes (it was vent-shaft facing, so little natural light), it was clean and comfortable.  Free coffee/tea in room, and included breakfast can be 'express' or 'relaxed' depending on your interest.  Love the daytime doorman. Gym/fitness center is small, but functional.

title: Mysigt och hemtrevligt
text: Washington Square Hotel skiljer sig en del från de hotell jag tidigare har bott på New York, vilket är något positivt. Jag gillar verkligen den avslappnade atomsfären som råder på hotellet, personalen är både extremt trevliga och servicemedvetna. Något om jag tyckte var väldigt trevligt med det här hotellet var att personalen inte var dömande, det spelade ingen roll huruvida jag var klädd i trasiga jeans och en sliten t-shirt eller finbyxor och skjorta - det goda bemötandet var identiskt. Lägger vi till det faktum att frukost är inkluderat, sängarna är bekväma, läget är bra och priserna är humana så får vi en vinnande kombo. Jag rekommenderar starkt Washington Square Hotell.

title: Great location and friendly staff
text: I went to New York for a long weekend and was pleased with our choice of the Washington Square Hotel.  The room was not big, but I think that's be expected in Manhattan.  It was clean and quiet with a comfortable bed and satisfactory shower.  Having Washington Square Park nearby was a plus for early morning walks.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  We didn't eat in the hotel, but the Waverly Diner nearby does a great breakfast.

title: idéalement placé
text:
Hôtel idéalement placé dans New York et probablement un des meilleurs endroits pour partir visiter la ville.
Les chambres sont correctes, assez simple et les salles de bains un peu vieillissantes.
Le petit déjeuner est très simple mais bon
Le personnel est sympathique et peu présent

title: Pleasant (small) rooms;  great location but lack of actual hospitality
text:
Although I live and work locally, occasionally in connection with a business event, I stay at a NYC hotel, too (including last night). Do note that December hotel prices in NYC are sky-high (as they are in the summer, too) because of holiday events, so it's best to look away from midtown. Since I used to live in the West Village, I recalled the Washington Square Hotel and decided to book there. Their rates -- about $275 a night, including tax -- are very reasonable for NYC, and especially good at this time of year. 

Pros:

** Great location steps away from Washington Square Park. Subways (including different lines) are within a 5 minute walk; plenty of restaurants and shopping etc.

** The room was very small (like a European hotel) but clean, well maintained and had everything you'd need in it for a short stay (it would get very cramped in there for a longer stay). The bathroom is also quite small but also very clean and nice. 

** My room, on the 9th floor, had a direct view of the Empire State Building --- beautiful!

** A quick walk from one of the best bookstores in the world -- The Strand! (12th St. and Broadway). 

Cons:

** The front desk staff is not welcoming at all. Both the woman who checked me in (she wasn't rude, just unfriendly), and the man who checked me out (who was borderline rude) were totally disinterested in me (their "guest"). At check in I was asked for my license and credit card, and also if I wanted one key or two -- that's it. No "have a good stay" or anything else. It was brisk (I'm all in favor of moving things along, but maybe with a smile or two, too) and unfriendly. Check out (very early morning) was downright frosty -- no "how was your stay?" "have a good day" or anything at all. In fact, I had to ask for a printed copy of my invoice and the man at the desk seemed put out. He also did not thank me for staying with them (and paying for it) etc.

** The small rooms could be a problem for a couple, and are not conducive to a family or a long stay. I actually liked the room just fine for a night (and it would probably be fine for 2 or 3 nights, too).

** This is an old building, and the hallways are narrow and rather claustrophobic. The hotel has tried to open this claustrophobic feeling up by painting the hallways in a lighter color, and also making sure the room doors are pleasant looking.

** The elevator is so small that it feels like a tomb. They do, however, have stairs that are easily accessible (and wider and well lit).

I would have given this hotel 3.5 stars if it was possible to do so. I couldn't round up to 4 because of the unfriendliness of the front desk, and the lack of actual hospitality.. I did, however,  meet a very nice man from housekeeping in the elevator, and there were two nice staff guys (one in the afternoon and one in the early morning) in the lobby -- perhaps they should be behind the desk greeting travelers instead!

Even though this review isn't a rave, I did like a lot about the hotel -- the location, the room etc., and might give it another try if I ever needed to stay downtown again. 

Please excuse typos.

title: Great value near Washington Square Park
text: This is a very nice and friendly New York City boutique hotel.  Your choice of an express breakfast or larger restaurant, all included.  The hallways are narrow and the rooms small, but it is what you expect in this type of hotel in NYC.

title: Perfect location. Helpful and friendly staff.
text: Just stayed here this past weekend for my wife's birthday. Walking distance to everything we were looking to see. Included breakfast was nice. Clean simple rooms. Staff was very nice and knowledgeable.

title: Delightful independent hotel
text:
A historic building, but thoroughly maintained. My room was comfortable and everything worked in it. The staff was extremely pleasant. In the morning, a lobby greeter helped direct my half asleep self to the correct dining room. I asked for late checkout and received an hour extra, which is fair.

I got a good price on my Sunday evening room. A weekday rate certainly would be more, but worth it.

title: Awesome location in the village! Wonderful staff! SMALL
text:
Who stays in their room when they are in NYC?  No one... Exactly!!! 
 A friend recommended WSH since it was close to the Blue Note, which is where we were attending shows.  It was all about the 'walking factor' for us and WSH fit the bill. I tried to book 5-6 weeks out but they were full so I just kept checking back and ended up booking 2-3 weeks out on trip advisor, which was super easy AND it was significantly cheaper. 
-Check in was easy.
-Rooms and bathroom are very small.
-We had a queen as no king available. Tight walk around bed area.
-Little furniture-only stool and small chair.
-Did have a coffee machine in room. Nice
-Loud on street side.
-Check out was easy.
-Stored out bags until our flight.
-Got us a car service: short wait time/decent price

title: Great little hotel
text: Stayed here last week room 329, excellent little hotel, staff great although they did forget to leave cups one day - however this was quickly remedied by the ladies on reception! Lovely and clean, comfortable bed, no noise at all, we loved our stay at the Washington Square Hotel!!

title: Awesome location
text: The best location to get all around town. Boutique Hotel with great breakfast on Washington Square. Rooms were small, but comfy. Staff was very helpful and their was always a taxi available. A good choice fitting our needs!

title: Qualità e offerta
text: Struttura e camere fatiscenti, qualità del servizio sopravvalutato rispetto alla spesa sostenuta.... colazione inclusa?? Una furbata... la realtà è che se vuoi caffè e un muffin ti va bene ma se con il prezzo che paghi speri di trovare il sognato buffet che ti offre il 99,9 % delle strutture anche a costi inferiori...be' allora evita di prenotare qui!!!!

title: Convenient, clean and comfortable
text: I stayed at the WSH overnight before a morning business meeting, so I was actually on th premises for less than 10 hours.  But I would definitely recommend it for a convenient base in NYC. The room was spacious for the price by Manhattan standards and had all the basic amenities. I didn't have time to try the complimentary continental breakfast, but would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: A nice hotel in the big city
text:
I don't normally pay much attention when reviews talk about the hotel staff but WSH gets lots of comments about the staff. And the do seem friendlier than most chains. 
Our bathroom had a window that opened and let natural light in, too. 
Hotel is in a great location to use the subway, most trips uptown didn't involve a change. 
And of course great restaurants in the neighborhood including one fantastic one right across the street.

title: Hyggelig hotell
text: Et lite men hyggelig hotell med flott beliggenhet. Hyggelig betjening bortsett fra i frokostrestauranten. Vi ventet over en halv time på mat av aller enkleste slag. Rommene og resten av hotellet er derimot både hyggelig og sjarmerende. Dette var tredje gang vi bodde der, og jeg tror vi kommer til å bo der igjen.

title: Great find
text: Loved this hotel. Super clean and very friendly staff. Comfy bed and It was quiet. In a really great part of the city as well. I will definitely be back. I just loved it. It's great Trip Advisor reviews are definitely right on point!!

title: Wonderful surprise in a great part of the city
text: We had an apartment in the Upper West Side for many years.  Now as visitors we were looking to stay somewhere close to the jazz clubs, shopping and restaurants in the Village.  The Washington Square Hotel is a wonderful property.  Rich in history, clean, nicely appointed rooms, and courteous service!  The bar was fabulous also.  We will definitely be back!

title: Awesome Location Terrific Staff Great Neighborhood
text:
We couldn't have been more delighted. The room was small and no great view but... we didn't come to NYC to hang out in the room. 

It''S a completely refurbished 100-year old property. Crisp, clean and with an ever so helpful smiling staff.

If you love to walk you won't find a better location to explore Greenwich Village or walk in the Lower East Side. And there's Washington Square. And when the weather's nice you'll find, buskers, chess players, sidewalk artists and the best of New York -- all right across the street. 

Free continental breakfast and the coffee was excellent. And here's a tip: just one block down the street is a 24 hour restaurant on 8th Avenue. Also, that's where you can catch the subway to Mid Town. Finally, compared to other properties further uptown, the price was friendly.

title: Modernized and retains character
text: Our room was roomy for an older city hotel, and had been nicely modernized. The lobby and commons areas are small but have a warm, traditional feel, The staff was friendly and helpful. Free wifi was good. Parking is available one block away for about $50 per night. Easy walk to Washington Square Park, and lots of little dining spots on the slame block. Cab ride to the theater district (52nd streeet) about $15 plus tip.

title: Sehr gute Lage in Manhattan, kleines Bett
text: Die Metro ist wenige Meter entfernt, auch in Gehdistanz ist vieles erreichbar. Frühstück war inbegriffen, aber zB. Eier und anderes müssen extra bezahlt werden. Der Service war langsam und unaufmerksam. Es gibt neben der Lobby das express breakfast (geht schneller wegen self service). Das Bett war deutlich zu klein. Meine Füsse hingen über (bin 184cm gross) und zu zweit nebeneinander zu liegen ist nur für wenige Tage zumutbar. Sonst war das Zimmer ok. Hotelpersonal ist freundlich und hilfsbereit. Ausnahme ist der unterbeschäftigte, freundlich grüssende Herr, der allen zuschaut, wie sie sich mit schwerem Gepäck die Treppenstufen hoch und durch die Tür kämpfen. Aber er ist nur für security zuständig. Aha..

title: Solid choice; great location
text: Stayed in Room 608 for 1 night.  First visit.  Clean, typical size for NYC, no view (not a surprise), but comfortable and relatively quiet (thanks in large part to the neighborhood). Washington Square neighborhood itself is quaint and almost cozy. Enjoyed the free continental breakfast.  Will come back.

title: Very good hotel at the Washington Square
text: Free breakfast was a value. Rooms differ in quality, som needs an update. Friendly staff. Location perfect, close to subway and good Soho restaurants. We will come back for sure. The Washington Square nearby is filled with people and music.

title: OLD
text: Rooms are roomy and nice but for the price the lobby and common areas need to be redone and cleaned up. Also check in was not on time. Front doorman is very nice and helpful. Qverpriced. Some hotel guests looked very seedy.

title: Great Location
text: I love staying here for the convenience to NYU, the Village, subway, etc., but the bonus is that they have the friendliest staff and I always feel at home here.  Will always stay here if my visit is predominantly centered south of midtown.

title: A gem in a wonderful neighborhood!
text: This was our second time staying at the WSq Hotel and both were simply wonderful. The staff is gracious and ready to help but remember this is a smaller property so there aren't 10 check-in staff like a Hilton! If you want a more relaxed, simple approach in this area of the city you can't go wrong. We had a regular room each stay and it was comfortable, well-appointed and clean --- no issues at all. We spent some time in the basement bar and again, the staff are pleasant, professional and just nice! Here's a tip: We drove into the city on Friday late afternoon and found street parking for a couple of hours. Once it gets to be 6pm though you can park the rest of the weekend right on the street in front of the hotel. I'd suggest you be there by 5:45p though because it can fill up. Enjoy free parking for the weekend! From this hotel we walked to Eataly and to the High Line with no problem (and we're not that young!) as well as the neighborhood. This is our 'go to' hotel for NYC!

title: Getting worn out
text:
My wife and I stay here just about every year.  We like the location and the small but nice included breakfast.  However rooms have always been odd sized, with typical small bathrooms.
This year the person at the front desk told us our room was ready to check in but if we waited an hour we'd get a better room. After walking around a couple hours the room was finally ready.  Unfortunately as it turned out the room made clunking noises most of the night.  After a few nights we figured out it was a hidden elevator.
Also the pillows were too firm and bed was bad , and short?
These days there are too many nicer hotels with GREAT beds and pillows.
I'm afraid that our years of staying here are over.  We already found two new hotels at the same price in good neighborhoods.
As always Ronnie the doorman is nice, as is done of the long term desk staff.  Leudo at breakfast was nice and helpful all week.
We had issues with the restaurant at dinner as well.  Not as great as billed to be.

title: Do not be fooled by the nice video
text: Reserved an Executive King several months ago.  I was foolish enough to prepay for the room .  Showed up at 3pm, the stated check in time.  It is now 3:45pm.  Still waiting.  Told room will be ready in 10 minutes.  Just as it was supposed to be when I checked in.  Manager now says it will be another 25 minutes.  But wait, now it's ready.
