Apparently they had to change the bathroom fixtures!  Wow!  If you don't hear from me again, you may assume everything from this point forward was OK.

title: Very, very nice and eclectic.
text: We were visiting our son who lives in a studio apartment near Washington Square.  This hotel was perfectly located and we were impressed with the whole experience.  The room was cozy, very clean, and the bed was very comfortable.  We slept very well.  The staff was helpful, and delightfully pleasant.  The complimentary breakfast was simple but filled our tummy's and didn't drain our wallet!  I would have liked to have a small frig to put leftovers from some of our meals in, but not a deal breaker.  We never had to wait for an elevator,  Every time we pushed the button it showed up.  We were on the 6th floor.  This is not a Luxury hotel... which we don't care for... so if you want a reasonably priced (for NYC), clean, quaint, and delightful place to stay then this is it.  We LOVED Washington Square Park.  It was enchanting and day or evening, the walk though the park always had something happening.

title: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay
text: My husband and I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel last week for an anniversary trip.  The hotel surprised us with a bottle of champagne in our room.  The room was older but clean.  The staff was very attentive.  We would absolutely stay there again.

title: Very disappointing. Avoid this poorly run hotel.
text: We were excited to stay in the Village for a romantic weekend and, ignoring some of the negative reviews,  splurged on an executive king room at this hotel for about $375 a night. We booked directly through the hotel a few months in advance.  But when we arrived on Friday shortly after check-in time, we were told that the room we had booked was not available.  The best they could do, the front desk clerk said, was to put us in a much smaller room for the first night, then have us move into a larger room for the second right.This was a first -- in my 30 years of business travel, I have never arrived at a hotel to be told that I'd have to take a smaller room than I'd booked, much less have to move rooms in the middle of my stay. And, by the way they added, the smaller room wasn't ready yet, even though it was past check-in time.  We probably reacted too politely, because they then wasted 3 hours of our weekend keeping us waiting for the tiny room to be ready, while they repeatedly told us, "The maid is in there, it'll just be another 30 minutes."  When I asked for a late check out as compensation, they told us they could extend our check out by only 2 hours.  The rooms were very banal, done in muddy colors with skimpy furnishings. Bottom line: at this room rate, there are dozens of better places to stay in Manhattan.  The Washington Square Hotel treats guests terribly and is a rip-off.

title: A little gem in a great neighborhood
text: This hotel is in Greenwich Village, very near Washington Square Park and NYU, and also near the West 4th subway station. It's a little historical gem, with Dylan Thomas and Bob Dylan among other famous prior guests. It's a great value. I asked for their most inexpensive room, and I had a pleasant sunny room with two small beds. The bathroom was small but had a makeup mirror at the right height (this rarely happens). The closet had two bathrobes, an iron and ironing board and an umbrella. The staff was polite. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was that the room cleaning was not optimal. Nothing major, just dust in the corners, not hanging up the bathrobe, etc. Other than this, it was perfect.

title: All Around Diamond
text:
Great Location, Subway is just a block away and can get you anywhere in the city
Helpful staff, providing their personal insights and experiences if asked.
Great restaurant on site providing delicious breakfasts sensibly priced
Room was beautifully furnished. Bathroom is a little tight but adequate. 
Cannot wait to return.

title: Brilliant location, nice staff
text:
We had a very enjoyable three nights at this hotel. The place itself is quite an old building and a bit dated but as a base for exploring the city it is very good and I would definitely stay there again. The room was perfectly good although I would recommend getting a room with a view as the one we had was a bit claustrophobic. However if you are not going to spend much time in the room during the day it's not a big deal. 

Washington Square is seconds away and is lovely. There was always stuff going on - buskers etc - and it's nice to go for a stroll. When it's warm there is good shade too. Location wise it's within a mile of the Hudson River, the Highline and nearby West Village on one side. Less than a mile to East Village, union square/Gramercy area and Soho in the other directions. Very close to subway stop too. 

Staff were always very friendly and helpful and the breakfast which was included was pretty good.

title: Deja vu
text: Professional staff who were courteous, helpful and above all friendly; i personally could not have asked for more considering this was my first visit to this great city; the surrounding area to this hotel is beautiful, stunning and ideal for wherever you wish to visit in Manhattan; the rooms were fine, comfy, welcoming, and had the amenities of a gym, bar, restaurant at your disposal along with a continental breakfast which is included in the cost of the hotel.

title: Loud
text: There has been very little attempt to screen out noise from other guests in a rickety hotel with loud footfalls above (not to mention from the streets outside, especially if you are on a low floor). Avoid and look for someplace better if you can.

title: Great location and the hotel has charm
text:
Overall I still much like this place.  Have stayed here many times and most everyone working there is very congenial.  That does not  evidently mean that if I have an early arrival  as I did  last week at 10:00 anyone  will make  the necessary call  to get me into a room before  2:40,  or  that  even then  I would get the  type of room that I'd  requested  and that they were in fact planning to give me ( a room facing Sixth away from street noise) which not ready.  Won't  hurry  back,  but won't give up on the WSH. 
First day there was some chaos w all bars closed at 5:30 when I'd arranged to meet a friend and neither of us had much time for running around the nabe. Had a drink at the basement level Lounge the next night  and was dismayed and  really repelled by the egoism of the manager there who was socializing with a friend there at the bar, loudly , at length  and I'd say unprofessionally -  as if in his own kitchen.  I would never spend another moment in that room if I see him.  Otherwise,  have always  enjoyed the cuisine here.  Sadly they no longer include croissants w breakfast.

title: Well situated hotel in fairly quiet area.
text:
We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in October 2016. The foot print is surprisingly small for a hotel with connections to a number of famous people over the decades. We were on the 9th floor and had peaceful nights. The air conditioner was not intrusive ( required during an unseasonal warm spell) and there was a safe included in the room, which was an 'adequate' size as you would expect from a period building. Washington Square has historic buildings all round, many of which are occupied by New York University. Location wise, it is just 5 minutes from 6th Ave/W4 subway.
The slightdown side was the extremely compact area designated for breakfast, although we did not have to wait long for one of the few tables to become available. Item selection was OK, but some items do run out and do not get replaced very promptly.

title: Historic, Great location, Huge room
text: This is a historic hotel - former guests include Bob Dylan, Rolling Stones etc. It is sort of Art Deco. We were amazed by the size of the room for a NY hotel. Bathroom looked brand new. Continental breakfast was ample. Right near Washington Square Park which merits a walk thru. Just a block away from W 4th st. station where you could get trains to all areas. Will definitely stay there on our next trip to NY.

title: NY fore the first time with family
text: I have been to NY several times for business trips and had promised myself that I should give my family the experience to lie on the lawn in front of the Statue of Liberty. In this context, we booked the hotel on the recommendation of friends and we were not disappointed. Not a Hilton hotel, but a reasonable hotel in decent distance for the most part with OK room (double Queen bed, which was probably too little for four people), and please serviceminded staff and an OK break first buffet.

title: Good location, large room!
text: Very conveniently well situated in lower Manhattan - was able to quickly access subway and PATH lines to business meetings, dining and entertainment.  Room was the biggest that I have ever seen in my stays in NYC.  Staff was pleasant and helpful, assisting in numerous tasks.  Great rate as well!

title: מלון נעים ביותר במרכז העניינים
text: מלון במיקום מעולה!!! צוות המלון אדיב ונעים מאוד. בימי ראשון מתקיים ברחוב שוק דוכנים נחמד. ממליץ לא לקחת חדר סטנדרטי בסיסי, שווה להשקיע עוד קצת ולקבל חדר בקומות העליונות עם נוף לניו יורק. מאוד נהננו מהמלון.

title: Quirky independent historic hotel
text:
Hotel is steps away from the great people watching in Washington Square. Even though we had reservations & said we would be arriving early, we had to wait until after 4 pm for our room. But it was a larger one for the hotel & with a window, so perhaps it was worth it. We stopped back several times in the afternoon and at one point enjoyed free fresh-squeezed lemonade & homemade cookies in the bar area with other guests. The staff was mixed, some were really friendly, some were rather cold. The doorman was quite friendly, but we never had help up all the various stairs in the hotel with our luggage. We also had to catch a cab ourselves. 

Our room was on the 2nd floor and there were 3 steps half way down the hall that we had to carry our luggage over. Room amenities are good. Lots of fluffy towels! Room's safe was too small for a laptop, but fine for iPad. Breakfast was part of room cost, and quite good: scones, muffins, bagels, fresh fruit, yogurt, orange juice, tea, coffee. Room was comfortable.

The hotel is a short block from West 4th Street Subway Station where trains A, C, E, B, D, F, M go through. Just a 10-15 minute subway ride to Times Square, Rockefeller Center. Mario Battali's upscale Babbo restaurant is across the street. We enjoyed Battali's OTTO restaurant a few blocks away. Hotel's restaurant with a Sunday jazz brunch looked good. It was busy. Lots of great bars/ performing spaces nearby: Blue Note, Cafe Wa?, Public Theater, NYU Skirball Center, Comedy Cellar, etc. Close to NYU. On the hotel's website you can find several neighborhood guides in .pdf format to download. The hotel does have decent wifi, but it didn't need a password for access so it's not secure.

We usually had our window slightly open at night. We didn't mind the noise of people walking by and a few cars driving by. But if that bothers you, perhaps ask for a windowless room.

We took a car that the hotel arranged to travel back to Newark Airport. Cost: $75 including $20 in tolls. Travel time: 35 minutes. Cash only.

I didn't receive an email welcoming me a day before I arrived, which would have been helpful. But then, this is not a corporate hotel. It's very independent and that is part of its appeal, along with a great location that feels more like living in the city than staying in a hotel

title: Lovely hotel
text: The staff were wonderful, very welcoming. The hotel is fabulous. location was perfect, right next to Washington Square Park, which is lovely.  In the heart of Greenwich Village.  Would highly recommend.

title: Superb Hotel
text: Stayed for 2 nights at the beginning of October with my sisters.  From checking in to checking out, service was impeccable.  3 of us shared a room on the 1st floor and there was enough room for us all.  Could hardly hear any noise from outside.   The complementary toiletries were fabulous.  Even tried to buy them online when I got home but not available in the UK. Sadly I found out once home that I could have bought them a few blocks away from the hotel.   The Art Deco style of the hotel is lovely.  So much better than more expensive hotels.  The concierge on every morning was very charming and helpful.  The complementary breakfasts were good and the staff were very helpful in assisting one of my sisters who eats a gluten free diet with her choices.   Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

title: Lovely stay
text: We stayed here for 5 wonderful nights. The position is fabulous and we loved walking around the whole area as there is so much history and quirky places to see. It is around the corner from Washington Square Park where we listened to jazz and classical music being played and it is close to the subway as well as buses if you want to travel elsewhere. We paid extra for an executive room which was totally worth it as it was renovated and had plenty of space. Even though we heard a bit of noise at times it was quiet most of the time. We enjoyed the included breakfast in the restaurant as well as a nice dinner and drinks some afternoons. We had previously stayed in a top hotel in midtown but much prefer the atmosphere of this hotel as well as the area. We will certainly return on our next visit.

title: It was nice and good location for lower manhattan
text: nice service, ok price, great location clean room ,beautiful tile work on walls. the breakfast was not to extravagant, continental but good and easy to get to. I wish they had parking, or a deal arranged with a lot. but it was close by.

title: 40th birthday celebration
text:
Stayed here for the weekend to celebrate my 40th birthday, great location on 4th street with easy access to tube stations.
Lovely boutique hotel which is opposite Washington Square Park, nice views with plenty of trees and squirrels.
Only down side is that I couldn't stay longer, will definitely return.

title: Nice and Quiet
text: Even in New York city you can find a nice quiet hotel.  Washington Square Hotel is situated in the village and worked out very well for my recent visit to NYC.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  Like most NY hotels the rooms are small, but the room was tastefully decorated and clean.

title: Wonderful location in the heart of Greenwich Village
text:
A wonderful hotel in the heart of Greenwich village has a perfect location on the Square. We were college shopping in NYC and this spot gave us a chance to savor the NYU ambience and with subway stops just steps away we had access to everywhere else in the city.
Our room was very clean and stocked. This hotel is a little old and dated but is quite charming and has a very European feel.
The staff was friendly and very helpful.
Thank you, Washington Square, we will return!

title: A few days in New York City
text: We stayed at this hotel for our first ever trip to New York. The staff were helpful and polite. Our room was spotless and the bathroom well equipped. Breakfast was a buffet style in quite a small room, that would be my only reservation with this hotel, although on our last morning we were seated in the restaurant beneath the hotel because the hotel was fully booked which was fine. The hotel is just around the corner from a subway so attractions can easily be reached. Ideal hotel for a few days in NYC.

title: Bien situé
text: Super bien situé au coin nord est du square. Les chambres pas très grandes, avec coffre mais sans frigo, ménage et propreté ok. Prix a partir de 300€: cher pour des Europeens mais normal pour NY. Petit déj. "continental" compris mais digne d'un 2* á 50€ pres d'une gare de province profonde! Personnel parfois sympathique mais pas très arrangeant. Malgré tout à recommander pour son emplacement et son rapport offre/prix.

title: Doen!
text: Klantvriendelijk, schone kamer, goede bedden, leuke wijk, vlakbij metro, goede ligging: bij park en bij fifth avenue. Inclusief westers ontbijt. Vriendelijk bediening. Wij hadden kamer op 8ste verdieping. Badkamer met goede douche en ook een bad. Uitzicht op Empire state building.

title: Parfait !
text: Excellent hôtel très bien situé dans le quartier de Greenwich. Dans une rue calme a 2 pas du métro (station assez centrale qui permet de rejoindre facilement tous les lieux incontournables) et du parc et bar restaurants pour sortir le soir. , personnel adorable, chambre spacieuse et propre. Petit déjeuner très bon ! Bref on recommande !

title: Nära det mesta!
text: Mysigt med trevlig personal.  Nära tunnelbanan och mitt i underbara Greenwich. Missa inte Bleeker Street. Förvånansvärt bra frukost som ingår. Lagom stora rum med lite ljud från gatan och sängar som glider isär.

title: Great location
text: I recommend this hotel, friendly staff, we had a nice room with view over the front street of the hotel. Perfect location for us. We will probably stay at this hotel on our next trip to NY. The only downside is the price was on the higher side.

title: Great location great boutique hotel
text: I lived near this hotel for a few years and moved away. I visit NY frequently and always stay there. Fantastic staff. Very pleasant and great attitude. Always helpful and accommodating.  Nostalgic old world charm.  Rooms have been renovated, some bigger than others and the bigger ones are substantially larger than other NY hotels. Reasonably priced for NY. It books fast so look early but call the hotel frequently my experience is that you have a good chance of getting a room.

title: Great place to stay
text: We loved the neighborhood which is lively and beautiful with great restaurants and bars. Convenient to lots of sites and other neighborhoods. Our room was fine, clean and comfortable. No view but no traffic noise!

title: Fabulous Stay!!!!!
text:
This was a great hotel. The location is perfect. Near great bars, restaurants, the park, etc. The staff here is tremendous. I saw a couple reviews where people talked poorly about the staff. I cannot even fathom how that is even possible for anyone to have anything negative to say about these people. 

We were greeted every single time we passed through the lobby. The doorman offered us unsolicited advice on some fun places to go.....which we thought was awesome. We didn't even have to ask:) They gave us a late checkout at no extra charge. The sweet lady who took care of our room made it look so nice and welcoming every time we returned. The maintenance man was so nice and friendly. Honestly, everyone there just exuded warmth and hospitality. But the cherry on top... One of the front desk employees (he had a unique name and I cannot remember it) told us to go to a club called Cafe Wha to hear the band. Not only did we have a blast, but when we returned, he had gone to Insomnia Cookies when he got off work and gotten us a box of cookies and had left them at the front desk for us. Who does that???? Seriously....WOW!

Our room was awesome. This was a girls weekend. We had the 2 doubles room. It was a corner room and for NYC it was huge. There were lots of windows which even opened. The decor was trendy. Super comfy beds and linens. Bath robes. The bathroom was incredible. I kept reading comments about the shower in other people's reviews and all I can say is that now I get it. Loved the tile, the lighting, the double sinks, the windows, the water pressure, etc. There were plenty of mirrors and counter space for 4 women to get ready simultaneously. I did see another 2 double room and it was much smaller, so be sure to request a corner room. The building heat had not been turned on yet and we were freezing. They had another room they could move us to that had an individually controlled thermostat. We checked it out but opted to stay in our larger room. When we returned they had brought a portable heater in and our room was toasty. Every night when we returned, they had come in and turned our heater on for us.

They do offer a complimentary continental breakfast. It's yogurt, granola, fruit, toast, muffins, coffee, tea, etc. 

So, YES, we will be back to this hotel sometime.

title: Be careful who you book through.
text: I booked this hotel on 8/6/2016 for three nights 9/27/2016 through 9/30 through Trip Advisor. I was given a confirmation number and a price for the three nights. When my sister and I arrived at the hotel on 9/27 they had no reservation with that confirmation number and no booking under Trip Advisor. We were very confused and upset. However, The Washington  Square staff were wonderful, found a room and honored the price quoted by Trip Advisor which was less than the price that day. This is a great location with friendly efficient staff, around the corner from the station and breakfast daily. Rooms are a little small but that adds to the character. I will recommend this hotel but will not book through Trip Advisor.

title: A New York Overnight stay
text: Great hotel! Service was awesome. Very clean. Charles at front desk put us in an u believable room. It was large, king size bed very comfortable. Large updated bathroom. We had the windows open and it was quiet! The doorman (wish we remembered his name, Reggie?) Free continental breakfast was good too! Was superb with his knowledge, friendliness and helpfulness. Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Perfect home from home
text:
I cannot fault this place, we stayed here for 8 nights and have never felt more at home. From the moment we arrived we were warmly welcomed by Ronnie who was always on hand to offer any information we needed about the city, such a great character, himself along with all of the hotel staff really made us welcome. We were in the city to celebrate my birthday and they had even left a bottle of prosecco in our room with a Birthday message. 
  We had asked for a room with a newly refurbished bathroom which was lovely and clean with a great shower, the room was big enough for us to feel at home for our whole stay without being cramped with a really comfortable bed and great air con. 
    The continental Breakfast in the North Square restaurant was also accompanied with great service, plenty to choose from off the menu rather than buffet style which we loved. 
   We really fell in love with the location of the hotel, you really feel as if you are in a village within the city, countless lovely bars and restaurants near by and great subway links to wherever you want to go, I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Excellent hôtel et emplacement
text:
Emplacement idéal pour être au milieu de tout et tranquille à la fois. Le Washington Square Park est à quelques pas - nous avons découvert et adoré ce parc pour son ambiance étudiante relaxe.

Le service à l'hôtel était impeccable et courtois. Le lobby est les espaces communs sont charmants. Les chambres sont effectivement petites mais pas au point de nous avoir causé un désagrément. Le lit king était très confortable, la chambre et la salle de bain propres, de bon goût et à la hauteur des attentes.

Seul petit point négatif - le petit déjeuner continental. Fonctionnel et de base. Rien de bien grave mais potentielle amélioration!

title: Quaint hotel
text:
Great location very quiet room. Comfy bed.  Room on smallish side.  Staff very helpful!
Air conditioning worked great..
Agree with some of other comments that the common areas/hallways etc could use some improvement; overall a very nice stay!

title: Suverent
text: Meget koselig hotell, suveren service og særdeles hyggelig beliggenhet. Dette er virkelig en oase midt inne  i denne verdensmetropolen, hvor man kan trekke seg tilbake, nyte roen og ta innover seg mektige inntrykk fra livet utenfor, før en igjen begir seg ut i denne byen som så til de grader er fyllt opp av energi, atmosfære og grenseløst med morsomme muligheter.

title: Great Base for NYU
text: This is a lovely hotel, staffed by warm and friendly people. The room was pretty small, but very comfortable, and a simple, but tasty continental breakfast included with your booking. If you are visiting NYU, this is the perfect base. My only complaint was an awful smell in our room that never went away! I did mention it to the front desk, and they told me that our floor was due for renovation.

title: Favorite NY hotel!
text: Just returned from our fourth stay at Washington Square Hotel and it still exceeds our expectations! We love the friendly, helpful staff who always ask about our day and seem genuinely interested in hearing about our adventures in the city! The hotel is quaint and cozy with a very European feel. The rooms are on the small side, but the lighting is great, the beds are very comfortable, and the dressing table in the bedroom is perfect for doing hair and makeup. Light breakfast, including yogurt & granola, cut fruit, assorted bagels and muffins is included and the perfect way to start the day. A full service restaurant is also available. Located diagonally across from the beautiful Washington Square, this little gem is a haven from the hustle and bustle of New York. We sleep soundly without the interruption of frequent sirens and car horns, yet we are only a block or two in either direction from the subway, restaurants, etc. This little boutique hotel, with its charm and character, always brings a smile to my face!

title: In need of some TLC
text:
Reading through other reviews here, much is said about room size but which for us was fine - perhaps smaller than we've seen elsewhere in the US but travelling from the UK, I've seen (and stayed in) much much smaller! And looking through the website, we were drawn to the charm this hotel must have exuded considering the guests it has welcomed over the years. Sadly, though, I've deliberately used the past tense here as, whilst the bedrooms & great bathrooms are clean & tidy the corridors and landings remain in a past age (and not a particularly nice past age!) with Artex swirls on the walls and day glow 70's carpets all well past their best. In fact none of the communal areas we saw were particularly inviting.
Breakfast, on both days we stayed had rather surly staff in attendance whilst you had a DIY breakfast with little or no attempt at presentation - plastic pots of fruit and granola, quartered bagels (that got lost at the bottom of the toaster!) all of which was fresh and tasty even if the surroundings were a little institutional in atmosphere.
All-in-all it felt like a hotel which has in the past been lovely but which now is suffering from a lack of investment. With that investment it could surely return to being a gorgeous boutique hotel, but at the moment I'm afraid simply remains ripe for improvement.

title: Great location, warm welcome, slept soundly.
text:
A great location close to Greenwich Village yet not very far to walk to meat-packing district or Battery park. This is a wonderful place to stay with friendly helpful staff and an excellent adjoining restaurant at North Square, where we ate twice.
Our room was clean, not too small, comfortable and quiet. 
The place also has a bit of history!

title: closest hotel next to NYU
text: I like Washington Square. I have stayed here many times and really love that it is so convenient to NYU. Having said that, the rooms are cozy(small), lower floors are noisy, very clean and comfortable beds.  The front desk is friendly and helpful. This hotel is old and feels old, but I like that.  Art Deco. The restaurant is  good, but there are so many wonderful restaurants in the neighborhood.  I will stay here again and again while my son attends NYU.

title: Charming!
text: During a recent trip to New York, my friend and I decided to stay in Greenwich Village and found the Washington Square Hotel.  The staff were extremely friendly and were eager to help with suggestions for restaurants and things to do in the evening.  The hotel is charming!  The rooms are on the smaller side but very clean and the beds are SO comfortable.  It reminds me of a boutique hotel that you might find in Europe.  We will definitely stay here again.

title: Location and value
text:
WSH is in a great location, on the NE corner of Washington Square Park.  Cool lobby (deco) and overall vibe. Concierge service that is uber helpful. Decent gym with a Cybex machine. Epic value for NYC. Breakfast included. Connected to a fine little bar and lounge. 

Minuses: rooms run from small to tiny. No comfortable seating in room. (Just a tiny grade school chair. But that is all that would fit). Claustrophobic hallways that echo every conversation and door slam. 

But I quibble. Overall a good experience and great value.

title: Great Location with a Friendly Staff
text: If you want to experience Greenwich Village this is your hotel! Located next to Washington Square Park The Washington Square Hotel is right in the heart of the village. The rooms are small (most rooms in NYC are) but very clean, and the staff is exceptionally friendly and willing to point out great restaurants and points of interest. If you are looking for the Village experience this is your place.

title: A simple and pleasant hotel in a good location
text: This is a well run clean and friendly hotel. Whilst you wouldn't describe it as smart it's well maintained and the staff are very helpful and welcoming. Our room was plain and compact but a perfectly nice place to be for the few hours that we were actually in it.  Its big advantage is its location which is well placed for visiting uptown or downtown and of course Greenwich its self with its boho charm and great jazz clubs. Overall we were very pleased with it as a place to base ourselves and will go back when we visit the city again.

title: Enjoyed our stay
text: We have been staying at this Hotel on and off over the past 10years. We like its location, the friendly staff and its overall services. It is not expensive by NY standards. It is historic and the rooms aren't large but they are clean and comfortable. We feel welcome when we stay here.

title: Great location, ok hotel
text: Very good location, close to metro and a park. The hotel room was in good condition, the hall smelled a bit old. Smiley and friendly staff. Included breakfast is fair enough. I'd come back to this hotel.

title: Ottimo soggiorno!
text:
L'hotel è situato in una posizione eccellente, di fianco al parco di Greenwich Village e vicino alla Fifth Avenue e a Broadway. Anche la metro è molto vicina. 
Ottima camera, buona colazione, trattamento completo e accogliente.
Tutto molto positivo.

title: Amazing!!!
text: I usually never leave reviews but I couldn't help myself with this one!!! The staff was incredibly welcoming and catered to our every single need all throughout our stay. Our room was big enough for my boyfriend and I, the view was great, and it was CLEAN! We honestly have no complaints about this hotel. The location was perfect for our needs. I would LOVE to come back again and stay longer!!! If you're looking for a hotel in New York...look no further!!! This is it!!

title: Terrible room
text: My room was the worst I have ever seen: small, damp, no daylight, and very noisy once people moved in the room above. The location is great, the breakfast (continental) is fine, the staff moderately efficient (10 minutes to check me in; the cleaning staff will turn on the AC very low even if you turn it off).

title: Wonderful Hotel and Great Location
text: Spent roughly 10 days in New York City right after Thanksgiving staying at the Washington Square Hotel.  The Hotel's amenities were wonderful and the staff were extremely helpful and knowledgeable.  The rooms were small but that is typical of rooms in New York City.  The hotel was in walking distance of Greenwich Village and lots of activities were to be found nearby.  I definitely would recommend this hotel.

title: Charming hotel with hospitable, friendly staff....great place to stay!
text: With a fantastic location in Greenwich Village, the Washington Square Hotel offers a cozy, comfortable place to stay. Ronnie, who greets you at the door, makes you feel welcome to this NYC gem. We will definitely stay here again.

title: The door is opened and a different world is there!
text:
This hotel is a gem in the city. 

The location is unbeatable because Washington Square is almost part of your room.
The team at the hotel is lovely and always always trying to help and they do help a lot!

Again, a place to visit and stay and relax!

title: MAGNIFICA UBICACION, TRATO PERSONAL Y AGRADABLE
text: Excelente ubicación , junto a Washington Square, en pleno Village, en una zona tranquila , muy bonita, y a la vez con muy divertido ambiente. El hotel es muy limpio y el edificio es bonito por dentro, se trata de un antiguo edifico muy bien rehabilitado. El personal es muy amable. El desayuno suficiente y muy correcto. Repetiría sin duda.

title: weekend stay
text:
great location walk to the attractions ofgreenwich village and easy walk to the whitney museum
friendly and attentive staff
clean room and very comfortable beds
the subway is close by for longer distance exploration

title: Great option - salty, indifferent staff
text: This is a great hotel; the rooms are a nice size for NYC. The location is wonderful, the facilities more than adequate. However, the staff were a bit indifferent. We checked in at 1:00pm and were told our room would be ready at 3, which was fine and expected. We came back around 3:15 and our room was still not ready. The daytime doorman was odd. However, the weekend doorman was great - friendly, informative, etc. Overall, this is a great hotel with mediocre staff.

title: A bit of history, wonderful stay, wonderful location
text: My husband and I took a one-night trip to the city for our anniversary. We stayed at this hotel and it was perfect! exactly what we were looking for. It was an old, quaint hotel, small rooms (but we werent in the room much as Greenwich Village was right downstairs!) and helpful staff. We honestly had no complaints except that we were put in a room right next to the elevator (old elevators = super loud), so we asked to switch rooms, and they did it without a problem!  We went to the Comedy Cellar right around the corner which was awesome, awesome awesome, and then didnt have a long walk back to the hotel!

title: charmless hotel
text: Small, boring, terribly designed room. It feels and smells like a cheap hotel. Its clean and the people are friendly and the location is nice. If you don't care about style or price this hotel might work for you.

title: Lovely one night stay
text: We stayed at this hotel for one night and were very comfortable.  We were 4 people in the room, and the beds were full size, the sheets were incredibly soft, the bathroom very large with 2 sinks and great water pressure.  There was a coffee maker (Keurig), we were able to watch the Olympics on tv, and we had a good time.  The staff were very kind, and there was a delicious complimentary breakfast where the staff brought the food offerings to your table in the downstairs restaurant.  Overall, a very lovely experience.  Definitely recommend.

title: If it was good enough for Bob Dylan........!
text:
Located in Greenwich Village, this small art deco hotel is a home from home after a day's sightseeing in New York City. Washington Square Park is very close, as is New York University. The subway is only a few minutes' walk and a variety of eateries are also within a short walking distance.

Our hotel room was small but clean and the ensuite had a large shower area. The restaurant and bar are compact and intimately decorated. A continental style breakfast is included in the overall price, which makes a stay here very reasonable by NYC standards. An a-la-carte breakfast can be purchased but we found the inclusive breakfast to be quite sufficient.

The staff are attentive and friendly and a special thank you must go to Ronnie who provided us daily with a list of local attractions.

This is not a hotel for guests who prefer the bright lights and party atmosphere of other NYC hotels. For guests who like personal and professional customer service, an intimate and cosy atmosphere, then look no further than the Washington Square Hotel.

title: Love this hotel!!
text: WSH has a wonderful location-- subway station at end of the block--and just steps from Washington Square  and many good restaurants in the Village.The hotel staff is friendly and helpful and great with directions. It has an on-site restaurant that Is charming for  breakfast and amazing for dinner!! If you like dessert, try some of the fabulous  creations of the pastry chef -- oh my!!

title: Sentimental Favorite
text: We love this hotel because of its charm and location, and because we stayed here often some years ago when our daughter was in college at NYU. Staff is friendly and the rooms are very comfortable. Only criticism is the price has certainly gone up and the room had an odd musty spell. However it was an extremely hot week in the city so it may have just been the extreme humidity. Breakfast was excellent.

title: Au top !
text:
Rien à dire : très bon accueil (avec un gardien génial à l'entrée), de belles chambres et idéalement placée niveau transports, un personnel efficace après un petit problème dans la salle de bain géré en 15 minutes.

Des commerces et Un parc à côté en prime, du wifi nickel...

Je recommande !! 

Congratulations !

title: Dyrt utan kvalitet
text: Sängar som spånplattor. Rummet doftaprayat så att vi var tvungna att byta rum. Vi märkte då varför man doftaprayat.  En svag doft av mögel kändes i rummet. Rum utan fönster trots dryga $230 per natt. Fint läge dock.

title: Disappointing
text:
A charming, bijou hotel, ideally situated on the edge of Washington Square, it is great for a short stay of a few nights or a weekend, but no more. The room was very small, with limited luggage space, a wardrobe big enough for no more than 6 hangers, and equally minimal drawer space. The bathroom, however, was spacious. A limited view from the window.

Breakfast was simple, but adequate and you had to get there early to find a place to sit.

All the staff were charming and helpful.

Overall, I was disappointed with our stay. For the cost, I am sure I could have found somewhere of a higher standard, better located and cheaper. It is not what I consider to be a "Tourist's" hotel.

title: Summer vacation
text: Stay here twice in the summer, good location, breakfast buffet not so good. The rooms are small, the staff - some very helpful some seemed unhappy in their jobs, not sure why. would probably stay here again.

title: big room in the big city
text: Modern boutique hotel in an awesome location in Manhattan. Had a great one night stay in this hotel.  Huge room for the city with the nicest shower I have ever had in a hotel.  The complimentary breakfast was limited and in a small space but well presented and offered take out bags for those on the go. Highly recommend.

title: Charming boutique hotel
text: This hotel is in an excellent location just off Washington Square Park. It has a lot of charm, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are not large, but they are comfortable. Many New York hotels have very small bathrooms, but the ones in this hotel are normal sized. There is a free continental breakfast as well, and also free wifi. A good choice if you want a hotel in Greenwich Village.

title: Location! Location! Location!
text: The Washington Square Hotel is boutique hotel right on the north corner of Washington Square park. This European style hotel is steps away from the subway, great restaurants and New York University. The rooms are small with an Art Deco feel. Their prices are reasonable and it even includes breakfast!

title: Interesting place
text:
My boyfriend and I visited the Washibgton Square Hotel as it was recommended by a friend of a family. While the hotel is nice in appearance and decor, the rooms are extremely small and hallways to narrow to walk and move with luggage. The bellman was very nice and access to touristic areas within walking or driving distance. I would recommend to people if interesting on visiting Tine Swuare, Central Park or Rockerfeller Center, please chose a closer hotel to these landmarks. Can fairs scan be very expensive and you can invest on the hotel stay instead of cabs fairs. 

The hotel offer continental breakfast and it's quiet lively and quiet place to have coffee before starting your journey. The other couple staying with us exoerience bathroom noises and they were unable to sleep. We experience the street noise until late hours! 

Overall, it was nice but next time I would stay near Time Square!!!!

title: Excellent location
text:
Washington Square Hotel is maybe not the most up to date hotel in the city, but it is small enough to feel cozy, it has really helpful staff, nice bar, good breakfast and good pricing.

Rooms are not very large, and not all of them have great view, but they are all very clean and comfortable.

Greatest value of this hotel by far is its location; Washington square park is the very heart of New York city and living there while visiting is simply imperative. This hotel have one of the very best locations in the city if you want to feel the city (and you should).

I have been in New York many times, and stayed in this hotel (which is my very first choice when booking) few times (not always due to room avaliability).

title: Excelente localização e custo-benefício
text:
Localizado junto ao Washington Square Park, no meio do Village, a pé do Soho, 4 estações de metrô próximas; com a New York University no entorno.
Atendimento eficaz e cordial, café da manhã incluído na diária, o que é raro na cidade. Café continental bem servido caso queira paga-se um adicional para buffet.
Amenidades do quarto acima da média, é um hotel histórico muito charmoso.
Excelente custo benefício.
Excelente opção para quem quer se sentir como um novaiorquino.
Recomendo

title: Amazing location, in the heart of the Village, attentive staff and great value for money!
text: New York has that most amazing of properties, which is to do with the fact that, no matter when you go, and no matter how many new beds in town may have been added thanks to new hotels being built etc., it is always an expensive place to stay, particularly if you want to stay outside of touristy Times Square. I had been recommended this place by friends, and I love the Village and just generally Lower Manhattan (Lower East side, Chelsea, the Meatpacking district, SoHo, etc.), so I decided to give it a try for what was at the time very reasonable rates. I must say, the hotel's location is amazing, right on the same Washington Square where Bob Dylan used to go for inspiration, and on a very quiet, leafy street (for New York that is!). Staff were very friendly and always helpful, and the free breakfasts, whilst not sophisticated, offer plenty of choice and gives you that extra unexpected value. Rooms are of course small (this is New York after all!), 'in-room entertainment' is provided by an old TV, and the style of the property, whilst recently refurbished, is still slightly quaint and bordering on the kitsch. Make no mistake, this is not a 5-star hotel, or a 4-star at that, but it does deliver a great experience as an extremely good 3-star hotel, in the cut-throat competitiveness of NYC, and for that it should be commended!!

title: Perfect for NYU visit
text: My niece and I were in NYC so she could tour NYU.  It was the perfect location for visiting the campus and getting a feel for the surrounding neighborhood.  There was a blue and orange line subway within a 2 minute walk that made getting to other parts of the city a snap and we felt very comfortable walking back to the hotel from the train station.  The doorman was so friendly and every time he saw us offered a suggestion for someplace to eat, get a drink or see a band.  Our room on the 7th floor was a good size for NYC and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was the standard continental with fruit, yogurt and pastries.  I was trying to book a car service to take us to NewarK Airport but was having trouble doing so on my phone so I called the front desk (at 1 am) and I so glad I did.  They were able to have a car for us the next morning at 11 am AND they saved me about $30 from what the website was charging.  They also have umbrellas in the room that you can borrow which came in very handy since it did rain the one day we were there.

title: Lovely hotel in great location
text: Stayed 6 nights. Location was fantastic, having the Park so close was a real bonus.  The park a lovely place to spend some time on a sunny afternoon, always lots of entertainment happening. Hotel check in was good, asked for a room with a view and was told we could get one in 2 days time which we did. First room was small but very clean. Next room we had a side view of the park, lovely new modern bathroom and room slightly bigger. Housekeeping was excellent as was Wi Fi. The continental breakfast in restaurant was nice.  We found lobby staff always cheerful and helpful. Loved walking around the neighbourhood, felt safe at all times and would certainly stay here again. Overall a terrific hotel in a great part of New York.

title: Jewel of a hotel in a great location
text: Spent 4th of July weekend at this hotel and it far exceeded my expectations. Could be because we were upgraded for our 30th anniversary which was lovely and unexpected. But the nicer room aside, the hotel was clean, safe, well staffed and in a terrific location. The front desk and bell hop were always available and so helpful. Easy to reach all things in the West Village area and easy to get to the subway. Continental breakfast was included and quite good... fresh squeezed OJ, bagels, fruit, good tea selection, yogurt, etc. Would totally return. A gem of a small hotel.

title: Nice but nothing special
text: Great location.  Room are quite small but not tiny.  Everything is very clean.  Nice amenities.  But hotel has no real personality.   It is just a place to sleep.  Eat the complementary breakfast in the restaurant and NOT in the hotel lobby.  Restaurant much nicer environment and wait staff extremely friendly and helpful.  Check in  and housekeeping service very friendly but slow.  We tried to check in at noon.  Told to come back at 3.  We came back at 5 and our room was still not ready.  First day we were here went out for 7 hours.  Came back to our room at 3.30.  Room had still not been made up.   We had paid extra for a queen bed.  They gave us a full and said they didn't have any queens available.  Didn't do anything to compensate us.

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel in Greenwich Village
text: Bordering the Park as it does helps give the hotel an ambience of quaint yet refined. The interior was warm and the front desk staff always friendly. Other reviewer have said rooms were small but ours seemed adequate with the queen bed. Our bed was a little hard but not too bad, and everything was quite clean. The bathroom was also reasonably sized. The continental breakfast, in room coffee, gym and bath amenities were also nice to have. We loved being able to walk around the neighborhood and park, and everything felt reasonably secure. The room we had was on the back of the hotel and very quiet too. We would recommend going to the restaurant for breakfast, as it seemed a tad more civil and friendly than the reception room off the lobby. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and will come here again!

title: 40th wedding anniversary
text: We have stayed in this hotel many times.  Perfect location. Once the staff knows you, you feel very welcome. It's a lovely hotel. The king executive is a favorite room.  There is a complementary continental breakfast.

title: Great Stay
text: My girlfriend and I stayed here for the first time over Pride weekend. The room was just the right size. The room didn't feel like a small box, which is always a win in the city. We got a nice little vanity, a coffee maker, drawers, two night tables, a small closet and all the amenities like soap and shampoo and a hair dryer. We were on the 7th floor right next to the elevator, which I was nervous about cause I figured there would be a lot of noise, but it was quiet both nights. The elevator was a bit small, but the lobby is super nice and the eating area for breakfast was a decent size. They serve a breakfast and a brunch. For the breakfast they had bagels, orange juice, scones, fruit cups, coffee, tea and yogurt with the option of a granola cup to go. Everything was good! The staff were all super friendly and its too bad we found out late, but one of the staff said the hotel has a rooftop area on the 9th floor! That would of been nice to see, but we found out right before check out. The paint in the tub was also a but chipped, but other than that no complaints! So don't miss out. The hotel is also conveniently located around the block from the Pride parade route, subway and Washington Square Park so a great location!

title: Average at best
text:
First time at this hotel.  It is old, tired and feels dirty.  
Came in tired and arrived at check in time and were told that we had been upgraded.  Great!!! The only issue would be that we had to wait a few minutes for the room to be ready.  TWO hours later we were in the room.  It was roomy for a NYC hotel but it was cheaply furnished and everything felt worn out including the bed. 
The restaurant and bar was up and don a rat's maze of corridors and stairs and average at best.  
The bell staff was great but the rest of the staff was disinterested and not engaged. 
We won't be back.

title: Vintage con anima
text: Albergo dai prezzi ragionevoli e posizionato meravigliosamente. Arredamento  art déco, spazi ristretti, moquette ovunque. Il punto è che questo hotel non ha niente di design, non è fashion, non è trendy, ma ha una cosa impagabile: si respira un'atmosfera beat: il posto ha un'anima anni 70 che a me è piaciuta molto. Letti comodissimi e ambienti puliti. Personale molto gentile e non mieloso. Tornerò sicuramente.

title: Weekend away
text: The hotel was small and the rooms were also small, but they were very clean and very well maintained. It has an amazing location just outside of Washington Square  Park in Greenwich Village. Overall a very good value for a New York City hotel. If you're looking for a quieter neighborhood to stay in this may be for you.

title: Still a favorite
text: I've been at this hotel before, and requested to be put here on a work trip. As always, the people at the front desk and in lobby are invariably warm, friendly, and helpful. I had a high floor room this time, with a nice extended view over the roofs of nearby low buildings, and it made me appreciate even more the openable windows...  as well as the great bedding, stylish lobby and rooms, coffee maker, free wi-fi and continental breakfast, and nicely tiled bathrooms. The Washington Square is in such a great location, and each time I return it makes me happy to be there. Here's an odd tip: if you are missing your home exercise, take the stairs! I always do once I don't have luggage, and quite enjoy it. Though the art deco elevators are nice too.

title: Charming boutique hotel in great location
text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night.  The staff is pleasant, the location is convenient to so much in the village, and the rooms are comfortable.  The only negative was we had to wait an hour past check-in for our room as it was being cleaned.  It was well worth it because it was spotless!  The linens and towels are plush and plentiful.  The toiletries are Bigelow - so wonderful!  The AC worked effectively. The continental breakfast well-stocked and attended to by very nice servers.  Delicious yogurt, fruit, pastries, granola, oj, and coffee.  Yes, there is noise, but it's NYC.  Yes, the room is small, but it's NYC.  We dined at the North Square restaurant (attached to the hotel) and had a delicious meal with attentive service.  We enjoyed our stay and will definitely return to this charming hotel.

title: Perfect location for lovers of the Chelsea-Village area
text: Excellent european style hotel. We stayed in Queen bed Delux rooms that are a bit more spacious and confortable. Our room had two windows and was very quiet despite being adjacent to the elevator. A very nice complimentary breakfast is served in their restaurant.Service was excellent. Highly recommended.

title: Excellent European style hotel in great location
text: This was my second stay at the Washington Square Hotel.  the other TripAdvisor reviews are all pretty accurate--the staff are pleasant, the location in Waverly Place just off Washington Square in the Village is great and the rooms comfortable. One big improvement since I last stayed in 2013 is in the restaurant North Square

title: Muy buena ubicación para conocer Nueva York
text:
La conveniente ubicación del hotel nos permitió aprovechar el viaje, ubicado cerca de las estaciones del metro, restaurantes, farmacias...
Si le gusta caminar este hotel esta a 3km (2millas) del Theater District, 1km de SoHo, 2km del Empire State.
Este hotel incluye desayuno en la tarifa.  Habitación agradable y cómoda.
La razón por la que no doy 5 estrellas es porque el servicio en recepción es promedio, sin embargo debo reconocer que Allen, quien se encarga de la limpieza y Ronny fueron muy detallistas con nosotros, tuvieron genuino interés por hacer agradable nuestra estancia.

title: Old hotel with inexperienced staff
text: This hotel is located across from Washington Square Park, which is convenient if have business in the area or at NYU.  The hotel is best described as old, rundown and with narrow staircases and maze like hallways.  The rooms are small and with outdated furniture, and a small tv that hangs near the ceiling.  Good customer service eludes the front desk staff, they were consistently rude at check in and check out.  I was charged a rate different than the room rate I reserved under, so definitely check your bill.  I checked out at 5:30 a.m. before going to the airport and when checking my bill, noticed that they charged me for the night that I was checked out for.  When I pointed that out, the front desk person indicated that technically I should be charged since it was the morning of that day/date!  Puzzled, I explained that since I am checking out at 5:00  a.m. and they will rent the room still that day, that I shouldn't be charged.  He then indicated that he doesn't know how to fix the computer or to adjust the charges.  Worried about missing my plane, I left and told him to work it out and I will call to double check.  I called an hour later and was told that he was able to adjust the charges.  The only thing that is good about the hotel is the location across from the part and near the subway, otherwise it is very expensive at $300.00 a night (and more).  It was the worst hotel experience that I have ever encountered.  They need to update the hotel, train the staff, and ensure that are respected.

title: Historically elegant and beautiful
text: We stayed for 2 nights while visiting family in Manhattan.  It was quaint and well appointed. After a long day of trecking through the city seeing sites the shower was A-MA-ZING.  The only draw back is it is an old (yet beautifully maintained) building and not sound proofed well.  Our room came with windows facing street and sidewalk level so it was not quiet.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again however!! And probably will.

title: Good location and neigborhood
text: My husband and I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel in April. We were in town for a memorial service.  It was in a good location.  Nice neighborhood. Continental breakfast was good.  Our room was small but it served our needs. Check in was slow as their was some confusion over the rate.  We got it figured out eventually.  It was reasonably priced for New York.

title: 何度目のNY？
text: 今迄はミッドタウンからタイムズスクエアまでのホテルでしたが、初めてヴィレッジに泊まりました。小さいですが、中はそれなりに綺麗で窓枠などはかえって趣があって良かったです。フロントも親切でベルボーイが日本に行ったことがあるとかで気さくな人でした。朝食フリーでパン、ヨーグルト、ドリンクなどの簡単なものでしたが、デニッシュパンなどもあり、お持ち帰りも自由なので、置いてある袋に入れて公園でのランチに大活躍でした。冷蔵庫はフロントに頼めば持ってきてくれました。部屋のおおきさも色々あるようですが、私達はツインでスーツケースを広げると歩けませんでした。夜帰って寝るだけなのでその辺は気になりません。それよりもニューヨーカー気分になれるホテルの雰囲気がとっても気に入りました。早朝の近所の散歩が格別でした。また泊まりたいですが、結構高くなりました。

title: Nice hotel in a great location
text: Front Desk Staff was very friendly and most of the time greeted us as we came and left.  We had an issue with our room and they were very nice about changing our room for us.  The hotel is very quiet and we slept well.  The only reason I give it 4 stars is that  our room was very tiny and there was almost no room to put anything anywhere and it was extremely basic.  But that being said, the hotel is very reasonably priced and I would consider staying here again in the future.  Overall I am satisfied with my decision with this hotel and its location.

title: Wonderful hotel in a great area
text:
I love this hotel! It's a small boutique, extra friendly establishment and a refreshing change from the chain hotels where I've stayed on previous visits to NYC. Reasonably priced. The staff are great.  Special shout out to Ronnie, the concierge who's a real asset and can help you with anything at all, even giving my daughter and niece a free baseball cap to shield them from the sun. We stayed in a double double for 4 people. Yes the room isn't massively big but, you're only sleeping there and the beds were very comfortable with enough storage space for 4 women and all the baggage that came with us!. The bathroom was the biggest I've seen in a NY hotel with constant hot water and a really powerful shower. Air conditioning was a godsend because it was very hot last week. 
We stayed on the first floor facing the street but, because it's a quiet area, we weren't really bothered by noise. The odd siren but, hey, it's New York! Continental breakfast, included in the price was more than enough in the morning with delicious pastries and fresh fruit, yoghurt, cereal etc. 
The location is great - right across from the park and close to a subway for uptown and downtown. Greenwich Village is one of my favourite areas of the city but the biz of midtown is a subway ride away if you want it. I'll definitely be staying again on my next trip.  Only slight negative for me was no de-caff coffee in the room and that taxes aren't included in the price upfront but that's not enough to put me off - and I'm very fussy about hotels. 
I've found in some of the bigger hotels that the staff just don't have the time to be attentive so I think the fact that this is a smaller hotel allows them to give great service.
Hope to see you again soon

title: Good location; nice hotel with basic amenities
text:
This was my first time staying in East Village in NYC.  This hotel is in a great location-  near many stores, shops, eateries- easy access to the subway  There is a continental breakfast included which is good- fruit cups, tea, coffee, croissants and bagels, muffins. 
The front desk service is a little uneven.  We arrived very late to check in and the desk clerk was outstanding- furnishing us with all kinds of aids (brochures, information).  The check out clerk was less than stellar . He claimed he could not print out my boarding pass as the "computer' was sluggish- although I waited about 45 minutes for my cab in the lobby.  The night before, the clerk was good enough to offer to print it out and directed me to an iiPad printer.  I should have taken advantage of his request at that time.  This clerk also reserved a car for me to the airport. I guess it just depends who was on duty,

That aside, the rooms are spacious and clean and its quiet.  For the price, this is a good hotel if you want to stay in on the East Side.

title: Great hotel
text: My husband and I stayed at this cute little hotel on the recommendation of good friends who are from the city. We found the staff to be very helpful, the room and bed to be comfortable and the bathroom was roomy. The location in the village is so convenient and felt like home. Can't wait to come back for another visit!

title: great location
text: I staid at the WSH for a week and had a very pleasant experience. The location is great, nice jazz clubs in the area. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. The free breakfast is ok, if you just need a quick bite, but if you want something more elaborate you can use the hotel's restaurant and plenty of places in the area. Definitely recommend the place. Noise level of other guests was at times an issue, people being inconsiderate of others, but can't blame the hotel for that. Good experience!

title: Perfect location!
text: I love staying here, perfect location "in the middle" of everything! Great service at check in & the rooms are alright. But not more than that, I would choose a different hotel if I would like to spend more time there. But now we only sleep and spend the days out exploring, and for that this hotel is perfect!

title: Bad Bed
text: The location is fantastic; the decor is pleasant; the room was a good size considering this is Manhattan. But the bed was terrible. The mattress in Room 604 was probably about as old as me. In any case, each side of the bed sagged, and due to the apparent compression of the mattress in those areas, the bed felt hard and uncomfortable. I slept badly both nights I spent there.

title: Low key boutique hotel in excellent location
text:
I have just spent a week at the Washington Square Hotel and really enjoyed the stay.
It was the first time I'd been to this part of NYC and the hotel was perfectly located to Washington Square Park, Greenwich Village and subway to anywhere in Manhattan and Brooklyn. The room was compact but very tidy and clean. Staff were helpful and friendly and breakfast included each morning more than enough to satisfy. I felt rather at home here and would stay again when next in New York.

title: Well-Located and Clean
text: The subway A train from the JFK Air Train drops you 1/2 block from the Hotel.  It only takes about 45 mins, and costs just $7.50 - greatly reducing transportation costs.  The Hotel is central to most things NYU and Greenwich Village-related.  The room was quite small, but very clean, and appointed with all the necessities.  The rate included a continental breakfast, well-stocked with quality fare, which mercifully stayed open until 11 AM.  The staff was helpful, and service-oriented.  I booked through TripAdvisor.com, and was traveling solo, and felt this influenced the location of my room away from the street, next to the elevator shaft.  Also, felt like I should have paid 15-20% less for what I got, but in NYC convenience apparently has its price.  Assuming I was not on too strict a budget, I would definitely stay here again.

title: Big disappointment.
text:
We arrived at the hotel around 2:00 pm and decided to wait till the chek-in time of 3:00 pm. Our room was not ready at 3:00 and we had to waste our time for 20 more minutes just sitting at the sofa. Instead of sincere apology, we were told check-in time does not mean "at 3:00" ,but " after".
Room we finally got was filled with the strong smell of chrolide. It must been cleaned in minutes before. We felt like checked-in to a hospital rather than a hotel. It was not comfortable and reluxed feeling. We felt sick because of the strong smell.

This is an old fashion, nicely decorated hotel in beautiful environment, but it did not meet our standard of over $250/ night hotel. Actually this is our first experience of delayed check-in over 40 years of traveling worldwide.

title: Kleinschalig hotel op geweldige locatie
text: Goed hotel, gelegen in Greenwich Village en dat is een super leuke wijk van New York met veel restaurants en barretjes in de omgeving! Personeel van het hotel is vriendelijk, de kamers zijn niet ruim maar voldoen, goede badkamer en het ontbijt is prima: grote glazen jus d'orange en yoghurt met vers fruit en granola. Tegen betaling kan men het ontbijt uitbreiden met eieren of pancakes.

title: Perfect location for the village
text:
This was my first time staying around Washington 
Square Park, and this cozy little hotel was perfectly adequate for my needs.  The price was right, the breakfast had two options: The included option was coffee, tea, bagels, toast, OJ and Yogurt.  The full breakfast was in the hotel's restaurant, and is not included (at least we got charged there separately).  Our room was very small, but big enough for our needs and was clean.  The reception staff was very helpful.  Overall, there was nothing offensive and we enjoyed the location very much- especially since Babbo is almost directly across the street.

title: Très bon séjour
text:
Très bien placé dans "the village"
Accueil et service excellents
Chambre propre, confortable et calme

Seul Point Négatif : petit déjeuner ne correspondant pas au standard de l'hôtel. Il semble qu'il y ait deux salles de PDJ... Ce n'était pas claire et l'information ne nous avait pas été communiquée.

title: Hyggeligste beliggenhed
text:
Hotel med meget små og lidt ældre stand værelser, men med den hyggeligste beliggenhed lige ved den hyggelige Washington Square Park. 

Venlig betjening i morgenmadsrestauranten og en meget hjælpsom dørmand, som altid var i strålende humør. 

Let morgenmad var inkluderet i prisen, hvilket var rart. 

4 stjerner pga. værelsernes størrelse, hvor der kun var plads til 2 kufferter ved at kravle hen over sengen.

title: Very Cool Hotel!
text:
We´ve stayed here 3 times and want to come back again. The rock´n roll history of the hotel is present and the fact that both Dylan and Stones stayed for some time is awesome. I´ve got the feeling that the hotel looks the same today at is did at that time. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Always there to welcome you and having a chat. 
The location is great close to the park, Greenwich Village and Soho.
If you want a modern design hotel this is not the place but if you´re out for charm defenitely.

title: West Village Charmer
text: Boutique hotel at Washington Square offers convenience, comfort and value. The rooms are small and clean. The staff is attentive. Our 7th room was quiet with partial view of the park. Defintely would return if I wanted to be in Lower manhattan. Our only issue was breakfast. A  quite acceptable continental breakfast is available two ways. First there is a self service location where you can sit and eat or take away. The other option is a cute dining room where you can be served the free continental breakfast or order al carte.We tried both. The dining room needs some staff management to make it a winner. Finally Babbo is less than 50 yards from the font door and Il Mulino and Minetta Tavern are both a 5 minute walk.

title: Nice area, a regular hotel
text:
I found reception staff to be helpful when I asked questions.The doorman is very welcoming and friendly.
The room was small, clean and comfortable however you could hear other guests coming in at night and talking in general. 
The hotel is located close to New York University, Washington Square and many good bars, cafes and restaurants. The hotel is not on a major road so gets little traffic noise. It is a beautiful area worth exploring for the architecture and ambience. It is also not far from the high-line, Hudson River walk and interesting surrounding districts. Close by (a couple of train stops away or walking if you like walking), is Union Square, Gramercy Park and East Village. 
The hotel offers complimentary continental breakfast that was good, consisting of breads (toast), pastries, fresh fruit, yoghurt, tea/coffee/juice. A very small eating area and some guests had to wait for a table. Also the staff member in the café does not offer instructions on the breakfast however you can work it out yourself and you can ask. The wifi worked in the room.

The subway is very close by (few minutes walk) where you can catch a train anywhere in New York. If you are arriving from JFK follow the hotel directions for the air-train and subway. I did this with no problem. The hotel was easy to find. On arrival to New York get a subway map. It is an easy to navigate city and easy to use transport. 

I really enjoyed staying in this area and the hotel is comfortable and in a good location.
If you don’t mind a little noise from other guests the hotel is good.

title: Still a great value hotel with history
text:
This was about our 6th stay at the hotel and it is just as good - close to everything downtown and friendly staff. Absolutely recommended - forget Times Square which is an overcrowded mess. Stay downtown and feel like a local!
It is close to the W4th station which is a big station with many trains or go to Astor Place for the Eastside trains. And the Park is there and both the hotel and the park have so much history - look it up on their website

title: Excellent Location
text: Like a previous review said, perfect for NYU parents.  Location is superb. Friendly helpful staff.  Nice breakfasts.  Rooms nicely sized and reasonably priced. Bathrooms recently renovated and very nice.  If I could change one thing (well two things) - replace those dowdy curtain surrounds and carpet tiles.

title: Fabulous 50
text:
Excellent location, great views and very friendly and helpful staff. 
Close to 2 subway stop options. Good bars and nightlife nearby due to proximity of the university.
It was quiet but unfortunately the NYC decided to relay the roads outside for 3 nights but even then it wasnt too bad.- Given free ear-plugs!!!

We will hopefully be staying again soon.

title: Perfect for NYU parents
text:
We stayed in the hotel for 6 nights to help our son move out of campus and find a new place for the fall.  The location is the best for NYU parents. We noticed a few parents coming for graduation ceremony with their kids. 

Very comfortable beds and clean bathroom.  Breakfast is good too but there are too many good eats close by you do not want to miss either. 

The only  complaint is the check in process.  We arrived at 240pm and had to wait till exact 3pm to be checked in.  The front desk girl who helped us was not friendly either.

title: Un emplacement idéal à Manhattan
text:
Cet Hotel est d'un très bon rapport qualité prix en comparaison avec des hôtels de standing équivalent  à New York.
Sa situation est idéale: À proximité de Soho  de West Village et de toutes les grandes avenues, à quelques blocs d'Union Square il bénéficie cependant du calme (tout relatif bien sûr !!!) des petites rues New-yorkaises. On a même entendu les oiseaux dans l'arbre devant notre fenêtre.... Oui oui c'est vrai. 🐧🐧
Les chambres sont confortables, avec une bonne literie et pourvues d'un coffre-fort. Pas très grandes, mais c'est un peu le standard de l'Hôtellerie dans cette ville (mais qui s'attarde dans sa chambre ici).!!! 
La salle de bains carrelée de blanc était très propre et les produits tels que gel douche, lait pour le corps, shampooing, après shampooing sont à disposition. Tout comme le fer à repasser et le sèche cheveux.
Attention quelques chambres donnent sur un mur sans aucune vue, une amie de voyage en a fait la mauvaise expérience et mieux vaut peut être se renseigner avant le booking.
Le personnel est attentionné et prévenant.
Une bonne adresse pour NYC😜🗽

title: En favorit i repris!
text: Mitt favorit hotell i New York på grund av att läget är toppen ,nära tunnelbanan och bra restauranger i Greenwich Willage.Rummen är vad man betalar för, vill man ha ett större rum med usikt över Washington Square(Parken)välj då Executive King t.ex Det är inget stök på hotellet eller utanför, man kan faktiskt inte tro att man befinner mitt i NYC.Sist men inte minst så ingår det frukost i rumspriset.Personalen är mycket hjälpsam med vad du än behöver hjälp med !En pärla med andra ord missa inte detta Hotell!

title: A Warm Welcome
text: I had an emergency at home in January and needed a place to stay for a few days near home.  I have often passed the Washington Square Hotel and wondered what it is like.  It is certainly on an attractive corner of Waverly Place and Macdougal Street just across from famous Washington Square Park; the northwest corner where public executions took place in earlier centuries.  I decided this was just the place for me.  I had an inside room which looked out on an air shaft.  This was fine for me.  I just thought of Melville who has associations with the area and his character, Bartleby.  But if I were on vacation I would want to look out on either of the streets.  I liked my room and was quite comfortable.  I loved the lobby which has beautiful tile and wood work.  A copy of Sargent's scandalous Madame X hangs in a corner.  The reception and housekeeping staff are wonderful and one of the porter's is so avuncular he is a walking invitation to return.  This excellent location in the West Village is very convenient.  Poe lived near by at both West 3rd Street where NYU's Law School is (we don't like NYU) and also on Waverly Place at No 139 I believe.  Both he and Melville attended a Saturday evening literary salon across the street at No 116.  Babbo, also across the street, continues to attract throngs of diners.  There are movie and legit theatres in the area and a surfeit of music venues.  Two blocks away is Sheridan Square where the Stonewall Inn is back in the news and The Northern Dispensary which is, alas, closed so you can't get your head cold treated here as Poe did around 1840.  The No 1 train can get your downtown to the World Trade Center or up town to your Broadway show.

title: Extremely helpful
text:
This hotel is a hidden gem . 

Front desk staff and concierge are unfailingly helpful - best I've seen in awhile . 

There's a small gym and bar - even a restaurant although I didn't eat there 

Location is great for NYU , the village and the subway . 

Rooms - I always get two double beds in the hope of a bigger room - are reasonably sized for NY

There's no fridge in the room , but all other facilities available including dear little bigelow pharmacy toiletries .

title: Made my stay a real pleasure!
text: Front-desk service was cordial and beyond professional -- personal attention and plenty of eye contact.  My room, as requested, had something of a view of Washington Square Park.  The bathroom was lovely and apparently recently renovated.  Clean white tile, great water pressure, no highly scented cleaners had been used and the Bigelow mini-shampoo, etc. were barely scented.  The bed was firm and the linens high quality and smelled fresh.  The carpeted floor was clean, plenty of coffee, tea, lovely terry bathrobes.  The continental breakfast was more than ample; they even provide paper bags so you can stock up for later, and when I needed to stash my bag after check-out for a couple of hours, the concierge was on it before I even asked.  All in all, a top-notch establishment with funky decor in the common hallways -- hand-painted by the current owner, I was told -- and for less than $250, a bargain!

title: The Best of Greenwich Village
text: We love this property.  The penthouse is wonderful, the staff is outstanding, and the location is the best.  Since our visit was so fantastic last year, we are returning for five nights this year vs two last year.  Highly recommend.

title: Quaint with a flare and Amazing location
text:
Amazing location. Hotel was closer to an inn. But the continental breakfast was very well organized, which Chobani yogurt, fruits, croissants, and different types of toasts and breads. Jams, nuttella, and various teas and coffees were included. The overall feeling of the hotel however was a little dark for an April evening or day, but I'm sure during the winter months, it would have been very charming. The washroom and toilet areas were super clean, and there was also a tea and coffee set in the bedroom. The size of the space was average, and much smaller than a commercial hotel, however much more than adequate as a boutique hotel. The choice of the hotel was made for me by an inviting institution, and was not the usual contemporary or modern hotel I would usually book, but am pleasantly surprised. 

Overall: B+

title: Great value, great location, lovely place.
text: Hard to beat this value in this location.  The rooms and bathrooms are small, yes, but really, why do you need much space?  They are clean and the staff is very helpful and pleasant.  I will stay here again on my next visit to NYC.

title: NYU Visit
text: We stayed here due to proximity to NYU for an early morning tour. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Arianna in Reservations was terrific and the check in staff switched us to a better set up for us upon arrival. Small rooms, but clean and good for the price/location. The doorman was very eager to help. Will return.

title: Great little hidden treasure!
text: Being a native NY'er and knowing how expensive it is to stay in NYC this I must say was worth the price . Very clean rooms , small yes but for NYC not bad....lots of high end toiletries in the room , friendly staff ....Nice little getaway....comfy beds (pillow, eh too mushy) will definitely go again close to everything within walking distance. Clubs , bars restaurants!! Check out is not until 12 which is a huge plus..and a breakfast is included....

title: Nice hotel, great staff
text: Room was tiny but well appointed and extremely clean. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was continental and nothing to write home about but nothing to argue about either. Price very high (IMO) but it is NYC... Will definitely visit again.

title: Not what I expected.
text:
I was a bit disappointed in the Washington Square Hotel - the pics on their website were charming.  I expected "more charming".  My first room was really small, I am thankful I said something to the front desk and was offered a larger room.  

Continental breakfast is included.  Location is excellent for the Village and Washington Square/ NYU. 

European travelers will feel right at home.

title: excelente experiencia!
text:
Me hospede 3 veces en este Hotel dado que tienen el mejor desayuno, es muy limpio, el staff es amable y la ubicacion excelente. tiene una estacion de subte a una cuadra, esta cerca del soho y de la zona de bares.
Muy recomendable!!

title: Yeah.... No
text: This hotel isn't "charming," it's just bad.  The rooms are just tiny (yes, yes, I know... NYC.... trust me, even for NYC they're tiny).  Furnishings are cheap.  Floor squeaks.  Hallways are claustrophobic.  Bathroom is miserable.  We stayed here because of its proximity to NYU, but learned our lesson - stay in a "real" hotel elsewhere in Manhattan, and leave some extra subway time to get to NYU.

title: Excellente situation et prix abordable
text:
C'est ma meilleure trouvaille dans les hotels de New York !
Situation agréable dans un quartier étudiant (NY University), au pied de la 5ème avenue, avec un parc à côté et en plein Greenwich Village.
Le service est honorable.
Pas de grand luxe mais des chambres suffisamment grandes et salles de bains lumineuses.

Il vaut mieux les chambres en hauteur (8ème ou 9ème étage) et les chambres x02 et x04 ont la meilleure vue.

Attention : les coffres ne permettent pas tous de stocker un MacBook. C'est à peine la taille d'un iPad !

title: Fab hotel for a NY city break
