text: We stayed here for 4 nights and had a really comfortable stay. We booked a deluxe queen room which I guess was slightly larger than the "small" rooms. We overlooked the street and at times it was noisy from the traffic but it didn't keep us awake - the bed was extremely comfortable! Breakfast consisted of fresh orange juice, tea, coffee, toast, bagels, pastries, fruit salad and cereals, which was fine for the few nights we were there - it was great to have breakfast included. The concierge are extremely helpful and get your day off to a great start by pointing you in the right direction! Location great for subway and bus and Washington Park is a great spot to catch the sun at the end of the day after walking around the city.

title: Small but central
text:
This is an old hotel and the rooms are small. i didn't mind that they are small as I am used to very small rooms when traveling in Europe. But if you are used to roomy US hotels, this hotel will be too small for you. The single room is only good for one person. There is hardly a place to put your luggages. The breakfast menu is good and you get it for free if you are an NYU guest. 

Btw, the room is not sound proof. You could easily hear street noise. The nights I was there it was very windy and I could hear loud flapping noise outside. Needless to say it was a restless night.

title: Great Neighborhood Hotel-Close to Everything
text:
A friend recommended this boutique hotel, similar to European hotels. The elevator is a little bigger and the rooms about the same size. It has clean, comfortable, fluffy towels. The desk people demonstrated the kind of customer service everyone wants. They helped with suggestions for finding restaurants, understanding the area and transportation options. It is the only independently owned hotel in Manhattan. The art deco tiles and paintings are special.

The brownstones and community are next to NYU. The subway is a block one way and the city bus is a block the other way. The area is close to little shops and fun things to do. It's beautiful, fun and a friendly place to stay.

It was too cold to spend time in Washington Park when we were there but we enjoyed seeing the trees beginning to bloom and the dogs in the dog park.

title: A hotel with character and soul.
text:
Washington Square Hotel is a hotel with history, character and soul.  It befits its location on the Northwest corner of Washington Sq Park in the village.
The staff is friendly and knowlegeable.
Easy subway access.Free Wi Fi and no attitude.  I'll be back.

title: Location is Perfect
text:
Recently, I returned to the Washington Square Hotel.  I'm very glad I did.  Washington Square Hotel boasts an amazing location.  Not only is Washington Square right outside the door, but everywhere I wanted to go, West Village, East Village, Lower East Side, Chelsea, were just a few minutes walk. 
Since the last time I visited the hotel, the breakfast service has improved a lot.  Currently, breakfast is offered in the North Square Restaurant.  One unfortunate element, the coffee is terrible!  However, there is a coffee maker in the room, and Stumptown is just around the corner.
The room was very clean and comfortable.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Overall, the place seems to be more homey and cheerful than in the past.

title: Lovely hotel in great area
text: Very nice and charming hotel in a great location. One block from W 4th St subway stop. Lots of restaurants/cafes etc nearby. Right opposite the park. Room was small as would be expected but nicely laid out and comfortable and importantly, quiet. Bathroom was perfectly fine. Breakfast was outstanding and front desk staff were super friendly and helpful. Minor peeves - overhead light over bathroom sink was too dim, housekeeping wasn't the best - used coffee cup wasn't removed for instance, too few outlets. But I'd definitely stay there again.

title: Friendly staff
text: The location of the hotel is very convenient for New School, transportation, and restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful. A complimentary continental breakfast (yogurt, cereal, pastries, bagels, juice, fresh fruit, etc.) was provided each morning. The room was small, but very clean. The downside of the non-smoking room I was in was that it was right next to the elevator. I solved the noise problem by turning on the air conditioner fan. If you have mobility problems, this is not the hotel for you--there are steps from the street to the lobby.

title: Perfect location
text:
Beds were fantastic, extremely important when you're on a walking holiday:)
Location perfect, subway close by and lots and lots of good restaurants.
The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly.

title: Posizione stupenda
text: Ottima posizione. Camere pulite e silenziose. Personale gentile e disponibile. Unico neo la colazione al buffet molto scarsa e se chiedevi un piatto dalla cucina, a pagamento, con uova ecc ecc era di pessima qualità

title: Convenient and charming
text: The location was great, right on the corner of Washington Square and convenient to NYU, New School, transportation, and restaurants galore, and the staff very helpful.  The room was quite pleasant and large enough, not always the situation at NYC hotels, and the price was reasonable.  An adequate continental breakfast was included in the restaurant downstairs.  I also ate dinner there one evening and was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere and food.

title: Extremely friendly staff.....
text:
I stayed in this hotel on three Consecutive Business trips, with two other colleagues. The location of the Hotel is excellent, as it is accessible to Transport links, restaurants and shops etc.

On all three occasions the room was immacutely cleaned, the hotel staff were very friendly and approachable.

The Breakfast, which I paid for in addition was great.....very filling, no lunch required and it set me up for the day. I've forgotten the Concierge's name, but great....what a character,  very knowledgeable.

Thank you for a wonderful and personable stay.

title: Not good value for money
text:
Room has a decent size but next to the very noisy lift. It has a window but being on 2nd floor we didn't see any natural light at all
Breakfast included was extremely poor (just same bagels or toasts, cereals and yogurts)
On the other hand, Location is excellent and very friendly staff

title: Charming; great location
text: The hotel staff may be the nicest people in NYC!  They were very welcoming and superbly helpful in answering our many questions.  The location worked well for us, as our purpose was to visit NYU and attend a nearby indie band concert.  Great shopping in SOHO and the charms of Greenwich Village and East Village just a short walk away, as were the subway stop and the ever-necessary (for me) Starbucks.  The room was well-appointed, and we particularly liked the design and utility of the updated bathroom.  We were on a lower floor and did hear the occasional street noise, but the nice view of Washington Square Park made up for that.  The hotel is over 100 years old and is charming with beautiful architecture and some art deco appointments.

title: Well run, clean, boutique-style hotel
text: Visitors will find this hotel located in a pleasant area of the West Village, close to a subway station and a great choice for those visiting NYU and environs. The lobby is relatively small but has a sitting area. Rooms are a good size for New York hotels and are very clean and comfortable, with a desk/work area, iron and ironing board, TV, and other amenities. A restaurant associated with the hotel offers excellent breakfasts and dinners. One block away is a decent wine store and also a convenience store, and a really excellent bar, the Arts and Crafts Beer Parlor, is just around the corner. Service in the hotel is first-rate and very friendly. There is WiFi in the rooms and it's quite fast.

title: Great location, wonderful hotel
text: My husband and I spent 5 days here and found it to be a great hotel. It is centrally located and 1/2 block away from the subway station. The rooms are nice with plenty of clean towels, bathrobes and other amenities. They have a free continental breakfast with a very good supply of fresh fruit, pastries and cereal. We would definitely stay here again if we return to New York city.

title: Great spot!
text:
Awesome area right near Washington square park, clean and spacious rooms, friendly and accommodating staff! They have bath robes!

As an infrequent business traveler, the folks at WSH were easy to work with and very knowledgeable of the area.

title: Small, quaint and right next to Washington Square
text: My daughter and I stayed here because were touring NYU.  The hotel has a small lobby with kind staff.  Breakfast was included, but we ate at Black Seed Bagels each day (highly recommended).  Our room didn't have any spectacular views, but it was nice and quiet.  The bathroom was a good size for two people. The beds were comfortable, and it was nice to have a double twin room.  We were able to walk to Soho for shopping.  Babbo is literally across the street.  I highly recommend the hotel for its hospitality, cleanliness, and character.

title: Functional and not much else
text: This is a decent New York hotel without much in particular to recommend it. The rooms are small, but not excessively so by New York standards. The bed was fine, but not as luxurious as in a high-end hotel. My room's window opened onto a wall, five feet away, with no way to see even a glimpse of sky. The decor and bathroom look tired and cramped. The furniture is spare--just one of those cube-like benches for the narrow desk and an un-upholstered chair in the corner. In short, it's not as nice as the typical suburban Hampton Inn, but it's decent for New York.

title: What a lovely stay
text: I was delighted in every way with my stay at the Washington Square Hotel. The hotel is a lovely, European style hotel, with Art Deco / Old Hollywood aesthetics. Classy, not flashy. I will definitely be back.

title: Good place to stay in NYC
text: Small, family run hotel.  Breakfast is available.  Very helpful, pleasant staff.  Close to bus station and metro.  Useful place to stay if you want to get around NYC.  Right in Greenwich Village.  Shops and restaurants nearby.  Nice, central location.

title: A Decent Value
text: Nothing fancy, but a good location for travelers who want to be close to Greenwich Village.  The lobby staff is active, friendly, and helpful.  Room rate includes an acceptable continental breakfast in the adjoining cafe.

title: Right in the Middle of the West Village
text:
TripAdvisor was instrumental in the choice of this wonderful boutique located right off Washington Square.  As a long time New Yorker now living in Miami, I always enjoy being downtown.  We arrived in the morning after a very early flight from Miami and were greeted by a very courteous staff and an available room on the 9th floor.  The room was small (as expected) but clean, comfortable and well-appointed.  Our only complaint was that the bed was a bit hard and short.  Notwithstanding, we slept well.  The bathroom had a nice shower with abundant water pressure.  

The location is perfect.  Right next to Washington Square - meaning open green space - and within walking of Union Square, East Village and Tribeca.  The next block over is 6th Ave and then Greenwich Village where one of our close friends live.  And bonus points for being a block away from the West 4th subway station.

Our room price included a nice continental breakfast in the restaurant located on the ground floor.  Just remember to tip the great wait staff a couple of dollars.  They do a very nice job.

So good rooms, great location, nice continental breakfast.....but why 4 stars?  

I spoke about the restaurant staff but the hotel staff is wonderful.  The doormen are some of the best in NY in particular the gentlemen in the morning who makes a  point of saying something nice to everyone.  You leave the hotel in good spirits and you return to a warm greeting.  While there are scores of hotels in the same price range, my wife and I highly recommend this gem.

title: Superb hotel
text: Perfect location of this old fashioned hotel. We loved it as it was quiet and away from mid town madness. Our room was on 3rd floor overlooking the square. All the staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast also was tasty. Short walk to soho, Chelsea, TriBeCa and lower east side. Would definitely recommend to our friends.

title: Greenwich Village Gem
text:
Everything about this gem is fabulous. Great beds, clean rooms with every amenity imaginable. Friendly staff. The restaurant is great! Awesome happy hour and snacks. Breakfast is complimentary. Location is key.
We really had a wonderful stay.

title: Best hotel in NY!
text: I have visited New York several times and can safely say this is the best hotel I have stayed in. It is great value for money in a fabulous location. Right next to W4 St subway stop you can get anywhere in the city easily. You are also in the middle of Greenwich Village so loads of good nightlife nearby. The staff are lovely here, so friendly and nothing is too much trouble for them. The rooms are small (but this is NY!) well maintained and very clean. The toiletries are from CO Bigelow, a lovely old fashioned pharmacy down the street. Breakfast is a tasty continental mix with bottomless coffee/tea. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting the city.

title: un pezzo di storia del village
text:
ho soggiornato in questo hotel durante la grande nevicata di new york di febbraio 2014.
hotel storico ma con camere molto fresche e curate seppure semplici.
ottimo servizio e colazione varia e di buona qualità.
negli anni ha ospitato artisti, musicisti e scrittori che poi hanno animato i vari movimenti nati intorno a questa fascinosa piazza....e quest'aria si respira in ogni stanza dallo stile art-deco.
la posizione è strategica per le zone di new york alternative come il village e la stessa washington square; dall'arco di washington square, poi, parte la 5a strada che ti porta direttamente in uptown dopo una camminata lunga ma assolutamente stimolante e interessante. camminare per new york è la cosa più bella che si possa fare!
dispone di una mini palestra con tutti gli strumenti che possono essere necessari in un soggiorno del genere compreso il tapis roulant dei professionisti della maratona.

title: Une très bonne adresse !
text:
Malgré la petitesse de la chambre et le fait qu'il y manque un frigo, je le recommande pour le calme, l'accueil agréable, le petit dej copieux et bon, l'emplacement idéal dans Greenwich, proche de bons restaus et club de jazz; il faut aussi noter que c'est également un très bon restaurant ! Les prix restent correct pour un New-York qui est une ville chère ... 
(Attention cependant à certains membres du personnel (2) dont le comportement peu accueillant tranche fortement avec l'ensemble) ...

title: A so-so experience
text: The location is in the Village and close to NYU. Great neighborhood across from Washington Square. The hotel room was very small, the furnishings were not an acceptable quality. The carpet was dirty and the furnishings were old and adequate, but not well maintained. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would probably not choose to stay there again, but it wasn't awful. OK for the price. The restaurant adjacent to the hotel (North Square) was superb and would recommend whether you stay at the hotel or not.

title: Great Place to stay, superb location!
text: Just in the heart of the Village, in the corner of Washington Square Park. Nice rooms, the staff is super nice and friendly, couple of blocks away from Christopher St (Stonewalls' Inn) take a stroll by Greenwich Ave x Perry St and try the Meatball Shop, or 7ths x Waverly Pl try Morandis

title: Delightfully Bohemian Chic, Boutique Hotel
text:
I searched for weeks before I found this on booking.com and thank goodness I did. I won't consider any other hotel from now on when I visit the city.
The charm and history of this hotel was so unexpected and it made for a delightful stay. The place was spotless. The staff are so friendly and accommodating. I could have stayed here for a week. They also included a complimentary continental breakfast which was outstanding. The location of the hotel is perfect as its right in the Village and everything is so easy to walk to. 
The rooms are very nice. High ceilings, windows that open, comfortable beds and large fully equipped bathrooms.
I cannot recommend this place more highly.

title: Silenzioso e centrale
text: Ferie agosto 2015 con la famiglia. Hotel a 50 mt dalla metro ed in posizione centralissima. Vicina a tutti i locali e shopping. Molto silenzioso (salvo la raccolta della nettezza urbana alle 5 del mattino). A noi è stata data una stanza splendida con affaccio sui giardini. Unica grossa pecca: ad un ns. parente è stata data una stanza con affaccio sulla tromba dell'ascensore (!!!). Non abbiamo protestato perchè ci è stato riferito solo alla fine del viaggio. La colazione è ottima. Consiglierei a tutti di chiedere in anticipo la tipologia della stanza che viene data in quanto non risulta chiaro all'atto della prenotazione.  Se non ci fosse stata quella pecca (grave) avrei dato 5 stelle.

title: What more could you ask for?
text: What a lucky find! The Washington Square Hotel is a lovely gem with all the extras.  The room, by NYC standards was large. The bathroom was enormous and flooded with natural light. The room was immaculate, and there were plenty of outlets, coffee, pillows and a comfortable bed. Even better, the staff.  Fast, efficient, kind and then some. I called to let them know our flight to NY was cancelled (at 1:00 a.m.). and they informed me that they would take the first night's charge off of my bill.  (without me having to ask)  One morning, we were in a rush to get out the door.  Knowing we didn't have time to sit for breakfast, they grabbed bagels and fresh fruit for us.  (The next morning, we made sure to leave time to eat.  The food and coffee were terrific and my advice is NOT pass on the juice, it was delicious. Charles, at the front desk, even tracked down a lost shopping bag from the restaurant where we had left it.  I found out later that he had called the restaurant the next morning (on his day off) to find the bag, after they had said it was not there the night before.  Now that my daughter has decided to attend college in NYC, the Washington Square Hotel will be our first choice

title: East Village art deco gem within minutes of 5th Avenue and West 4th Street Subay
text:
We had the pleasure of staying three nights at the Washington Square Hotel in late February and would thoroughly recommend to travellers, business people or NYU Academics looking for a pleasant base to travel/commute from in East Greenwich Village.
Taking the AirTrain and Subway from JFK we had a 5 minute walk from the subway exit to the front entrance of the hotel. We later found the exit on the corner of 6th and Waverly Place that was even closer.
The hotel is a lovely old art deco hotel which somehow has been maintained/refurbished to not feel old at all, but rather "lived in".
Reception were friendly, helpful and efficient and the security guy was full of great tips for things to see and do.
As far as rooms go, ours was not big, but was roomy enough for a couple with three nights and two days to see the Big Apple.
Our rate included continental breakfast, and I enjoyed the fruit with yoghurt, selection of breads/bagels, juice and coffee or tea. Full breakfast was available at a charge. The restaurant is tucked away 1/2 below ground level, with windows to the side street. Staff there were friendly and efficient and the food was good.
Our room had a nice aspect over the East Village and some of the townhouses on Waverly Place and the bed was firm but comfortable. We were in 903 which is right by the elevator, which if you are a light sleeper could disturb you early in the morning or late at night, but as we were already jet lagged and tired from being out all day we did not have problems sleeping.

Our only recommendations to the hotel would be to have extra blankets for the bed, as on our last night when it got below freezing outside it was quite chilly in bed. I also suggested to reception when we checked out at 6am for our early flight from JFK that as we would not be able to make use of the included breakfast it would be nice to be able to donate the cost or the food to someone in need.

Great hotel and great location right by Washington Square

title: A total score!
text: Anyone who thinks it's not possible to stay in a pleasant hotel in a prime location in the city and pay less than $200 a night with a lovely breakfast included, has now been proven wrong! In town for some college interviews with my son, I zeroed in on the hotels in closest proximity with a moderate price tag and positive enough reviews and we luckily landed here at Washington Square Hotel. Of course it's old, the hallways are oddly narrow, and the bathrooms are a bit ehh, but I assure you that you can expect to get a good nights sleep and to be greeted by a pleasant front desk staff to help orient you. It felt very old school in the best possible way and has an inviting entrance. You can walk across the street to Washington Square Park, Ben's pizza is a couple blocks down and you are surrounded by charming streets with endless good food opportunities while being away from the crowded streets you find elsewhere in the city.

title: Location
text: Visiting my busy freshman, I wanted to make it as easy as possible for us to get together regardless the weather. Also, wanted to have plenty to do while she was in class but still close enough so we could rendezvous quickly at "home base" if she suddenly discovered she had free time. The Washington Square Hotel was just that. We both had a key to the decent sized room and if she wanted she could study or take a shower in the very nice bathroom--pragmatic mothering a college student could enjoy. The hotel was clean and quiet.The other guests were thoughtful and discreet. I didn't need a hotel that was a destination in itself. The location was my destination. I could have kept busy without leaving the neighborhood but I walked out the door to attend events in minutes utilizing the nearby subway station. Faster than a cab or uber. I found the hotel more reasonable with more services than the VRBO or AirBnB options I considered and sometimes used on other trips.

title: Dejligt hotel tæt ved NYU
text:
Hvis du kan få værelse 912 er du heldig - tre vinduer med fantastik udsigt over SOHO.
Personalet er venlige og hjælpsomme. Vi har det dejligt her. Morgenmaden er også god - men hvis du går udenfor kan du finde den endnu bedre.

title: A great hotel
text: We stayed President's Weekend for college visits.  It was a great location for NYC and The New School.  We got really good recommendations for lunch and dinners from the front desk staff.  There is complimentary continental breakfast - fruit, breads/muffins, yogurt, cereal - it was a nice extra. The room we had was very small but expected in the city.  On Saturday night after dinner we can in and were invited by front desk staff to a poetry reading in the hotel. It was fun and a cool thing to do with the family(2 adults, 2 teens).  All and all a nice hotel, I would return!

title: Trygt og koselig
text: Besøkte dette hotellet i Juni 2012. Utrolig fornøyd med valget vårt. Hotellet ligger i et veldig hyggelig og trygt område. Bare rett ved siden av den koselige Washington square park, her var det masse liv og røre om kvelden! Få minutter til nærmeste subway-stasjon. Anbefaler trygt dette hotellet videre! Mye koseligere og fredeligere i Greenwich village, enn kaotiske og stressende Time Square, eller litt kjedelige Upper Manhattan. Deilig å komme tilbake til hotellet etter å ha vært ute i turist-røra

title: Perfect location
text: First time at this hotel. Perfect location.  Cool decor and history.  Rooms aren't large but just fine for a weekend in NY. The staff are really friendly.  Included breakfast. It's where we'll stay for now on.

title: College Visit
text: Very nice quaint and affordable hotel near NYU campus. Small enough to be personable but still nice. Definitely recommend to families visiting the university to get immersed in the immediate surrounding neighborhood. A very important piece of the decision making process for college. And helpful for a parent's comfort level.  Enjoy.

title: Great cozy stay where you feel like a treasured guest.
text: Many trips to NYC and this is now our go-to hotel.  Great price for the coziest stay with friendliest staff.  Ronny in the lobby is so very friendly and extremely helpful.  We will continue to return to this little hidden treasure on the campus of NYU.

title: Super location, tiny room, excellent value, good breakfast
text:
Loved it! Very "atmospheric" - different levels and great art. Citi Bike station right outside on MacDougal. Absolutely fabulous location.

We usually stay in NoMad but tried this for a change; visiting Village kid and Wall Street brother. Easy walk from Chris/Sheridan 1 train. A, C, E and B, D, F just a block away. Arrived super early, no problem, they took my bag and let me check in a couple of hours later. 

OK, the room was tiny and the bed was just 6 feet long, so if you're tall ask for a King room. But it was immaculate and the shower was outstanding! My room's window was on an air shaft, but it didn't matter because the real view is outside. There's a coffee maker, iron, hair dryer, cool terrycloth robes, and a safe in the room. It was also super quiet (when I arrived the only room they had ready was next to the elevator, and the desk clerk said "You don't want that, we'll find you something better when you come back.")

Since I was there for a weekday breakfast I didn't get the buffet, but they seat you and offer you a menu, and you can choose from the items on the left hand page at no additional cost. So I had a toasted bagel with some cheddar cheese slices and a bowl of sliced bananas and all was well (they also offer complimentary coffee and juice, which I don't drink, but you might like).

I see that other people consider this "expensive", but in NYC to get a room for $139 a night is an absolute bargain. Yes, it's February, and the rates are higher in the warmer months, but considering how easy it is to get there and how wonderful the location is once you arrive, it's worth it!

Please go and enjoy!

title: Expensive but great quality
text: Great location (NYU is nearby, Greenwich Village is amazing, awesome restaurants around, plenty of places to listen jazz etc.) very nice rooms, nice comfort, very nice service. It's very expensive though, but if you can afford, you won't be disappointed.

title: Why stay near Times Square? Bob Dylan once lived here.
text:
The folk rock icon Dylan lived in the building with Joan Baez when the place was known as The Earle. (Read the hotel's web site about him, the Stones, and other famous guests on their web site.)  Don't worry.  We saw no drug-crazed guests in the current common areas that recall more distant times, i.e. the Gilded Age and Hollywood's Golden Age. Our Waverly Street view room was very quiet.

Because February room prices were quite fair, we opted for an executive room, with two sinks, one great shower, and plenty of space to roam around.  The room furnishings are not lavish, but the bed and pillows are luxurious.  Room attendants diligently replenish necessities for the Keurig. The "included' breakfast is just fine.  Although the menu itself is not clear, you can ask for anything on the left side and they will promptly bring it.  The guys who serve you are friendly and helpful.  

The stars of the hotel are its bellman and the location.  Ronnie not only greets you warmly, but he will answer your questions and help remove the stress from your departure, i.e. printing boarding passes, storing bags, and/or securing a ride to LGA.  About the locale: right across the street from Washington Square and less than one block from the Sixth Avenue/Eighth Street subway.  Unless you happen to love riding in a taxi -- or think Harry Chapin just might be your driver - estimate the number of train rides you need and buy a MetroCard, then take direct rides to stations serving MOMA, the Whitney, and Times Square.  Walk east to the #6 at Astor Place and you're at the Metropolitan Museum in less than 30 minutes. 

In the past, the Village might have been intimidating for some. Today, the hotel is a pleasant place to call home after days chasing Picasso and Van Gogh or a night spent with Gershwin ("An American in Paris").  In the neighborhood, you can shop, grab a bite, and tour the haunts of Poe, Dylan Thomas, and Jimi Hendrix.  And then there's Bob Dylan ...

title: Best lacation in town for the gay pride parade,and the village in general.
text: Very nice hotel in the best spot in the village. The parade goes a block north and a block west ,so you can get away from it ,recharge and go back for the rest, (Its about 5 hours). Washington square park always has something amusing going on. The hotel gives a free breakfast. Just a few blocks to the subway.

title: Cozy spot for Greenwich Village stay
text: After years of spending every NYC visit in Midtown, our tickets to an off-Broadway play finally gave us the push we needed to stay in the Village. We booked the quad room (two doubles) for my wife, my daughter, and me, and planned our trip around the location. The room was tight for space, and the bathroom more so, but that's typical for New York. Best of all were the cheerful staff, who sent up a complimentary bottle of prosecco for my daughter's birthday (after inquiring about her age!) and never failed to greet us or to check to see if we needed any additional service. Complimentary breakfast is in a sit-down restaurant, but here too they were accommodating, preparing bagels, muffins, and orange juice to take back to our room.

title: Did the trick
text: We stayed here so we'd be in walking distance of NYU and it did the trick.  We arrived a couple of nights after the blizzard and it was still pretty snowy.  Had to unload the suitcases so I could drive around the block and find the parking garage.  There were no bellman.  My son was able to find someone in the hotel to tell us what to do, but no one provided help.  We found that very strange and unwelcoming.  The hotel itself was fine, nothing fancy.  I did like the shower and the good towels.  I had trouble sleeping because the noises from either inside or outside were ongoing all night. I think I liked it more than my son though because I know how expensive NY hotels can be so this was a relative bargain.

title: Una bella settimana a New York
text: Ho soggiornato in questo hotel col mio fidanzato per una settimana. Posizione strategica, dal momento che da Washington Square Park inizia la 5th avenue e a due passi c'è il bellissimo quartiere di Soho. Camera pulita, bagno un po' piccolo. Colazione continentale soddisfacente. Personale gentilissimo, sempre pronto a dare indicazioni e consigli sui posti per mangiare o visitare. Torneremo sicuramente!

title: Une excellente adresse
text:
Hotel charmant qui a su conserver son caractère rétro art déco. Petite chambre confortable, très propre. Privilégiez les au dessus du 7e étage pour bénéficier d'une vue sur les toits. L‘hôtel se situe idéalement à côté de l'université de New York et du park "Wasington Square", tout près du métro. 

Petit déjeuner continental très bon, et service au petit soin, sans être trop présent.

Pour les amateurs de culture, l'hotel est juste à côté du légendaire Blue note et du Comedy celar, où a démarré Louis CK.

title: Excellent location and service
text:
Washington Square Hotel is a modern take on a traditional New York hotel.  It is
perfectly located on the corner of Washington Square park, very central to NYU and 6th avenue.  Easy to walk to great cafes, bars or restaurants, and easy access to bus and subway lines. Inside the hotel has an old 1920's flair, beautiful tile and curtains.  The room are not large but are clean and charming, with very nice C.O. Bigelow brand shampoos, soaps and lotions in the bathroom.  I had a room that you could see towards the park but I heard from others that their room only faced a brick wall. The staff was lovely and accommodating.  I got stuck an extra two days in NY due to a blizzard and the front desk and the doorman were very helpful in helping me book extra nights and navigate the city. Free breakfast but the staff there seemed bored so it was kind of uncomfortable.  Overall, great stay.

title: Agradável e localização top
text:
O Hotel fica em uma localização muito legal de NY, ao lado da Washigton Square Park e de uma universidade de artes,ou seja, é repleto de música, arte e gente descolada.
O quarto é antigo pequeno e com um banheiro ótimo, produtos melhores ainda.
A estrutura do hotel é bonita com toques de artes pois dizem que artistas e escritores costumavam ficar por essa região..
Para casal,ótimo. Já para família acho um pouco complicado.

title: Ok but not the best
text:
We stayed in this hotel only for one night at New Year Eve so didn’t really see enough to give full comments. Generally, the hotel is situated in a nice part of Manhattan near Washington Square with an easy access to some cafes and restaurants or subway. It takes about 5-7 mins walking to the nearest subway station. As majority of the hotels in NYC the room was quite small and dark however clean. In the room we had a little wardrobe, hairdryer, ironing board and iron that could be handy for some travellers like us. We could get ready planning to go out to the restaurant that evening.
There was a big mirror in our room  and the air con was working really well. The room did not offer any window views so all we could see was a wall of the building near by.
The only complaint I would have will be breakfast as it is simply scam. Guests have a choice of self service breakfast or served to the table breakfast which is obviously much more expensive. We wanted to try a buffet (self service) first but after finding out what food they serve as part of it we decided not to use it. Self service breakfast variety of food was disappointing for the price charged. Nothing warm you can get as part of it, only muffins, bagels, toast,  cereals, croissant and jam. No eggs, no meat (at any form) no cheese no anything.   Breakfast in the restaurant offers cooked options where you can get fried eggs, bacon etc. 
It terms of the restaurant staff I have noticed that it was too many of them at breakfast and they didn’t have anything to do so they have been hiding around looking at mobile phones and speaking to each other in Spanish. I personally don’t mind that however if I can suggest something I would recommend for the restaurant staff to hide better so guests cannot see it.
Check in/out was good with no problems and reception staff were nice and professional. 

Overall I would recommend staying in this hotel however not for long as the room size wasn’t that great so there was not much room to pout your belongings away or walk around bed. The reason why I rated it as average is because it doesn't offer anything extraordinary other than good sleeping base in Manhattan.

title: 허름하지만 위치좋은 호텔
text:
학회때문에 일주일간 머무르게 되었던 호텔입니다.
대형체인호텔들에 비해서 시설의 쾌적함이나 깔끔함이 떨어지는건 사실이나, 일반 뉴욕호텔 치고는 괜찮은 룸컨디션이었습니다. 아침 조식도 굉장히 좋았구요.
특히 근처에 뉴욕대,워싱턴스퀘어광장이 있어서 늦게다녀도 그다지 위험하지 않았고, 5번가로 쭉 이어져있어 길찾기도 쉬웠습니다. 지하철역도 근처에 있구요~

title: Loved
text: Great hotel, excellent value and location. Good breakfast, lovely neighbourhood. Not sure how it can be so affordable in this neighbourhood. Nothing more to say really, just need to get to minimum character limit for tripadvisor. Quite annoying.

title: Great Location
text: Very friendly staff, especially the front desk. The rooms are not super modern, but have a certain charm. I loved the location close to NYU, the park, and great restaurants within walking distance. The staff at breakfast was not the most attentive. Because of that I would have preferred to be able to serve myself to save time.

title: A value property in a great location
text:
We've tried to get into this hotel in the past and finally snagged a room for the weekend after Thanksgiving.  Asked for a park view and got it. Though the view was from the smallest room I think I've ever stayed in that actually had a view.  (Have had a couple of air shaft view rooms in the NYC Plaza and LA Biltmore when I was very young)  But it was on a high floor on the most easterly room section of the hotel.  So the best possible park view from Waverly Place.  My request was honored so I can't complain.  The next time, and there will be one, I'll have to think more carefully about my request.  

I really like the ambiance of this hotel.  Quite a few european couples.  No groups.  Felt like these were travelers, not tourists.  Incredibly convenient location in terms of subways. Real shops and eateries within a block or two.  Easy walking to the East or West village.  A pleasant walk on Greenwich Ave (which still has something of the old west village feel)  to the new Whitney and the High Line.

I hate to recommend it but I must if you're not a grand hotel type. I just hope there is room for us the next time.  

We found the staff, especially the doorman/greeter, quite pleasant.  Had no problem with the WI-FI.

title: Second stay. Okay but not great.
text:
This was my second time here. I found the bellman to be nice and friendly again. Always willing to give recommendations and help get you a cab. The rest of the staff were friendly but didn't necessarily go out of their way to say hello or good night unless you said something to them. That's fine though.

Check in was easy - which is much appreciated.

I was unimpressed with housekeeping and the breakfast on this trip. We were here 5 nights.

First, the hotel doesn't let you really request a specific floor or room. That's okay, but something they told us even if you make a request when you book online that they can't take it into consideration. I am just not used to this having stayed at other NYC hotels where for special occasions they are happy to set aside a room to you for a specific view on a special occasion. That's okay though, just know they can't guarantee a room with a view.

When we got to our room, a queen, I found it slightly smaller than the queen room we stayed in last time. That was fine. The rooms at this hotel lack one of the most important features in my opinion, a mini-refrigerator. This was again a disappointment but we knew it would be having stayed here before. We like to buy snacks, wine, cheese, etc. for the room and luckily it was winter and we could put them in the window sill and they stayed cold. There are plenty of space in the room to put a mini-fridge, but I'll leave this one alone for now.  The room only had one tiny ( and I mean tiny) trash can located in the bathroom. It could use another in the bedroom.

The rooms are decorated fine and have nice lighting, which I appreciate. Not too bright or dark. The bathroom was mostly clean, but there was hair in the drain from the guest before us. Ew.

The room was supposed to have a city or park view. It did. We were in the middle of th hotel on the side and had a slight view of each, though not good ones. There is construction going on at Washington square park on the corner near the hotel so we maybe saw one tree without its leaves and that's all. You don't come to NYC to sit in a hotel and look out the window anyways. Especially in winter when so much is going on.

Waking up the next morning I discovered that the sheets we slept on had dried blood stains on them. I was disgusted. Rather than making a big fuss in the lobby in front of guests going to breakfast, checking out, and checking in, I just said something to the housekeeper who said she would change them for us.  I used to work in a hotel at a front desk and also know what a pain some guests can be who love to complain about every little thing. And that's not me. Plus, I believe in karma and in the realm of life I'll probably forget this one day. If it's the worst thing that happens to me this year, then I'm in good shape. So I felt it was hardly worth being overly dramatic about, though the next guest after me might feel different. The next few days everything with housekeeping went okay except that they gave us sheets on the bed which were worn, ripped, and had holes in places.  That wasn't a deal breaker for me, so I just didn't bother saying something else.

A final thing which again wasn't a deal breaker, but was slightly annoying as an Eco-conscious traveler is that I typically like it when hotels ask guests to reuse towels and help them conserve energy. But when you hang towels up so they won't take them and wash them and replace them with others, and housekeeping changes them out anyways each day... Then what's the point of saying you are Eco-conscious asking people to help you conserve energy when your housekeeping changes sheets and towels no matter what. Oh well, not a huge issue in any way, just something I have over time noted at many hotels.

Breakfast was disappointing. The cereals (we tried two of them) were all high sugar choices and the two we tried were stale. One was so old it had gotten stuck and gummed up in the dispenser. The rest of the breakfast offerings ( the continental breakfast side mind you, not the sit down restaurant side) were all high sugar pastries, bagels, and yogurts. I'm kinda picky about breakfast not being a high sugar meal and every offering they had except the fruit was high sugar. Though fruit has its own sugars. Plus we're in NYC which has the best bagels in the world and the ones they offered here were not great. The coffee was cold on 2 occasions. Another day they were not fast getting things out and they ran out of spoons and forks and guests just sat there with nothing to eat with but knives. I'm sure the restaurant side was different.

Maybe we had just arrived after a big rush of people but after a couple days we decided to get something to eat out in the city on the go. We didn't want to spend all our time in the hotel anyways, we were there to get out and explore the city! Getting brekky on the go worked out fine!

The hotel has a nice feel and amazing location. I appreciated the fast wifi. I had no issues with it. You are in one of the best locations in the city staying here. Lots of amazing restaurants all around you within a 10 minute walk. Not to mention good shopping and subway connections nearby.

I'm no longer a novice when it comes to NYC and every hotel has its ups and downs and quirky things, but overall despite the small faults this is a nice place to stay. The poor housekeeping service, breakfast issues, etc. could happen anywhere and it really didn't detract from my trip to the city in any way. I was happy to ring in New Years in New York as I have the past 6 years and I would still consider this hotel again in the future. 

Best of luck to this place. It's historic and has been around a long time and I'm sure it will continue to!

title: Clean and Good Location
text: I stayed here in January right after New Years and reserved the room via Priceline.com at a rate of $187 for the night. Room 408 was clean, nicely appointed, with a comfortable bed and crisp linens. The only sort of hesitation for me as a solo traveler was that the room was the absolute last on the floor, which had narrow halls. I arrived around 6pm and the front desk was professional although not exactly warm. The attendants in the lobby both the night I checked in and the next morning were very friendly and helpful. The room was outfitted with a vanity/desk with a footstool and a chair, with good lighting. The toiletries are from Bigelow and good quality. It was a chilly evening, the only reservation about the room is that the windows were completely closed but drafty. The baseboard heat was turned on but the room never got terribly comfortable. The split ventilation system was on when I arrived but the temperature never got warm. The decor throughout the hotel is eclectic and nicely done. There is continental breakfast served in the restaurant just off the lobby--the service there was helpful and the food delicious. Centrally located in the Village right off of Washington Square close to subways, this is a well priced, nicely run hotel. I would definitely return.

title: Piacevole scoperta
text:
Sono capitata in questo hotel su consiglio di conoscenze. Devo dire che mi ha piacevolmente colpito. La posizione è ottima e il quartiere, il Greenwich village, offre molti ristorantini, locali e varie attrazioni. La camera, doppia con due letti singoli, è stata la scoperta piacevole. Spazio a sufficienza, si poteva facilmente camminare intorno ai letti tenendoli separati e devo dire che per NY è una cosa non da poco. Bagno grande il giusto e soprattutto pulito come tutta la stanza. Caffè e tea a disposizione degli ospiti in camera gratuitamente e rifornito giornalmente. Accappatoio a disposizione, cassaforte, phon per capelli, ferro e asse da stiro. La reception dell'hotel sempre cortese e a disposizione. L'unico appunto che posso fare è la colazione. Mancava quel tocco di America che ci si può aspettare andando a NY, niente di salato. Nonostante questo frutta fresca, yogurt, bagels, toast e bevande varie.
Detto ciò lo consiglio a tutti coloro che vogliono vivere NY con un po' più di tranquillità senza stare tutti i giorni nella folla di Times Square. Non ha nulla da invidiare a grandi catene di hotel.
OTTIMO!

title: Nice enough place to stay
text:
I typically go here for 7-10 days at a time.  WSH provides convenient access to the West Village area.  Plenty of things to do there, right next door to NYU, Babbo is across the street.  Goodwill store is around the corner. Convenience and drug stores only a block away.

I had a room with a window my last stay and never closed it the entire time I was there.  On the front of the hotel if you stand just right, you can see Washington Square Park. (Where the utilities companies recently were working and disturbed a few graves) - Read the curious lore of the park.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: We stayed at the Washington Square Hotel in late November.  This is a charming, European-like boutique hotel across the street from Washington Square Park. It's in a wonderful neighborhood in Greenwich Village. The rooms are comfortable and quiet.  The restaurant has great offerings for breakfast. The staff is friendly and accommodating. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Fair and Square In Greenwich Village
text:
We were hitting town for a New Year's Eve concert and needed a hotel in close proximity to Webster Hall. From an online search this fit the bill. Although it was on the high end of what I was willing to pay. In the long run, the facility and it's location made it worthwhile.

The staff was welcoming and gracious and we were immediately comfortable in the setting. 

The sleeping quarters were small, but served their purpose. We needed a clean, safe and comfortable place to sleep. We didn't come to the city to hang out in a hotel room and I doubt that many do. 

The heat was easy to adjust to our comfort. Coming in to crash late at night, that was a necessity. As I began to melt into the mattress, I realized that the window mount air conditioner was still installed behind the pulled shade and emitted just enough draft to be a nuisance. A quick adjustment of the thermostat created a reasonable balance and I drifted off to sleep. We awoke to an ideal temperature.

Although the sleeping quarters were small, the bathroom was well sized and amenities for the room abounded. The shower had the usual shampoo, soap, conditioner and moisturizer; but also a shower gel. In addition there were robes and a Washington Square embossed umbrella, which I had foolishly missed when I went out for a late night walk in the rain. The fact that I could walk alone late at night is a statement of how safe the area felt. (I was amused that walking alone in my black leather seemed to put two other sets of night strollers ill at ease). Trust me, I am not imposing to others by appearance.

The staff was more than accommodating. I kept thinking of different places I wanted to go during the stay and they were great about confirming my directions.

The continental breakfast included in the stay was good. I had  fresh squeezed orange juice, cereal, yogurt with fresh fruit and fresh from the oven scones and muffins. The wait staff was very pleasant. I finished with my hunger well satiated.

Overall it was a pleasant stay in a comfortable environment. In quick evaluation of the stay, I intend on returning here again.

title: Great Location
text:
We stayed here for the weekend.  The location is easy to access many restaurants and sights.  
The hotel was comfortable, if not fancy and the breakfast was good.
We requested a room at the back,for the quiet.

title: Great Greenwich location!
text: Stayed here on a Friday evening during a 24 hour trip. Hotel is just a few yards off Washington Square Park and a few blocks walk to Bleecker St., and the numerous bars, cafes, and restaurants for any taste or budget. Superbly located to maximize time on a short trip like ours. The hotel front was tastefully and beautifully decorated for the holidays. This boutique hotel appears to have been remodeled from an old mid-rise dorm of NYU, at least, that's what we were told by one of the guests. There is a full time door man to help with bags, directions, taxi's, etc. The front desk staff was friendly and informative. Beautifully furnished marble floored lobby area. Our king room was very spacious by Manhattan standards and worth the $24 extra to get it. Nothing fancy but comfortable and clean, and the shower pressure was fantastic - the best I can ever remember at a hotel. The bed mattress rested on a platform and was firm for my taste, but my wife liked it fine. There aren't a ton of places to stay in the Village, but I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

title: Greenwich
text:
Spent 7 nights here on a business trip whilst my wife did shopping.  This hotel is not your usual chain hotel, and that's what makes it unique as well as very charming.  Lovely continental breakfast available at no charge or a full breakfast is available.

Staff all extremely helpful and freindly.  This is why when visiting New York it will be the first hotel I'll check for availability.  Love it!

title: Отель с харизмой и отлично расположен
text:
Отель находится в нескольких шагах от Washington square и университета Нью-Йорка, район достаточно тихий, сравнивая с другими местами на Манхеттене. Шумоизоляция номеров отсутствует в принципе, поэтому гости отеля и движение лифта не дают насладиться относительным спокойствием вечно живущего в бешеном ритме супер мегаполиса. Нужны беруши, если вы не спите, обычно, как убитый.
Я, лично, не из таких, поэтому спала только в берушах.
В стоимость номера входил относительно приличный, по Нью -Йоркским меркам, завтрак - йогурт, сок, хлеб на выбор, кофе, масло, джем и сыр. Омлет или другие блюда - за доп плату. Бесплатный wi-fi с хорошим уровнем сигнала. Вид из окна лучше не вспоминать и в окно не смотреть. 
В целом, номер достаточно удобный, хотя и маленький. Есть кофе-чай машина, однако без воды, халат, шампунь, мыло, фен.
Достаточно удовлетворительное впечатление от отеля испортил персонал на ресепшн, который впарил нам своего таксиста для поездки в аэропорт. Обещали час езды максимум. Тупее водителя мы не видели в своей жизни, ехали около 2-х часов до аэропорта Кеннеди, выехав в 4 часа дня! С трудом успели на рейс. Ехали через Еврейский квартал и Бруклин, где светофоры каждые 200 метров со старушками. Если будут впаривать своих водителей, требуйте Yellow Taxi, они водят лихо, но зато знают все особенности местного трафика и посоветуют, когда лучше выезжать.
В целом, отель соответсвует нормам качества отелей среднего класса Нью Йорка - платите бабло, получите ночлег и валите. 
Наверное, в 5 звездах лучше, но это уже совсем другая исторя от 500 долларов за ночь, ибо Нью Йорк - город дорогой.........

title: 小さいですが、便利なホテルでした
text:
ワシントンスクエア公園側にあり、グリニッジビレッジのジャズクラブやSOHO散策で遅くなっても比較的安心できる場所にあります。
地下鉄やバスを使えば、移動も楽に出来ます。
近くにスーパーもあるので、上手く使えば、飲食も不自由しないです。

こじんまりしたホテルですが、ホテルチェーンのホテルに無い雰囲気も感じられます

title: I'll come back anyway
text:
The Washington Square Hotel is an old world hotel with a location so good I will return despite its flaws.
The staff is first rate. You get a continental breakfast with some fairly dull fruit and pastries but genuine bagels. My room (a queen bed deluxe) was tiny, even by New York standards, and it was spare not luxurious, but as others have mentioned you’re not likely to be spending a lot of time in your room.
Two problems kept my rating down at three stars. First, my room was quite noisy. There was not much traffic noise, but virtually no sound barrier between my room and the hall, and I heard the elevator and its discharge all night. Second, when I wanted to shower in the morning the water wouldn’t get hotter than lukewarm. (It was fine in the evening.) I can’t give four stars to a hotel with those two problems.
It’s a shame, because the positive features are so strong, and the Washington Square could be a real gem.

title: Great location, friendly staff, mediocre rooms
text: This hotel is conveniently located in West Village, a wonderful area to walk to bars, restaurants, and shopping.  It is right on Washington Square and has a lovely entrance.  The rooms are average size but a bit old and bare.  If you plan on spending your time out of the room this is a perfect place to be situated, however don't expect much luxury.

title: Conveniently situated small, comfortable hotel in NYC
text: Washington Square Hotel, recommended to me by my business partner, is a small, Euro feeling hotel right next to Washington Square Park in the heart of the Village. It is a remarkably quiet street making for good sleeping. Entrance to the subway is at the end of the street. Rooms a small as befits a place you are supposed to be out of not in..Staff is friendly and helpful but not overly effusive, just what you want. The breakfast buffet is adequate to start the day; there is also full breakfast service but that seemed over the top considering the food offerings in the Village. It is located across the street from Babbo, Mario Batali's main restaurant (make reservations more than a month in advance). Great restaurants all around, and the Village Vanguard an 8 minute walk!

title: Nice but gave away our room!
text:
Made reservation in August for a quad room. Sister stayed there before and wanted same type room. Got there round 1000 so we checked our luggage with desk and hit the streets. They never said a word about room change until we returned that evening. Gave us two rooms. We were disappointed because one person had to sleep alone. Sister had booked the quad so 
Her, niece and I could be together and have fun as roomies. They said we could move to quad next day so we did not totally unpack. Before we went out next morning we repacked everything to move to new room. They later said no new room and we had to unpack again. Nice area in Village. Love it there. 2 subway stops at end of block. They did comp our room price and gave us free breakfast everyday but caused us a lot of stress. 
Mario Batalli restaurant Babbo across the street! $$$$ many other restaurants and shopping close.

title: Terrific hotel
text: Stayed for 2 nights. Positive features: (1) good location in Greenwich Village close to subway and lots of restaurants/bars; Whitney Museum and High Line are a 15 minute walk; (2) the room and bathroom were very spacious compared with many NYC hotels; (3) very pleasant and helpful staff; (4) reasonable rate for NYC Christmas shopping season; (5) rate included continental breakfast--not typical for NYC. Negative features: none. Highly recommended if you want a traditional, older hotel away from the crowds in the Midtown-Time Square area.

title: Perfect Hotel
text:
Perfect hotel!  Perfect location. Very freindly staff. Great breackfast.
Rooms are clean , renovated, feels like a high standart hotel.
Best value for this price.
Would defently recomend it and will come again next time I'll be in the city.

title: Great hotel and in the middle of Greenwich village
text: This was a great hotel, all of the staff were friendly and cheerful, the room was quite small but it was clean. The hotel was in the middle of everywhere so we went to all the usual places sometimes by train. Apart from breakfast there was no other meal but you could buy a meal at their restaurant quite cheaply, otherwise there were several diners about. In all if I was going back to New York I'd definitely stay here again.

title: Un lugar muy especial
text:
Este hotel ofrece una buena localización, junto a Washington Square. Las habitaciones tienen el tamaño correcto, no son grandes pero tampoco pequeñas. El baño es muy cómodo y los amenities de gran calidad. 
  La habitación es completa, muy cómoda y el servicio muy correcto (NY style).
Me encantó la cafetera que había en la habitación, te permitía tomar una infusión o café en cualquier momento del día.

title: And I stay in a nice area
text: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip. I stayed here for two days and had an excellent experience. The room comes with a continental breakfast that meets expectations. The location was excellent. The staff was very friendly. The rooms were a little bit small but in New York small isn't uncommon at a hotel.

title: Ideal location
text:
This is a refurbished character hotel, so it's an older building which has retained many of its original features.  The staff were great, and we felt very welcome.
The room was functional and the bed excellent.  It was fairly small, but let's be honest - you're in New York.  You're not gonna laze around your hotel all day.  There's an amazing city to explore!  So, is the room clean, is the bed comfortable, does the bathroom do all the things you need a bathroom to do?  Yes!
It's in a great location for exploring the Village, High Line, Nolita and SoHo, Union Square areas, we'd definitely return.

title: Great price for a great location and super friendly vibe
text: We found the washington square hotel by chance online, and thought the combination of location and price was pretty great (especially when compared with similarly priced hotels the majority of the reviews contained the word mouse quite frequently, that's a deal breaker). We could not have been happier with the Washington Square hotel- it was charming in its aesthetic, making me feel like we had stepped back in to the glorious days of art deco. All of the staff were so friendly, chatty and attentive. The room was clean and well equipped, on the small size but I never find that to be an issue, you don't really want to spend hours sitting in a hotel room when you've got Greenwich village to explore just outside. We were so sad to leave, and I would definitely book this hotel again should I go back to NYC.

title: We loved the location and the hotel
text:
Trying to find a room in NYC is a daunting task.  With over 1000 hotels there are plenty of options.  I have stayed in the New York area only two times previously, once in New Jersey (had a good rate) and once in the Upper West Side (loved it).  I wanted to experience Lower Manhattan.  I needed two beds.  I did not want to pay a fortune, but I didn't want a dumpy place.  I was really hoping I didn't need to use a chain hotel.  

Washington Square Hotel was mentioned in the forums as a possibility and after searching other options we chose to stay here.  I am so glad.  We loved the older character of the hotel, that was still well cared for and in good condition.  We loved the price.  We loved that it was right at Washington Park.  We loved that it was within walking distance of so many restaurants and classic venues, not to mention the subways.  We loved the Village vibe that we had right outside the door and everywhere we could walk.  It was perfect for us.  

We had a two double bed room on the third floor.  It was a bit of a maze to find it, but that was part of the charm.  The staff was good (though would it have been too much to ask the efficient front desk clerk checking us in to smile?)  The room was clean, the beds very comfortable, the heating worked and we were warm on the chilly autumn nights.  The bathroom was a good size, the shower was warm and had good pressure, (which I love and don't always get).  We realized about the second day that one of the photos of old actresses on the wall was of Maureen Ohara who had just recently passed away.  It seemed appropriate.

This was a perfect hotel and base for my friend and I to visit New York.  I would return here with no hesitation and highly recommend it to others.

title: Trevligt hotell med fantastiskt läge
text:
Läget var väldigt bra, precis vid metron vid 4th street samt kort gångavstånd till andra linjer vid 8th street.
Det ingick en enklare frukostbuffé men man kunde köpa till varm frukost. Rummen var funktionella, sköna sängar. Vi bodde högt upp med utsikt mot tvärgatan och stördes inte av gatuljud på natten trots att vi sov med öppet fönster. 
Trevlig personal som var hjälpsamma.

title: Location
text: This is hardly a 3 stars hotel. Small rooms. Old establisnment. Staff is usually nice. Room could be more clean. Breakfast is less than basic. Plates and forks are spotted and not clean. Location is great, in the middle of the village, close to blue note and village vanguard if you like jazz, and during weekends you can enjoy free performances in the square. Prices are not logical for this pit but this is new york...

title: Great NYC location
text:
Have stayed at Washington Square on several occasions on business in the city. It's location makes it easy to get uptown or downtown.  Proximity to NYC and Washington Square Park make it more of a neighborhood than a city.

Rooms are larger than a typical NYC hotel.  This is an older hotel and the decor brings back a great period.  Marble floors and staircase, early Hollywood themes make for interesting appeal.

Good amenities,  free continental breakfast and WiFi a plus.  Highly recommended.

title: Convenient and decent
text: We have stayed here several times. This is not a sleek modern place. But it's convenient for Greenwich village area (and near a lot of subway lines too), comfortable and, if you get a higher floor, not noisy. King-size bedrooms have a larger footprint if you care about space

title: Upscale Retro Chic
text: I love this historic hotel with the marble staircase and autographed photos of celebrities. It is upscale and high tech, yet cozy, quiet and comfortable. Great service and an excellent restaurant connected by an interior passageway. My favorite hotel in Greenwich Village.

title: love this place
text:
the room is very small, as usual in N Y, but everything else is great.
it is cosy, the staff is very friendly and helpful.
they have Ronny, a marvelous person. It was the second time I've stayed in this hotel.
I don`t wanna stay in another hotel else in Manhattan

title: Location location location - Heart of NYC
text: I was a female solo traveller to NYC and recently stayed 7 nights at this Hotel.  The deluxe room was comfy, clean, tidy and well equipped and with all the essentials needed.  I chose this Hotel due to wanting a 'Village' feel and it did not disappoint.  Close to absolutely everthing, including Washington Square Park (directly opposite), shops, restaurants, attractions, subways.  Very central and easy to get around.  The staff were happy, friendly and accommodated my every need.  Ronnie @ Concierge was simply the BEST without a doubt!  Breakfasts are included and I chose fruit to begin my day.  I would happily recommend this Hotel to anyone travelling to NYC and in particular wanting to stay away from the 'touristy' areas.  I will be back.

title: Two nights in New York
text:
I booked the Hotel for a two night stay for my wife and I, we also invited our friends from Boston to join us, which they did and also booked the same two nights. We are so glad we chose this hotel, ideally placed in Greenwich Village. 

First impressions, as we pulled up the exterior façade was pleasing and gave us an expectation that the hotel is quite grand, we were not disappointed! On arrival the doorman greeted us, the best greeting we have had from a doorman ever, very polite, joyful and a pleasant chap. Likewise the reception staff were very polite and pleasant. T
he interior décor was classical and splendid. We were quickly checked in and in our room in minutes. On entering the room, the hotel staff exceeded our expectations by having not only a bottle of prosecco for us, but a birthday card for my wife, absolutely brilliant.  

The room itself was sizable compared to other similar sized hotels I have stayed at in NYC. The room was well lit, with a selection of lighting which could be selected to change the ambience/mood of the room. The bed was a good size and height, with crisp clean white linen bedding, extremely comfortable.  The bathroom is a good size, very clean and stylish. The room also has a wardrobe, electronic safe, hair dyer, iron and ironing board, all of which is needed by travellers, well done on that!  The room also has heating and air conditioning.

Once we settled in our room, we headed to the bar, and what a great bar it is. Great friendly staff, fantastic ambience great music and a good selection of beers, wines and spirits. On the first night, after eating out we returned to the bar and had some more drinks and a little late snack. The food we tried and what we saw others having, convinced us that on the second night we would eat in the restaurant at the hotel. As it turns out, we didn't make it to the restaurant but we had the restaurant food in the bar, what a great choice that was, yet another great night complimented by the great staff. 

On both mornings we enjoyed a superb breakfast in the hotel.

On the whole I cannot say enough good things about this place, the only criticism would be that the bar and restaurant doesn't open until 5pm.  

One thing is for certain, on our next visit to NYC we will be staying at the Washington Square Hotel again without a doubt, for us there is no better place to stay and I've stayed in several hotels in NYC over the years!

title: Will definitely come back
text: Clean room, friendly staff, good bar and restaurant, can't beat the central location. Previous review said avoid rooms ending in xx2 or xx3 as they were right next to the elevators and noisy. We stayed in 302 and never heard a thing. Will definitely come back to this hotel.

title: Great location
text: Picked this place due to its great location just off WSP in the West Village. Room was a decent size for NY and was clean and tidy. In room coffee machine was good and the staff were nice. We opted for the complimentary continental breakfast which was OK but not great - there is also a full service breakfast option at extra cost. Overall a decent choice for price vs. location. Loads of bars and restaurants in the surrounding streets too.

title: ハロウィンパレードに極近！！
text: グリニッジビレッジのジャズクラブにも、ハロウィンパレードにもとても近くて、帰りが遅くなっても安心できました。最寄駅の地下鉄W4の駅にはエレベーターがあるので、帰路JFKへは地下鉄Aトレイン（７日間乗り放題券）＋エアトレイン（５ドル）で１時間３０分程でラクラク移動でした。上品な年配のお客さんが多くて、全体的に落ち着いた雰囲気。スーパーも２４時間が近くにあります。朝食も充実していました。ミッドタウンの雑然とした雰囲気が苦手な人はぜひお薦めです。部屋のWIFI無料はとても便利です。
